projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

The Scrivener's Guide.

BEING Choice and Approved Forms OF PRESIDENTS, OF All Sorts of Bu≈øine≈øs now in u≈øe and practice, in a much better Method than any yet Printed; being u≈øeful for all Gentlemen, but chiefly for tho≈øe who practi≈øe the Law, viz.
A≈ø≈øignments,
Articles of Agreement,
Acquittances,
Bargains and Sale,
Bills,

By Nicholas Covert, one of the Attornies of the Court of Common-Pleas.
The Second Edition, corrected by the Author, with many Additions made by him.
LONDON, Printed by the A≈ø≈øigns of Richard and Edward Atkins E≈øquires, for Charles Harper at the Flower de Luce over again≈øt St. Dun≈øtans-Church in Fleet≈øtreet, 1700.

div.head: TO THE READER.
div.p: THAT a New Book of this kind ≈øhould come forth after ≈øo many already extant, ≈øome may wonder, who do not con≈øider, that Pre≈øidents grow Ob≈øolete, and New ones are made according to new Laws, or as the Notions of Men become more refined.

Of the Fir≈øt Sort, is a Bargain and Sale of Goods di≈øtrained for Rent, pag. 329. which with the Notes thereupon are a good direction how to proceed upon the late Act, impowring Land-Lords to ≈øell Di≈øtre≈ø≈øes for Rent, &c.
Of the Second Sort, are many never before Extant, and whereof every one is manifold more worth than the Price of the whole Book.

The≈øe Pre≈øidents being collected only for private ∆≤≈øe, without any de≈øign of being made publick, have mo≈øt of them been lately executed, and undergone the In≈øpection and Peru≈øal of Coun≈øel learned in the Law. They are not all placed in Alphabetical Order, there being no need of ≈øuch placing of them; becau≈øe there is put before them an exact Table of what is contained in the Book.

The fir≈øt Impre≈ø≈øion hereof having met with ≈øo kind a Reception, and been ≈øo well approved of by the Ingenious, that it was ≈øold in a ≈øhort time, hath encouraged the Author, for the publick Good, to make an Addition of ≈øeveral very u≈øeful Pre≈øidents of both ≈øorts to this ≈øecond Edition, never before Publi≈øhed, whereby the ≈øaid Book is rendred much more u≈øeful and beneficial to the Candid and Ingenious Reader, which is the ≈øole end and de≈øign of the Author.

div.p: THE Reports of Sir Peyton Ventris, Knight, late one of the Ju≈øtices of the Common-Pleas, in two Parts. The fir≈øt containing ≈øelect Ca≈øes adjudged in the King's-Bench, in the Reign of King Charles II. The Second Part, containing choice Ca≈øes, adjudged in the Common-Pleas, in the Reign of King Charles II. and King James II. and in the three fir≈øt years of his now Maje≈øty, King William and the late Queen Mary, while he was a Judge in the ≈øaid Court, with the Pleadings to the ≈øame; with the allowance and Approbation of the Lord Keeper and all the Judges. Two Volumes. Folio. Pr. 1 l. 14 s.

The Second Part of Modern Reports, being a Collection of ≈øeveral ≈øpecial Ca≈øes, mo≈øt of them adjudged in the Court of Common-Pleas in the 26, 27 28, 29, and 30 Years of the Reign of King Charles II. when Sir Francis North was Chief Ju≈øtice of the ≈øaid Court: To which are added ≈øeveral ≈øelect Ca≈øes in the Courts of Chancery, King's-Bench, and Exchequer; Carefully collected by a Learned Hand. Printed 1698. Price 12 s.

The Third Part of Modern Reports being a Collection of ≈øeveral ≈øpecial Ca≈øes in the Court of
King's Bench; in the la≈øt years of the Reign of King Charles II. in the Reign of King James II. and in the two fir≈øt years of his pre≈øent Maje≈øty: Together with the Re≈øolutions and Judgments thereupon; None of the≈øe Ca≈øes ever printed before: Carefully collected by a Learned Hand. Price 14 s.

from Magna Charta, until the fir≈øt of King James II. that do any ways concern a Ju≈øtice of Peace; in the other part, the whole Office of a Ju≈øtice of Peace is methodically dige≈øted, with the mo≈øt approved Pre≈øidents under proper Heads; to which is now added a Table for the ready finding out the Pre≈øidents, with a large Table of the Matters never before Printed: By Jo≈ø. body.head: Articles of Agreement, indented, made, concluded and agreed unto upon the 10th day of December, &c. Between W. C. of London, Gent. of the one part, and T. C. of, &c. of the other part, viz.
body.p:
IMprimis, The ≈øaid W. C. for the con≈øideration of 5 l. to him by the ≈øaid T. C. before the ≈øealing hereof, well and truly in hand paid, and 930 l. more to be paid as is after herein mentioned, for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and every of them, doth covenant, promi≈øe and grant to and with the ≈øaid T. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, and every of them by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid W. C. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will at the proper co≈øts and charges in the Law of the ≈øaid T. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, on or before the 10th day of March, next en≈øuing the date hereof, make, ≈øeal, deliver, do, execute and acknowledge all and every ≈øuch Act and Acts, Deed and Deeds, Fine and Fines, A≈ø≈øurances or other Conveyances in the Law what≈øoever, as he the ≈øaid T. C. his Heirs, Executors or A≈ø≈øigns, or his or their Council
learned in the Law ≈øhall rea≈øonably devi≈øe, advi≈øe or require for the ≈øure conveying, ≈øetling and a≈ø≈øuring unto the ≈øaid T. C. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns all tho≈øe Lands, &c. now in the occupation of C. D. or A≈ø≈øigns: In con≈øideration whereof he the ≈øaid T. C. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant, promi≈øe and grant to and with the ≈øaid W.C. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid T.C. his, &c. or ≈øome of them, ≈øhall and will well and truly ≈øatisfie, content and pay, or cau≈øe to be ≈øatisfied, contented and paid unto the ≈øaid W. C. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns the afore≈øaid 935 l. immediately after he the ≈øaid W. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall have levied and acknowledged a Fine of the premi≈øes afore≈øaid, to the ≈øole and proper u≈øe of the ≈øaid T. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever.

Item, It is agreed between the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, That all A≈ø≈øurances and Conveyances, and any and all Fine and Fines hereafter to be had, levied and acknowledged of the premi≈ø≈øes before-mentioned, ≈øhall be and enure, and ≈øhall be deemed and taken to be and enure to the only proper u≈øe, benefit and behoof of him the ≈øaid T. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, and to no other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoever.

La≈øtly, It is agreed, That if the ≈øaid W. C. doth not travel in per≈øon to London or We≈øtmin≈øter, to levy and acknowledge ≈øuch Fine for the ≈øure ≈øetling of the premi≈ø≈øes unto the ≈øaid T. C. then he the ≈øaid W. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall pay and allow unto the ≈øaid T. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, at the acknowledging of ≈øuch Fine, the Sum of 12 s. and 1 d. for and toward his charges in procuring of a Writ of Dedimus pote≈øtatem to enable him the ≈øaid W.C. to acknowledge the ≈øaid Fine in the Country.

div.head: Articles for dividing the Rent and avoiding Survivor≈øhip, between Jointenants of Lea≈øe-Lands.

body.head: Articles, &c. Between J. F. of, &c. of the one part, and R. C. of the other part, viz.
body.p:
IMprimis, Whereas J.V. of, &c. by his Indenture of Lea≈øe bearing date, &c. for the con≈øideration therein mentioned did demi≈øe, grant and to farm let unto A.V. of, &c. all that Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. with the Appurtenances, ≈øituate, lying and being in, &c. To have and to hold the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. unto the ≈øaid A. V. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns from the Fea≈øt of St. Michael then la≈øt pa≈øt, unto the full end and term of ≈øeven years from thence next en≈øuing, fully to be compleat and ended, yielding and paying therefore the Sum of 20 l. of lawful Mony of England, as in and by the ≈øaid recited Lea≈øe it doth more at large appear. And whereas the ≈øaid A. V. by his Indenture of Lea≈øe bearing date, &c. for the con≈øideration therein mentioned, did demi≈øe, grant and to farm-let unto F. J. of, &c. two Chambers and a Cellar, being part of the Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement wherein the ≈øaid A. V. did then live, with all conveniences and appurtenances to the ≈øaid Chambers and Cellar belonging; To have and to hold the ≈øaid two Chambers and Cellar unto the ≈øaid F. J. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns from the day of the date of the la≈øt mentioned Indenture of Lea≈øe, unto the full end and term of five years from thence next en≈øuing, and fully to be compleat and ended, Yeilding and paying therefore yearly and every year during the ≈øaid term, the ≈øum of 8 l. of lawful Mony of England, as in and by the ≈øaid la≈øt recited Lea≈øe it doth more at large appear. And whereas the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt and Term of years to come of him the ≈øaid
J. V. of, in, and to the above-recited premi≈ø≈øes, and every part thereof, is lawfully come to and ve≈øted in the above-named J. F. and R. C. by force and virtue of one Indenture of A≈ø≈øignment, bearing date, &c. made by the ≈øaid J. V. unto the ≈øaid J. F. and R. C. as in and by the ≈øaid Indenture of A≈ø≈øignment it doth more at large appear. And whereas al≈øo the ≈øaid J. F. and R. C. by their Indenture of Lea≈øe, bearing date the, &c. for the con≈øideration therein mentioned, did demi≈øe, grant and to farm-let unto D. C. of, &c. one Chamber and a Shop, being part of the premi≈ø≈øes fir≈øt above-recited; To have and to hold the ≈øaid Chamber and Shop, with the appurtenances unto the ≈øaid D. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, from, &c. next en≈øuing the ≈øaid la≈øt mentioned Indenture of Lea≈øe, until the full end and term of three years from thence next en≈øuing, and fully to be compleat and ended, Yielding and paying therefore yearly and every year, the Sum of 14 l. of lawful Mony of England, as in and by the ≈øaid la≈øt recited Indenture of Lea≈øe it doth more fully appear. Now it is covenanted, concluded and agreed, by and between the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents; and the true intent and meaning of either of them is, That fora≈ømuch as either of them the parties above-named, have disbur≈øed and paid equally their ≈øhares of Mony towards and for the purcha≈øing of the premi≈ø≈øes before-mentioned, that the ≈øeveral afore≈øaid Rents of Twenty pounds, Eight pounds and Fourteen pounds, in and by the ≈øaid ≈øeveral recited Lea≈øes re≈øerved ≈øhall be equally divided and ≈øhared between the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents. And if either of the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents ≈øhall happen to die before the end and expiration of the term and terms of years in the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Indentures of Lea≈øe before-recited contained, that then and from thenceforth it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the Executors, Admini≈øtrators
and A≈ø≈øigns of the party decea≈øed, to have, occupy, receive, take and enjoy the full and entire moiety or half part of all the Rents, I≈ø≈øues and Profits of all and ≈øingular the before-recited premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances, in as large and ample man ner and form, to all intents and purpo≈øes as the party ≈øo dying ≈øhould or ought to have done, if he were then living, any Re≈øtraint, Provi≈øion or Statute to the contrary notwith≈øtanding; and that neither of the ≈øaid Parties, nor the Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns of them, or either of them, ≈øhall or will at any time hereafter take, demand or receive any of the Rents above-re≈øerved, or make or give any di≈øcharge or acquittance, of or for the ≈øame, or any part thereof, without the a≈ø≈øent and privity of the other party, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, fir≈øt had and given under their hand.

Item, It is farther covenanted, concluded and agreed unto by and between the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, That neither of the ≈øaid Parties, nor the Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns of them or of either of them, ≈øhall or will at any time or times hereafter, grant bargain, ≈øell, a≈ø≈øign, ≈øurrender or convey his or their E≈øtate or E≈øtates, right, title, intere≈øt, term or terms of years to come, of, in or to all or any part of the before-recited premi≈ø≈øes, to any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, without the knowledge, con≈øent or refu≈øal of the other party fir≈øt had, or of his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, he or they paying as much as any other ≈øhall and will give and pay for the ≈øame.

La≈øtly, It is covenanted, concluded and fully agreed upon, by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, That all and every the ≈øeveral Deeds and Writings before-recited ≈øhall be reputed, deemed and taken to be and enure to the joint u≈øe and u≈øes, benefit and commodity of both the ≈øaid parties, their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns,
and to no other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoever: And that the party ≈øo keeping the ≈øaid writings, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will upon the rea≈øonable reque≈øt of the other party his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, at all times hereafter, produce and bring forth all and every, or ≈øo many of the ≈øame Writings as ≈øhall be required, either for the maintenance of their Title to the premi≈ø≈øes, or for the ≈øelling and conveying of his and their E≈øtate and Intere≈øt, of and in the moiety of all or any part of the ≈øaid recited premi≈ø≈øes.

div.head: Articles for building a new Hou≈øe, and taking down the old one there.

body.head: Articles, &c. Betwen J. F. and R. C. viz.
body.p:
IMprimis, The ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, doth covenant, promi≈øe and grant to and with the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, in manner and form following; That is to ≈øay, That he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, or ≈øome of them, for the Con≈øideration hereafter mentioned, ≈øhall and will forthwith take down the now Dwelling-hou≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øituate, &c. and in the room thereof ≈øhall make, erect, build and ≈øet up one new Tenement or Dwelling-hou≈øe, to be 40 Foot wide and 50 Foot long together with a Cellar of the ≈øame length and breadth, and ≈øhall al≈øo make four Rooms on each Floor, and ≈øhall find and provide at his own proper co≈øts and charges, all and all manner of Tyles, Bricks, Laths, Nails, Lead, Iron, Sand and Lime, and all other Materials what≈øoever, which ≈øhall be fit and nece≈ø≈øary to be u≈øed in or about the ≈øaid Building, and ≈øhall carry away
all Rubbi≈øh what≈øoever, which ≈øhall ari≈øe by rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Building, and ≈øhall and will in all things well and workman-like frame, erect, ≈øet up and fini≈øh the ≈øaid Building at or before the 10th day of March, next en≈øuing the date hereof.

In Con≈øideration of which ≈øaid Building, ≈øo to be done and fini≈øhed in manner and form afore≈øaid, the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, by the≈øe pre≈øents, in manner and form following; That is to ≈øay, That the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, or ≈øome of them, ≈øhall and will well and truly pay, or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns the ≈øum of 250 l. of lawful Mony of England, at three ≈øeveral payments, in manner and form following; That is to ≈øay, Fifty pounds thereof in hand, at and before the en≈øealing and delivery hereof, the receipt whereof the ≈øaid R. C. doth hereby acknowledge, and thereof doth acquit and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, One hundred pounds more when the Roof of the ≈øaid Bulding is framed and tiled, and One hundred pounds more re≈øidue, in full payment of the ≈øaid ≈øum of Two hundred and fifty pounds, when the whole Building is fully compleated and fini≈øhed.

div.head: Articles between a Merchant and his Apprentice's Father, &c.

body.head: Articles, &c. between J.F. and R.C. and D. C. viz.
body.p:
WHereas the ≈øaid J. F. the day of the date hereof, in con≈øideration of the Affection which he the ≈øaid J. F. beareth to the ≈øaid R. C. is contented
and agreed to take the ≈øaid R. C. to be his Servant in merchandizing Affairs, and accordingly to employ him therein, as well in parts beyond the Seas, as in England, where the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall or may hereafter, or now hath Trading and Dealings for the ≈øpace of ≈øeven years, to commence from the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents. And hereupon the ≈øaid D. C. Father to the ≈øaid R. C. doth covenant and grant for him≈øelf, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, to and with the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, That he the ≈øaid R. C. his Son ≈øhall, during the ≈øaid Term, (if he ≈øo long live) well, diligently and faithfully, to the utmo≈øt of his power and skill, ≈øerve him the ≈øaid J. F. in his Trade of Merchandizing, and other his Affairs, in ≈øuch place and places as he the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall think fit and appoint: And that he the ≈øaid R. C. at all times hereafter, during the ≈øaid Term, ≈øhall receive and take into his charge and cu≈øtody all ≈øuch Goods and Merchandizes what≈øoever, as by or for the u≈øe or account of the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall be con≈øigned or ≈øent to him the ≈øaid R. C. and al≈øo ≈øell, utter and di≈øpo≈øe of the ≈øame Goods or Merchandizes to the be≈øt profit he can for the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns; and ≈øhall al≈øo at all times during the ≈øaid Term, follow and perform the advice, directions and orders of him the ≈øaid J. F. which ≈øhall by Letters or otherwi≈øe be ≈øent, given or made known to him the ≈øaid R. C. about or concerning the Factory or Merchandizing afore≈øaid; and al≈øo, that he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall at the charges of the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. provide and keep in due order Books of account, concerning his ≈øaid Employment as afore≈øaid, according to the cu≈øtom of Merchants in ≈øuch ca≈øes; and ≈øhall deal ju≈øtly, truly and faithfully, to and with the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. in all and every his Accounts, Reckonings, Bargains and Dealings, relating to and concerning
his ≈øaid Employment; and ≈øhall con≈øtantly once in ≈øix Months, during the Term afore≈øaid, tran≈ømit and ≈øend unto the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. true Accounts of all the Bu≈øine≈ø≈øes and Dealings of the ≈øaid R. C. in the premi≈ø≈øes, and ≈øhall al≈øo ≈øend Letters of Advice to the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. as often as conveniently he can, of ≈øuch Matters and Occurrences wherewith it ≈øhall be proper and expedient, that the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. be acquainted: And ≈øhall al≈øo return and come into England, and bring all his Books of Accounts with him, whenever he ≈øhall be required ≈øo to do by the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. And that the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall from time to time, upon rea≈øonable Reque≈øt made, ≈øhew forth all his Books of Accounts concerning all his dealings, as afore≈øaid, and make and give unto the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. a ju≈øt, true and perfect Account in Writing, of, for and concerning all and every ≈øuch Goods, Wares, Mony, Debts and Merchandizes, what≈øoever, as well of the ≈øaid J.F. for his own proper u≈øe, as joyntly with any other, which ≈øhall hereafter come to the hands, charge or factory of him the ≈øaid R. C. or for which he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhould or ought to be accountable unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns. And moreover, That he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall within one Month next after ≈øuch Account made and given in, well and truly ≈øatisfie, pay and deliver unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, all and every ≈øuch Wares, Mony, Goods, Debts and Merchandizes and other things what≈øoever, as by or upon the foot of the ≈øaid Account ≈øhall appear to be, and be found due unto him the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, by or from the ≈øaid R. C.

div.p: Note. Bonds mu≈øt be given for performance.

div.head: Articles of Agreement between a Country Trader, and a London Factor.

body.head: Articles of Agreement made, indented, concluded and agreed upon, the, &c. Between R. C. of, &c. and J. F. of, &c.
body.p: WHereas the ≈øaid R. C. hath contracted and agreed with the ≈øaid J. F. to employ him as a Factor in London for him the ≈øaid R. C. for the vending, ≈øelling and uttering of all ≈øuch Wares and Merchandizes as he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall con≈øign and ≈øend unto the ≈øaid J. F. in his now Dwelling-hou≈øe in Clements-Lane, for and during the term and ≈øpace of four years, to commence from the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents.

Whereupon it is covenanted, granted, concluded and agreed by and between the ≈øaid R. C. and J. F. And they the ≈øaid R. C. and J. F. for them≈øelves, their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, do covenant and grant to and with each other reciprocally, and either of their Executors and Admini≈øtrators in manner and form following:

Imprimis, That he the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall and will accept and take into his tru≈øt, charge and cu≈øtody, all ≈øuch Wares and Merchandizes as he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall ≈øend and con≈øign to him the ≈øaid J. F. And al≈øo ≈øhall do his be≈øt indeavour to vend and ≈øell the ≈øame for the be≈øt profit and advantage of the ≈øaid R.C. for and during the ≈øaid Term of four years, to commence from the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents, as afore≈øaid.

Item, That he the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall keep or cau≈øe to be kept ju≈øt and true Books of Account in Writing of all ≈øuch Wares and Merchandizes as the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall from time to time, during the ≈øaid Term, con≈øign unto the ≈øaid J. F. and ≈øhall come
into his charge and cu≈øtody; that is to ≈øay, to whom, and at what price, and when they ≈øhall be ≈øold and vended by him the ≈øaid J. F. And ≈øhall al≈øo make true payment and delivery unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, of all ≈øuch Monies, Specialties and other things as ≈øhall come to the hands of, and be received by the ≈øaid J. F. for the ≈øaid Wares and Merchandizes, during the Term afore≈øaid, together with all ≈øuch Wares and Merchandizes as ≈øhall remain un≈øold in the cu≈øtody of the ≈øaid J. F. at the expiration of the ≈øaid Term.

Item, That he the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall be true and faithful unto the ≈øaid R. C. in the ≈øelling and vending of all Wares and Merchandizes of the ≈øaid R. C. during the ≈øaid Term, and not defraud or cheat the ≈øaid R. C. wilfully or with his knowledge in the premi≈ø≈øes; but ≈øhall endeavour to vend the ≈øaid Ker≈øeys to able Men, for the be≈øt Prizes, and ≈øoone≈øt day or time of payment he can.

Item, That the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall not, during the ≈øaid four years, deal or trade as Factor for any other per≈øon or per≈øons, for the buying or ≈øelling of any Wares or Merchandizes what≈øoever, ≈øave only for him the ≈øaid R. C. as afore≈øaid.

Item, The ≈øaid R. C. for and in con≈øideration of the ≈øaid Factor≈øhip, doth covenant and agree, for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, to pay unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators the Sum of 30 l. per Ann. of lawful Mony of England.

div.head: Articles of Agreement between Creditors, and the Widow of a Debtor, concerning Admini≈øtration and paying Debts.

body.head: Articles of Agreement Tripartite, Indented, made the, &c. Between the Creditors of R. C. late of, &c. decea≈øed (who≈øe Names, together with the Debts ≈øeverally to them owing, are ≈øpecified in a Schedule to the≈øe pre≈øents annexed) on the fir≈øt part, C. R. of, &c. Creditor al≈øo of the ≈øaid R. C. of the ≈øecond part, and J. C. of, &c. Widow of the ≈øaid R. C. of the third part, viz.
body.p: IMprimis, The ≈øaid Creditors, and every of them, have agreed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do agree with the ≈øaid C. R. and J. C. That the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall and may have and take the Admini≈øtration of all the Goods and Chattels which were of the ≈øaid R. C. decea≈øed, according to the Laws of this Realm, to di≈øpo≈øe of and Admini≈øter the ≈øame according to the tenure of the≈øe pre≈øent Articles, and not otherwi≈øe.

Item, That in con≈øideration of ≈øuch pains as the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall take and be at in and about the ≈øaid Admini≈øtration, the ≈øaid C. R. upon his true and rea≈øonable account thereof made before ≈øuch Auditors as the ≈øaid Creditors, or the greater part of them, ≈øhall a≈ø≈øign to take the ≈øaid Account, ≈øhall have allowance of all his rea≈øonable co≈øts and charges as well in Suits at Law as otherwi≈øe, by him to be expended about the ≈øaid Admini≈øtration; and al≈øo that the ≈øaid C. R. at every dividend making ≈øhall and may retain for and towards his own Debt owing by the ≈øaid J. C. ≈øo much as ≈øhall be an equal portion with what he ≈øhall divide and pay to the other Creditors, according to the quantity of their ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Debts.

Item, That the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall before any dividend made, pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid J. C. for ≈øatisfaction of her Title of Dower in the late Man≈øion hou≈øe of the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øituate, &c. the Sum of 50 l. of lawful Mony of England, or ≈øhall deliver unto her ≈øo much of her ≈øaid late Hu≈øband's Goods as ≈øhall amount to that value, according to a rea≈øonable e≈øtimation; and likewi≈øe for the Funeral-charges of the ≈øaid R. C. 15 l. of &c. and al≈øo ≈øhall deliver to her the ≈øaid J. C. to her own u≈øe, or ≈øuffer her to detain and keep to her own u≈øe and behoof all her Apparel and Ornaments belonging to her Body, and ≈øuch other things as ≈øhe and the Creditors have agreed, as may appear by Writing under their hands.

Item, That the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øo ≈øoon as rea≈øonably may be, after the ≈øaid Letters of Admini≈øtration granted, ≈øhall with and by the con≈øent, and in the pre≈øence of, &c. or three of them, cau≈øe all the Goods, Chattels and Debts within the Realm of England which were belonging to the ≈øaid R. C. at the time of his decea≈øe, to be viewed and apprai≈øed by indifferent Per≈øons, and a true Inventory thereof to be made, according to the Cu≈øtom u≈øed in ≈øuch ca≈øes within the City of London.

Item, That the ≈øaid J. C. for her part ≈øhall and will u≈øe her be≈øt endeavour to di≈øcover and make known all and ≈øingular the Goods, Chattels and Debts of the ≈øaid R. C. to the ≈øaid C. R. and the other per≈øons before-mentioned, without concealment or delay.

Item, That after the Goods, Chattels and Credits of the ≈øaid R.C. ≈øhall be ≈øo viewed and prai≈øed, and an Inventory thereof made and taken as afore≈øaid; That then as well for the ≈øatisfying and payment of what is to be fir≈øt ≈øatisfied and paid in manner and form afore≈øaid, as towards the equal payment of the ≈øaid Creditors, the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall by the
con≈øent and over≈øight of the ≈øaid, &c. or any two of them, make ≈øuch ≈øpeedy Sale at the be≈øt Rates he can of all the Goods and Chattels which were of the ≈øaid R. C. within the Realm of England, other than ≈øuch as be appointed for the ≈øaid J. C. as afore≈øaid, and make ≈øuch ≈øpeed to gather in and obtain ≈øuch Debts as were owing unto the ≈øaid R. C. at the time of his decea≈øe, as he rea≈øonably can or may: And then after the ≈øatisfaction and payment before-mentioned to be fir≈øt ≈øatisfied and paid, being fir≈øt had and made, ≈øhall from time to time proportion and divide all the re≈øidue of the E≈øtate of the ≈øaid R. C. as ≈øhall come to his hands unto every of his ≈øaid Creditors, ≈øhare and ≈øhare alike, according to the quantities of their ≈øeveral Debts, from time to time, and as often as he the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall have any thing whereof ≈øuch dividend can be made, until all the ≈øaid Creditors ≈øhall be paid and ≈øatisfied their ≈øaid Debts, if the Goods and Chattels of the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall be ≈øufficient ≈øo to do.

Item, That F. J. one of the Creditors in the ≈øaid Schedule mentioned, ≈øhall enjoy all ≈øuch Goods and Debts which were of the ≈øaid R. C. and which the ≈øaid F. J. hath now attached beyond the Seas, towards the payment of ≈øuch Debts as the ≈øaid R. C. did owe there to him; and thereof the ≈øaid F. J. ≈øo ≈øoon, as conveniently may be to ≈øhew the Account to the ≈øaid C. R. and four, or three of the ≈øaid Creditors at the lea≈øt. And if more be recovered beyond the Seas by the ≈øaid F. J. of the Goods and Debts late of the ≈øaid R. C. than the Debts ≈øo owing by the ≈øaid R. C. at the time of his decea≈øe, to the ≈øaid F. J. there, That then he the ≈øaid F. J. ≈øhall accept of the overplus towards payment of his Debt owing here in England.

Item, That none of the parties afore≈øaid ≈øhall or will do or procure any thing to be done by any
Suit or Action again≈øt the ≈øaid C. R. or any other per≈øon, whereby the performance of the≈øe pre≈øent Agreements or any of them, ≈øhall or may in any wi≈øe be impeached, troubled or hindred; and that every of them ≈øhall revoke and di≈øcharge all and every Suit and Suits commenced theretofore, which ≈øhall or may be any impediment or hindrance of the true performance of the Articles and Agreement herein contained.

Item, The ≈øaid C. R. doth hereby agree to take upon him the ≈øaid Admini≈øtration, and to admini≈øter truly and faithfully, according to the true intent and meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents; and if there ≈øhall be more than is ≈øufficient to ≈øatisfie and pay all the ≈øaid Creditors their ≈øeveral Debts, That then upon rea≈øonable Reque≈øt to him made, and a Di≈øcharge for the ≈øame to him given by the ≈øaid J.C. her Executors or Admini≈øtrators, he the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall and will well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid the remainder thereof unto the ≈øaid J. C. her Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhe or they giving good Security to the ≈øaid C. R. by her or their Bond to repay the ≈øame, or ≈øo much thereof as ≈øhall be lawfully and truly recovered by any other Creditor of the ≈øaid R. C.

Item, If any Creditor or Creditors of the ≈øaid R. C. not party to the≈øe pre≈øents, do at any time commence any Action or Suit again≈øt the ≈øaid C. R. as Admini≈øtrator of the Goods and Chattels of the ≈øaid R. C. and the ≈øaid Creditor or Creditors ≈øhall lawfully without fraud or covin recover their ≈øaid Debt or Debts again≈øt the ≈øaid Admini≈øtrator: In ≈øuch ca≈øe it is agreed by and between all the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, That all the Creditors, Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, who≈øe Debts ≈øhall be paid in part or in all, according to this Agreement, ≈øhall out of their ≈øeveral Dividends allow, ≈øatisfie and pay part and part alike unto the ≈øaid
C. R. as will ≈øatisfie and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid Debt or Debts, and damages and co≈øts of Suit for the ≈øame, the ≈øaid C. R. likewi≈øe allowing his proportionable ≈øhare toward the ≈øame.

Item, It is further agreed, That if any Creditor or Creditors of the ≈øaid R. C. not being parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, ≈øhall or do commence any Suit or Suits again≈øt the ≈øaid C. R. as Admini≈øtrator of the ≈øaid R. C. Then the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall thereof give Notice unto all the ≈øaid Creditors, Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, or to three of them at the lea≈øt, to the end they may joyn with the ≈øaid C. R. in defence of the ≈øaid Suit.

All and every which Agreements afore≈øaid, and every Article and Clau≈øe therein, every one of the ≈øaid parties on their ≈øeveral behalves, and for their ≈øeveral Executors and Admini≈øtrators, do covenant, promi≈øe and grant, to and with all and each other of the Parties, their ≈øeveral Executors and Admini≈øtrators, well and truly to perform and keep, without fraud or deceit.

div.head: Articles of Agreement on a Marriage, concerning Settlement of Lands.

body.head: Articles of Agreement indented, made, concluded and agreed upon the, &c. Between R. C. C. R. J. F. and F. J. of the one part, and A. B. of the other part, of, for and concerning a Marriage to be ≈øolemnized and had between the ≈øaid A. B. and B. A. one of the Daughters of C. A. late &c. decea≈øed, viz.
body.p: IMprimis, The ≈øaid A. B. doth covenant, promi≈øe and agree with the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. J. F. and F. J. That he the ≈øaid A. B. ≈øhall and will before the 10th day of March, &c. next coming, take to Wife the ≈øaid B. A. if ≈øhe will thereunto con≈øent and agree.

Item, The ≈øaid A. B. doth covenant and promi≈øe That he ≈øhall and will, before the end of next Hillary Term, together with F. B. and S. B. levy a Fine unto ≈øuch per≈øons as ≈øhall be named by the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. J. F. and F. J. the which Fine ≈øhall be Sur conu≈øance de droit come ceo, &c. of Lands, Tenements and Hereditaments in the County of S. of the clear yearly value of 50 l. of, &c. The which Cognizees in the ≈øaid Fine ≈øo to be acknowledged, and their Heirs, ≈øhall be ≈øei≈øed of the ≈øaid Lands, &c. comprized in the ≈øaid Fine from the time of the Celebration of the ≈øaid Marriage between the ≈øaid A. and B. to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid A. B. and B. and of the heirs Male of the Body of the ≈øaid A. B. to be begotten on the Body of the ≈øaid B. And for lack of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, then to the u≈øe the ≈øaid A. B. and of the heirs Male of his Body lawfully to be begotten; and for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, to the u≈øes in an Entail thereof made by one E. B. decea≈øed, Father of the ≈øaid A. B. mentioned, limited and declared.

Item, The ≈øaid A. B. doth covenant, promi≈øe and agree, in manner and form above-≈øaid, That he ≈øhall and will within the time and ≈øpace of two years next en≈øuing the date hereof, purcha≈øe, obtain and procure Lands and Tenements of the clear and yearly value of 50 l. to be lawfully a≈ø≈øured and conveyed unto him the ≈øaid A. and to the ≈øaid B. and to the Heirs Males, &c. upon the Body of the ≈øaid B. to be begotten, with the Remainder of the ≈øaid Lands, &c. to the ≈øaid A. B. and his Heirs for ever. And if the ≈øaid A. B. do happen to depart this life within the ≈øaid two years now next en≈øuing, as afore≈øaid; and before he hath purcha≈øed, obtained and procured Lands, &c. of the yearly value of 50 l. in manner and form afore≈øaid, Then ≈øhall the ≈øaid A. B. leave, give and bequeath unto the ≈øaid B. by his la≈øt Will and
Te≈øtament, or otherwi≈øe, the full ≈øum of 500 l. of lawfuy Mony of England, over and above ≈øuch part and portion as ≈øhe the ≈øaid B. may ju≈øtly and lawfully claim and challenge by the Cu≈øtom of the City of London.

Item, The ≈øaid A. B. doth covenant and agree, That if the ≈øaid B. ≈øhall happen to decea≈øe before him the ≈øaid A. B. that then it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid B. by her la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament, to give and bequeath the full Sum of 100 l. of, &c. to any per≈øons or per≈øons what≈øoever. And the ≈øaid A. B. doth by the≈øe pre≈øents firmly covenant and agree, to content and pay the ≈øaid Sum of 100 l. to ≈øuch per≈øon, or per≈øons to whom the ≈øaid B. ≈øhall Will and Bequeath the ≈øame, or any part thereof, within three Months next after her decea≈øe; any Law or Cu≈øtom to the contrary notwith≈øtanding,

Item, The ≈øaid A. B. doth by the≈øe pre≈øents, for him≈øelf his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant, promi≈øe and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. J. F. and F. J. their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, That if after the full Portion or Legacy due to her him the ≈øaid B.A. be fully contented and paid unto the ≈øaid A. B. there ≈øhall appear any Debt or Sum of Mony, to be lawfully due and unpaid to any per≈øon or per≈øons, from and by the late Father of the ≈øaid B. and which his Executors ≈øhall be compellable and liable to pay; That then he the ≈øaid A. B. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall contribute and allow one half toward the ≈øatisfaction and payment of ≈øuch Debt.

div.head: Articles for ≈øecuring 1000 l. and paying Intere≈øt to two Per≈øons, until Lands can be purcha≈øed to the ≈øame u≈øes.

body.p:
THis Indenture Tripartite, made, &c. Between M. B. of &c. of the fir≈øt part; C. B. of, &c. of the ≈øecond part; and J. P. and W. T. of, &c. of the third part. Whereas the ≈øaid M. B. was lately ≈øeized of Freehold for term of her Life, of and in divers Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands and Tenements in T. in the County of O. the Rever≈øion thereof belonging to the ≈øaid C. B. and his Heirs, upon the death of the ≈øaid M. And the ≈øaid M. and C. being ≈øo ≈øeized, did bargain, ≈øell and convey all the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands and Tenements unto J. S. of T. afore≈øaid Gent. and his Heirs, for and in Con≈øideration of the entire Sum of 1000 l. for the purcha≈øe of the ≈øeveral Intere≈øts of the ≈øaid M. and C. in the premi≈ø≈øes, by the ≈øaid J. S. paid into the hands of the ≈øaid J. P. and W. T. for the u≈øe of the ≈øaid M. and C. To the intent and purpo≈øe, and upon agreement, that by and out of the ≈øaid Sum of 1000 l. or the Intere≈øt and profit thereof, the yearly Sum of 40 l. might be paid and ≈øecured unto the ≈øaid M. during her Life; and all the re≈øt of the ≈øaid 1000 l. and the benefit thereof, to be for the only u≈øe of the ≈øaid C. and be di≈øpo≈øed as is herein after mentioned. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That in pur≈øuance of the Agreement afore≈øaid, the ≈øaid J. P. and W. T. do jointly and ≈øeverally, for them and either of them≈øelves, their and either of their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid C. B. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That the ≈øaid J. P. and W. T. their Executors or Admini≈øtrators (≈øome or one of them having Notice by the ≈øpace of three
Months before) ≈øhall and will at the now Dwelling-hou≈øe of the ≈øaid J. P. and W. T. in L. afore≈øaid, well and truly pay, or cau≈øe to be paid, the ≈øaid Sum of 1000 l. to ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons, and in ≈øuch manner and form as the ≈øaid C. B. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall direct or appoint, upon the ≈øealing and executing a good and ≈øufficient Conveyance and A≈ø≈øurance in the Law, for the payment of one Annuity or yearly Sum of 40 l. (to be i≈ø≈øuing and going out of Lands or Tenements of Freehold in Fee-≈øimple, or for Term of three Lives, or holden by a Lea≈øe for a Term of 50 years, at the lea≈øt, unexpired, of the clear yearly value of 50 l. above Repri≈øals, and free from Incumbrances, to be approved by the ≈øaid M. B.) to be paid unto the ≈øaid M. B. and her A≈ø≈øigns, yearly and every year, during her Natural Life, at the Fea≈øts of the Birth of our Lord, the Annunciation of the Ble≈ø≈øed Virgin Mary, the Nativity of St. John the Bapti≈øt, and St. Michael the Arch-angel, by equal portions: The fir≈øt payment thereof to begin and be made at ≈øuch of the ≈øaid Fea≈øts as ≈øhall fir≈øt and next happen after the ≈øealing and executing ≈øuch Conveyance and A≈ø≈øurance, as afore≈øaid. And al≈øo, That they the ≈øaid J. P. and W. T. their Executors or Admini≈øtrators, yearly and every year, during the Life of the ≈øaid M. B. or untill the Sealing and Executing ≈øuch Conveyance and A≈ø≈øurance as afore≈øaid, at the place afore≈øaid, ≈øhall and will well and truly pay, or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid C. B. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators 20 l. of lawful Mony of England at the four Fea≈øts afore≈øaid, by equal portions, the fir≈øt payment thereof to begin and be made at the Fea≈øt of the Birth of our Lord next coming. And al≈øo, That if default ≈øhall be made of Sealing and Executing ≈øuch Conveyance and A≈ø≈øurance, as afore≈øaid, for payment of the ≈øaid 40 l. per Annum unto the ≈øaid M. B. during her Life; Then the ≈øaid J. P.
and W. T. their Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will within three Months next after ≈øuch the death of the ≈øaid M.B. at the place afore≈øaid, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid C. B his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, the ≈øaid 1000 l. together with ≈øo much Mony as ≈øhall or may be grown due for the Intere≈øt or Forbearance of the ≈øaid 1000 l. after the rate by Law allowed, from ≈øuch of the ≈øaid four Fea≈øts afore≈øaid, as ≈øhall happen next before the death of the ≈øaid M. B. until ≈øuch payment of the ≈øaid 1000 l. And the ≈øaid J. P. and W. T. do joyntly and ≈øeverally, for them and either of them≈øelves, their and either of their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid M. B. her Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That they the ≈øaid J. P. and W. T. their Executors or Admini≈øtrators, yearly and every year, during the Life of the ≈øaid M. B. or until the Sealing and Executing ≈øuch conveyance and A≈ø≈øurance, as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall and will at the Place afore≈øaid, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid M. B. or her A≈ø≈øigns, 40 l. of lawful Mony of England at the four Fea≈øts afore≈øaid by equal portions, the fir≈øt payment to begin and be made at the Fea≈øt of the Birth of our Lord next coming. Provided always, That if the ≈øaid J. P. and W. T. their Executors or Admini≈øtrators, (the ≈øaid C. B. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, and the ≈øaid M. B. having Notice by the ≈øpace of three months before) do or ≈øhall at any time during the Life of the ≈øaid M. B. at the place afore≈øaid, pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid C.B. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, and the ≈øaid M.B. the ≈øaid Sum of 1000 l. by ≈øuch part, ≈øhares and proportions as they ≈øhall by Writing under their Hands and Seals direct and appoint, with ≈øo much of the ≈øaid yearly Sums of twenty pounds and Forty pounds, as ≈øhall be then re≈øpectively unpaid unto
the ≈øaid C. B. and M. B. ratably and proportionably for the time the ≈øame ≈øhall be arrear; That then and from thenceforth, and at all times after this pre≈øent Indenture, and all and every Covenant, Clau≈øe and Article therein contained, ≈øhall cea≈øe and become void. Any thing herein contained to the contrary notwith≈øtanding.

div.head: Covenants about a≈ø≈øigning a Stock in the Ea≈øt-India Company.

body.p:
THis Indenture, &c. made between A. B. of the one part, and C. D. of the other part, Witne≈ø≈øeth, That in con≈øideration of three Guinea's to the ≈øaid A. B. by the ≈øaid C. D. in hand paid, at and before the ≈øealing and delivery hereof, the Receipt whereof the ≈øaid A. B. doth hereby acknowledge. The ≈øaid A. B. doth hereby covenant, promi≈øe and agree, to and with the ≈øaid C. D. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, That if the ≈øaid C. D. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall transfer, or cau≈øe to be transferred, One hundred pounds Credit of the General Joint-Stock of the Governour and Company of the Merchants of London, Trading to the East-Indies, to the ≈øaid A. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, at any time, on or before the 19th day of September now next following: And thereof ≈øhall give Notice or Warning in Writing at the now Dwelling-hou≈øe of the ≈øaid A.B. ≈øituate in Cheap≈øide, London, three days at the lea≈øt before ≈øuch Transfer of the ≈øaid One hundred pounds Credit, That then the ≈øaid A. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will accept the, ≈øaid One hundred pounds Credit, and al≈øo ≈øhall and will well and truly pay, or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid C. D. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns for the ≈øame, at the time of ≈øuch Tran≈øferring thereof, as afore≈øaid, the full Sum of Seventy
five pounds of lawful mony of England; together with all ≈øuch Sum and Sums of mony as ≈øhall after the date hereof, and before ≈øuch Transfer, become due or payable into the ≈øaid Joint Stock, on account of the ≈øaid One hundred pounds Credit, by virtue of any Order of a General Court, or Court of Committee, that ≈øhall hereafter be made, Then and in ≈øuch ca≈øe all Dividends and Profits that ≈øhall after the date hereof, and before ≈øuch Transfer, be Voted, Ordered, made, ari≈øe or happen, on or in re≈øpect of the ≈øaid One hundred pounds Credit, ≈øhall be and remain to the ≈øaid A. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, and be deducted out of the ≈øaid Seventy five pounds, ≈øo as afore≈øaid to be paid to the ≈øaid C. D. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns. But, if the ≈øaid C. D. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall not Tran≈øfer or cau≈øe to be Transferred unto the ≈øaid A. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, the ≈øaid One hundred pounds Credit, as afore≈øaid, within the time afore≈øaid, then this Indenture to be void and of none effect; and the ≈øaid three Guinea's to remain to the ≈øaid A. B. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators for ever.

div.head: Such Nece≈ø≈øary Articles of Agreement between four Joint-Executors, as ought to be made between them for the better Execution of the Will.

body.head: Articles of Agreement quadripartite, indented, had, made, concluded and agreed upon, &c. between W. C. of, &c. of the first part, A. C. of, &c. of the ≈øecond part. W. L. of, &c. of the third part, and T.D. of, &c. of the fourth part, as followeth.
body.p:
WHereas R. P. late of W. in the County of S. Yeoman, the 20th day of May la≈øt pa≈øt before the date of the≈øe Pre≈øents, made his la≈øt Will
and Te≈øtament in writting, and thereby did make and appoint the ≈øaid W.C. A. G. W.L, and T. D. Executors of his la≈øt Will; and ≈øhortly after the making thereof died, as by the ≈øaid Will may appear.

Now for the better Execution of the ≈øaid Will it is covenanted and agreed between the ≈øaid Executors in manner and form following (that is to ≈øay) Fir≈øt, the ≈øaid W. C. doth for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors, and Admini≈øtrators covenant, promi≈øe, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid A. C. W. L. and T. D. their Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, that the ≈øaid W. C. ≈øhall not, nor will not acquit, relea≈øe or di≈øcharge any Debt, Duty or ≈øum of mony due unto the ≈øaid R. P. in his Life time, nor any Debt, Duty or Sum of Mony due unto the ≈øaid W. C. A. C. W. L. and T. D. by rea≈øon or means of the Execution of the la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament of the ≈øaid R. P. nor acquit, relea≈øe, di≈øcharge di≈øcontinue or otherwi≈øe adnul any Suit, Action, Cau≈øe, Plaint, or other Legal Proceeding to be by them brought pro≈øecuted or commenced for any matter, cau≈øe or thing what≈øoever touching the execution of the la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament of the ≈øaid R. P. without the ≈øpecial licen≈øe and con≈øent of the ≈øaid A. C. W. L. and T. D. the ≈øurvivors and ≈øurvivor of them, therein or thereto fir≈øt had and obtained: And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid W. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will from time to time, and at all times hereafter, at and upon every rea≈øonable reque≈øt of the ≈øaid A. C. W. L. and T. D. and the ≈øurvivors and ≈øurvivor of them give and deliver upon unto them, and the ≈øurvivors and ≈øurvivor of them, a true, exact and ju≈øt particular of all and ≈øingular ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony, as well ≈øuch as have been received, as ≈øuch as have been disbur≈øed by the ≈øaid W. C. in, about or concerning the execution of the la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament
of the ≈øaid R. P. and ≈øhall and will acquit and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid A. C. W. L. and T. D. their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, of, and from all ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony received, or to be received by the ≈øaid W. C. in and about the execution of the la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament of the ≈øaid R. P. of, from and again≈øt all and every per≈øon and per≈øons, to whom ≈øuch ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony doth, ≈øhall or may of right belong and appertain; and ≈øuch ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony ≈øo by him received, or to be received, ≈øhall and will pay, di≈øpo≈øe and imploy, as by the ≈øaid la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament of the ≈øaid R. P. is directed, limited and appointed: And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid W. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will from time to time, and at all times hereafter, ≈øu≈øtain, bear, pay, and di≈øcharge the fourth part, or one part in four parts to be divided, of all co≈øts, charges and expences, which they the ≈øaid W. C. A. C. W. L. and T. D. and the ≈øurvivors and ≈øurvivor of them ≈øhall any way ≈øu≈øtain, bear, pay or be put unto by pro≈øecuting or defending of any ≈øuit in Law or Equity, or otherwi≈øe, by occa≈øion, means or rea≈øon of the execution of the la≈øt will and Te≈øtament of the ≈øaid R. P. without fraud or guile. And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid W. C. ≈øhall and will a≈ø≈øi≈øt and concur with the ≈øaid A. C. W. L. and T. D. the ≈øurvivors and ≈øurvivor of them, in and about the payment of the Debts of the ≈øaid Te≈øtator R. P. and of the Legacies given and di≈øpo≈øed by the ≈øaid R. P. in his ≈øaid la≈øt Will, and in the ≈øelling and di≈øpo≈øing of the Lands, Tenements and Hereditaments of the ≈øaid R. P. by the ≈øaid Will of the ≈øaid R. P. appointed to be ≈øold, and in all other things tending to the due Execution of the ≈øaid la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament of the ≈øaid R. P. without fraud or guile: And the ≈øaid A. C. doth Covenant, &c. mutatis mutandis, and ≈øo of the re≈øt.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof to one part of the≈øe pre≈øent Articles to be remaining, with the ≈øaid W. C. the ≈øaid A. C. W. L. and T. D. have ≈øet their Hands and Seals, and to another part, &c.

div.head: Covenants between a Mortgagee and a Purcha≈øer of the Redemption, That the Mortgagee ≈øhall a≈ø≈øign upon payment of the Mortgage Mony.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between R. S. of, &c. of the one part, and W. B. of, &c. Merchant, of the other part. Whereas T. F. of L. Jeweller, and S. his Wife, late called S.C. by their Indenture of Relea≈øe bearing date, &c. for and in Con≈øideration of 100 l. to them in hand paid, did grant relea≈øe and confirm unto the ≈øaid R. S. and W. S. of, &c. afore≈øaid, Victualler, their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, All that Ma≈ø≈øuage or Tenement, with the appurtenances, late in the occupation of G. S. Doctor in Divinity, ≈øituate lying and being on, &c. afore≈øaid, between a Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement in the occupation of R. T. Gent. on the North, and a Me≈ø≈øuage called W. in the occupation of T. P. on the South; and upon a certain Provi≈øo or Condition in the ≈øame Indenture contained for making void thereof, If the ≈øaid T. F. ≈øhould Pay unto the ≈øaid R. S. 106 l. at ≈øeveral days then to come, and yet not pa≈øt. And whereas the ≈øaid W. B. hath contracted and agreed with the ≈øaid T. F. to purcha≈øe of and from the ≈øaid T. F. the redemption and benefit of redemption of the premi≈ø≈øes. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That it is covenanced and agreed between the ≈øaid parties to this Indenture; and the ≈øaid R. S. doth for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid W. B. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, That if the ≈øaid W. B. or his
Heirs, do or ≈øhall before the, &c. next coming, purcha≈øe of and from the ≈øaid T. F. the Redemption of the premi≈ø≈øes. And al≈øo, If the ≈øaid W. B. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, do or ≈øhall upon the ≈øaid, &c. next coming, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid R. S. &c. of lawful Mony of England, being the Principal Mony lent upon Security of the premi≈ø≈øes, and the Intere≈øt which will then be due for the forbearance thereof; Then they the ≈øaid R. S. and W. S. or their Heirs, ≈øhall and will by good and ≈øufficient conveyance and a≈ø≈øurance in the Law, well and ≈øufficiently to be executed at the reque≈øt, and at the co≈øts and charges of the ≈øaid W. B. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, well and ≈øufficiently convey and a≈ø≈øure unto the ≈øaid W. B. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, or to ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons as he or they ≈øhall direct or appoint; all the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement, with the appurtenances, before herein mentioned, with Covenants in ≈øuch Conveyance to be comprized, for their enjoying all the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement, with the appurtenances, without any let or interruption, of or by the ≈øaid R. S. and W. S. or either of them, their or either of their Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, or any other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, claiming or which ≈øhall claim by, from or under them, or any of them, free, clear and di≈øcharged from all Incumbrances, by them or any of them, done or to be done or ≈øuffered. And the ≈øaid W. B. doth for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid R. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid W. B. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid R. S. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, the, &c. upon the ≈øaid, &c. next coming, without fraud or delay.

div.p: Note, On all Purcha≈øes where there is a pre≈øent Mortgage not pre≈øently taken in, it is be≈øt to have ≈øuch Covenants for avoiding Suits in Chancery about the Redemption and other Inconveniences.

div.head: A Declaration of a Tru≈øt upon admitting two Lives into a Copyhold, with nece≈ø≈øary Covenants.

body.p:
THis Indenture Tripartite, made, &c. Between H. E. of, &c. of the fir≈øt part, T. B. of, &c. of the ≈øecond part, and G. S. of, &c. of the third part. Whereas the ≈øaid G. S. &c. hath this pre≈øent day granted unto the ≈øaid H. E. and T. B. one Me≈ø≈øuage and 16 Acres of Land, with the appurtenances, in the Pari≈øh of B. within the Mannor afore≈øaid; To have and to hold unto the ≈øaid H. E. and his A≈ø≈øigns, for term of his Life, (immediately after the death or other forfeiture of the E≈øtate of J. P who holdeth the premi≈ø≈øes, for the term of his Life;) and after the death of them the ≈øaid J. P. and H.E. To have and to hold the premi≈ø≈øes afore≈øaid, with the appurtenances, unto the ≈øaid T. and his A≈ø≈øigns, for and during the term of his Natural Life, by Copy of Court-Roll, at the Will of the Lord, according to the Cu≈øtom of the Mannor afore≈øaid in Tru≈øt, to ≈øurrender the ≈øame Premi≈ø≈øes at the reque≈øt of the ≈øaid G. S. and to ≈øuch u≈øes as he ≈øhall direct. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, that the ≈øaid H. E. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid H. E. ≈øhall and will upon the reque≈øt, and at the co≈øt and charges of the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øurrender into the hands of the Lord of the Mannor afore≈øaid, the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, and all his E≈øtate and Intere≈øt
therein, in ≈øuch manner and to ≈øuch u≈øe and u≈øes as the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall direct or appoint: And in the mean time, until ≈øuch Surrender as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall and will permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators peaceably and quietly to have, hold and enjoy the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, and the Rents, I≈ø≈øues and Profits thereof to receive and take up to and for his and their own u≈øe, without any let or interruption of or by the ≈øaid H. E. his Executors, Admi≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns. And the ≈øaid T. B. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid T. B. ≈øhall and will upon the reque≈øt and at the co≈øts and charges of the ≈øaid G. S his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øurrender into the hands of the Lord of the Mannor afore≈øaid, the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, and all his E≈øtate and Intere≈øt therein, in ≈øuch manner and to ≈øuch u≈øe and u≈øes as the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall direct or appoint: And in the mean time, until ≈øuch Surrender as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall and will permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators peaceably and quietly to have hold and enjoy the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, and the Rents, I≈ø≈øues and Profits thereof to receive and take up, to and for his and their own u≈øe, without any let or interruption, of or by the ≈øaid T. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns. And becau≈øe it is uncertain whether the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes be Heriotable or not, The ≈øaid G. S. doth for him≈øelf his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid H. E. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors or
Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will upon the reque≈øt of the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid H. E. well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid H. ≈øo much mony as any Bea≈øt which ≈øhall be taken or ≈øeized for, or in the Name of a Heriot for the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes, upon the death of the ≈øaid H. E ≈øhall be worth at the time of ≈øuch taking. And the ≈øaid G. S. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid T. B. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will upon the reque≈øt of the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid T. B. well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid T. ≈øo much Mony as any Bea≈øt which ≈øhall be taken or ≈øeized for or in the Name of a Heriot for the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes, upon the death of the ≈øaid T. B. ≈øhall be worth at the time of ≈øuch taking.

div.head: Articles for purcha≈øing of a Me≈ø≈øuage, with a Covenant, That the Grantor ≈øhall pay the Charge which the Grantee ≈øhall expend in ejecting the Tenant in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion.

body.head: Articles of Agreement Indented, had, made concluded and agreed upon, &c. Between A. P. of &c. in the County of S. Widow, of the one part, and T. A. of, &c. Gent. of the other part, viz.
body.p:
FIr≈øt, The ≈øaid A. P. for and in con≈øideration of 5 s. of lawful Mony of England, to her in hand paid by the ≈øaid T. A. and of 270 l. and 15 s. of like lawful Mony, to be paid in ≈øuch manner
as is after herein mentioned, doth covenant, promi≈øe, grant and agree for her ≈øelf, her Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, to and with the ≈øaid T. A. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, by the≈øe pre≈øents, That ≈øhe the ≈øaid A. P. or her Heirs, ≈øhall and will before the 25th day of December next en≈øuing the date hereof, at the co≈øts and charges in the Law of the ≈øaid T. A. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, by good and ≈øufficient conveyance and a≈ø≈øurance in the Law, well and ≈øufficiently executed, convey and a≈ø≈øure, or cau≈øe to be conveyed and a≈ø≈øured unto the ≈øaid T. A. and his Heirs afore≈øaid, all that Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement, &c. with their appurtenances ≈øituate, lying and being in, &c. now in the occupation of R. P Gent. with Covenants and Warranty in ≈øuch conveyance and a≈ø≈øurance to be comprized, That the ≈øaid T. A. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall hold and enjoy for ever the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, or Tenement and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, again≈øt the ≈øaid A.P. and her Heirs, and without any let, trouble, interruption, or contradiction of or by the ≈øaid A. P. or T. G. or G. G. Son of J. G. Father of the ≈øaid A. P their Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, or any of them, or any other per≈øon or per≈øons claiming in, by, from or under her, them, or any of them. And for being di≈øcharged or ≈øaved harmle≈øs of and from all Jointures, Dowers and Titles of Dower, Charges, Titles, Troubles, Burthens and Incumbrances what≈øoever, had, commited, done or ≈øuffered, or to be had committed, or done by the ≈øaid A.P. T.G. J.G. G.G. or either of them, their or either of their Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns. And for making any further lawful and rea≈øonable a≈ø≈øurance in the Law at the co≈øts and charges of the ≈øaid T. A. as ≈øhall be rea≈øonably advi≈øed or devi≈øed by the ≈øaid T. A. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, or by his or their Council learned in the Laws, during the ≈øpace of, &c. next en≈øuing the date of ≈øuch Conveyance ≈øo to be made,
with all other fit and rea≈øonable Covenants to be compri≈øed in ≈øuch Conveyance and A≈ø≈øurance.

Item, The ≈øaid A. P. doth further Covenant, &c. That ≈øhe the ≈øaid A. P. her Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will within 40 days next after Notice and Reque≈øt made, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid T. A. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns all ≈øuch Sum and Sums of Mony, as he or they ≈øhall at any time hereafter nece≈ø≈øarily expend, lay out or disbur≈øe in ejecting or putting out the ≈øaid R. P. out of the po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement, and premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, and recovering the po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion thereof unto the ≈øaid T. A. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, by due cour≈øe of Law.

Item, The ≈øaid T. A. doth covenant, &c. That he the ≈øaid T. A. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid A. P. her Executors, Admi≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, the ≈øaid Sum of 270 l. and 15 s. on, &c. next en≈øuing the date hereof, at or in the now dwelling Hou≈øe of, &c. without fraud or delay, &c.

div.head: Agreement of the Tenants of a Mannor about ploughing a Common Field.

body.p:
KNow all men by the≈øe pre≈øents, That a parcel of Pa≈øture Ground called, &c. doth belong to ≈øeveral Lands and Tenements in, &c. afore≈øaid, and in the ≈øeveral po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions of us who≈øe Names are hereunder written, by ≈øuch portions and alloments thereof as were enjoyed and occupied with our ≈øaid ≈øeveral Lands and Tenements, by the re≈øpective Owners thereof, about 30 years ago, when the ≈øaid Down was ploughed and ≈øown with Corn and Grain; and ≈øince that time the ≈øaid Down hath been u≈øed by us in Common
for feeding Sheep, by every of us, after the rate of 50 Sheep for every Yard-Land in, &c. afore≈øaid. and proportionably for a greater or le≈øs quantity: And it is agreed between us, that from henceforth yearly, ≈øo long as the major part of us ≈øhall think fit, the ≈øaid Down ≈øhall be ploughed and ≈øown with Corn and Grain, and u≈øed and enjoyed for that purpo≈øe ≈øeparately by us, according to the ≈øaid former portions and allotments, to our ≈øaid re≈øpective Lands and Tenements, and every of us ≈øhall in the la≈øt year of Sowing the ≈øaid Down, ≈øow on his ≈øeveral allotment ≈øo much Trefoil-Seed as the major part of us, ≈øhall think fit. And it is further agreed between us, That none of us ≈øhall permit or ≈øuffer any Cattle to depa≈øture or be kept upon the ≈øaid Down at any time, in any year after ≈øome Corn ≈øhall be ≈øown in the ≈øaid Down, until all the Corn and Grain there growing ≈øhall be cut and mowed, and carried away. And at ≈øuch times in the year when the ≈øaid Down ≈øhall be convenient for pa≈øturing, Then none of us ≈øhall depa≈øture or keep there more or other Cattle than according to the proportion of 35 Sheep for every Yard-Land. And it is further agreed, That every of us, according to the proportion of his allotment afore≈øaid ≈øhall bear, and pay the charge of making and maintaining of ≈øuch Hedges as the major part of us ≈øhall think nece≈ø≈øary to be made upon the ≈øaid Down; and ≈øhall bear ≈øuch proportionable part of all charges which the major part of us ≈øhall think fit to expend about the enforcing the due performance of the mutual Agreements herein contained, and ≈øecuring the enjoyment of the afore≈øaid portions and allotments of the ≈øaid Down. And every one of us by him≈øelf doth promi≈øe unto every other of us to perform the Agreement afore≈øaid on his part to be performed.

div.p: Note, Such Agreement of numerous Parties ≈øeems be≈øt to be made by Writing un≈øealed, and may be atte≈øted thus:
div.q: Signed and agreed by A. B. &c. and ≈øo of the re≈øt as they ≈øeverally ≈øign.

div.head: Indenture of Covenants upon a Contract for Purcha≈øe of a Copyhold, where part of the Purcha≈øe mony is paid, and the Purcha≈øer is to be at liberty to proceed in the Purcha≈øe or not.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. between J. S. of, &c. of the one part, and W.R. of &c. of the other part; whereas the ≈øaid J. S. in con≈øideration of 75. l. of lawful Mony of England, to him by the ≈øaid W. R. in hand paid, 60 l. more to be paid in ≈øuch manner and as is herein after mentioned, hath this pre≈øent day bargained and ≈øold, or agreed to bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid W. R. all that Me≈ø≈øuage and Yard-land called, &c. which the ≈øaid J. S. now holdeth to him and his Heirs by Copy of Court Roll of the Mannor of, &c. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. S. doth for him≈øelf his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid W.R. is Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, that the ≈øaid J. S. upon reque≈øt to him made, ≈øhall and will at the co≈øts and charges of the ≈øaid W. R. well and truly, and according to the cu≈øtom of the Mannor afore≈øaid, ≈øurrender into the hands of the Lord of the ≈øaid Mannor, the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances, to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid W. R. and his Heirs for ever: And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid W. R. and his Heirs ≈øhall, or lawfully may from time to time, and at all times
from henceforth during the life of the ≈øaid J. S. peaceably and quietly have, hold and enjoy the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances; and the rents and profits thereof receive, have and take to his and their own u≈øe, without any account thereof to be rendred, and without any lett or interruption of or by the ≈øaid J. S. Provided always and upon this condition, neverthele≈øs that if the ≈øaid W. R. or his Heirs at the time of the reque≈øt unto the ≈øaid J. S. for making ≈øuch ≈øurrender as afore≈øaid, do not or ≈øhall not well and truly pay, or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid J. S. the ≈øaid 60 l. before mentioned, and do not al≈øo in the mean time upon every reque≈øt thereof to be made by the ≈øaid J. S. pay unto him Intere≈øt for the forbearance of the ≈øaid 60 l. after the rate of 5 l. per Cent. for a year, that then and from thenceforth, and at all times after all the agreements and covenants of the ≈øaid J. S. before herein mentioned ≈øhall cea≈øe and be utterly void and of none effect. And the ≈øaid J. S. doth further for him≈øelf his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid W. R. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, that if the ≈øaid J. S. do not in his life make ≈øuch ≈øurrender as afore≈øaid, then the Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid J. S. ≈øhall and will within 20 day after his decea≈øe, repay unto the ≈øaid W. R. the ≈øaid 75 l. by him paid to the ≈øaid J. S. as afore≈øaid.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs, &c. interchangeably ≈øet their Hands and Seals the day and year fir≈øt above written.

div.head: Covenants upon purcha≈øing the equity of Redemption of Copyhold-lands Mortgaged.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. between H.W. of, &c. of the one party, and J. P. of, &c. of the other party, witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid H. W. for and in con≈øideration of the ≈øum of 550 l. of lawful Mony of England, to him agreed to be paid in manner and form herein after expre≈ø≈øed, hath granted, bargained and ≈øold, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth grant, bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid J. P. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, all and ≈øingular the Copyhold-lands, Tenements and Hereditaments of him the ≈øaid H. W. ≈øituate, &c. and all redemption and benefit of redemption, condition, benefit of condition, claim and demand of him the ≈øaid H. W. of, in or to all and every the Copyhold-lands and Tenements which are or were of the ≈øaid H. W. ≈øituate, &c. afore≈øaid. And the ≈øaid H. W. doth covenant, promi≈øe and grant for him≈øelf his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns to and with the ≈øaid J. P. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, that he the ≈øaid H. W. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and will at or before the 29 day of September next en≈øuing the date hereof, by good and ≈øufficient ≈øurrender, well and ≈øufficiently executed, ≈øurrender into the hands of, &c. all and every the Copyhold-lands and Tements which he the ≈øaid H.W. hath within the ≈øaid Mannor, and which do to him of right belong or appertain in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion or rever≈øion, whereof and wherein he hath any power or po≈ø≈øibility of redemption, and the ≈øaid J. P. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and may thereunto be admitted, and ≈øhall and may from time to time, and at all times hereafter enjoy and po≈ø≈øe≈øs the ≈øame without fraud or guile: And al≈øo that W. S. of, &c. ≈øhall at or before the 29 day of September next en≈øuing the dath hereof,
by good and ≈øufficient ≈øurrender, well and ≈øufficiently to be executed, ≈øurrender into the hands of, &c. all and every the Copyhold-lands and Tenements which he the ≈øaid W. S. now hath, or ≈øhall or may claim by virtue or colour of any ≈øurrender from the ≈øaid H W. And the ≈øaid J. P. ≈øhall and may upon ≈øuch ≈øurrender made, have and take admittance of and to the ≈øaid Copyhold-lands and Tenements, and the ≈øame ≈øhall and may po≈ø≈øe≈øs, hold and enjoy without fraud or guile. And it is agreed by and between the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, that the ≈øaid J. P. his Heirs, Executors and A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall out of the ≈øaid 550 l. pay unto the ≈øaid W. S. within 28 days after ≈øuch ≈øurrender made by him the ≈øaid W. S. as afore≈øaid, ≈øo much Mony as is now due unto the ≈øaid W. S. from the ≈øaid H. W. and the re≈øidue of the ≈øaid 550 l. he the ≈øaid J. P. ≈øhall within 28 days after ≈øuch ≈øurrender made as afore≈øaid, pay unto the ≈øaid H. W. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns.

div.head: Covenants for ≈øaving harmle≈øs a Bi≈øhop, in refu≈øing to admit an unfit per≈øon to a Vicaridge.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. between A. B. of, &c. and C. D. of, &c. of the one part, and the Right Reverend Father in God, G. Lord Bi≈øhop of C. of the other part. Whereas T. W. Clerk Rector of the Pari≈øh Church of H. within the Dioce≈øs of C. afore≈øaid, did pre≈øent unto the Vicaridge of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh Church, being vacant, F. S. Clerk, whom the ≈øaid A. B. and C. D. did alledg to be a very unfit per≈øon; and did undertake to
prove him a man ≈øo criminous, that he ought not to be admitted into the ≈øaid Vicaridge; whereupon the ≈øaid Lord Bi≈øhop at the reque≈øt of the ≈øaid A. B. and C. D. did refu≈øe to admit or in≈øtitute the ≈øaid F. S. into the ≈øaid Vicaridge. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, that the ≈øaid A. B. and C. D. in con≈øideration of the Premi≈ø≈øes, do jointly and ≈øeverally for them and either of them≈øelves, their and either of their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid Lord Bi≈øhop his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, that they the ≈øaid A. B, and C. D. their Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will from time to time, upon every rea≈øonable reque≈øt, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid Lord Bi≈øhop his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, all ≈øuch ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony, Co≈øts Charges and Damages which he or they have at any time heretofore, or ≈øhall at any time hereafter bear, pay or ≈øuffer for or by rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Lord Bi≈øhops former refu≈øing to admit and in≈øtitute the ≈øaid F. S. into the Vicaridge afore≈øaid, or for or by rea≈øon of any other future refu≈øing ≈øuch admi≈ø≈øion or in≈øtitution, until the ≈øaid A. B. and C. D. their Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall reque≈øt the ≈øaid Lord Bi≈øhop to give ≈øuch Admi≈ø≈øion and In≈øtitution.

div.head: Articles for dividing ≈øome Corn between two Partners in Husbandry.

body.head: Articles of Agreement indented, had, made, concluded and agreed upon, &c. between. T. H. of, &c. of the one part, and T. S. of, &c. of the other part, as followeth.
body.p:
WHereas the ≈øaid T. H. and T. S. are jointly po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of a certain quantity of Barley in the Straw lately grown upon eight Acres of Land in the Pari≈øh of N. in the County afore≈øaid; and al≈øo of a certain quantity of Oats, lately grown upon twenty Acres of Land, in the ≈øame Pari≈øh of N. which ≈øaid Barly and Oats are now in the Barn of the ≈øaid T. H. under the Northwalls of the City of C. afore≈øaid, and in a Reek near the ≈øaid Barn; Wherefore for the better dividing the ≈øaid Barley and Oats, as is herein after mentioned, It is covenanted and agreed between the ≈øaid parties in manner and form following, (that is to ≈øay): Fir≈øt, The ≈øaid T. H. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid T. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid T. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and any other per≈øon or per≈øons to be by him or them appointed, ≈øhall or lawfully may from time to time and at all times ≈øea≈øonable before the _____ day of next _____ en≈øuing the date hereof, enter into and upon the Barn of the ≈øaid T. H. before mentioned, and the Clo≈øe thereunto adjoyning, and thre≈øh out the winnow all the ≈øaid Barley and Oats there; and al≈øo have, take and carry away to and for the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid T. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, three fifth parts, or three parts in five parts to be divided of all the Straw, ari≈øing and
coming of the ≈øaid Barley and Oats, being thre≈øhed from time to time, as the ≈øame ≈øhall be thre≈øhed, without any lett, trouble, interruption or contradiction, of or by the ≈øaid T. H. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators,: And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid T. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and any other per≈øon or per≈øons to be by him or them appointed, upon rea≈øonable notice to be given to the ≈øaid T. H. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall or lawfully may from time to time, and at all times ≈øea≈øonable, after the Barley and Oats afore≈øaid ≈øhall be thre≈øhed and winnowed, enter into and upon the Barn afore≈øaid, and the ≈øaid Barley and Oats equally divide by the Bu≈øhel; and the moiety or one half of the ≈øaid Barley and Oats ≈øo divided, ≈øhall or may have, take and carry away, to and for the ≈øole and proper u≈øe of the ≈øaid T. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, without any lett, interruption or contradiction of or by the ≈øaid T. H. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, without fraud or delay.

Item, The ≈øaid T. H. for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, doth further covenant, grant and gree to and with the ≈øaid T. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid T. H. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall not at any time before ≈øaid Barley and Oats ≈øhall be equally divided according to the true intent hereof, have, take or carry away from the Barn or Clo≈øe afore≈øaid, any part of the Barley and Oats afore≈øaid.

Item, The ≈øaid T. S. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid T. H. his Executors and Adminin≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid T. S. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall, and will at his and their only and proper co≈øts and charges thre≈øh out and winnow all the Barley and
Oats afore≈øaid, or cau≈øe the ≈øame to be thre≈øhed out and winnowed before the ≈øaid _____ day of _____ next coming; and al≈øo that he the ≈øaid T.S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid T. H. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators peaceably and quietly to have, take and enjoy two fifth parts of all the Straw ari≈øing and coming of the Barley and Oats afore≈øaid, the ≈øaid Straw to be divided by the daily thre≈øhing (to wit) the ≈øaid T. H. to have two daies thre≈øhings, and the ≈øaid T. S. three daies thre≈øhings thereof alternis vicibus. And al≈øo that the ≈øaid T. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid T. H. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators peaceably and quietly to have, take and enjoy to and for his and their only and proper u≈øe and behoof the moiety or one half of all the Barley and Oats afore≈øaid, being equally divided by the Bu≈øhel as afore≈øaid.
