div.head: Articles between Joynt-Tenants for cutting Corn and dividing it in the Field.

body.head: Articles of Agreement, Indented and made, concluded and agreed upon the, &c. between R. F. of, &c. of the one part, and J. M. of, &c. afore≈øaid, of the other part as followeth.
body.p:
WHereas the ≈øaid J. M. and R. F. have a joint right, property and intere≈øt of, in and to all the Corn and Grain ≈øtanding, growing, and
being upon ≈øeveral parcels of Land, whereof J. M. Father of the ≈øaid M. party to the≈øe pre≈øents lately dead, po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed, lying &c. Now for the better dividing the ≈øaid Corn and Grain between them the ≈øaid R. F. and J. M. it is covenanted and agreed between the ≈øaid Parties in manner and form following, (that is to ≈øay:) Fir≈øt, The ≈øaid R. F. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid J. M. party to the≈øe pre≈øents, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents; That when and a≈ø≈øoon as the ≈øaid Corn and Grain ≈øhall be reaped, mowed or cut down, he the ≈øaid R. F. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall or will divide, or cau≈øe the ≈øame to be divided into equal parts: And ≈øhall and will permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid J. M. party to the≈øe pre≈øents, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and his and their Servants, Labourers and Work-men, with nece≈ø≈øary Carts and Carriages, peaceably and quietly to enter into and upon all the ≈øeveral parcels of Land before mentioned, and the moity or one half of all the Corn and Grain afore≈øaid, to load, have, take, carry away and enjoy to, and for the only and proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. M. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, without any lett, trouble, interruption or contradiction of or by the ≈øaid R. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, without fraud or delay.

Item, The ≈øaid J. M. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. F. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents: That he the ≈øaid R. F. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall or lawfully may load, have, take, carry away and enioy the other moiety, or one half of the Corn-and Grain afore≈øaid, to and for his and their own proper u≈øe and behoof, without any lett, trouble,
interruption or contradiction of or by the ≈øaid J. M. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, without fraud or delay: And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid J. M. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will from time to time, upon notice and reque≈øt to him or them made, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid R. F. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, all ≈øuch Sum or Sums of Mony as he or they ≈øhall expend, lay out or disbur≈øe for or about the reaping, mowing cutting down or otherwi≈øe harve≈øting the Corn and Grain afore≈øaid, without fraud or delay.

div.head: Covenants for delivery of Wheat ≈øold by two Bu≈øhels Weekly.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. between R. H. of, &c. of the one part, and W. C. of, &c. of the other part, Witne≈ø≈øeth that the ≈øaid R. H. hath ≈øold unto the ≈øaid W. C. thirteen Quarters of Wheat, at the price of 1 l. 12 s. for every Quarter, to be delivered and paid in ≈øuch manner and form as is herein after mentioned: And the ≈øaid R. H. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid W. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That the ≈øaid R. H. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, at the place called, &c. ≈øhall and will deliver or cau≈øe to be delivered unto the ≈øaid W. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, the ≈øaid thirteen Quarters of Wheat in manner following, (that it to ≈øay,) Two Bu≈øhels thereof Weekly upon Saturday in every Week, until the ≈øaid thirteen Quarters ≈øhall be fully delivered; The fir≈øt delivery thereof to begin and be made
on Saturday, the third day of October next en≈øuing the date hereof. And that the ≈øaid two Bu≈øhels of Wheat ≈øo Weekly upon every Saturday to be delivered, ≈øhall be good, ≈øweet, clean and merchantable Wheat, and not wor≈øe by more than three pence in every Bu≈øhel, than ≈øo much of the be≈øt Wheat which on ≈øuch Saturday ≈øhall be ≈øold in the ≈øaid Market-hou≈øe. And the ≈øaid W. C. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admi≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid R. H. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid W. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, for the ≈øaid Wheat ≈øo to be delivered as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall and will at the Corn Market-hou≈øe afore≈øaid, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid R. H. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, 20 l. 16 s. of lawful Mony of England, in manner and form following, (that is to ≈øay,) eight ≈øhillings Weekly upon Saturday in every Week, until the ≈øaid 20 l. 16 s. ≈øhall be fully ≈øatisfied and paid, The fir≈øt payment thereof to begin and be made upon the afore≈øaid third day of October next coming.

div.head: Covenants for Repairing the Steeple of a Cathedral Church.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. between H. R. of, &c. of the one part, and H. E. of, &c. of the other part. Whereas the Steeple of the ≈øaid Cathedral Church afore≈øaid, is much decayed, and many cracks and clefts are therein, and much of the Morter and divers of the Stones and iron-work thereof are moltered, wa≈øted and con≈øumed by Age and Tempe≈øt. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid H. R. for and in con≈øideration of 23 l. to be paid in ≈øuch manner as is herein after mentioned, doth for him≈øelf, his Executors
and Admini≈øtrators, convenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid H. E. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid H. R. before the fir≈øt day of August next coming, will repair the ≈øaid Steeple as followeth, viz. That he the ≈øaid H. R. ≈øhall and will take down the Weathercock being upon the top of the ≈øaid Steeple, and amend, repair and make ≈øufficient all the iron-work, which is or hath been about the top of the ≈øaid Steeple, for the bearing the ≈øaid Cock. And al≈øo ≈øhall and will well, ≈øufficiently and artificially put, hang up and fa≈øten perpendicularly and geometrically and aptly to be turned with every Wind, upon ≈øuch repaired iron-Work on the top of the ≈øaid Steeple, the ≈øaid Weathercock or ≈øome other Cock or Fan as the ≈øaid H. E. or his A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall appoint: And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid H. R. ≈øhall and will, well, ≈øufficiently and artificially ≈øcrape off and do away all the Mo≈øs growing or being upon the ≈øaid Steeple, And ≈øhall and will take out all Stones in the ≈øaid Steeple, being loo≈øe, broken, crackt or decayed, and in the places thereof, ≈øhall well and artificially ≈øet and put in other good and ≈øound Stones, and them ≈øhall ≈øtrongly clamp in with Iron and Lead and ≈øhall al≈øo with fit Stones and other materials well, ≈øufficiently and perfectly fill up all the rifts, cracks, clefts and holes in the ≈øaid Steeple, and new clamp them with Iron and Lead; And ≈øhall al≈øo with good, fit, ≈øtrong and durable Morter, well, ≈øub≈øtantially and prefectly new point all the out≈øide of the ≈øaid Steeple with the Garlands thereof: And likewi≈øe new point the in≈øide of the ≈øaid Steeple where any need requires. And when the ≈øaid Steeple ≈øhall ≈øo be repaired as afore≈øaid, he the ≈øaid H. R. ≈øhall and will remove and take down into the Church-yard near the ≈øaid Church all the Scaffolds, Ladders and other implements u≈øed
about the work afore≈øaid: And the ≈øaid H. E. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid H. R. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid H. E. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will well and truly pay or cau≈øe to paid unto the ≈øaid H. R. or his A≈ø≈øigns, for the repairing of the ≈øaid Steeple as afore≈øaid to be done and performed, the afore≈øaid 23. l. in manner following, (that is ≈øo ≈øay,) 2 l. thereof when the Weathercock afore≈øaid ≈øhall be taken down, 10 l. more thereof when the Fowre of the ≈øquares or ≈øides of the ≈øaid Steeple ≈øhall be ≈øo repaired and amended as afore≈øaid, from the top to the bottom, and 11 l. re≈øidue thereof when all the ≈øaid reparations and works ≈øhall be wholly done and fini≈øhed, in all things according to the true intent and meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents: And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid H. E. or his A≈ø≈øigns, at the co≈øts of the ≈øaid H. E. ≈øhall and will from time to time upon rea≈øonable warning, at the co≈øts of the ≈øaid H. E. find and provide near the Cathedral Church afore≈øaid, ≈øuch Lime, Sand, Stones, Iron, Lead and other Materials as ≈øhall be needful and nece≈ø≈øary to be u≈øed and imployed in or about the repairing the ≈øaid Steeple as afore≈øaid, except Scaffolds and the materials thereof. And al≈øo that the ≈øaid H. R. and his Servants and Labourers ≈øhall and may in and about the work afore≈øaid, have the u≈øe of all or any the Ladders belonging to the Cathedral Church afore≈øaid.

div.head: An Agreement of Copartner≈øhip between two Sale≈ømen with nece≈ø≈øary Covenants.

body.p:
THis Indenture made &c. between R. C. of the one part, and C. R. of the other part. Whereas the ≈øaid C. R. is po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed by Lea≈øe for divers
years yet to come, of and in all that Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement with the appurtenances, called or known by the name of the Queen's Head, ≈øituate and being in, &c. now in the occupation of the ≈øaid R. C. And whereas the ≈øaid Parties are agreed to be Copartners in the Art or Trade of a Sale≈øman, and in buying and ≈øelling of Apparel and other things belonging to the ≈øaid Trade.

Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid R.C. for him≈øelf, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øings doth covenant, promi≈øe, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall have, hold and enjoy the ≈øeveral Rooms hereafter mentioned, being part and parcel of the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, that is to ≈øay, &c. and al≈øo free liberty of ingre≈øs, egre≈øs and regre≈øs to and from the ≈øaid Rooms and Premi≈ø≈øes, at all convenient and ≈øea≈øonable times, for the term of five years, to commence from the Fea≈øt day of, &c. next en≈øuing the date of the≈øe Pre≈øents, yielding and paying therefore yearly unto the ≈øaid R.C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns the yearly Rent or ≈øum of 13 l. of lawful Mony of England at the four mo≈øt u≈øual Fea≈øts or Terms of the year, that is to ≈øay, &c. by even and equal portions. And the ≈øaid C. R. for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, that he the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall and will from time to time, during the ≈øaid term of five years, permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid R. C. and all tho≈øe of whom he holdeth the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, their Heirs, Executors and A≈ø≈øigns with Workmen to enter and come into and upon the ≈øeveral Rooms afore≈øaid, to view, ≈øearch and ≈øee the e≈øtate of the ≈øame.

And this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. for the good liking and opinion,
and ≈øpecial tru≈øt and confidence which each of them hath and repo≈øeth of and in the other of them, and for the advancing of their E≈øtate are contented agreed; and do by the≈øe pre≈øents covenant, grant and agree, each of them to and with the other of them, his Executors and Admini≈øtraters, That they the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall be and continue Copartners together, and Joint-dealers in the Art and My≈øtrey of a Sale≈øman, and the making and ≈øelling of all ≈øorts of Apparel for Men and Women, and in buying and ≈øelling of all things thereunto incident and belonging, from the Fea≈øt day of, &c. next en≈øuing the date of the≈øe Pre≈øents, until the end and term of five years from thence next en≈øuing and fully to be compleat and ended (if both the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall ≈øo long live) the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip to be kept and u≈øed in the Shop and Warehou≈øe beloning to the above named Me≈ø≈øuage.

And for the better managing of the ≈øaid Joint-trade, they the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents have agreed to make up, bring in and put together the ≈øum of Six Hundred Pounds of lawful Mony of England. And the ≈øaid R. C. is agreed to bring in to the ≈øaid Stock for his part, the ≈øum of Three Hundred pounds of lawful Mony of England. And the ≈øaid C. R. is agreed to bring into the ≈øaid Stock for his part and ≈øhare of the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock, the like Sum of Three Hundred Pounds of like lawful Mony of England, being the re≈øidue of the ≈øaid ≈øix Hundred Pounds. And they the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall and may bring and put into the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock-trade, ≈øuch further addition of Stock, as they the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall think fit.

It is now therefore covenanted granted and agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, and each of them by and for him≈øelf his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, doth covenant, promi≈øe,
grant and agree to and with the other of them by the≈øe Pre≈øents in manner and form following, that is to ≈øay, That each of them the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall and will on or before the 10th day of March now next en≈øuing, bring and put into the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock and Trade, each the ≈øum of 300 l. as afore≈øaid, being his ≈øaid re≈øpective part and ≈øhare of the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock.

And that the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock of 600 l. and ≈øuch further addition of Stock, as they the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall bring and put into the ≈øaid Joint-trade, and all the proceed, gains and increa≈øe which ≈øhall be acquired or gotten by rea≈øon or means of the imployment of the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock, and Additional-≈øtock in the ≈øaid Joint-trade, (Except a weekly allowance of 20 s. to each of them the ≈øaid Parties, for their particular expences, to be taken out of the ≈øaid gains,) ≈øhall be from time to time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, continued, u≈øed and imployed in the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip and Joint trade, to and for the u≈øe, benefit and behoof of both the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, as is here under mentioned; and ≈øhall not be taken out, converted, u≈øed or imployed by either of the ≈øaid Parties, to or for any other u≈øe, intention or purpo≈øe what≈øoever.

And that each of them the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall from time to time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip diligently imploy and endeavour him≈øelf in the managing of the ≈øaid Joint-trade, and to advance the ≈øame and the gains and encrea≈øe thereof for the equal benefit and advantage of both the ≈øaid Parties.

And that neither of them the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall u≈øe the ≈øaid Trade in any other places, but only in the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage during the ≈øaid term, nor ≈øhall u≈øe or exerci≈øe the ≈øaid Trade with any other Stock but only for the benefit of both the ≈øaid Parties. And that each of the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall be
true, ju≈øt and and faithful to the other in all his buyings, ≈øellings, dealings, doings and imployments in and about the ≈øaid Joint-trade, and that each of the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall and lawfully may take out of the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock and Gains, the Sum of 20 s. for his particular charges and expences.

And that the ≈øaid Joint-trade ≈øhall be managed and driven, and all buyings, ≈øales, receipts, payments, bills, bonds, ≈øpecialties and other a≈ø≈øurances to be had, made or taken for any matter or thing touching the ≈øaid Joint-trade, ≈øhall be from time to time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, entred, had, and made, taken in the Joint-names of both the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents. And that neither of them the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall at any time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, become bound, or bail, or ≈øurety, or otherwi≈øe engage him≈øelf with or for any per≈øon or per≈øons, for any debt or duty, matter or thing not concerning this Copartner≈øhip, without the licen≈øe and con≈øent of the other Party fir≈øt had in writing under his hand in that behalf, nor ≈øhall at any time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, compound, relea≈øe or di≈øcharge any Debt or Duty which ≈øhall be due or owing to the ≈øaid Joint-trade, without the con≈øent of the other of the ≈øaid Parties fir≈øt had in that behalf, other than ≈øo much thereof as ≈øhall be brought into the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock within ≈øeven days next after ≈øuch relea≈øe made or given for the ≈øame. And that the Joint or Additional-≈øtock afore≈øaid, or any of the gains or increa≈øe thereof, ≈øhall not at any time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip be attached, ≈øeized, extended or taken in Execution, for or in re≈øpect of the private or particular debt or debts, duty or duties of either of the ≈øaid Parties, not concerning this Copartner≈øhip: But that ≈øuch private and particular debt and debts, duty and duties, ≈øhall be payed and ≈øatisfied by him or them the ≈øaid Parties
who≈øe debt or duty the ≈øame is, or ≈øhall be out of his own particular E≈øtate, not included in the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip.

And that neither of the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall at any time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, retain or keep any Servant or Apprentice to be imployed in the ≈øaid Joint-trade, without the con≈øent of the other of them the ≈øaid Parties fir≈øt had and obtained in that behalf.

And that if either of the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall at any time hereafter, ≈øell or deliver upon tru≈øt or credit, any Wares or Commodities of or belonging to the ≈øaid Joint-trade, without the con≈øent of the other of the ≈øaid Parties, then ≈øuch of them the ≈øaid Parties which ≈øhall deliver the ≈øaid Goods or Wares, ≈øhall within three Months next after ≈øuch ≈øale or delivery made, pay into the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock ≈øo much lawful Mony of England as each and every ≈øuch parcel of Wares ≈øhall be ≈øold for, if the per≈øon or per≈øons to whom ≈øuch ≈øale or delivery ≈øhall be made, ≈øhall not in the mean time pay and ≈øatisfie for the ≈øame.

And further it is agreed by the ≈øaid R. C. That he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall and will from time to time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, at his own co≈øts and charges, bear, pay and di≈øcharge all Tythes and other Duties due and payable to the Par≈øon for the afore≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, and all A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øments for relief of the Poor of the Pari≈øh, ≈øo that the ≈øame A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øments exceed not what the ≈øaid R. C. now payeth, and is a≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed for the ≈øame.

And moreover it is mutually conde≈øcended and agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, and each of them for him≈øelf his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, doth covenant and agree to and with the other of them, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That each of them the ≈øaid Copartners ≈øhall and will from time
to time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, have a ≈øeveral and equal part, right, title and intere≈øt in and to the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock and proceed of the ≈øame And in and to all and every the gains and increa≈øe which ≈øhall be made, rai≈øed or gotten in by rea≈øon or by means of the ≈øaid Joint-trade, that is to ≈øay, the ≈øaid R. C. in and to the moiety, or one half part thereof. And the ≈øaid C. R. in and to the other moiety, or one half part thereof: And that each of them the ≈øaid Parties, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and may, at and upon the di≈ø≈øolution of the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, have, receive and take his ≈øaid re≈øpective ≈øhare and part of all the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes to his and their proper u≈øe and behoof for ever, in ≈øuch manner as hereafter in the≈øe Pre≈øents is mentioned and ≈øet down, without any lett or interruption of or by the other of them the ≈øaid Parties, his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, and without any benefit or advantage to be taken by ≈øurvivor≈øhip, or by any of the ≈øaid Parties ≈øurviving the other of them, any Law, U≈øage or Cu≈øtom of Survivor≈øhip to the contrary notwith≈øtanding. And that all debts and duties which ≈øhall be owing by them the ≈øaid Parties, touching the ≈øaid Joint-trade; and all lo≈ø≈øes by bad Debtors (other than ≈øuch as ≈øhall be tru≈øted by either of them, without the con≈øent of the other of them the ≈øaid Parties) decay in Wares, or any other inevitable accident, and all charges and expences for repairing of the ≈øaid Hou≈øe and Shop, and all other charges nece≈ø≈øarily ari≈øing for any matter or thing touching the ≈øaid Joint-trade, ≈øhall be from time to time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, born, ≈øu≈øtained and paid by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, equally out of their ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock and Gains.

And moreover, that they the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall from time to time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, at their own charge provide, have and keep ≈øufficient
and competent Books of Account and Reckning in writing, to be always remaining in the ≈øaid Shop, wherein they the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall from time to time write down and enter, or cau≈øe to be written down and entred the true particulars of all ≈øuch Goods, Wares and Merchandi≈øes that ≈øhall be bought or ≈øold, brought in or delivered out, in or touching the ≈øaid Joint-trade; and of all ≈øum or ≈øums of Mony that ≈øhall be received or paid, together with the Names of all Per≈øons unto, or of whom any ≈øuch Goods, Wares or Monies ≈øhall be paid or received; and all other circum≈øtances of time and place, any ways conducing to the manife≈øtation of the ≈øtate and proceeding of the ≈øaid Joint-trade; and that each of them the ≈øaid Parties, ≈øhall and may from time to time during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, have free acce≈øs and recour≈øe unto the ≈øaid Books of Account, to read, peru≈øe, examine and copy out the ≈øame at his will and plea≈øure.

And further, That they the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall yearly, and every year during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, in the Month of December, join in account to gether at the ≈øaid Shop, and then and there to make, ca≈øt up and fully fini≈øh a true, ju≈øt, plain and perfect account and reckning in writing, of, for and concerning the ≈øaid Joint-trade, and of and for all Monies, Wares, Goods, Debts and other E≈øtate what≈øoever, which ≈øhall then be in Copartner≈øhip between the ≈øaid Parties, or jointly owing and belonging to them. And upon the fini≈øhing of every ≈øuch yearly account, they the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall write and enter, or cau≈øe to be written down and entred into the ≈øeveral Books of Account the true particulars of every ≈øuch account and ≈øhall ≈øub≈øcribe their Names in the ≈øaid Books at the foot of every ≈øuch account entred therein; and upon the ≈øub≈øcription of their Names as afore≈øaid,
each of the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall and may have and take to his own u≈øe, one of the ≈øaid Books ≈øub≈øcribed as afore≈øaid.

And furthermore, that at the end of the ≈øaid Term of five years, if they the ≈øaid parties ≈øhall be both then living, the ≈øaid parties ≈øhall join together in account at the Shop afore≈øaid, and ≈øhall then and there make, ca≈øt up, and fully fini≈øh between them a true, plain, perfect and final account and reckoning in Writing, of, for and concerning the ≈øaid joint Trade: And of and for Mony, Wares, Goods, Debts and other E≈øtate what≈øoever, which ≈øhall be then in Copartner≈øhip between the ≈øaid parties, or jointly owing or belonging to them by rea≈øon or means of the ≈øaid Joint-trade, and of all Debts and Duties which they the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall then owe to any per≈øon or per≈øons. And upon fini≈øhing the ≈øaid account, they the ≈øaid parties ≈øhall forthwith ≈øatisfie, or take order for the ≈øpeedy ≈øatisfying all and every the ≈øaid Debts and Duties ≈øo by them owing, and ≈øhall al≈øo thereupon make a ju≈øt and equal partition, allotment, a≈ø≈øignment and divi≈øion between them the ≈øaid parties, of all the then re≈øidue and remainder of their ≈øaid partible and Joint-≈øtock and E≈øtate and increa≈øe thereof; That is to ≈øay, one moiety or half part thereof unto the ≈øaid R. C. to his own proper u≈øe, and the other moiety or half part thereof unto the ≈øaid C. R. to his own proper u≈øe.

And after ≈øuch Partition, Divi≈øion, A≈ø≈øignment and Allotment ≈øo made neither of the ≈øaid parties, his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall without the con≈øent of the other of them, receive, relea≈øe, compound or di≈øcharge any Debt or Duty which is, or ≈øhall be a≈ø≈øigned or allotted to the other of them re≈øpectively, but that each of the ≈øaid parties, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall from
time to time ≈øufficiently Authori≈øe the other of them the ≈øaid parties, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators upon his or their reque≈øt to Sue for, recover, receive and take to his and their own proper u≈øe, all and every the Debts and Duties which ≈øhall be allotted to him or them the ≈øaid parties, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators re≈øpectively making ≈øuch reque≈øt. And further, that if either of the ≈øaid parties ≈øhall happen to decea≈øe before the end of the ≈øaid five years, and after any yearly account ≈øhall be made between them the ≈øaid parties touching the ≈øaid joint-Trade, That then the Survivor of them the ≈øaid parties ≈øhall have and take to his own proper u≈øe all the Monies, Goods and Wares which ≈øhall be belonging to the ≈øaid joint Trade and Copartner≈øhip, at the ≈øame rate and price the ≈øame Goods and Wares did co≈øt, and al≈øo all Debts and Duties which ≈øhall be then due and owing to the ≈øaid joynt Trade, (except ≈øuch of them as were tru≈øted by the ≈øaid decea≈øed party, without the con≈øent of the party ≈øurviving:) And in con≈øideration thereof, the ≈øaid Survivor his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall pay or cau≈øe to be paid to the Executors, or Admini≈øtrators of the per≈øon ≈øo fir≈øt dying at the Shop afore≈øaid, ≈øo much lawful Mony of England, as the part and ≈øhare of the party decea≈øing, of, and in all the ≈øaid Debts that ≈øhall be then owing to the ≈øaid joynt Trade, that were accounted good and recoverable Debts and of and in all the Goods, Monies and Wares of the ≈øaid joint Trade, did or ≈øhall clearly come and amount unto, by and upon the ≈øaid yearly account made between the ≈øaid parties next before ≈øuch decea≈øe, (the Debts owing by the ≈øaid Joint Stock being allowed for, and deducted out of the ≈øaid whole E≈øtate,) the ≈øame Monies to be paid to the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the decea≈øed party
as followeth, That is to ≈øay, one third part thereof at the end of four Months next after ≈øuch decea≈øe, one other third part thereof at the end of ≈øix Months next after ≈øuch decea≈øe, and the remaining third part thereof at the end of eight Months next afuer ≈øuch decea≈øe.

And that the ≈øaid Survivor his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will within fourteen days next after ≈øuch decea≈øe of the other of them the ≈øaid parties, become bound in one Bond or Obligation with ≈øufficient Sureties to the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the per≈øon ≈øo fir≈øt dying, as well for the true payment of the ≈øaid three ≈øeveral Sums in manner and form afore≈øaid, as al≈øo for the ≈øaving harmle≈øs and keeping indempnified the Executors and Admini≈øtrators, Lands, Tenements, Goods and Chattels of the ≈øaid fir≈øt decea≈øing party, of and from all and every the Debts and Duties which were jointly owing by them the ≈øaid parties at the time of ≈øuch decea≈øe, of, for and concerning the ≈øaid joint Trade, and of, and from all Accounts, Suits, Judgments and Demands, for, touching or concerning the ≈øame.

In con≈øideration whereof the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid decea≈øed party, ≈øhall upon receipts of the ≈øaid ≈øecurity ≈øufficiently and in due form of Law, relea≈øe unto the ≈øaid Survivor his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, all the part, ≈øhare, right, title, intere≈øt, claim and demand what≈øoever, which they the ≈øaid Executors and Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid decea≈øed party, and every, or any of them have or hath, or may, can, might, ≈øhould or ought to have, in, to or out of all and every, or any of the Stock, E≈øtate, Money, Goods, Wares and Debts, which were in or belonging to the ≈øaid Joint-trade or Copartner≈øhip at the decea≈øe of the Party ≈øo fir≈øt dying, or at any time before, except ≈øuch Debts as were accounted
de≈øperate, which by the Agreement of both the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, for them their Excutors and Admini≈øtrators, are to be equally divided between the Suvivor and the Executors and Admini≈øtrators of the decea≈øed party, as they or any of them ≈øhall be recived or gotten in.

And it is further covenanted and agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, That if either of the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall happen to depart this life, before any yearly Accounts ≈øhall happen to be made between the ≈øaid Parties touching the ≈øaid Joint-trade; That then the ≈øurviving Party his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall have and take to his and their own u≈øe and behoof all the Goods, Wares, Monies, Debts and other E≈øtate what≈øoever, in or belonging to the ≈øaid Joint-trade at the time of ≈øuch decea≈øe, and ≈øhall ≈øatisfie the Debts jointly owing by the ≈øaid Parties as afore≈øaid at the time of ≈øuch decea≈øe, and ≈øhall truly pay unto the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the fir≈øt decea≈øed Party within one year then next en≈øuing, ≈øo much lawful Engli≈øh Mony, as the Stock that then ≈øhall be brought into the ≈øaid Joint-trade by the party ≈øo decea≈øing did come and amount unto, and that ≈øuch Security ≈øhall be given for the ≈øame, and for the ≈øaving harmle≈øs of the Executors and Admini≈øtrators of the decea≈øed Party, of and from the Debts and Duties jointly owing by the ≈øaid Parties as afore≈øaid, as is above mentioned to be given for the like purpo≈øes, in ca≈øe the decea≈øe of the party ≈øo fir≈øt dying ≈øhall happen after the making a yearly Account as afore≈øaid: And that then al≈øo the like Relea≈øe ≈øhall be made and given by the Execuctors or Admini≈øtrators of the fir≈øt decea≈øing Party, to the Surving Party, his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, as is above mentioned.

And the ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That if he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall happen to decea≈øe within the ≈øaid Term of four years, that then the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall within fourteen days next after his decea≈øe, demi≈øe and grant unto the ≈øaid C. R. if he ≈øhall then be living, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, all the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement above mentioned, for and during the then re≈øidue of the ≈øaid Term of five years, at, for and under the yearly Rent of 30 l. of lawful Mony of England, to be by the ≈øaid demi≈øe re≈øerved quarterly to be paid, and with ≈øuch Covenants on the part and behalf of the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, to be parformed and kept in the ≈øaid Demi≈øe, to be in≈øerted as are contained in the Lea≈øe whereby the ≈øaid R. C. holdeth the ≈øame, ≈øo that the ≈øaid C. R. do upon the Sealing and Delivery of the ≈øaid Lea≈øe, ≈øeal and deliver the Counterpart thereof, as his Act and Deed unto the Le≈ø≈øor or Le≈ø≈øors therein named.

And it is covenanted concluded and agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, for them their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, That if any variance, ≈øtrife, difference or controve≈øie, ≈øhall at any time hereafter during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, or at the end thereof, happen to grow, ari≈øe or be between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, their Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or any of them, upon, touching or concerning their ≈øaid Joint-trade, or any their Buyings, Sellings, Accounts, matters or things relating thereupon, or for or touching any Covenant, matter or thing in the≈øe pre≈øents contained, That then and ≈øo often, they the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, their
Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall upon rea≈øonable reque≈øt made by either or any of them, unto the other of them, before any Suit ≈øhall be commenced, for or touching the ≈øame, elect, name and chu≈øe two indifferent per≈øons to hear and determine the ≈øame differences and matters of difference, one of which Arbitrators the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall chu≈øe and name, And the other of the ≈øaid Arbitrators, the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors, or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall chu≈øe and name, And that each of the ≈øaid parties, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall re≈øpectively ≈øtand to and abide, perform and keep ≈øuch award, order, determination and Judgment, which the ≈øaid two Arbitrators ≈øhall make and give in Writing under their Hands and Seals, unto the parties by the≈øe pre≈øents ≈øubmitting thereunto, upon and touching the ≈øaid differences and matters in difference, ≈øo that the ≈øaid Award be made and given as afore≈øaid in Writing, within fourteen days next after the choi≈øe and nomination of the ≈øaid Arbitrators in that behalf; And in ca≈øe the ≈øaid Arbitrators ≈øhall not make and give forth their award as afore≈øaid, within the time before limited for the doing thereof, then each of the ≈øaid parties his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will ≈øtand to, abide, perform, and keep ≈øuch award, order and umpirage, as ≈øuch one per≈øon umpire to be elected, and cho≈øen by the ≈øaid Arbitrators ≈øhall make, and give forth in writing as afore≈øaid, under his Hand and Seal, upon and touching the ≈øad differences and matters in difference within ten days next after the end of the ≈øaid fourteen days; And in ca≈øe the ≈øaid Umpire ≈øhall not make and give forth as afore≈øaid, his ≈øaid award and umpirage within the time above limited for the doing thereof, That then, each and every of them the ≈øaid parties, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will for his and
their parts, ≈øtand to, abide, perform and keep ≈øuch award, order, determination and Judgment as the Ma≈øter and Wardens of the Company of Merchant Taylors in London, or the major part of them ≈øhall make and give forth as afore≈øaid, in writing under the Hands and Seals, upon and touching the ≈øaid differences and matters in difference within one Month next after the end of the ≈øaid ten days.

Provided neverthele≈øs, and it is covenanted, concluded and agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, for them their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, That if either of the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall be untrue, unju≈øt or unfaithful unto the other of them, in any Buyings, Sales, Receits or Payment, belonging to, or concerning the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip; That then or at any time afterwards upon notice of di≈ølike given thereof, by either of them, to the other of them the ≈øaid Parties, and de≈øire thereupon ≈øignified that the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip ≈øhall determine, The ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip and Joint trade ≈øhall cea≈øe, determine and be di≈ø≈øolved, And that the like account, partition and divi≈øion ≈øhall be made between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, their Executors and Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock and proceed thereof, and ≈øhall do all other things concerning the ≈øaid Joint-trade in ≈øuch manner and form, to all intents and purpo≈øes in every re≈øpect, as they are to do at the end of the ≈øaid five years; And that from and after the end and di≈ø≈øolution of the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip in manner and form afore≈øaid, the ≈øaid term and intere≈øt granted unto the ≈øaid C. R. of and in part of the ≈øaid Dwelling-hou≈øe and Shop in manner afore≈øaid, ≈øhall likewi≈øe cea≈øe, determine and be void.

div.head: A Certificate into the Exchequer, where neither the per≈øon nor any di≈øtre≈øs can be found for levying the Tax on his Office, according to the Act of 4 s. per Pound, 4 W. & M.

body.head: To the Right Honourable R. H. E≈øq; Chancellor and Under-Trea≈øurer of Their Maje≈øties Court of Exchequer, Sir R. A. Knight of the Bath, Lord Chief Baron of the ≈øaid Court, and to the rest of the Barons there.
body.p:
WE R. F. and J. M. E≈øquires, and N. C. T. W. W. W. R. T. G. O. and F. P. eight of the Commi≈ø≈øioners for putting in execution within the ≈øaid County of S. an Act of Parliament made in the 4th year of Their now Maje≈øties Reign, Intituled, An Act for Granting an Aid of 4 s. in the Pound for one Year, for carrying on a Vigorous War again≈øt France; do hereby certifie unto your Lord≈øhips, That in pur≈øuance of the ≈øaid Act we do appoint N. F. R. G. T. S. T. N. R. F. D. D. E. C. and N. A. to be A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øors (within the City of C. in the ≈øaid County of S.) of all and every the Rates and Duties by the ≈øaid Act impo≈øed; which ≈øaid A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øors on the 28th day of February, in the year of our Lord, 1692. we did make and return unto us a Rate and A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øment wherein was certified, That F. H. of the City of C. afore≈øaid, Doctor in Divinity, did then hold a publick Office and Employment of Re≈øidentiary, and one of the Managers of the Revenue, belonging to the Cathedral Church of C. afore≈øaid: By the Fees and Profits of which Office he received yearly 100 l. the rate whereof, according to the ≈øaid Act, did amount unto 5 l. for the fourth part and fir≈øt Quarterly payment in the ≈øaid Act expre≈ø≈øed. And the ≈øaid Rate and A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øment being by us
approved in further pur≈øuance of the ≈øaid Act, We did i≈ø≈øue out Warrants and E≈øtreats under our Hands and Seals to T. A. J. R. W. E. R. P. and T. A. Sub-Collectors, by us appointed for levying the ≈øaid Fourth part and fir≈øt Quarterly payment afore≈øaid; which by the ≈øaid Sub-Collectors being duly demanded, was not paid: But on the part of the ≈øaid F. H. was made unto us an Appeal, complaining, that the ≈øaid Rate was exce≈ø≈øive. Whereupon we the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners did hear and examine the ≈øaid Matter, and upon knowledge, and deliberation thereof did adjudge and determine, and do adjudge and determine, That the ≈øaid Rate of 5 l. for the Fourth part and fir≈øt Quarterly payment afore≈øaid, was rightly and duly taxed and a≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed according to the ≈øaid Act. And now at this day the ≈øaid Sub-Collectors have complained unto us, That the ≈øaid F. H. is not found in the ≈øaid County, and that he hath no Goods or Chattels there, whereby the ≈øaid Five pounds may be levied; and therefore we humbly pray, That your Lord≈øhips, (as in the ≈øaid Act is directed) will i≈ø≈øue out Proce≈øs of the ≈øaid Court of Exchequer, again≈øt the Body, Goods and Lands of the ≈øaid F. H. until the Five pounds ≈øo a≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed, as afore≈øaid be fully and actually levied and paid to Their Maje≈øties.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof. We the ≈øaid Commi≈ø≈øioners and Sub-Collectors have hereunto ≈øet our Hands and Seals, &c. in the fifth year of the Reign, &c.

div.head: A General Relea≈øe.

body.p:
KNow all men by the≈øe pre≈øents, That I F. J. of, &c. have remi≈øed, relea≈øed and quit-claimed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do remi≈øe, relea≈øe and for ever quit-clain unto R. C. of, &c. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, all and all
manner of Actions and Suits, Cau≈øe and Cau≈øes of Action, Bills, Bonds, Writings, Obligations, Accounts, Debts, Duties, Reckonings, Sum and Sums of Mony, Controver≈øies, Judgments, Executions, Claims and Demands what≈øoever, which I the ≈øaid F. J. ever had, or which my Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, or any of them in time to come, can or may have, to, for or again≈øt the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. for or by rea≈øon of any matter, cau≈øe or thing what≈øoever, from the beginning of the World until the day of the date hereof.

div.head: A Relea≈øe of Errors in a Judgment.

body.p: BY the≈øe pre≈øents, I J. D. of, &c. in the County of, &c. Yeoman, do remi≈øe, relea≈øe and for ever quit-claim unto T. H. of D. in the ≈øaid County of S. all and all manner of Errors, Mi≈øpri≈øions and Mi≈øentries what≈øoever, in one Judgment for 20 l. Debt, and 30 s. Co≈øts of Suit, obtained by the ≈øaid T. H. again≈øt me the ≈øaid J. D. in the Court of Common-Pleas at We≈øtminster in the Term of St. Hillary la≈øt pa≈øt, and al≈øo all Writ and Writs of Error and Errors what≈øoever.

div.head: A general Relea≈øe of Errors.

body.p:
BE it known, &c. That I R. C of, &c. for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me hereunto moving, have remi≈øed, relea≈øed and quit, claimed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents, for me, my Heirs Executors and Admini≈øtrators, do remi≈øe, relea≈øe and for ever quit-claim unto J. F. his, &c. and every of them, all and all manner of Error and Errors, and the benefit and advantage thereof, and all Mi≈øpri≈øions of Error and Errors, Defects and wrongful Pleadings and Proceedings what≈øoever, had, made,
committed, ≈øuffered, omitted and done at any time before the date of the≈øe pre≈øents in any Action or Actions pro≈øecuted or ≈øued by the ≈øaid J. F. again≈øt me the ≈øaid R. C. in any Court of Record, or otherwi≈øe; and all Error or Errors in the Judgment or Judgments thereof, ≈øo that I the ≈øaid R. C. my, &c. ≈øhall be for ever hereafter debarred and excluded to ≈øue forth any Writ or Writs of Error or Errors concerning the ≈øame.

div.head: A Relea≈øe of Title to Lands.

body.p:
Know ye, That R. C. of, &c. for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations him moving, hath remi≈øed, relea≈øed, and for ever quit-claimed; and by the≈øe pre≈øents, for him≈øelf and his Heirs, doth fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely remi≈øe, relea≈øe and for ever quit-claim unto J. F. of, &c. in his full and peaceable po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion and Sei≈øin, and to his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, all ≈øuch Right, E≈øtate, Title, Intere≈øt and Demand what≈øoever, as he the ≈øaid R. C. had or ought to have, of, in, or to all, &c. and, &c. by any ways or means what≈øoever; To have and to hold all the ≈øaid, &c. unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, to the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever; ≈øo that neither he the ≈øaid R. C. nor his Heirs, nor any other per≈øon or per≈øons, for him or them, or in his or their names, or in the name, right or ≈øtead of any of them, ≈øhall or will by any way or means hereafter have, claim, challenge or demand any E≈øtate, Right, Title or Intere≈øt, of, in or to the Premi≈øes, or any part or parcel thereof. But from all and every Action, Right, E≈øtate, Title, Intere≈øt or Demand, of, in or to the premi≈ø≈øes, or any part thereof, they and every of them ≈øhall be utterly excluded and barred for ever by
the≈øe pre≈øents. And al≈øo the ≈øaid R. C. and his Heirs, the ≈øaid Mannor, &c. to the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, to his and their own proper u≈øe and u≈øes, in manner and form afore≈øaid, again≈øt their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, and every of them, ≈øhall and will warrant and for ever defend by the≈øe pre≈øents, &c.

div.head: A Relea≈øe of an Annuity

body.p:
We R. C. and C. R. of, &c. ≈øend Greeting. Whereas J. F. of, &c. by his Deed Indented bearing Date, &c. [recite the Grant here] for the Con≈øideration therein mentioned, did give and grant unto us the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. one Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. to be i≈ø≈øuing and going out of all and ≈øingular the Mannors, Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands and Tenements called A and B. within the Pari≈øh of, &c. To have, hold, receive and enjoy all the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. to us the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. our Executors or A≈ø≈øigns, for and during the Natural life of the ≈øaid J. F. to be payable and paid to us the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. our Executors or A≈ø≈øigns, during the Life of the ≈øaid J. F. at the Fea≈øt of, &c. and of ≈øt. Michael the Archangel, as by the ≈øaid Deed it doth appear. Now know ye, That we the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. for and in Con≈øideration of a certain Sum of lawful Mony of England to us in hand paid, at and before the, &c. Have remi≈øed, relea≈øed and for ever quit-claimed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents, for us and either of us our and either of our Executors and A≈ø≈øigns, do fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely remi≈øe, relea≈øe and for ever quit-claim unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. and every part and parcel thereof; and all Rents, arrearages of Rents, Penalties, Forfeitures and Di≈øtre≈ø≈øes what≈øoever,
at any time or times heretofore due or forfeited, by rea≈øon of the Non-payment of the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. or any part thereof; To have and to hold the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. and all the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt and demand what≈øoever, of us the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. our Executors or A≈ø≈øigns, in or unto the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, ≈øo as neither we the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. or either of us, nor our or either of our Executors or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall, may or can at any time hereafter, ask, claim challenge or demand any E≈øtate Right Title or Intere≈øt, in or to the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. or any part thereof: But thereof and there-from ≈øhall be utterly ≈øecluded and barred by the≈øe pre≈øents.

div.head: An Acquittance and Relea≈øe of an Extent by an Admini≈øtratrix.

body.p:
REceived by me J. F. Widow, Admini≈øtratrix of the Goods and Chattles of R. F. Gent. decea≈øed, of and from R. C. the Sum of, &c. of lawful Mony of England, being the Con≈øideration Mony which the ≈øaid R. C. payeth to me, for the vacating and di≈øcharging of an Extent on a Statute-Staple, heretofore acknowledged and entred into by the ≈øaid R. C. unto the ≈øaid R. F. and al≈øo for the buying in and compounding of the ≈øaid Extent, by virtue or colour of the ≈øaid Statute; and al≈øo, for all my intere≈øt and demand in the ≈øame Statute and Extent, of which ≈øaid Sum of, &c. I do hereby acknowledge the Receipt, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do for me, my Executors and Admini≈øtrators, remi≈øe, relea≈øe and for ever quit-claim unto the ≈øaid R. C. the ≈øaid Statute and Extent, and all manner of
Proce≈øs and Proceedings what≈øoever, occa≈øioned by rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Statute.

div.head: A Relea≈øe to a Sheriff, for di≈øcharging a Re≈øcue.

body.p: KNow all Men by the≈øe pre≈øents, That I J. F. of, &c. have remi≈øed, relea≈øed and quitclaimed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do remi≈øe, relea≈øe and quit claim unto R. R. E≈øq; now Sheriff of the ≈øaid County of S. all and all manner of Actions, Suits, Troubles and Incumbrances which I have, may, might or ought to have again≈øt him, for or by rea≈øon of the di≈øcharging or ≈øetting at liberty of R. C. of, &c. in the ≈øaid County Yeoman, being arre≈øted and impri≈øoned on a Ca. ≈øa. out of the Court of Common Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter for 60 l. Debt, and 5 s. Co≈øts, at my Suit, Returnable a die Pa≈øchae in quindecim dies la≈øt pa≈øt.

div.head: The like in a better form.

opener.salute: TO G. L. E≈øq; Sheriff of the County of S. and to the Keeper of the Common Gaol within the ≈øaid County,

body.p:
Whereas T. D. of, &c. is now in your Cu≈øtody by virtue of a Writ of Capias ad ≈øatisfaciendum, i≈ø≈øued out of the Common Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter at the Suit of me the ≈øaid J. for certain damages in the ≈øaid Writ mentioned; of which Damages I have received ≈øatisfaction. Now therefore the≈øe are to will and authorize you and either of you, That you immediately di≈øcharge and relea≈øe the ≈øaid T. D. of and from the Execution afore≈øaid, and of and from all Writs and Proce≈øs what≈øoever, at my Suit, and of and from all Re≈øtraint and Impri≈øonment, by occa≈øion of any Execution, Writ or Proce≈øs heretofore charged again≈øt him by me
the ≈øaid J. and for ≈øo doing this ≈øhall be your Warrant.

closer.dateline: Given under my Hand and Seal the, &c. day of, &c. in the year, &c.

div.head: Mutual General Relea≈øes by Indenture.

body.p: THis Indenture, made, &c. Between A. B. of the one part, and C. D. of the other part Witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid A. B. hath remi≈øed, relea≈øed and for ever quit-claimed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth remi≈øe, relea≈øe, and for ever, quit-claim unto the ≈øaid C. D. all Actions and Cau≈øes of Actions, Tre≈øpa≈ø≈øes, Obligations, Accounts, Promi≈øes, Debts, Judgments, Executions, Damages, Claims and Demands what≈øoever, from the beginning of the World, unto the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents. And this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid C. D. hath remi≈øed, relea≈øed and for ever quit-claimed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth remi≈øe, relea≈øe and for ever quit-claim unto the ≈øaid A. B. all Actions and cau≈øes of Actions, Tre≈øpa≈ø≈øes, Obligations Accounts, Promi≈øes, Debts, Judgments, Executions, Damages, Claims and Demands what≈øoever, from the beginning of the World unto the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents.

div.head: A ≈øhort Relea≈øe of the Equity of Redemption in a Term for years, mortgaged.

body.p:
BY the≈øe pre≈øents, I D. C. for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me hereunto moving, do grant, remi≈øe relea≈øe and for ever quitclaim unto J. P. his Executors, Admini≈øtrator, and A≈ø≈øigns, all that Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. and all the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt, Term and Terms for years, Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, Rever≈øion, Redemption, Benefit of Redemption, Equity, Claim and Demand what≈øoever, of me the ≈øaid D. C. of, in or to the Me≈øuage, &c.
So as neither I the ≈øaid D. C. nor my Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, any E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt, Term or Terms, for years, Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, Rever≈øion, Redemption, Equity, Claim or Demand, of, in or to the ≈øame, ≈øhall or may from henceforth claim or challenge. But of and from all E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt, Term and Terms for years, Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, Rever≈øion, Redemption, Claim and Demand what≈øoever, of, in and to the ≈øame Premi≈ø≈øes, ≈øhall and will for ever hereafter be ≈øecluded and debarred by the≈øe pre≈øents.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney or Proxy, appointing a Proctor in an Eccle≈øia≈øtical Court to procure a Guardian to be appointed for an Infant, to ≈øue an Adminstrator there for a Dividend.

body.p:
KNow all men by the≈øe pre≈øents, That I J. A. the Natural and Lawful Son, and next of kin of E. A. decea≈øed, while he lived the Natural and Lawful Kin≈øman, of J.A. late of B. in the County of S. al≈øo inte≈øtate, decea≈øed without any Will by him made, for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me hereunto e≈øpecially moving, being in my minority, viz. abut the age of 14 years, and under the age of 21 years, and ≈øo incapable in my own name and per≈øon to ≈øue, pro≈øecute or call W. W. Admini≈øtrator of the Goods, Chattels and Credits of J. A. late of B. in the County of S. decea≈øed, to bring in and exhibit a true, full, ju≈øt and perfect Inventory, and an Account of all the Goods, Chattels and Credits of the ≈øaid J. A. decea≈øed, which ≈øince his death have come to his hands, po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion or knowledge, and to make a di≈øtribution thereof according to the Tenor of the Statute for ≈øetling of Inte≈øtatets E≈øtates, or any other Statute or Act of Parliament in that behalf
made and provided. Therefore by the≈øe Pre≈øents I do con≈øtitute and appoint A. B. Notary Publick, one of the Procurators General of the Con≈øi≈øtory Court of C. my true, certain and lawful Procurator, for me and in my name, place and ≈øtead to appear before the wor≈øhipful T. B. Doctor of Laws, Vicar General to the Reverend Father in God R. by Divine Permi≈ø≈øion Lord Bi≈øhop of C. or his lawful Surrogate, or any other competent Judge in that behalf, and for me and in my name, place and ≈øtead, to de≈øire and procure J. A. of London Merchan-Taylor, to be a≈ø≈øigned my Curator in order to call the ≈øaid W. W. to exhibit a true, perfect and particular Inventory and Account of all the Goods, Chattels and Credits of the ≈øaid J. A. which ≈øince his death, as Admini≈øtrator thereof, have come to his hands, po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion or knowledge, by virtue of his Oath, and to ≈øee and hear a di≈øtribution thereof made per≈øuant to the Act of Parliament for ≈øetling of Inte≈øtates E≈øtates, or any other Act of Parliament in that behalf made or provided, and to all other effects and purpo≈øes in Law, and generally to do and perform all other matters nece≈ø≈øary in and about the premi≈ø≈øes.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof, I have hereunto ≈øet my Hand and Seal the 11th day of February Anno Dom. 1699. Juxta, &c.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to ≈øurrender Copyhold-lands to the u≈øe of a Will.

body.p:
BY the≈øe pre≈øents I S. C. of the Middle Temple London, Gent. Son and Heir of J. C. Clerk do make, ordain and appoint T. C. of the City of C. in the County of S. and J. L. of the ≈øame City Gent. my true and lawful Attorneys, jointly and ≈øeverally for me and in my name, ≈øtead and place, to ≈øurrender into the hands of the Lord of
the Mannor of B. in the ≈øaid County of S. according to the cu≈øtom of the ≈øaid Mannor, all and ≈øingular the Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands, Tenements and Hereditaments, with the appurtenances of me the ≈øaid S. C. within the Mannor afore≈øaid; and all ≈øuch Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands, Tenements and Hereditaments with the appurtenances holden by Copy of Court Roll of the Mannor afore≈øaid, whereof the ≈øaid J. C. my Father lately died ≈øei≈øed, to the u≈øe and behoof of ≈øuch per≈øon and per≈øons, and for ≈øuch E≈øtate and E≈øtates as I the ≈øaid S. C. by my la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament in writing ≈øhall direct and appoint.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof I have hereunto ≈øet my Hand and Seal the 19th day of February, in the year of Our Lord 1699.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to enter on Land, and to ≈øue for the recovery thereof, or compound.

body.p:
BY the≈øe pre≈øents, I E. C. &c. do nominate, con≈øtitute, ordain and appoint C. A. of L. Gent. my true and lawful Attorny, for me and in my name, ≈øtead and Place, to enter into and take po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of all that Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. and al≈øo for me and in my name to ≈øue forth and pro≈øecute again≈øt any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, any Writ or Writs, Action or Actions as to him ≈øhall ≈øeem meet, for the recovering or obtaining the po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion or ≈øei≈øin of the Premi≈ø≈øes or any part thereof. And further, to do and execute all and every ≈øuch Act and thing tending to the recovery of my E≈øtate and Right in the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage and Lands or any part thereof. And further, I do hereby give and grant unto my ≈øaid Attorney full and whole Power and Authority for me, and in my name, ≈øtead and place, to make and conclude with any per≈øon or per≈øons any agreement what≈øoever touching the Premi≈ø≈øes, in as full and ample
manner as I my ≈øelf could do in my own per≈øon And I will ratifie and comfirm what≈øoever my ≈øaid Attorney ≈øhall lawfully do in pur≈øuance of the≈øe pre≈øents.

body.head: To N. C. W. P. and J. L. Gent. Attornies of his Majesty's Court of Common pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter, I T. S. ≈øend greeting.
body.p: THe≈øe are to will and authorize you, or any one of you to appear for me the ≈øaid T. S. the next Michaelmas Term in the Court afore≈øaid, at the ≈øuit of J. V. and of the ≈øame Term to confe≈øs one Judgment for 40 l. debt be≈øides co≈øts of ≈øuit, in any Action of Debt brought or to be brought by the ≈øaid J. V. again≈øt me the ≈øaid T.S. upon one Obligation, bearing date the 10th day of March, in the fourth year of the Reign of our Lord, &c. Whereby I the ≈øaid T. S. did become bound unto the ≈øaid J. V. in the penal ≈øum of 80 l. with condition to be void upon payment of 40 l. at a day long ≈øince pa≈øt; and for ≈øo doing this ≈øhall be your and every of your ≈øufficient Warrant.

closer.dateline: Given under my Hand and Seal the 10th day of Augu≈øt, in the ≈øixth year of the Reign of our Sovereign Lord, &c.

body.head: To N. C. W. P. and J. L. Gent. Attornies of their Maje≈øties Court of Common Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter, I D. S. ≈øend greeting.
body.p:
THe≈øe are to will and authorize you, or any of you to appear for me the ≈øaid J. F. the next Michaelmas Term in the Court afore≈øaid, at the ≈øuit of R. C. to confe≈øs one Judgment for 20 l. debt, be≈øides co≈øts of Suit in any Action of Debt by him brought or to be brought again≈øt me the ≈øaid J. F. and for ≈øo doing this ≈øhall be your
Warrant.

closer.dateline: Given under my Hand and Seal the 20th day of Augu≈øt, in the Year of Our Lord, 1699.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to appoint a Steward and Bailiff of a Mannor to keep Courts.

body.p: KNow all men by the≈øe pre≈øents, That we R. C. and C. R. of, &c. do hereby authorize, con≈øtitute and appoint A. B. of, &c. our lawful Deputy and Attorney, for us, and in our names to appoint a Steward and Bailiff of and for our Mannor of C. and by him≈øelf or his ≈øufficient Deputy, to and for our u≈øe to keep Courts within the ≈øaid Mannor, and to give admittance upon alienation or death, and to take and receive Atturnments of all and every the Tenants thereof. And to and for our u≈øe to a≈ø≈øe≈øs Fines upon ≈øuch admittances, and for us and in our names and for our u≈øe to receive the ≈øaid Fines: And al≈øo all ≈øuch Heriots as ≈øhall be due upon the death or alienation of any Tenant or Tenants: And likewi≈øe to receive all Rents and Arrearages of Rent, and al≈øo all Amercements, Perqui≈øites and Profits that ≈øhall ari≈øe and grow due to us, for out of the ≈øaid Court. And we do al≈øo hereby authorize the ≈øaid A. B. to gather, take up and ≈øeize to our u≈øe all Wayfs, Strays, Deodands, Outlaws and Felons Goods which ≈øhall happen to ari≈øe, be due or fall within the ≈øaid Mannor.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to take po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of Land newly purcha≈øed.

body.p:
KNow all men by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That I R. C. of, &c. have made, ordained, con≈øtituted, authorized and appointed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents, do make, ordain, con≈øtitute, authorize, appoint, and in my ≈øtead and place put C. R. of, &c. my true, ≈øufficient
and lawful Attorney for me, and in my name and to my u≈øe, to take and receive peaceable and quiet po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion and ≈øeizin of and in all that Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement, and all and ≈øingular the Lands, &c. with the appurtenances, ≈øituate, lying and being in, &c. lately bargained and ≈øold by F. J. unto me the ≈øaid R. C. And the ≈øame po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion ≈øo had and taken, to detain and keep to the only u≈øe and behoof of me the ≈øaid R. C. my Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, according to the tenour and true meaning of the Indenture, whereby the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes are conveyed unto me, Ratifying, allowing and confirming all and what≈øoever my ≈øaid Attorney ≈øhall do or cau≈øe to be done in or about the Premi≈ø≈øes by the≈øe Pre≈øents.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney from two Executors of a Bond ≈øued to a Judgment.

body.p:
KNow all men by the≈øe Pre≈øents, &c. That we R. C. and C. R. Gent. Executors of the la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament of A. B. late of, &c. in the County of S. E≈øq; decea≈øed have made, con≈øtituted, ordained, and in our places and ≈øteads have put, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do make, ordain and put in our places and ≈øteads, our wellbeloved Friend J. F. of &c. our true and lawful Attorney for us, and in our names, but to his own u≈øe and behoof, to ask, demand, receive and take of F. J. of, &c. the ≈øum of 15 l. of lawful Monies of England, due and payable to the ≈øaid A. B. in his life time by virtue of one Obligation, bearing date, &c. wherein the ≈øaid F. J. is, and ≈øtandeth bound to the ≈øaid A. B. in the penal ≈øum of One Hundred Pounds, conditioned for the payment of the afore≈øaid Sum of fifty pounds, as by the ≈øaid Obligation and Condition doth more fully appear: And whereas the ≈øaid A. B. in his life time did obtain one Judgement
upon the ≈øaid Bond or Obligation for the ≈øaid Sum of One Hundred Pounds be≈øides co≈øts of Suit, Know ye further, That we the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. have authorized and appointed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do authorize and appoint the ≈øaid J. F. in our names, but to his own u≈øe, to ≈øue and take out any Execution or Executions, or other Proce≈øs upon the ≈øaid Judgment again≈øt the ≈øaid F. J. his Heirs Executors or Admini≈øtrators or any of them, or again≈øt his, their or any of their Lands, Tenements, Goods or Chattels, and with him, them or any of them to compound or agree at his will and plea≈øure for the ≈øame, and the benefit and profit thereof to his own u≈øe to take, and him the the ≈øaid F. J. to ≈øue arre≈øt, implead and impri≈øon, and out of Pri≈øon to di≈øcharge and relea≈øe at his will and plea≈øure; and all and every other thing and things which in or about the obtaining and getting of the ≈øaid debt and damages, or any part or parcel thereof, ≈øhall be needful and nece≈ø≈øary to be done, to execute, and do in as large, ample and beneficial manner and form, to all intents and purpo≈øes as we the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. may, can, might, could, ≈øhould, or ought to do by virtue, force or rea≈øon of the ≈øaid recited Obligation or the Condition thereof, or by virtue, force or rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Judgment thereupon had.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof we have hereunto ≈øet our Hands and Seals this 10th day of December, &c.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney or A≈ø≈øignment of a man's whole E≈øtate, in con≈øideration of ≈øeveral Debts and Ingagements.

opener.salute: TO all, to whom the≈øe pre≈øents ≈øhall come

body.p:
Whereas I am indebted unto J. F. in the Sum of 50 l. of lawful
Monies of England. And the ≈øaid J. F. and one F. J. of, &c. ≈øtand jointly and ≈øeverally ingaged for me the ≈øaid R. C. in ≈øeveral Bonds or Obligations for ≈øeveral Sums of Monie, Now know ye, That I the ≈øaid R. C. for and towards the payment and ≈øatisfaction of the ≈øaid Monies, and for divers other good con≈øiderations me thereunto moving, have granted, a≈ø≈øigned, bargained and ≈øold, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do freely and ab≈øolutely grant, a≈ø≈øign, bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. All and all manner of Goods, Chattels, Debts, Monies and all other things of me the ≈øaid R. C. what≈øoever, as well real as per≈øonal, of what kind, nature or quality ≈øoever; To have and to hold the ≈øame, and every part and parcel thereof unto them the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, to the only proper u≈øe of them the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns for ever in, &c.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to receive Monie which is not yet become due upon a Bond.

opener.salute: TO all Chri≈øtian People to whom this pre≈øent writing ≈øhall come
opener.signed: I R. C. of C. in the County of S.

body.p:
Whereas J. V. of, &c and V. J. of, &c. by their Obligation bearing date. the, &c. la≈øt pa≈øt are and ≈øtand bound unto the ≈øaid R. C. in the Sum of, &c. with Condition for the payment of, &c. on the, &c. now next coming, as by the ≈øaid Obligation it doth more fully appear, Now know ye that I the ≈øaid R. C. have hereby, made, ordained, con≈øtituted and authori≈øed my loving friend J. F. of, &c. to be my lawful Attorny and A≈ø≈øignee for me, and in my name to demand and receive the ≈øaid Sum of, &c. at the time limited for the payment of the ≈øame, And
if the ≈øame ≈øhall not be then paid, to ≈øue for and recover the Sum of, &c. being the penalty of the ≈øaid Obligation, And I the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall and will allow and maintain all and every Action, Plea and Proce≈øs which he the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall in my name, bring or ≈øue for the obtaining and recovery thereof,

closer.dateline:
In witne≈øs whereof I have hereunto ≈øent my hand and Seal this tenth day of March in the fir≈øt year of the Reign of our Sovereign Lord King William, &c. Anno
que Dom. &c.

body.closer: Sealed and delivered in the pre≈øence of _____

div.head: A General Letter of Attorney.

body.p:
Know ye that I the ≈øaid R. C. for divers good rea≈øons and con≈øiderations me hereunto moving have appointed, con≈øtituted and authorized, and in my ≈øtead and place deputed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do appoint, con≈øtitute and authorize, and in my ≈øtead and place depute my loving Friend J. F. to be my true and lawful Attorney, irrevocable, for me, and in my name, and to my own proper u≈øe and behoof to ask, demand and require, ≈øue for, recover and receive all ≈øuch Debts, Duties, Sum and Sums of Mony, Rents, yearly Payments, Merchandizes, Goods, Chattels, Legacies and Monies due or to be due on any Bill or Bills of Exchange or otherwi≈øe, and all other demands what≈øoever, which now are or hereafter ≈øhall be due, payable or any way belonging unto me, by or from any Per≈øon or Per≈øons or Bodies Corporate or Politick what≈øoever or how≈øoever; And for default of payment of any Rent or Rents which now is, or hereafter may become
due unto me, to enter into all or any of my Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands, Tenements, Hereditaments or any of them or any part thereof, and to di≈øtrain for the ≈øame Rent or Rents, and for default of payment thereof to enter in the name of the whole, and po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion thereof to take, and to make, ≈øeal and deliver in my name any Lea≈øe or Lea≈øes of Ejectment thereupon for any Term or number of years as in ≈øuch ca≈øe is u≈øual, and to u≈øe all lawful ways and means for recovery of the Premi≈ø≈øes: And to pay any Sum or Sums of Mony lawfully due from me to any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, And to contract for, lett, ≈øett, bargain and ≈øell all or any of my Me≈ø≈øuages and Lands, Tenements or Hereditaments, Goods or Cattels what≈øoever, for Term of years or otherwi≈øe as he ≈øhall think fit: And to ≈øue, implead, or make an≈øwer, pro≈øecute or defend in any Court, of Law or Equity, and before any Judges or Ju≈øtices, or other per≈øon or per≈øons in any Suit, Action, Matter or Cau≈øe with me, for me, or again≈øt me as the Ca≈øe ≈øhall require: And to deal and intermeddle in any Action, Suits, Affairs and Bu≈øine≈øs any way concerning me, as my Factor or Agent, or otherwi≈øe, Giving and granting by the≈øe pre≈øents to my ≈øaid Attorney, my full and lawful Power and Authority, in the Execution and performance of all and ≈øingular the Premi≈ø≈øes, and to make any Compo≈øition or Agreement, for or concerning the Premi≈ø≈øes, And to make, ≈øeal and deliver any Di≈øcharge or Acquittance for me, and in my name as ≈øhall be requi≈øite; And Attorney or Attorneys under him to make, and at his plea≈øure to revoke, and generally to do, determin and execute all and every ≈øuch further, and other lawful and rea≈øonable Act and Acts Device and Devices what≈øoever, which in and about the Premi≈ø≈øes ≈øhall to my ≈øaid Attorney
≈øeem fit to be done, as fully and amply as I my ≈øelf might or could do if per≈øonally pre≈øent, ratifying, allowing and confirming what≈øoever my ≈øaid Attorney ≈øhall lawfully do, or cau≈øe to be done in my name by force hereof.

div.head: A Letter of Attorny to enter on Land and deliver a Lea≈øe.

body.p: KNow all Men, &c. That I R. C. of, &c. have made, ordained, con≈øtituted and appointed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do make, ordain, con≈øtitute and appoint J. F. of, &c. my true and lawful Attorney for me, and in my ≈øtead to enter and come in my name into and upon the Farm and Lands of T. in the P. of, &c. in the County of, &c. now in the Tenure or Occupation of J. U. or his A≈ø≈øigns, and upon any part thereof, then and there for me, and in my name and ≈øtead to deliver as my Act and Deed unto R. R. of, &c. or to his A≈ø≈øigns one Indenture which I have already Sealed bearing date, &c. made between me the ≈øaid R. C. of the one part, and the ≈øaid R. R. of the other part, purporting a Lea≈øe of the ≈øaid Farm and Lands unto the ≈øaid R. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, for the Term of ten years next en≈øuing, as in and by the ≈øaid Indenture more at large appeareth; which Indenture after the ≈øame ≈øhall be ≈øo delivered by my ≈øaid Attorney, I the ≈øaid R. C. do promi≈øe by the≈øe pre≈øents, ≈øhall be as effectual a Deed in Law, to all intents and purpo≈øes, as if I the ≈øaid R. C. had ≈øealed and delivered the ≈øame then and there in per≈øon. In, &c.

div.p: Note, Such Letter of Attorney may be better put in the ≈øame Lea≈øe or Deed, in form as followeth.

body.p: And this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth, that the ≈øaid R. C. for the better execution of the≈øe pre≈øents, doth hereby nominate, con≈øtitute, ordain and appoint J. F. of, &c. his true and lawful Attorney, for him, and in his name, ≈øtead and place to enter into and upon the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. and thereof to take full po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, and ≈øeizin, and ≈øuch po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion and ≈øeizin, ≈øo had and taken to deliver unto the ≈øaid R. R. in and upon the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes this pre≈øent Indenture as the Act and Deed of the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øo that this Indenture may be duly executed, and the ≈øaid R. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns may be po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes, and may enjoy the ≈øame according to the form and effect of this Indenture; And further to do and execute all and every other matter and thing for the better and more perfect execution of the≈øe pre≈øents.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to take Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of a Me≈ø≈øuage, extended by the Sheriff upon a Statute.

body.p:
Know ye that I the ≈øaid R. C. have made, ordained, con≈øtituted and appointed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do make, ordain, con≈øtitute and appoint J. F. and A B. or either of them my true and lawful Attorneys or Attorney, jointly or ≈øeverally for me, and in my name to take and receive of the now Sheriff of the County of S. peaceable and quiet Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, as well of and in one capital Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. as of and in, &c. all and ≈øingular which ≈øaid Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes were lately belonging unto R. R. Gent. and which the ≈øaid Sheriff hath Extended by vertue of a Writ of Extent to him directed on a Statute for 200 l. acknowledged and entred into by the ≈øaid R. R. unto me
the ≈øaid R. C. giving and by the≈øe pre≈øents granting unto my ≈øaid Attorneys, or either of them, full Power and Authority for me, and in my name to do, execute and accompli≈øh all and what≈øoever ≈øhall be needful and nece≈ø≈øary to be done, in or about the Premi≈øes by the≈øe pre≈øents: And I ≈øhall and will ratifie, allow and confirm all, and what≈øoever my ≈øaid Attorneys or either of them ≈øhall do, or cau≈øe to be done in or about the Premi≈øes by the≈øe pre≈øents, as if I my ≈øelf were then and there pre≈øonally pre≈øent.

div.head: A General Letter of Attorney to receive Debts.

body.p: KNow all men, &c. That I R. C. of, &c. have con≈øtituted and authorized, and in my ≈øtead and place by the≈øe pre≈øents put J. F. of, &c. to be my true and lawful Attorney for me, and in my name, and to my u≈øe to ask, ≈øue for, levy and receive of J. A. of, &c. all and every ≈øuch Debts and Sums of Monie, which are now due unto me from any per≈øon or per≈øons, or any way how≈øoever, giving and granting unto my ≈øaid Attorney my full Power and Authority in and about the Premi≈ø≈øes, And on the receit of any ≈øuch Debt or Sums of Monie, Acquittances or other di≈øcharges for me and in my name to make ≈øeal and deliver, and all and every ≈øuch Act and Acts, Thing and Things, Device and Devices in the Law, for the recovery of all and every ≈øuch Debts or Sums of Monie as afore≈øaid for me and in my name to do, execute and perform as fully, largely and amply in every re≈øpect, to all intents, as I my ≈øelf might or could do if per≈øonally pre≈øent, ratifying, allowing and confirming what≈øoever my ≈øaid Attorney ≈øhall lawfully do, in or about the Execution of the Premi≈ø≈øes, by vertue of the≈øe pre≈øents.

div.head: A Revocation of a Letter of Attorney.

body.p: Whereas I the ≈øaid R. C. on tru≈øt and confidence which I had and did place in P. P. of, &c. did by my Letter of Attorney con≈øtitute and make the ≈øaid P. P. my Attorney, for recovery of all Debts and Sums of Monie what≈øoever due to me the ≈øaid R. C. as by the ≈øaid Letter of Attorney more fully appears, Now know ye that I the ≈øaid R. C. for that the ≈øaid P. P. hath by colour of the ≈øaid Authority to him given, behaved him≈øelf greatly to my hindrance, contrary to the tru≈øt and confidence I repo≈øed in him, have revoked, countermanded and made void, and be the≈øe pre≈øents do revoke, countermand and make void the ≈øaid Letter of Attorney, and all power and Authority thereby given to the ≈øaid P. P.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney of ≈øeveral Sums of Monie due from one per≈øons.

body.p:
KNow all men by the≈øe pre≈øents, that I R. C. of, &c. for divers good and valuable con≈øiderations m hereunto moving, have made, con≈øtituted and ordained, And do by the≈øe pre≈øents make, con≈øtitute and ordain J. F. of, &c. my true and lawful Attorney in my name, but to the only proper u≈øe of him the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, to demand and receive all ≈øuch Sum and Sums of Monie as are due or owing to me from A. B. of, &c. any manner of way how≈øoever, And for default of payment to Sue, Arre≈øt, Attach, Implead and Impri≈øon him the ≈øaid A. B. and his Body, Goods and Chattels in Execution to take, and out of Execution to deliver and di≈øcharge, on ≈øatisfaction, compo≈øition
or otherwi≈øe, at the will and plea≈øure of my ≈øaid Attorney; Acquittances or other di≈øcharges in my name to Seal and Deliver; Attorney or Attorneys one or more under him the ≈øaid J. F. to make and ≈øub≈øtitute or revoke; And generally to do, execute, pro≈øecute and determin all and every other Act and acts, thing and things what≈øoever, which in and about the Premi≈ø≈øes ≈øhall be needful and expedient, as fully and effectually, and in as large and ample manner, to all intents and purpo≈øes as I the ≈øaid R. C. might or could do, without any account thereof to be given to me, my Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, And what≈øoever my ≈øaid Attorney ≈øhall do, in, about or concerning the Premi≈ø≈øes, I do by the≈øe pre≈øents, ratifie, confirm and allow.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to Sue an Action of Covenant.

opener.signed: I R. C. of, &c. Executor of C. R. &c.

body.p:
Whereas in one Indenture bearing date, &c. made between the ≈øaid C. R. by the name of, &c. of the one part, and J. F. of, &c. of the other part, there are divers Covenants contained on the part and behalf of the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators to be kept and ob≈øerved, touching a Lea≈øe granted to the ≈øaid C. R. by A. Lord R. of of a certain Me≈ø≈øuage ≈øcituate, &c. and covenanted to be transferred over by the ≈øaid C. R. to the ≈øaid J. E. as by the ≈øaid Indenture it doth more at large appear, Now Know ye that I the ≈øaid R. C. for divers Good cau≈øes and con≈øiderations me moving and e≈øpecially for that it appeareth by the ≈øaid Indenture, that the name of the ≈øaid C. R. was only u≈øed in tru≈øt for the benefit of R. F. Wife of the ≈øaid J. F. and their I≈ø≈øue, have made, ordained, con≈øtituted, and in my ≈øtead and place,
put and appointed my beloved Friend F. J. of &c. to be my true and lawful Attorney, for me, and in my name to Sue, Implead and Pro≈øecute the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors or Admin≈øtrators, for or upon the breach or non-performance of all, or any the Covenants in the ≈øaid Indenture contained; And to have, receive and take to, and for the only u≈øe and benefit of him the ≈øaid F. J. his, &c. all ≈øuch Sum and Sums of Monie, profit, commodity and advantage what≈øoever, which ≈øhall be recovered or gotten by means of any ≈øuch Suit, Action or proceeding concerning the ≈øame; And to do, execute, and perform all and every other Act and Acts, thing and things what≈øoever, which ≈øhall be needful and nece≈ø≈øary to be done in and about the Premi≈ø≈øes, in as large and ample manner and form to all intents and purpo≈øes, as I my ≈øelf might or could do, And all ≈øuch lawful Actions and Suits, as the ≈øaid F. J. ≈øhall bring or ≈øue concerning the premi≈ø≈øes, again≈øt the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, I promi≈øe to allow, maintain, ju≈øtify and confirm by the≈øe pre≈øents,

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to demand Rent, and on default of payment to re-enter according to a Provi≈øo for ≈øuch re-entry contained in the Lea≈øe.

body.p:
KNow all Men by the≈øe pre≈øents, that I F. B. of the Pari≈øh of St. P. in the County of S. Widow, Executrix of the Te≈øtament of A. B. late of M. N. in the County of D. Clerk, have made con≈øtituted and appointed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents, do make con≈øtitute and appoint, R. C. of S. in the I≈øle of P. in the ≈øaid County of D. Gent. my true and lawful Attorney, for me and in my name, ≈øtead and place, on the Eight and Twentieth day next after the Fea≈øt of the Annunciation of the Ble≈ø≈øed Virgin Mary next coming, at the Capital
Me≈ø≈øuage, Man≈øion or dwelling Hou≈øe commonly called or known by the names or name of Forthill, otherwi≈øe For≈øell, or Furzhill, ≈øituate lying and being within the Pari≈øh of C. or C. H. in the ≈øaid County of D. to demand and receive of and from J. L. of D. in the ≈øaid County of D. Book≈øeller R. S. of D. afore≈øaid Woollendraper, and J. S. of B. in the ≈øaid County of D. Clerk, Twenty pounds of lawful Monie of England, which will become due unto me the ≈øaid F. from the ≈øaid J. L. R. and J. S. at the ≈øaid Fea≈øt of the Annunciation of the Ble≈ø≈øed Virgin Mary next coming, for one half Years Rent for the ≈øaid Mu≈ø≈øuage, Man≈øion or dwelling Hou≈øe, and divers Lands and Tenements, with the Appurtenances thereunto belonging, which by one Indenture of Lea≈øe, bearing date the Twentieth day of February, in the Year of our Lord One Thou≈øand ≈øix hundred fifty five, were by the ≈øaid A. B. demi≈øed unto the ≈øaid I L. R. and J. S. for a certain Term of Years yet unexpired; And for default of payment of the ≈øaid Twenty pounds, I give and grant unto my ≈øaid Attorney, full power and Authority to enter into and upon the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Man≈øion Hou≈øe and premi≈ø≈øes, by the before mentioned Indenture of Lea≈øe demi≈øed, and thereof for me and in my name ≈øtead and place to take Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, to the intent the ≈øaid Indenture of Lea≈øe may become void, according to a certain Provi≈øo in the ≈øaid Indenture contained; And further to do and perform all things requi≈øite and nece≈ø≈øary to be done in and about the execution of the≈øe pre≈øents, according to the true intent and meaning thereof.
