div.p: Note, Becau≈øe the Law doth not favour Forfeitures, and a Provi≈øo of Re-entry mu≈øt be pro≈øecuted ≈øtrictly, it is advi≈øable, that the Attorney, when the Rent is by him demanded, holding the Letter of Attorney in his hand, to avoid all doubtfulne≈øs of the form and manner of the Demand, do cau≈øe it to be written ready before his Demand; and then ≈øpeak it verbatim, thus,
div.q:
By virtue of this Letter of Attorney to me made by the Dean and Chapter of the Cathedral Church of the Holy Trinity of C. in their name and for
their u≈øe, I do demand of W. W. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, five ≈øhillings which were due unto the ≈øaid Dean and Chapter at Chri≈øtmas la≈øt for half a years Rent, for one Me≈øuage, &c. and al≈øo one ≈øhilling for half a years Rent due at Chri≈øtmas la≈øt, for one Garden, &c. which Me≈ø≈øuage and Garden, by Indenture of Lea≈øe, dated, &c. were demi≈øed by the ≈øaid Dean and Chapter to the ≈øaid W. W.
div.p: Underneath may be ≈øub≈øcribed a Memorial of it under the Hands of the Attorney and Witne≈ø≈øes pre≈øent, thus:

body.p: 14 January 1682. In the We≈øt Porch of the Cathedral Church above-mentioned N. C. did make ≈øuch Demand as above, before night, and while it was light enough to tell ≈øo much Mony, and continued there ≈øo demanding until it was ≈øo dark as that Mony could not be di≈øtingui≈øhed, and had all that time in his hand ≈øuch Letter of Attorney as above-mentioned; but none offered to pay the Rent above-mentioned.

Afterwards, to wit, the _____ day of _____ 1682. the ≈øaid N. C. in the name and ≈øtead of the ≈øaid Dean and Chapter did enter into the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. And thereof did take po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion to the intent the ≈øaid Lea≈øe ≈øhould determine and be void.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to take Admittance to Copyhold Lands, and after Admittance to ≈øurrender.

opener.salute: TO all Chri≈øtian People to whom the≈øe Pre≈øents ≈øhall come,
opener.signed: I A. T. Gent. Co≈øin and Heir of L. T. Doctor in Divinity, to wit, the Son of R. T. Gent. who was the Brother of the ≈øaid L.

body.p:
Whereas R. C. and E. his Wife, on the, &c. which was in the year of our Lord, &c. did ≈øurrender into the hands of the Lord of the Mannor of B. in the County of S. one Clo≈øe of Land called Breeches, alias, Newels, containing by E≈øtimation Ten Acres (being parcel of one Yard of Bordland, called Fairmanners;) and one other Clo≈øe of Land called Breeches, containing by e≈øtimation Six Acres; and one Clo≈øe of Land called Downcroft, containing by e≈øtimation Five acres, lying in W. in the ≈øaid County and holden by Copy of Court-Roll of the ≈øaid Mannor, by the yearly Rent of 7 s. 2 d. to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid L. T. and of his Heirs for ever, according to the Cu≈øtom of the Mannor afore≈øaid, upon a Condition for making void thereof, if the ≈øaid R. C. and E. his Wife ≈øhould pay unto the ≈øaid L. T. 106 l. at ≈øeveral days long ≈øince pa≈øt. And whereas the ≈øaid Surrender was made unto the ≈øaid L. T. in Tru≈øt, for the Dean and Chapter of the Cathedral Church of, &c. and the Monies thereupon lent were the proper Monies of the ≈øaid Dean and Chapter, and the Condition of the ≈øaid Surrender is not yet performed. Now know ye, That I the ≈øaid A. T. in di≈øcharge and performance of the Tru≈øt in the ≈øaid L. repo≈øed, as afore≈øaid, at the reque≈øt and by the direction of the ≈øaid Dean and Chapter, do by the≈øe pre≈øents make, authorize, appoint and put N. C. of the City of, &c. in the County afore≈øaid, Gent. my true and lawful Attorney, for me and in my name, ≈øtead and place, and to my u≈øe, to receive, have and take admittance of and from the Lord of the Mannor of B. afore≈øaid, or his Steward of his Court there, of, in and to the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Clo≈øes of Land and Premi≈øes before-mentioned, with the appurtenances, according to the Cu≈øtom of the Mannor afore≈øaid. And at any time after ≈øuch
admittance ≈øo had and taken, to ≈øurrender into the hands of the Lord of the ≈øaid Mannor, all the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Clo≈øes of Land and Premi≈øes, with the appurtenances, to the u≈øe and behoof of ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons, and their Heirs, as the ≈øaid Dean and Chapter ≈øhall appoint. And further, to do and execute all and every act and thing nece≈ø≈øary or expedient to be done, in or about ≈øuch Admittance and Surrender, as afore≈øaid, as fully and amply as I the ≈øaid A. T. might or could do in my own per≈øon.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to traver≈øe an Indictment, and enter into Recognizance to Pro≈øecute.

body.p: BY the≈øe pre≈øents, I G. S. of the City of C. in the County of S. Merchant, do make, appoint and put N. C. Gent. my Attorney, for me and in my name and ≈øtead to appear before the Judges of A≈ø≈øize and General Gaol-delivery, at the next A≈ø≈øizes to beholden for the County of S. And to traver≈øe and plead, That Iam not guilty of the Riot, Rout or Unlawful A≈ø≈øembly, whereof before the ≈øaid Judges I am Indicted. And further, for me, and on my behalf, to enter into Recognizance for my appearance at the following A≈ø≈øizes, to pro≈øecute ≈øuch Traver≈øe with effect; and I the ≈øaid G. S. do hereby covenant with the ≈øaid N. C. That I will appear at the next Summer A≈ø≈øizes to be holden for the ≈øaid County, and pro≈øecute ≈øuch Traver≈øe (as afore≈øaid) with effect; and di≈øcharge and ≈øave harmle≈øs the ≈øaid N. C. from ≈øuch Recognizance on my behalf to be entred into, as afore≈øaid.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney for appearance before a Judge, and ≈øubmitting to an Indictment for a forceable Entry.

body.p: KNow all Men by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That I S. S. of C. in the County of S. Gent. do hereby nominate, con≈øtitute and appoint N. C. Gent. my true and lawful Attorney, for me and in my name, ≈øtead and place, before any competent Judge in this behalf, or in any Court of our Lord the King, to appear, and under Prote≈øtation, that I am not guilty; and becau≈øe I will not plead with our ≈øaid Lord the King, to ≈øubmit to the Grace of our ≈øaid Lord the King, or of ≈øuch Court, upon one Indictment again≈øt me for a forceable Entry into a Me≈ø≈øuage, with the Appurtenances in C. afore≈øaid, or the Pari≈øh of, &c. in the ≈øaid County, or any other Indictment or Pre≈øentment what≈øoever. And further, to do and perform all and every act and thing nece≈ø≈øary to be done in or about the Premi≈øes; and I will allow and hold for ≈øure and good what≈øoever my ≈øaid Attorney ≈øhall do in the Premi≈øes, as fully and ab≈øolutely as done by me in my own per≈øon.

div.head: A Condition to perform Covenants.

q.p:
THe Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That if the above-bound R. C. his Executors, &c. do and ≈øhall from time to time, and at all times hereafter, well and truly ob≈øerve, fulfil, perform and keep all and ≈øingular the Covenants, Grants, Articles, Payments, Promi≈øes and Agreements, which on the part and behalf of the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, are and ought to be performed, fulfilled, ob≈øerved and kept, contained and ≈øpecified in one pair of Indentures bearing date the 10th day of March, in the year of our Lord &c. made between the ≈øaid R. C. of the one part, and the ≈øaid J. F. of the other part, according to the true intent and meaning of the
≈øaid Indentures; Then this Obligation to be void, otherwi≈øe, &c.

div.head: A Condition to perform an Award of Arbitrators.

q.p: THe Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That if the above bound R. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and every of them, for his and their part, do in all things well and truly ≈øtand to, ob≈øerve, perform, fulfil and keep the Award, Arbitrement, Determination and Judgment of A. B. of, &c. and D. C. of, &c. Arbitrators indifferently cho≈øen, elected and named, as well on the part and behalf of the ≈øaid R.C. as on the part and behalf of the ≈øaid J. F. to arbitrate, award, order, judge and determine, and a final agreement make, of and concerning all and every Action, Suit, Variance, Sum of Monie, claim and demand what≈øoever, had, moved or depending between the ≈øaid parties, ≈øo as the ≈øame Award of the ≈øaid Arbitrators be made and put in Writing under their Hands and Seals, ready to be delivered to the ≈øaid parties, on or before the 10th day of March next en≈øuing the date hereof, That then, otherwi≈øe, &c.

div.head: A Condition to find one Diet by the Year.

q.p: THe Condition, &c. That if the above-bound R. C. his Executors or A≈ø≈øigns, do and ≈øhall at his and their own proper co≈øts and charges, find, provide and allow unto J. F. or any Servant of his in his ≈øtead, good whol≈øom and ≈øufficient Diet, and Victuals of Meat and Drink, in ≈øuch ≈øort and manner as is now allowed by the above-bound R. C. for the time and ≈øpace of one whole year from the 10th of March next coming. And if at any time the ≈øaid J. F. or any Servant of his ≈øo to be Diered, ≈øhall be ab≈øent from the ≈øaid Commons for the ≈øpace of ≈øix Weeks or more together at any time or times during the ≈øaid Term; If the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall at the end of the ≈øaid term allow him the ≈øaid J. F. or his Servant Diet for as long time as he was ab≈øent, Then this Obligation ≈øhall be void, otherwi≈øe ≈øhall remain in full force

F. ≈øituate, &c. and whereas the ≈øaid J. F. hath agreed to pay the Rent of the ≈øaid Hou≈øe to the ≈øaid R. C. which is 50 l. per Annum, as the ≈øame ≈øhall grow due. If therefore the ≈øaid R. F. his, &c. and all other Co≈øts and Damages what≈øoever,
which he the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall ≈øu≈øtain or be at, by rea≈øon of any Action, Suits or Forfeitures what≈øoever, which ≈øhall or may happen or be to the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, by rea≈øon of paying the ≈øaid Rent, or any part thereof, to the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns; That then, &c.

C. or of any other per≈øon what≈øoever; That then, &c.

THe Condition, &c. That whereas the abovenamed J. F. hath taken and received into his Service the above-bound R. R. If therefore the ≈øaid R. R. do and ≈øhall during ≈øo long time as he the ≈øaid R. F. his Ma≈øter, without con≈øuming or imbezeling, wa≈øting, lo≈øing or unlawfully making away any of the Monies, Plate, Goods or Chattels of the ≈øaid J. F. his Ma≈øter, or of any other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, which
≈øhall or may be committed to his cu≈øtody, by rea≈øon of his ≈øaid Service. And if the ≈øaid R. R. ≈øhall by negligence or otherwi≈øe con≈øume, wa≈øte or unlawfully make away any Mony, Plate, Goods or Chattels of the ≈øaid J. F. his Ma≈øter, or of any other per≈øon committed to his care and cu≈øtody, as afore≈øaid: Then if the ≈øaid R. R. the above-bound R. C. and C. R. or any of them, their or any of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, or any of them, do or ≈øhall within three Months next after due Proof thereof, and Notice given in Writing to the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. or either of them, mak ≈øufficient recompence and ≈øatisfaction unto the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. for any and all damage ≈øu≈øtained by means of the ≈øaid R. R. as afore≈øaid; Then, &c.

within named A. W. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, for and towards the Maintenance of the ≈øaid J. W. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, on every ≈øuch payment, delivering unto the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. an Acquittance or Di≈øcharge in Writing for the Mony ≈øo paid and received from time to time; That then, &c.

C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, do at any time hereafter within the ≈øpace of one whole Year next coming after the date hereof, either well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid to the ≈øaid J. C. or his ≈øufficient Deputy, do from henceforth during his natural life, well truly and entirely levy, collect and gather all and ≈øingular the Rents, Revenues, Perqui≈øites of Courts, I≈ø≈øues and Profits what≈øoever, of, or belonging to the Lord≈øhip or Mannor of L. &c. and of all the Members and parcels of the ≈øame, at the Fea≈øts of, &c. yearly during the ≈øaid Term, and all the ≈øame Rents, &c. and all Mony thereof coming or to come, for the ≈øame or any part thereof, do well and truly content and pay to the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs Executors, or A≈ø≈øigns, at the Fea≈øts of, &c. yearly, And ≈øhall al≈øo at all times when required by the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. make render and deliver to the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, a ju≈øt true and perfect Account of all the ≈øame Rents, Revenues, and other the premi≈ø≈øes, and of all the Arrearages thereof (if any be) due, And do at the end of every ≈øuch Account made, make ju≈øt and true payment to the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns; And further do well and truly admin≈øter, ≈øerve and execute all Proce≈øs to him to be directed from the Steward and Officers of the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, concering the Premi≈øes, or any part thereof, and moreover do during all the ≈øaid Term, demean and behave him≈øelf as an hone≈øt and true Bayliff ought to do, that then, &c.

C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, or any of them on rea≈øonable reque≈øt to be made to him, them or any of them, by ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons, to whom any ≈øum of Mony not exceeding the Sum afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be bequeathed, do well and truly pay or cau≈øe to paid ≈øuch Sum or Sums of Mony ≈øo bequeathed and given by the ≈øaid A. B. Then, &c.

div.head: A Condition to ≈øave harmle≈øs for being bound in a Sheriff's Bond.

THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas the above-named N. C. at the ≈øpecial in≈øtance and reque≈øt of the above-bounden G. S. and H. S. ≈øhall appear before the ≈øaid Ju≈øtices of our Lord the King at We≈øtmin≈øter, from the ≈øaid day of St. Martin in fifteen days, to an≈øwer the ≈øaid H. S. of the ≈øaid Plea of Tre≈øpa≈øs. And al≈øo to an≈øwer the ≈øaid H. according to the ≈øaid Cu≈øtom of the Court of Common-Pleas in the ≈øaid certain Plea of Debt upon demand of ten Pounds. And al≈øo if the ≈øaid G. S. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall, well and truly pay, or cau≈øe to be paid, unto the ≈øaid N. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators all ≈øuch Sum and Sums of Mony as ≈øhall become due unto the ≈øaid N. C. for Fees and Expences in and about the defence of the ≈øaid Suit, Then
this Obligation to be void, or el≈øe to ≈øtand and be in full force.

div.head: Another Condition to ≈øave harmle≈øs for being bound in a Sheriffs Bond.

q.p: THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas the above-named N. C. at the ≈øpecial in≈øtance and reque≈øt of the above-bound J. P. together with the ≈øaid J. in and by one Obligation bearing date with the≈øe Pre≈øents, is become bound unto W. G. Baronet, Sheriff of the County afore≈øaid, in the penal Sum of four≈øcore Pounds with Condition to be void, if the ≈øaid J. P. ≈øhall appear before the Ju≈øtices of our Lord the King at We≈øtmin≈øter, from the day of St. Martin in fifteen days, to an≈øwer J. F. E≈øq; in a Plea of Debt of forty Pounds, as by the ≈øaid Obligation and Condition more at large appeareth. If therefore the ≈øaid J.P. ≈øhall appear before the ≈øaid Ju≈øtices of our Lord the King at We≈øtmin≈øter, at the day afore≈øaid, to an≈øwer the ≈øaid J. F. in the Plea afore≈øaid, in di≈øcharge of the ≈øaid Obligation. And al≈øo if the ≈øaid J. P. ≈øhall within two Months next coming cau≈øe the ≈øaid recited Obligation to be redelivered up to the ≈øaid N. C. Then this Obligation to be void, or el≈øe to ≈øtand and be in full force.

div.head: A Condition not to become Surety without Licen≈øe.

q.p:
THE Condition, &c. That if the above-bound R. C. do not at any time hereafter engage or bind him≈øelf in, by or with any Bond, Bill, Specialty or Contract or otherwi≈øe, to or for the payment of any other Debt or Debts, or Sum or Sums of Mony, than ≈øuch Debts and Sums of Mony only as now are or hereafter ≈øhall be contracted and owing by the ≈øaid R. C. in re≈øpect
or by rea≈øon of his own Trade or Bu≈øine≈øs, without the con≈øent and agreement of the above named J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, That then, &c.

div.head: A Condition not to ≈øell his intere≈øt in a Shop before J. F. has refu≈øed to buy it.

q.p: THE Condition, &c. That whereas the above bound R. C. hath and is po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of one Shop ≈øituate, &c. for the Term of twelve years, as yet to come and unexpired, as by a Lea≈øe thereof made to the ≈øaid R. C. by one A. B. by Indenture dated, &c. it doth more fully appear. If therefore the ≈øaid R. C. do not at any time hereafter grant, bargain, ≈øell or a≈ø≈øign his ≈øaid intere≈øt and Term of years yet to come in the ≈øaid Shop, to any per≈øon or per≈øons, without fir≈øt having the refu≈øal of the ≈øaid J. F. in writing, to buy or purcha≈øe the ≈øame; Then, &c.

div.head: A Condition to leave two parts in three of Land and Goods to a Wife.

q.p:
THE Condition, &c. That if a Marriage intended to be ≈øolempnized between the above bound R. C. and R. C. Daughter, &c. ≈øhall take effect; And if after the ≈øaid Marriage it doth happen that the ≈øaid R. C. doth ≈øurvive him the ≈øaid R. C. And if he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall before his decea≈øe convey and a≈ø≈øure to her the ≈øaid R. C. two full parts of all ≈øuch Goods and Chattels, as he now hath or hereafter ≈øhall have during the Coverture, the ≈øame into three parts to be divided; And ≈øhall al≈øo a≈ø≈øure and convey two full parts of all ≈øuch Lands and Tenements as he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall be or is now po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of in his own right of any E≈øtate what≈øoever, the ≈øame into three parts to be divided, ≈øo that the ≈øaid
two parts of all ≈øuch Lands and Tenements be conveyed and a≈ø≈øured to them the ≈øaid R. C. and R. C. and the Heirs of their two Bodies, and for lack of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, to the Heirs of her the ≈øaid R. C. for ever, and not otherwi≈øe; That then, &c.

div.head: A Condition that the Husband ≈øhall not ≈øell a Hou≈øe and Goods nor any part thereof, (whereof the Wife was ≈øei≈øed before Marriage,) during the Coverture, and to leave the ≈øame di≈øcharged of Incumbrances, if the Wife-≈øurvive.

q.p:
THE Condition, &c. That whereas there is an Agreement made between the above bound R. C. and C. R. of, &c. Widow, for a Marriage to be had and ≈øolemnized between them two, And whereas the ≈øaid C. by virtue of one Indenture of Lea≈øe bearing date, &c. made by one J. F. to her the ≈øaid C. is po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of one Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. with the Appurtenances in A. for all the re≈øidue of the Term of 21 years, &c. to come in the ≈øaid Indenture mentioned, And is al≈øo po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of certain Plate, Jewels and Hou≈øe-hold≈øtuff in the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage now being: If therefore at any time after the ≈øaid Marriage, and during the Natural Life of the ≈øaid C. the ≈øaid R. C. doth not alien, ≈øell, bargain, grant, forfeit, mortgage or incumber the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. nor do remove, convey or carry away, or cau≈øe to be conveyed, removed or carried away any of the Plate, &c. from or out of the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, nor bargain, ≈øell, change or alter the property of any part thereof, without the con≈øent of the ≈øaid C. And if it happen that the ≈øaid C. do ≈øurvive him, the ≈øaid R. C. if then al≈øo he the ≈øaid R. C. do leave the Intere≈øt in the ≈øaid Lea≈øe of the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. and all the Plate, &c. which ≈øhall then remain un≈øold or unaliened
by the con≈øent of the ≈øaid C. free from all bargains, ≈øales or incumbrance by him done, made or procured to her the ≈øaid C. her Executors and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øo that ≈øhe and they may lawfully, peaceably and quietly, have, hold, po≈ø≈øe≈øs and enjoy the ≈øame without any lett, ≈øuit, trouble, claim or demand from any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, from and immediately after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid R. C. That then, &c.

div.head: A Condition to make one Free.

q.p: THE Condition, &c. That if the above bound R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators, or A≈ø≈øigns, do and ≈øhall within one year next en≈øuing the date hereof upon rea≈øonable reque≈øt to him or them to be made by the above named C. R. cau≈øe and procure the ≈øaid C. to be lawfully and orderly according to the Cu≈øtom of the City of L. admitted into the Liberty and Freedom of the ≈øame City, without any manner of fraud or covin at the only co≈øts and charges of him the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øo always, that the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall not be lawfully hindred thereof, by rea≈øon of any Act or thing to be done hereafter by the ≈øaid C. R. That then, &c.

div.head: A Condition to become Bound with another to the Obligee, who has pa≈ø≈øed his word for the Debt of the Obligor.

q.p:
THE Condition, &c. That whereas the above named J. F. at the reque≈øt, and for the proper Debt of the above bound R. C. has agreed and undertaken for the payment of 50 l. of lawful Mony of England, to be paid by him the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, to F. J. of, &c. his, &c. according to the tenor and effect
of one Pair of Indentures dated and made, &c. If therefore the ≈øaid R. C. do together with one C. R. of, &c. become bound unto him the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. in and by one Bond or Obligation, at or before the tenth day of March next en≈øuing the date hereof wherein the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. ≈øhall be jointly and ≈øeverally bound unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, in the Sum of 100 l. of lawful Mony of England, with Condition for the ≈øaving and keeping harmle≈øs him the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs, &c. from all charge and damage which may ari≈øe, happen or come to him the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, for or by rea≈øon of his engaging, promi≈øing or undertaking to pay the ≈øaid 50 l. to the ≈øaid F. J. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns as afore≈øaid, Then, &c.

div.head: A Condition that a Father having received a Legacy given to a Child, ≈øhall ≈øave the Executor harmle≈øs.

q.p:
THE Condition, &c. That whereas the above mentioned R. C. did by his la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament give and bequeath to S. C. one of the Sons of the above bound A. C. the Sum of 50 l. of lawful Mony of England, to be paid unto him the ≈øaid S. C. or his A≈ø≈øigns, when he ≈øhould attain to his full age of one and twenty years, As by the ≈øaid Will it doth more fully appear: And whereas the above named J. F. and F. J. at the ≈øpecial in≈øtance and reque≈øt of the ≈øaid A. C. at and before the en≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents, have paid and delivered the ≈øaid 50 l. to the ≈øaid A. C. to and for the u≈øe of the ≈øaid S. C. his Son, if therefore the ≈øaid A. C. and the abovebound C. A. their or either or any of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, do well and
truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid the ≈øaid 50 l. unto the ≈øaid C.S. when he ≈øhall be of the age of one and twenty years, And do al≈øo at all times hereafter acquit, exonerate and di≈øcharge, or well and ≈øufficiently ≈øave and keep harmle≈øs them the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. and either of them, their and either of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, of, and from all Actions, Damages, Trouble, Claims and Demands, of or from the ≈øaid S. C. or any other Per≈øon or Per≈øons what≈øoever, for or by rea≈øon of the payment of the ≈øaid 50 l. to the ≈øaid A. C. That then, &c.

div.head: A Condition to pay back part of a Legacy, if any Debt of the Te≈øtator ≈øhall appear after to be unpaid.

q.p: THE Condition, &c. That whereas the above bound R.C. hath had and received of the above named C. R. Executor of the la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament of one A. B. of, &c. decea≈øed, the Sum of 50 l. of, &c. a Legacy given and bequeathed by the ≈øaid A. B. to the ≈øaid C. R. If therefore any Debt hereafter of the ≈øaid A. B. ≈øhall happen to be demanded or received and paid by the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, and the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall within one Month after notice thereof, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid to the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors or A≈ø≈øigns, a ratable part and proportion back again towards the ≈øatisfaction of the ≈øaid Debt; That then, &c.

div.head: A Condition to make ≈øatisfaction if any mi≈øtake be found in an Account made up.

q.p:
THE Condition, &c. That whereas the above bound R. C. having been Apprentice unto the ≈øaid J. F. is now about to leave the Service of the
≈øaid J. F. and in order thereto hath given an account in writing of all dealings and bu≈øine≈ø≈øes of the ≈øaid J. F. tran≈øacted by the ≈øaid R. C. during his ≈øaid Apprentice≈øhip, If therefore the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, do and ≈øhall well and truly account for, ≈øatisfie and pay any Sum or Sums of Mony, which on a more exact and ≈øtrict Examination of the ≈øaid account ≈øhall appear not to have been accounted, and to be due to the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, Then, &c.

div.head: A Condition to ≈øave harmle≈øs one Bail for a Defendant in the Common-Pleas, and for the Defendants paying the Condemnation Mony, or rendring him≈øelf to Pri≈øon, if Judgment be again≈øt him.

q.p:
THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas the above named R. C. at the reque≈øt of the above bound E. A. hath agreed to become Bail or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid E. in his Maje≈øty's Court of Common-Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter, at the Suit of J. M. Gent. one of the Attornies of the ≈øame Court, in an Action of Covenant broken, If therefore within five days next after Judgment ≈øhall happen to be given again≈øt the ≈øaid E. in the Action afore≈øaid, the ≈øaid E. do or ≈øhall pay the condemnation Mony, or render him≈øelf a Pri≈øoner to the Pri≈øon of the Fleet in di≈øcharge of the Bail or Manucaption afore≈øaid, And al≈øo if the ≈øaid E. A. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators, do or ≈øhall from time to time and at all times hereafter, ≈øave, defend and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, of and from all Writs, Actions, Suits, Bills, Co≈øts, Charges and Damages, which ≈øhall or may be brought or pro≈øecuted again≈øt the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or which he or they ≈øhall or may bear, pay or
≈øuffer for or by occa≈øion that the ≈øaid R. C. hath or ≈øhall become Bail or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid E. A. as afore≈øaid, then this Obligation to be void, or el≈øe to ≈øtand and be in full force.

div.p: Note, If the Defendant be of that quality that there is no fear of his in≈øolvency, then the clau≈øe of rendring him≈øelf to the Fleet may be left out: But if otherwi≈øe, then it is be≈øt to put that clau≈øe, whereby you will be ≈øooner intitled to put the Bond in Suit.

div.head: A Condition for ≈øaving a Bail harmle≈øs, without a Clau≈øe of the Defendants rendring him≈øelf to Pri≈øon.

q.p: THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas the above named A. B. at the in≈øtance of the above bound S. B. hath agreed to become Bail or Manucaptor of R. M. in their Maje≈øties Court of Common Pleas at Westmin≈øter, at the Suit of R. H. Gent. in an Action of Tre≈øpa≈øs upon the Ca≈øe, to the damage of the ≈øaid R. H. 1500 l. as it is ≈øaid, If therefore the ≈øaid S. B. her Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, do and ≈øhall from time to time, and at all times hereafter, ≈øave, defend and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid A. B. his Heirs Executors and Admini≈øtrators, of, and from all Writs, Actions Suits, Bills, Co≈øts, Charges and Damages what≈øoever, which ≈øhall or may be brought or pro≈øecuted again≈øt the ≈øaid A. B. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or which he or they ≈øhall or may bear, pay or ≈øuffer, for or by occa≈øion, that the ≈øaid A. B. ≈øhall become Bail or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid R. M. as afore≈øaid, Then, &c.

div.head: A Condition to ≈øave the Bail harmle≈øs, and pay the Charges which he ≈øhall expend in defence of the Suit.

q.p: THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas the above named A. B. at the reque≈øt of the above bound C. D. hath agreed to become Bail or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid C. D. in the Court of Common Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter, in an Action there brought or to be borught again≈øt him by J. M. If therefore the ≈øaid C. D. E. L. and M. N. or any of them do and ≈øhall from time to time, and at all times hereafter ≈øave, defend and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid A. B. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, of and from all Actions, Suits, Bills, Co≈øts, Charges and Damages what≈øoever, which ≈øhall or may be brought or pre≈øented again≈øt the ≈øaid A. B. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or which he or they ≈øhall or may bear, pay or ≈øuffer, for or by occa≈øion that the ≈øaid A. B. hath or ≈øhall become Bail or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid C. D. as afore≈øaid, And al≈øo, If the ≈øaid C. D. E. L. and M. N. or any of them ≈øhall from time to time and at all times hereafter upon rea≈øonable reque≈øt, pay unto the ≈øaid A. B. all ≈øuch Sum and Sums of Mony as he ≈øhall expend, disbur≈øe or de≈øerve to have, for or about defending the ≈øaid Action, Then, &c.

div.p: Note, A Bond with ≈øuch Condition is nece≈ø≈øary where the Defendants Attorney is the Bail.

div.head: A Condition to ≈øave harmle≈øs for being Bail in an inferior Court.

q.p:
THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas E. S. late in his Maje≈øty's Court of Record, held before the Mayor of the City of Chiche≈øter above-≈øaid, hath levyed a certain Plaint again≈øt the above-bound W.T. in a Plea of Tre≈øpa≈øs upon the Ca≈øe. And whereas E. C. one of the Serjeants of the Mace within the ≈øaid City by Precept of the Court afore≈øaid, hath arre≈øted the ≈øaid W. T. upon the Plaint afore≈øaid, And whereas the abovenamed N. C. at the ≈øpecial in≈øtance and reque≈øt of the ≈øaid W. T. for the enlargement of the ≈øame W. T. hath undertaken to become Pledge or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid W. T. in the Plea afore≈øaid, according to the Cu≈øtom of the ≈øaid Court: If therefore the ≈øaid W. T. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators do or ≈øhall within ten days next after Judgment ≈øhall happen to be given again≈øt the ≈øaid W. T. upon the ≈øaid Plaint in the Court afore≈øaid, well and truly pay, or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid E. S. all ≈øuch Sum and Sums of Mony as by ≈øuch Judgment ≈øhall happen to be recovered again≈øt the ≈øaid W. T. And do and ≈øhall al≈øo within the ≈øame ten days cau≈øe and procure ≈øatisfaction to be acknowledged and entred of Record upon ≈øuch Judgment ≈øo happening to be given as afore≈øaid, And al≈øo if the ≈øaid W. T. his, Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators, do or ≈øhall upon notice and reque≈øt made, well and truly pay, or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid N. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators all ≈øuch Sum and Sums of Mony, as he or they ≈øhall expend or disbur≈øe in defence of the Suit ≈øo brought again≈øt the ≈øaid W. T. as afore≈øaid, or in defence of any Writ, Plaint, Suit or Action to be brought again≈øt the ≈øaid N. C. for or by rea≈øon of his becoming
Pledge or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid W. T. as afore≈øaid, or in obtaining or pro≈øecuting any Writ or Writs of Error upon any Judgment to be obtained again≈øt the ≈øaid W. T. in the Plea afore≈øaid, or again≈øt the ≈øaid N. C. as Pledge and Manucaptor of the ≈øaid W. T. And al≈øo if the ≈øaid W. T. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall from time to time and at all times hereafter ≈øave, defend and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid N. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators of and from all Co≈øts, Charges, Damages, Lets and Troubles what≈øoever, which he the ≈øaid N. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall at any time hereafter ≈øu≈øtain, bear, pay or ≈øuffer for or by rea≈øon of becoming Pledge or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid W. T. as afore≈øaid without fraud or delay, Then this Obligation to be void and of none effect, or el≈øe to ≈øtand and be in full force and virtue.

div.head: A Condition to ≈øave harmle≈øs the Bail for the Defendant in an inferior Court.

q.p:
THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas R. S. late in the King's Maje≈øty's Court of Record, held before the Mayor of the City of C. did levy a Plaint again≈øt the above bound J. W. in a Plea of Tre≈øpa≈øs upon the Ca≈øe: By virtue of which Plaint, and by precept of the Court afore≈øaid, the ≈øaid J. W. was arre≈øted by one of the Serjeants of the Mace of the ≈øaid City, to an≈øwer the ≈øaid R. S. of the Plea afore≈øaid; And the ≈øaid J. W. ≈øo being arre≈øted, the above named N. C. at the ≈øpecial in≈øtance and reque≈øt of the ≈øaid J. W. and for his enlargement did undertake to become Bail or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid J. W. in the Plea afore≈øaid, at the Suit of the ≈øaid R. S. according to the Cu≈øtom of the ≈øaid Court: If therefore the ≈øaid J. W. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators do or ≈øhall within eight days next
after Judgment ≈øhall happen to be given again≈øt the ≈øaid J. W. in the Plea afore≈øaid, at the Suit of the ≈øaid R. S. procure and cau≈øe ≈øatisfaction to be acknowledged and entred upon the Record of ≈øuch Judgment ≈øo happening to be given again≈øt the ≈øaid J. W. as afore≈øaid, whereby ≈øuch Judgment ≈øhall be made void, And al≈øo if the ≈øaid J. W. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall from time to time, and at all times hereafter ≈øave, defend and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid N.C. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, of and from all Co≈øts, Charges and Damages what≈øoever, for or by rea≈øon that the ≈øaid N. C. hath or ≈øhall become Bail or Manucaptor of the ≈øaid J. W. at the Suit of the ≈øaid R. S. upon the Plaint afore≈øaid; And al≈øo if the ≈øaid J. W. ≈øhall within ≈øix months next en≈øuing, the date hereof clearly and ab≈øolutely acquit and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid N. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, of and from the Bail and Manucaption afore≈øaid; Then, &c.

div.head: A Condition for ≈øaving harmle≈øs the Plaintiffs Bail, to pro≈øecute in an inferior Court.

q.p:
THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas the above bound R. D. late in the King's Maje≈øty's Court of Record, hold before the Major of the City of C. above ≈øaid, did levy a Plaint again≈øt one A. C. in a Plea of Tre≈øpa≈øs upon the Ca≈øe, And the above named J. V. at the ≈øpecial in≈øtance and reque≈øt of the ≈øaid R. D. hath undertaken to become pledge of the ≈øaid R. D. for the pro≈øecuting the ≈øaid Plaint, If therefore Judgment ≈øhall happen to be given, again≈øt the ≈øaid R. D. in the Plea afore≈øaid, upon di≈øcontinuance Non-≈øuit, Verdict for the Defendant, or otherwi≈øe how≈øoever, Then if the ≈øaid R. D. do or ≈øhall within eight days next after ≈øuch Judgment
≈øhall happen to be given, procure and cau≈øe ≈øatisfaction to be acknowledged upon the Record of ≈øuch Judgment, whereby the ≈øaid Judgment ≈øhall be made void; And al≈øo if the ≈øaid R. D. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall from time to time, and at all times hereafter ≈øave, defend and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid J. V. his Heirs Executors and Admini≈øtrators of and from all Co≈øts, Charges and Damages what≈øoever, for or by occa≈øion that the ≈øaid J. V. hath or ≈øhall become Pledge of the ≈øaid R. D. upon the Plaint afore≈øaid; And al≈øo if the ≈øaid R. D. ≈øhall within ≈øix Months next en≈øuing the date hereof clearly and ab≈øolutely acquit and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid J. V. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, of and from the being or continuing Pledge of the ≈øaid R. D. as afore≈øaid; Then, &c.

div.head: Con≈øideration for ≈øaving harmle≈øs a Surety for a Par≈øon in the Fir≈øt-Fruits Office.

q.p:
THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas the above-named N. C. at the reque≈øt, and for the Debt of the above-bound J. B. in and by four ≈øeveral Obligations, bearing date with the≈øe pre≈øents, is become bound unto our Lord the King in four ≈øeveral Sums of 11 l. with Condition of the fir≈øt Obligation to be void, if the ≈øaid J. B. happen to dye before his or her age of One and twenty years, or day of Marriage, then all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Goods, Chattels and Monies, (Except before excepted) to be paid unto the Survivor of them the ≈øaid D. B. and E. B. at his or her age of One and twenty years, or day of Marriage, which ≈øhall fir≈øt happen, as afore≈øaid; Then, &c.

div.head: A Condition, That the Obligor ≈øhall never ≈øue out Execution upon any Statute or Judgment again≈øt the Obligee.

q.p:
THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That if the above-bound T. W. his Heirs Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall not at
any time hereafter ≈øue, implead, pro≈øecute, mole≈øt or trouble the above-named T. P. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators nor ≈øei≈øe, levy, extend or take his or their Goods, Chattels, Lands, Tenements or Hereditaments, of, for or by rea≈øon of any Judgment or Statute which the ≈øaid T. W. now hath again≈øt the ≈øaid T. P. or for or by rea≈øon of any Judgment or Statute which are or is at this pre≈øent remaining upon Record in any Court of Record, or el≈øewhere within the Kingdom of England, again≈øt the ≈øaid T. P. for any Sum or Sums of Mony due, or pretended to be due to the ≈øaid T. W. And al≈øo, If the ≈øaid T. W. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and do from time to time, and at all times for ever hereafter, ≈øave, defend and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid T. P. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and his and their Goods, Chattels, Lands, Tenements and Hereditaments, of and from all Statutes and Judgments, and of and from all and all manner of Executions, Extents, Troubles, Co≈øts, Charges and Damages what≈øoever, which ≈øhall or may happen to or again≈øt the ≈øaid T. P. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or any of them, for or by rea≈øon of any ≈øuch Judgment or Statute without fraud or delay; Then this Obligation to be void, &c.

div.head: A Condition upon an Adventure of Bottom-ree.

q.p:
THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That if the above-bound C. M. and O. R. their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, or either of them, do or ≈øhall cau≈øe to be paid unto the abovenamed R. P. or to his certain Attorney, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, the Sum of 65 l. and 13 s. of lawful Mony of England, at or before the end of 20 days next after the fir≈øt Return and
≈øafe Arrival of the Ship Mary of S. (Burthen 140 Tuns, or thereabouts, Mr. A. P. Ma≈øter for the time being) for her pre≈øent intended Voyage from S. afore≈øaid unto Virginia, and from thence back again unto her Port of delivery in England. But if the ≈øaid Ship by Order or any contingency ≈øhall give over the ≈øaid Voyage and not proceed thereon; and that if then the ≈øaid C. M. and O. R. or either of them, their Executors or Admini≈øtrators, do and ≈øhall re-pay unto the ≈øaid R. P. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators, or A≈ø≈øigns, the Sum of 50 l. and 10 s. Principal Adventure, at or before the end of 10 days next after, giving over the ≈øaid Voyage, as afore≈øaid; Then, &c.

div.head: A Bond with Condition to ob≈øerve the Orders of an Hou≈øe of Chancery.

body.p:
NOverint univer≈øi per pÃÑ≈øentes nos N. C. de Ho≈øpicio SciÃÑ Clementis Dacorum in ComÃÑ MiddÃî Genero≈øum & I. G. de eodem Ho≈øpicio Genero≈øum teneri & firmiter obligari E. G. Genero≈øo Principali Ho≈øpicii pÃÑdictÃÑ decem libris bone & legalis Monete Anglie ≈øolvendÃî eidem E. aut ≈øuo certo Attornato Executoribus Admini≈øtratoribus ≈øive A≈ø≈øignÃÑ ≈øuis Ad quam quidem ≈øolutionem bene ac fideliter faciendÃÑ Obligamus nos & utrum
que no≈øtrum ac Heredes Executores & Admini≈øtratores no≈øtros & utriu≈ø
que no≈øtri firter per pÃÑ≈øentes ≈øigillis no≈øtris ≈øigillatÃÑ

closer.dateline: DatÃÑ vice≈øimo quinto die Novembris Anno Regni Dornini Caroli ≈øecundi Dei Gratia Anglie Scotie Francie & Hibernie Regis Fidei Defen≈øoris &c. decimo quinto.

postscript.p:
The Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That if the above bounden N. C. ≈øhall from time to time ≈øatisfie and pay unto the Principal of St. Clements-Inn above≈øaid, for the time being, all ≈øuch Sum and
Sums of Mony, as ≈øhall be due for Pen≈øions, Commons, E≈ø≈øoins, Battles, Ca≈øtings into Commons Fines, Amerciaments and all other Duties what≈øoever, conforming him≈øelf to the Orders now made or hereafter to be made, by the Principal and Ancients of the ≈øame Society, Then this Obligation to be void or el≈øe to ≈øtand and be in full force.

div.head: A Bond with Condition That the Author of a Book ≈øhall take (of the Book≈øeller, undertaking to print it) a certain number at a price.

q.p: THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas the above-named R. C. at the reque≈øt of the above-named J. A. hath undertaken to cau≈øe to be printed a certain Book now in Manu≈øcripit, Intituled, &c. and to deliver unto the ≈øaid J.A. 400 of the ≈øame Books, printed on or before the fir≈øt day of November next ne≈øuing, at the Shop of the ≈øaid R. C. in Fleet-street; if therefore the ≈øaid J. A. do or ≈øhall on or before the fir≈øt day of February next following, well and truly pay unto the ≈øand R. C. 20 l. for the price of the ≈øaid 400 Books printed, ≈øo as the ≈øaid R. C. be on the ≈øaid fir≈øt day of November at his Shop afore≈øaid, ready to deliver to the afore≈øaid J. A. the ≈øame Books in ≈øheets, without fraud or delay; Then this Obligation to be void, or el≈øe to remain in full force and virtue.

div.head: A Bargain and Sale of a Term for years, taken in Execution upon a Fieri facias.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between W. S. one of Bailiffs of J. G. E≈øq; Sheriff of the County, &c. of the one part, and D. C. &c. of the other part. Whereas W. P. &c. at the time of making the Warrant herein after-mentioned, was po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed
for a Term of years yet to come, of and in all that Clo≈øe of Land, &c. And whereas N. C. in the Court of Common-Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter, did recover again≈øt the ≈øaid W. P. One Judgment for 40 l. Debt and 30 s. Co≈øts of Suit: Upon which ≈øaid Judgment in the Term of St. Michael la≈øt pa≈øt, a Writ of Fieri facias, Returnable in Octabis S. Hillarii, i≈ø≈øued out of the ≈øaid Court, and was directed and delivered unto the ≈øaid Sheriff in form of Law, to be executed. Which ≈øaid Sheriff on the ≈øecond day of December la≈øt, made his Warrant unto the ≈øaid W. S. and others, joyntly and ≈øeverally, for the Execution of the ≈øaid Writ. And the ≈øaid W. S. by Virtue of the ≈øaid Writ, and the ≈øaid Warrant to him made as afore≈øaid, hath entred into and upon the ≈øaid Clo≈øe of Land, and ≈øei≈øed and taken the ≈øame, together with the E≈øtate, Term and Intere≈øt of the ≈øaid W. P. therein Now this Indenture Witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid W. S. in pur≈øuance of the ≈øaid Writ and Warrant, and for and in con≈øideration of Five pounds to him by the ≈øaid D. C. before the ≈øealing and delivery hereof, well and truly in hand paid, Hath bargained and ≈øold, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid D. C. all the ≈øaid Clo≈øe of Land, and all the E≈øtate, Right, Title and Intere≈øt of the ≈øaid W. P. in his own right, and in the Right of M. his Wife, of and in the ≈øaid Clo≈øe of Land; To have and to hold unto the ≈øaid D. C. for and during all the remainder of ≈øuch term and terms of years as the ≈øaid W. P. in his own right, or in the right of his Wife, had in the ≈øaid Clo≈øe of Land, in as large and ample manner as the ≈øaid W. P. and M. his Wife, or either of them, their or either of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, may might, ≈øhould or ought to have held or enjoyed the ≈øame.

div.head: A Bargain and Sale, or A≈ø≈øignment of Lands Extended upon a Recognizance.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of, &c. of the one part, and R. C. and C. R. of &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, that whereas R. R. by the name of, &c. by one Recognizance bearing date, &c. taken, acknowledged and ≈øealed before Sir J. H. Knight, Lord Chief Ju≈øtice of England, acording to the form of the Statute for recovery of Debts in that ca≈øe provided, ≈øtandeth bound unto the ≈øaid J. F. in the Sum of 100 l. payable &c. as by the ≈øame Recognizance, &c. And whereas al≈øo the ≈øame J. F. hath extended, and to him is delivered in Execution, the Mannor of A. with the appurtenances in the C. of S. at he yearly Rent of, &c. for the non-payment of the ≈øaid Sum of 100 l. Now the ≈øaid J. F. for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations him hereunto e≈øpecially moveing, hath bargained, ≈øold, a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet over and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth bargain, ≈øell, a≈ø≈øign, and ≈øet over unto the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. All the ≈øaid Mannor of A. with the Appurtenances, and all the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt and Demand what≈øoever which he the ≈øaid J. F. hath by rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Extent, of in and to the ≈øaid Mannor, and of in and to every part and parcel thereof, and in and to all and ≈øingular the Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands and Tenements ≈øo extended and delivered in Execution as afore≈øaid; And the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, &c. that he the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. at any time or times hereafter, ≈øhall not do any Act or Acts, thing or things, whereby the ≈øaid extent or extents or the E≈øtate, Title or Intere≈øt of the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. or either of them, or of the Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns of them, or either of them by rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Extent may any wi≈øe be hurt,
hindred or impeached, di≈øcharged, undone or made void: And further, that he the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will at the rea≈øonable reque≈øt, co≈øts and charges in the Law of the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. or either of them, do and ≈øuffer to be done, made and acknowledged all and every ≈øuch lawful and rea≈øonable Act and Acts, thing and things, device and devices in the Law what≈øoever for the further a≈ø≈øurance, ≈øurety and conveying of the Premi≈ø≈øes, for and during all the time and term of the ≈øaid Extent and Execution unto the ≈øand R. C. and C. R. as by their or either of their Coun≈øel learned in the Law ≈øhall be rea≈øonably devi≈øed, advi≈øed or required.

div.head: A Grant of a Rent re≈øerved by Lea≈øe.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of. &c. And R. C of, &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That whereas the ≈øaid J. F. by his Indenture of Lea≈øe bearing date, &c. (reciting the Lea≈øe) as in by the ≈øaid recited Lea≈øe it doth more at large appear. Now this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth; That the ≈øaid J. F. for and in con≈øideration of a competent Sum of Mony, Hath demi≈øed, granted, bargained, and to farm letten, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth demi≈øe, grant, and to farm, let unto the ≈øaid R. C. the rever≈øion and remainder of the ≈øaid Shop, &c. and other the Premi≈ø≈øes by the ≈øaid Indenture of Lea≈øe demi≈øed, together with the ≈øaid yearly Rent thereby re≈øerved, and the Counter-part of the ≈øaid Indenture of Lea≈øe, under the Hand and Seal of the ≈øaid, &c. To have, hold, po≈ø≈øe≈øs and enjoy the ≈øaid rever≈øion and Rent of, &c. and every part thereof unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, from the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents,
for and during all the re≈øidue of the afore≈øaid Term of, &c. yet to come and unexpired, yeilding and paying therefore yearly, and every year during the ≈øaid Term unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors or A≈ø≈øigns at the fea≈øt of, &c. one Pepper-corn if the ≈øame ≈øhall be lawfully demanded; And the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, &c. that he the ≈øaid J. F. at the time of the ≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents, is the true, perfect and Lawful owner, and po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øer of the ≈øaid demi≈øed rever≈øion and Rent; And is at the en≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents lawfully and ab≈øolutely po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed thereof. And that he the ≈øaid J. F. hath full power and authority to demi≈øe and grant the ≈øaid Rever≈øion and Rents of, &c. unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, for and during all the re≈øt and re≈øidue of the ≈øaid Term of, &c. in manner and form afore≈øaid, according to the true intent and meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents; And further, that the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. ≈øhall and will from time to time and at all times hereafter, during the ≈øaid Term, fully and clearly, acquit, di≈øcharge, ≈øave and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. of and from all former or other bargains, ≈øales, gifts, grants, lea≈øes, forfeitures, claim and demand what≈øoever; And the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, &c. that the ≈øaid yearly Rent of, &c. ≈øhall continue, remain, and be from henceforth during the re≈øidue of the ≈øaid Term, due and payable unto the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. according to the true intent and and meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents

div.head: A Grant of a Rent Charge.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of, &c. of the one part, and R. C. of, &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. F. for and in
con≈øideration of the ≈øum of, &c. to him in Hand paid before the en≈øealing and delivery hereof, by the ≈øaid R. C. the receipt whereof he the ≈øaid J. F. doth acknowledge, and thereof, and of every part thereof, doth acquit and for ever di≈øcharge the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. Hath given, granted and confirmed and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth give, grant and confirm unto the ≈øaid R. C. one Annuity or yearly Rent Charge of, &c. to be had, taken and received, out of all and ≈øingular the Me≈ø≈øuages, &c. of the ≈øaid J. F. within the Kingdom of England, to be paid at the four mo≈øt u≈øual Fea≈øts or Terms in the year, that is to ≈øay, &c. the fir≈øt payment thereof to be made and to begin on, &c. To have, hold, receive, take and enjoy the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent Charge, of, &c. unto the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. from the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents, until the full end and term of, &c. And if the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent Charge of, &c. ≈øhall happen to be behind and unpaid in part or in all after any of the ≈øaid Fea≈øt days above limited for the payment of the ≈øame, the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, &c. that then it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. into all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuages, &c. or into any part thereof to enter and di≈øtrain both for the Annuity afore≈øaid and the arrearages thereof, (if any be) and the di≈øtre≈øs and di≈øtre≈ø≈øes then and there found and taken, to keep and detain until the ≈øaid Annuity and all Arrerages thereof, ≈øhall be fully ≈øatisfied, contented and paid unto the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. And the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, &c. that the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. ≈øhall and will from time to time, and at all times during the ≈øaid Term of, &c. well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid to the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. or ≈øome of them the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. in manner and form afore≈øaid, according to the true
intent and meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents.

div.head: A Grant of a Rever≈øion.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of, &c. of the one part, and R. C. of, &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. F. for and in con≈øideration of the Sum of, &c. hath granted, bargained, ≈øold, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely, grant, bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, all that his right, title, u≈øe, intere≈øt, rever≈øion and remainder of, and in all and ≈øingular, &c. now or late in the tenure, or occupation of, &c. which ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage and other the Premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances, J. F. hath, ≈øhould or ought to have by and after the decea≈øe of A. B. Brother of the ≈øaid J. F. which ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. R. B. Father of the ≈øaid A. B. decea≈øed by his la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament. Devi≈øed, willed and bequeathed unto the ≈øaid A. B. for and during the natural life of the ≈øaid A. B. and the immediate rever≈øion or remainder thereof, to the ≈øaid J. F. and his Heirs for ever, Together with all Deeds, Evidences, Charters, Re≈øcripts, Writings and Minuments which he the ≈øaid J. F. or any other to his u≈øe, or by his con≈øent or delivery, have or hath, touching or concerning the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. or any part thereof: All and ≈øingular which ≈øaid Deeds, Evidences, Charters, &c the ≈øaid J. F. hath already delivered unto the ≈øaid R. C. at and before the en≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents; To have and to hold the ≈øaid rever≈øion and remainder, and all E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt, &c. of the ≈øaid J. F. of in and to the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. before by the≈øe pre≈øents, bargained and ≈øold, or meant, mentioned or intended to be hereby granted, bargained
and ≈øold, and every part thereof immmediatly from and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid A. B. unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for, &c. And the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, &c. That the ≈øaid J. F. at the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents, is lawfully and ≈øolely ≈øei≈øed of and in the rever≈øion and remainder of the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. immediately from and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid A. B. of a true and perfect E≈øtate of Inheritance in the Law in Fee to his own u≈øe, without any manner of Condition, Mortgage or Redemption: And further, that the ≈øaid rever≈øion or remainder of the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. from by and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid A. B. and at the day of the date hereof are and be, and ≈øo at all times from henceforth ≈øhall be and continue free, clear and clearly acquitted, exonerated and di≈øcharged and ≈øaved harmle≈øs by the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, of and from all and every former and other Bargains, Sales, Gifts, Grants, Lea≈øes Statutes Merchant and of the Staple, Recogni≈øances, Jointures, Dowers, Wills and Rents, and of, and from all and all manner of incumbrance or demand what≈øoever, had, made, committed or done by him the ≈øaid J. F. or by any other per≈øon or per≈øons, by his authority or procurement.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of Dower.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between R. L. Son and Heir of C. L. late of S. in the County of S. of the one part, and N. C. and J. his Wife, who was the relict of the ≈øaid O. L. of the other part, Whereas the ≈øaid O. L. in his life, and at the time of death was ≈øei≈øed in his deme≈øne as of Fee, of and in divers Lands and Tenements in Y. and W. in the County afore≈øaid, which upon the decea≈øe
of the ≈øaid O. L. de≈øcended unto the ≈øaid R. L. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, that the ≈øaid R. L. hath endowed and a≈ø≈øigned and by the≈øe pre≈øents, doth endow and a≈ø≈øign unto the ≈øaid N. C. and J. his Wife the third part of all the ≈øaid Lands and Tenements (to wit, &c.) All that Me≈ø≈øuage, To have and to hold unto the ≈øaid N. C. and J. his Wife, for and during the natural life of the ≈øaid J. in ≈øeveralty by Meets and Bounds, in the name of Dower, and in recompence and ≈øatisfaction of all the Dower, which the ≈øaid J. ought to have of or in the ≈øaid Lands and Tenements which were of the ≈øaid O. L. in Y. and W. afore≈øaid.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of ≈øeveral Bonds to a Tru≈øtee for a Widow, with con≈øent of her intended Husband, that the Mony be at her di≈øpo≈øe after Marriage.

body.p:
THIS Indenture Tripartite, made, &c. Between J. D. of, &c. of the fir≈øt part, S. G. of, &c. of the ≈øecond part, and O. W. of, &c. of the third part. Whereas J. T. of, &c. did heretofore by one Writing Obligatory (become bound unto the ≈øaid S. G. in the penal ≈øum of 40 l.) bearing date the 29th day of October 1601. with Condition to be void upon payment of 20 l. 10 s. on the fir≈øt day of April then next following. And al≈øo by one other Obligation, bearing date the 18th day of October 1690. is and ≈øtandeth bound unto the ≈øaid S. G. in the penal ≈øum 240 l. with condition to be void upon Payment of 123 l. of lawful Mony on the 19th day of April then next following. And whereas A. T. of, &c. is likewi≈øe by one Obligation, bearing date the 7th day of June, bound unto the ≈øaid S. G. in the penal ≈øum of 10 l. conditioned for the payment of 51 l. on the 13th day of November then next following.
And al≈øo by one other Obligation, is and ≈øtandeth bound unto the ≈øaid S. G. (bearing date the 10th day of February 1689) in the penal ≈øum of 20 l. with condition to be void upon payment of 10 l. 5 s. upon the 11th day of Augu≈øt then next following. Which ≈øeveral Principal Monies in the ≈øeveral Conditions of the above-recited Obligations, amount unto the ≈øum of 200 l. relation to which ≈øaid recited Obligations and the Conditions thereof being had may more fully appear, and are yet due and owing unto the ≈øaid S. G. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That a Marriage being intended, by the grace of God, ≈øhortly to be had and ≈øolemnized between the ≈øaid J. D. and S. G. in con≈øideration whereof, among≈øt other things, it is agreed the ≈øaid ≈øum of 200 l. Principal Mony, in the Conditions of the recited Obligations mentioned, and the Intere≈øt thereof, ≈øhall be di≈øpo≈øed in ≈øuch manner as herein after is expre≈ø≈øed. And in pur≈øuance of the ≈øaid Agreement, the ≈øaid S. G. with the con≈øent of the ≈øaid J. D. hath granted and A≈ø≈øigned, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth grant and A≈ø≈øign unto the ≈øaid O. W. the ≈øeveral Writings Obligatory before recited, and all and every the ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony upon them due or to be due. And the ≈øaid J. D. and S. G. do hereby con≈øtitute, make, appoint and in their place and ≈øtead put the ≈øaid O. W. their true and lawful Attorney for them and their names or in the name of one of them, and to the u≈øes, intents and purpo≈øes herein after mentioned, to receive, have and take of and from the ≈øeveral Per≈øons, Debtos before named, their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, all and every ≈øum and ≈øums of Money due or to be due as afore≈øaid; and al≈øo in the name, ≈øtead and place of the ≈øaid J. D. and S. G. to give and deliver Acquittances (unto the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Per≈øons, their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators)
or other legal di≈øcharges for the ≈øaid ≈øeveral ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony, or any part thereof ≈øo to be received, or otherwi≈øe deliver up the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Writings Obligatory to be cancelled. And for default of payment of the ≈øaid ≈øeveral ≈øums of Mony, the ≈øaid ≈øeveral per≈øons or either of them, their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators re≈øpectively, in the names of the ≈øaid J. D. and S. G. to Arre≈øt, Implead, Impri≈øon and Condemn; and out of Pri≈øon them or any or either of them to Relea≈øe and Di≈øcharge. And the ≈øaid J. D. and S. G. do covenant and grant for them≈øelves their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, to and with the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That they the ≈øaid J. D. and S. G. their Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will allow, ratifie and confirm all what≈øoever the ≈øaid O. W. ≈øhall lawfully do or cau≈øe to be done in and about the Premi≈ø≈øes. And al≈øo that they the ≈øaid J. D. and S. G. their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, or any or either of them, ≈øhall not or will not at any time hereafter annihilate, acquit, relea≈øe or otherwi≈øe di≈øcharge or make void the writings Obligatory before-mentioned, or any of them, or any ≈øum or ≈øums of Mony thereupon due, or any Action, Suit, Bill, Plaint, Judgment or Execution thereupon, or for the ≈øame or any part thereof to be had, brought, pro≈øecuted or obtained, without the ≈øpecial licen≈øe and con≈øent of the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators therein or thereunto fir≈øt had and obtained in writing, or the Rule, Order or Decree of ≈øome Court of Law or Equity. And al≈øo that they the ≈øaid J. D. and S. G. their Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will from time to time and at all tines here after upon every rea≈øonable reque≈øt, well and truly do and execute all and every ≈øuch further lawful and rea≈øonable Act and Acts, Thing and
Things for confirmation of the≈øe pre≈øents; and for the further, better and more perfect authorizing and impowring the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, to receive, have and take up all and every the ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony now due, or which ≈øhall be due upon the ≈øeveral Writings Obligatory afore≈øaid, to the u≈øes herein after mentioned. Provided always, and upon the ≈øpecial Tru≈øt and Confidence, and to this intent and purpo≈øe, That the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall pay unto the ≈øaid S. G. ≈øo much Mony as the ≈øaid O. W. ≈øhall receive for the intere≈øt or proceed of the ≈øaid 200 l. during ≈øo long time as the ≈øaid J. D. and S. G. ≈øhall live and cohabit together. And the ≈øaid J. D. for him≈øelf his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth hereby further covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid O. W. in manner following (viz.) That the whole Intere≈øt, Product or proceed of the ≈øaid 200 l. which the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall as afore≈øaid, from time to time, and at all times accept, receive and take, he the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall pay to the ≈øaid S. G. as a Feme ≈øole. And the ≈øaid S. G. is hereby authorized and impowred to receive and take the ≈øame, and fully to di≈øcharge the ≈øaid O. W. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and every or either of them by her Acquittance or otherwi≈øe, with or without the con≈øent of the ≈øaid J. D. as if ≈øhe were a Feme ≈øole, and all the re≈øidue of the Intere≈øt or Proceed of the ≈øaid 200 l. together with the ≈øaid principal ≈øum, to ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons as the ≈øaid S. G. by any writing under her Hand and Seal, with or without her ≈øaid intended Husband, or by her la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament in writing ≈øhall appoint or direct; and for want of ≈øuch direction and appointment, to the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid S. G. Provided al≈øo,
and it is, agreed between all the Parties hereunto That if the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall receive any part of the ≈øaid principal ≈øum of 200 l. Then he or they ≈øhall lend out the ≈øame again at Intere≈øt to ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons, and on ≈øuch Security as the ≈øaid S. G. by any writing under her Hand and Seal, with or without the ≈øaid J. D. ≈øhall direct. And that the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall not be chargeable to an≈øwer any Intere≈øt or Profit of the ≈øaid 200 l. or ≈øo much thereof as ≈øhall remain in his or their hands unlent in default of ≈øuch direction. And al≈øo, That notwith≈øtanding any thing before in the≈øe pre≈øents contained, it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators out of any Intere≈øt Mony by him or them to be received by virtue of the≈øe Pre≈øents, to reimbur≈øe and retain to him and them≈øelves all ≈øuch ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony as he or they ≈øhall ence≈ø≈øarily expend or lay out by rea≈øon of any Suit or Suits in Law touching the Premi≈ø≈øes, not occa≈øioned by any breach of tru≈øt by the ≈øaid O. W. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators.

div.head: A Grant of the moiety of an Annuity during Life.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of, &c. F. J. of, &c. of the one part, and R. C. of, &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. for and in con≈øideration of the ≈øum of 800 l. of lawful Mony of England, to them in hand paid by the ≈øaid R. C. at or before the en≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe Pre≈øents, the receit whereof and them≈øelves therewith fully ≈øatisfied and paid, they the ≈øaid J. F. and F. bargained, ≈øold and confirmed, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents do fully and ab≈øolutely grant, bargain, ≈øell and confirm unto the ≈øaid R. C. one Annuity or Annual Rent of 100 l. by the year, being the moiety or half part of one entire Annuity or Annual Rent of 200 l. by the year, ari≈øing, due and payable unto the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. out of the Mannor of A. or out of any part or parcel thereof, To have and to hold the ≈øaid Annuity or annual Rent of 100 l. herein before-mentioned to be bargained and ≈øold unto the ≈øaid R. C. and his A≈ø≈øigns, from the, &c. la≈øt pa≈øt before the date of the≈øe Pre≈øents, for and during the term of four≈øcore years, if he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall happen ≈øo long to live, in as large, ample and beneficial manner to all intents and purpo≈øes as they the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. or either of them now hath, ever had, or could, or might, or can, or may in any wi≈øe grant, bargain or ≈øell the ≈øame to the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. C. and his A≈ø≈øigns. And the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. the ≈øaid annual Rent of 100 l. herein before-mentioned, to be bargained and ≈øold by the year, again≈øt them≈øelves and all other per≈øons lawfully claiming or to claim the ≈øame or any part thereof, by, from or under them, or either of them, unto the ≈øaid R. C. and him A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will warrant and defend by the≈øe Pre≈øents. And the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. do for them≈øelves, and either of them doth for him≈øelf, their and his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and every of them covenant, promi≈øe and grant to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs, Executors and A≈ø≈øigns, and every of them by the≈øe Pre≈øents in manner following, (that is to ≈øay) That they the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. or one of them, for and notwith≈øtanding any Act or thing by them or either of them heretofore done or ≈øuffered to the contrary, have or hath in them≈øelves, or one of them at the time
of their ≈øealing of the≈øe Pre≈øents, good right and lawful authority to grant, bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid R. C. and his A≈ø≈øigns, the ≈øaid annual Rent of 100 l. by the year, in ≈øuch manner and form as is herein before-mentioned. And further, That the ≈øaid R. C. and his A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and lawfully may, during the natural life of the ≈øaid R. C. or the term of, &c. if the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall ≈øo long live, peaceably and quietly have, hold, enjoy and receive, retain and keep the ≈øaid annual Rent or ≈øum of 100 l. by the year before granted, without the lawful lett, ≈øuit, trouble, denial or di≈øturbance of or by the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. or either of them, any other per≈øon or per≈øons lawfully claiming, by, from or under them or either of them, their or either of their E≈øtate, Right or Title. And further, That the ≈øaid bargained Premi≈ø≈øes were, are and be, and ≈øo ≈øhall remain and continue to the ≈øaid R. C. and his A≈ø≈øigns, during the natural life of the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall ≈øo long live, free and clear, and freely and clearly acquitted and di≈øcharged, or el≈øe by the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. or one of them, their or one of their Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øufficiently ≈øaved harmle≈øs and indempnified of and from all former and other gifts, grants, bargains, ≈øales, lea≈øes, jointures, dowers, ≈øttatutes, judgments, recognizances, titles, troubles and incumbrances what≈øoever at any time heretofore had, made committed or ≈øuffered, or hereafter to be had, made committed or ≈øuffered by them the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. or either of them. And the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. do for them≈øelves, their Heirs, Executors and Adminini≈øtrators and every of them, covenant and promi≈øe to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, and every of them by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That they the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. and all and every other per≈øon and per≈øons now
having or lawfully claiming, or which ≈øhall or may hereafter have or claim any lawful E≈øtate, Right or Title in or unto the ≈øaid bargained Premi≈ø≈øes or any part thereof, by, from or under them the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. ≈øhall and will at any times during the ≈øpace of five years next after the date of the≈øe Pre≈øents, if the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall ≈øo long live, at and upon the rea≈øonable reque≈øt, and at the proper co≈øts and charges in the law of the ≈øaid R. C. and his A≈ø≈øigns make, acknowledge and Execute to the ≈øaid R. C. and his A≈ø≈øigns, or any of them, his or their Councel learned in the Law, ≈øhall be devi≈øed, advi≈øed or required, ≈øo that ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons who are to make ≈øuch further a≈ø≈øurance as afore≈øaid, be not therefore compelled to travel farthe than to the Cities of London or Westmin≈øter, which ≈øaid other a≈ø≈øurances ≈øo to be had and made as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be and enure, and ≈øhall be judged and taken to be and enure, and by the ≈øaid parties is hereby ≈øo declared to the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. C. and of his A≈ø≈øigns, and to no other u≈øe and purpo≈øes what≈øoever.
