div.head: A Grant of the next Avoydance of a Vicaridge, with nece≈ø≈øary Covenants.

body.p:
THIS Indenture, &c. Between N. C. of, &c. of the one part, and G. G. of, &c. and G. S. of, &c. of the other part, Witne≈ø≈øeth, that the ≈øaid N. C. for and in con≈øideration of 25 l. of lawful Mony of England, to him by the ≈øaid G. G. and G. S. before the ≈øealing and delivery hereof, well and truly in hand paid, Hath granted, bargained and ≈øold, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents doth grant, bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid G. G. and G. S. the fir≈øt and next Advow≈øon, Nomination, Pre≈øentation and free Di≈øpo≈øition of and to the Vicaridge of the Pari≈øh Church of H. in the County of S. To have and to hold the ≈øaid next Advow≈øon, Pre≈øentation, Nomination and free Di≈øpo≈øition of and to the ≈øaid Vicaridge of H. unto the ≈øaid G. G. and G. S. their Executors Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns for the next avoidance only: So that it ≈øhall be lawful to and for the ≈øaid G. G. and G. S. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns by force and virtue of the≈øe Pre≈øents, any fit per≈øon to pre≈øent to the ≈øaid Vicaridge when it ≈øhall next become void, either by the death, re≈øignation or ce≈ø≈øion of the pre≈øent Incumbent, or otherwi≈øe how≈øoever. And the ≈øaid N. C. doth for him≈øelf his Heirs Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant
and grant to and with the ≈øaid G. G. and G. S. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That no per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever (other than the ≈øaid N. C.) have or hath any Right, Ritle or Intere≈øt to grant, bargain or ≈øell the ≈øaid next Advow≈øon and Pre≈øentation to the Vicaridge of H. afore≈øaid. And that ≈øuch per≈øon as by the ≈øaid G. G. and G.S. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, in pur≈øuance of the≈øe pre≈øents, ≈øhall be pre≈øented to the ≈øaid Vicarage, and thereunto have In≈øtitution and Induction, ≈øhall or may have, hold and enjoy the ≈øame without the lawful let or interruption, of or by any per≈øon or per≈øons, having right or title to the Advow≈øon or Patronage of the Vicarage afore≈øaid.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment made by a Vicar, of all Mony owing to him for Tithes.

body.p:
THis Indenture, made, &c. Between F. D. Clerk, Vicar of the Vicarage of St. Peter the Great, alias the Subdeanry within the City of C. in the County of S. of the one part, and E. B. of the City of C. afore≈øaid, Taylor, of the other part, Witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid F. D. hath made, ordained and appointed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth make, ordain and appoint the ≈øaid E. B. his true and lawful Attorney, for him and in his name, ≈øtead and place, and to and for the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid E. B. to ask, levy, recover, have and take up, of and from all and every per≈øon and per≈øons what≈øoever, Debtors unto the ≈øaid F. D. all and every ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony due and owing to him for Tithes, Offerings, or other Duties what≈øoever, belonging to the Vicarage afore≈øaid. And the ≈øaid F. D. doth hereby give and grant unto the ≈øaid E. B. full power and authority
for him the ≈øaid F. D. and in his name, ≈øtead and place, to give and deliver unto all and every the ≈øaid Debtors, their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, Acquittances or other legal Di≈øcharges for the ≈øeveral ≈øums of Mony by them due and owing, as afore≈øaid. And in default of payment thereof, for him the ≈øaid F. D. and in his name, ≈øtead, and place, to arre≈øt, implead, impri≈øon and condemn all and every the ≈øaid Debtors, their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, for the ≈øaid Tithes, Offerings and other Duties by them re≈øpectively owing, as afore≈øaid. And out of Pri≈øon them and every of them to relea≈øe and di≈øcharge, and to take all the benefit and advantage of the ≈øaid Tithes, Offerings, and other Duties, and of all and every Sentence, Decree and Judgment for the ≈øame to be obtained, and to appoint one or more Attorney or Attorneys under him, and to do all and every lawful Act and thing tending to the recovery of the ≈øaid Tithes, Offerings and other Duties, as fully as the ≈øaid F. D. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators may or can do. And the ≈øaid F. D. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid E. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid F. D. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will allow, ratifie and hold for ≈øure and good, what≈øoever the ≈øaid E. B. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall lawfully do, or cau≈øe to be done, in or about the Premi≈ø≈øes. And al≈øo that the ≈øaid F. D. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall not at any time hereafter do any act or thing whereby the ≈øaid E.B. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators may be barred in Law, or ob≈øtructed or hindred from the recovering and receiving all the ≈øaid Tithes, Offerings, and other Duties, with Co≈øts of Suit. And al≈øo that the ≈øaid F. D. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will upon every rea≈øonable
reque≈øt made, and at the co≈øts and charges of the ≈øaid E. B. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, well and truly do and execute, or cau≈øe to be done and executed, all and every further or other lawful and rea≈øonable Act or thing, for the better or more full authorizing and impowring the ≈øaid E. B. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, to recover and receive the ≈øaid Tithes, Offerings, and other Duties. And the ≈øaid E. B. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid F. D. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid E. B. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will from time to time, and at all times hereafter, ≈øave, defend and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid F. D. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, of and from all co≈øts, charges, damages and expences, by occa≈øion of any Bill, Suit or Plaint, to be brought or pro≈øecuted by the ≈øaid E. B. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, in the name of the ≈øaid F. D. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, for the ≈øaid Tithes, Offerings, and other Duties, or any part thereof.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of a Judgment.

body.p:
Whereas there is a Judgment for 400 l. on Record in the Court of Common-Pleas at We≈øtminster again≈øt R. C. of, &c. at the Suit of me the ≈øaid J. F. as by the Records of the ≈øaid Court, remaining in the Trea≈øury at Westmin≈øter it doth more at large appear, upon which Judgment Execution hath been lately ≈øued forth. Now know ye, That I the ≈øaid J. F. for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me hereunto moving, have granted, transferred, a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet over; and by the≈øe pre≈øents do clearly and ab≈øolutely grant transfer, A≈ø≈øign and ≈øet over unto J. F. of, &c. his Executors,
Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, as well the ≈øaid Judgment for the ≈øaid, &c. afore≈øaid, as al≈øo all benefit, profit, ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony and advantage what≈øoever, that now is, or hereafter ≈øhall or may be obtained by rea≈øon or means of the ≈øame, or of any Execution or Extent thereupon to be had ≈øued, executed or obtained, and all the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt and Demand what≈øoever, which I the ≈øaid J. F. have or ought to have or claim, of, in or to the ≈øaid Judgment, or any ≈øum of Mony, Lands or Tenements, which by virtue thereof, or of any Proce≈øs or Execution thereupon ≈øued or to be ≈øued, is or which ≈øhall be recovered, obtained or gotten. And further, I the ≈øaid J. F. do by the≈øe Pre≈øents make, ordain, con≈øtitute, authorize and appoint the ≈øaid F. J. to be my true and lawful Attorney, for me and in my name to ≈øue and pro≈øecute the Execution upon the ≈øaid Judgment, and upon Compo≈øition or Agreement made concerning the premi≈ø≈øes, to acknowledge ≈øatisfaction, or to make and do any other Relea≈øe or Di≈øcharge for the ≈øame; and all and every other act and acts, thing or things what≈øoever, as ≈øhall be requi≈øite in or about the Premi≈ø≈øes, I covenant, promi≈øe and agree, to allow, e≈øtabli≈øh and confirm by the≈øe pre≈øents. And I the ≈øaid J. F. for my ≈øelf, my Executors and Admini≈øtrators, do covenant, promi≈øe and agree to and with the ≈øaid F. J. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, by the≈øe Pre≈øents, in manner and form following; That is to ≈øay, That I the ≈øaid J. F. have never made, done or committed any Relea≈øe or other di≈øcharge of the ≈øaid Judgment, or of any Extent or Execution, which hath been thereupon ≈øued or executed, neither will or ≈øhall I the ≈øaid J. F. my Executors or Admini≈øtrators, at any time hereafter make, commit or do any relea≈øe, act or thing what≈øoever, whereby the ≈øaid Judgment, or any Extent
or Execution which hath been thereupon ≈øued or executed, or which ≈øhall be thereupon ≈øued or executed at any time hereafter by the ≈øaid F. J. or his A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall be in any manner or wi≈øe hurt hindred, di≈øabled, debarred or extingui≈øhed, without the con≈øent of the ≈øaid F. J. his Executors or A≈ø≈øigns, thereunto fir≈øt had in Writing, under their Hands and Seals. And farther, That I the ≈øaid J. F. my Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will at all times hereafter, on reque≈øt made, and at the co≈øts and charges of the ≈øaid F. J. and his A≈ø≈øigns, maintain ju≈øtifie, allow and confirm all ≈øuch lawful Actions, Suits, Proce≈øs, Extents, Executions and Proceedings what≈øoever, as have been, or hereafter ≈øhall be brought, ≈øued forth or pro≈øecuted again≈øt the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, his, their or any of their Tenements, Lands and Goods, upon or by rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Judgment. And that he the ≈øaid F. J. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and may peaceably and quietly have and hold, receive and enjoy, to his and their own proper u≈øe and behoof, all ≈øuch benefit, ≈øum and ≈øums of Mony, Lands and Tenements, which by virtue of the ≈øaid Judgment, or of any Extents, Executions or Proceedings thereon, ≈øhall be recovered, obtained or gotten, without the let, ≈øuit, trouble, eviction or di≈øturbance of me the ≈øaid J. F. my Executors or Admini≈øtrators, and without any account to me or them, or any of them therefore to be made or given.

div.head: A Letter of Attorney to receive Monies due from ≈øeveral Per≈øons.

opener.salute: TO all Chri≈øtian People to whom the≈øe Pre≈øents ≈øhall come,
opener.signed: I J. O. of King≈øham in the County of Su≈ø≈øex, Gent.

body.p: Whereas upon an account made between me and N. C. Gent. I am in arrear and indebted unto him in one and twenty Pounds and ten Shillings. Now know ye, That for the more ≈øpeedy re-imbur≈øing and paying unto the ≈øaid N. C. the ≈øaid one and twenty Pounds and ten Shillings, I do hereby grant and a≈ø≈øign unto him five Pounds and ten Shillings due unto me from R. L. of Farnham, upon a Bill Obligatory, dated the 14th day of March in the Year of our Lord 1676. And I do hereby al≈øo grant and a≈ø≈øign unto the ≈øaid N. C. all Sum and Sums of Mony due or payable unto me by R. L. Clerk for Co≈øts and Charges, Taxes or A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øes, or to be taxed or a≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed by his Maje≈øty's Court of Exchequer. And farther I do make and appoint the ≈øaid N. C. my true and lawful Attorny for me and in my name, ≈øtead and place to receive, have and take up all and every the Sum and Sums of Mony before mentioned, and to do and execute all and every matter and thing nece≈ø≈øary to be done for the receiving or recovering the ≈øaid Monies. And I do hereby covenant with the ≈øaid N. C. That he the ≈øaid N. ≈øhall or lawfully may receive, have and take up of and from the ≈øaid R. L. and R. L. re≈øpectively all and every the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Sum and Sums of Mony, and the ≈øame may retain and keep to his own u≈øe notwith≈øtanding any Act or thing by me done or to be done to the contrary, and without any Account hereof to me to be rendred.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof I have hereunto ≈øet my Hand and Seal the 3d. day of April, in the Year of our Lord, 1678.

div.head: A Memorial of Submi≈ø≈øion to an Arbritation according to the new Statute.

body.p: 1 May 1699. A. B. and C. D. being de≈øirous to end divers Controver≈øies and Quarrels between them (for which there is no other Remedy but by per≈øonal Action or Suit in Equity) did agree to ≈øubmit, and did ≈øubmit and refer all the ≈øaid Controver≈øies, Suits and Quarrels to the Award of E. F. and C. H. (Arbitrators indifferently cho≈øen between them) to be made in Writing under the Hands and Seals of the ≈øaid Arbitrators before the _____ day of _____ next en≈øuing. And the ≈øaid Parties did mutually promi≈øe and oblige them≈øelves re≈øpectively, That they will perform and execute ≈øuch Award as the ≈øaid Arbitrators ≈øhall make in the Premi≈øes. And the ≈øaid Parties did farther agree, That their ≈øaid Submi≈ø≈øion ≈øhould be made a Rule in his Maje≈øty's Court of Common-Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter, and that they will finally be concluded by the Arbitration which ≈øhall be made concerning them by the ≈øaid Arbitrators pur≈øuant to ≈øuch Submi≈ø≈øion.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment by a Mortgagee of a Term for Years.
div.p: Note, If the A≈ø≈øignor be not in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion nothing will pa≈øs unle≈øs ≈øuch A≈ø≈øignment be ≈øealed and executed on the Premi≈ø≈øes.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of a Bond

body.p:
Whereas R. C. of, &c. in and by one Obligation or Writing Obligatory bearing date, &c. ≈øtandeth bound to the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, in the penal Sum of Twenty pounds with a Condition thereunto anexed for the payment of Ten pounds of, &c. on the 10th day of March next en≈øuing the date of the ≈øaid Obligation, as by the ≈øaid Obligation and Condition it doth more fully appear. Now know ye, That I the ≈øaid J. F. for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me hereunto moving, Have bargained, ≈øold, a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet-over, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents do fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely bargain, ≈øell, a≈ø≈øign and ≈øet-over unto F. J. of, &c. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, as well the ≈øaid Obligation, as the ≈øaid ≈øum of Mony therein mentioned, to the proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid F. J. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, and without any account
therefore to be given unto me the ≈øaid J. F. my Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, or any of them.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of an Apprentice.

body.p: Whereas my Apprentice A. B. has certain years yet to come and unexpired of his Apprentice≈øhip, viz. three whole years from the Fea≈øt of St. Michael la≈øt pa≈øt, as by his Indenture to me ≈øealed it doth appear. Now know ye, That I the ≈øaid R. C for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me hereunto moving, Have granted, a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet over, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do fully and ab≈øolutely give, grant, a≈ø≈øign and ≈øet over unto my well beloved Friend F. J. all ≈øuch right, title, duty, term of years to come, ≈øervice and demand what≈øoever, which I the ≈øaid R. C. have in or to the ≈øaid A. B. or which I may or ought to have in him by force and virtue of the ≈øaid Indenture of Apprentice≈øhip: And moreover I the ≈øaid R. C. do by the≈øe pre≈øents covenant, promi≈øe and agree to and with the ≈øaid F. J. his Executors and A≈ø≈øigns, that notwith≈øtanding any thing by the ≈øaid R. C. to be done to the contrary, the ≈øaid A. B. ≈øhall during the ≈øaid Term of three years well and truly ≈øerve the ≈øaid R. C. as his Ma≈øter, and his Commandments lawful and hone≈øt ≈øhall do and from his Service ≈øhall not ab≈øent him≈øelf day or night during the Term afore≈øaid; Provided that the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall well intreat and u≈øe the ≈øaid A. B. finding for him Meat, Drink, Linnen, Woollen, Ho≈øe, Shoos and Bedding, and all other nece≈ø≈øaries during the ≈øaid Term.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of a Lea≈øe.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of, &c. of the one part, and R. C. of, &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, that C. R. of, &c. in and by one Indenture of Lea≈øe bearing date, &c. for the con≈øideration therein mentioned did demi≈øe, grant and to farm let unto the ≈øaid J. F. (recite the Lea≈øe) as in and by the ≈øaid recited Indenture of Lea≈øe it doth more fully and at large appear: And this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth, that the ≈øaid J. F. for and in con≈øideration of, &c. to him paid before the en≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents, by the ≈øaid R. C. the receipt whereof he the ≈øaid J. F. doth hereby acknowledge, and thereof, and of every part thereof doth hereby, fully, acquit, exonerate and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, Hath granted, bargrained, ≈øold, a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet over, And by the≈øe pre≈øents doth grant, bargain, ≈øell, a≈ø≈øign and ≈øet over unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, all that, &c. and all the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt, Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, Term of years to come, claim and demand what≈øoever, which he the ≈øaid J. F. now hath, or may, ought or ≈øhould have or claim in or to the Me≈ø≈øuage and Premi≈ø≈øes with the Appurtenances afore≈øaid, by force and virtue of the ≈øaid recited Indenture of Lea≈øe, To have and to hold the ≈øaid, &c. And al≈øo the ≈øaid recited Indenture of Lea≈øe, and all the E≈øtate, Right, Ritle, Intere≈øt and Term of years, before in and by the≈øe pre≈øents, bargained, ≈øold, a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet over unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, to his and their proper u≈øe and behoof, during the re≈øidue of the ≈øaid Term, by the Indenture of Lea≈øe granted and yet to come, and unexpired, in as large, ample and beneficial
manner to all intents and purpo≈øes, as he the ≈øaid J. F. now hath or might, ≈øhould or ought to have, and enjoy the ≈øame by force and virtue of the ≈øaid recited Indenture of Lea≈øe or otherwi≈øe how≈øoever; And the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, his &c. doth covenant and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. that notwith≈øtanding any act or thing by the ≈øaid J. F. done to the contrary, the ≈øaid recited Indenture of Lea≈øe is a good, ≈øure, perfect and indefeazable Lea≈øe in the Law, at the time of the en≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents, and ≈øo ≈øhall ≈øtand remain, continue and be unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, for and during the remainder of the term of years thereby granted, under the Rents and Covenants therein mentioned and contained; And al≈øo that the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, &c. paying the Rent re≈øerved, and performing the Covenants, Conditions and Agreements in the above recited Lea≈øe contained, ≈øhall and may peaceably and quietly have, hold occupy, po≈ø≈øe≈øs and enjoy the ≈øaid, &c. for and during the re≈øidue of the Term afore≈øaid, without the lett, ≈øuit, trouble or interruption of him the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. or of any other per≈øon or per≈øons, lawfully, claiming or to claim any right or intere≈øt in the Premi≈ø≈øes, by, from or under him, them or any of them.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of an Annuity.

body.p:
Whereas J. F. of, &c. by his Deed indented bearing date, &c. for the con≈øiderations therein mentioned, did give, grant and confirm unto me the ≈øaid R. C. one annuity or yearly rent of, &c. to be i≈ø≈øuing and going out of all and ≈øingular the Me≈ø≈øuages and Tenements, Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes
of the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øituate and being in, &c. for the term of the natural life of me the ≈øaid R. C. as in and by the ≈øaid Deed indented it doth more fully and at large appear: Now know ye that I the ≈øaid R. C. for divers good con≈øiderations me hereunto moving, have a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet over, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do a≈ø≈øign and ≈øet over unto F. J. of, &c. the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. To have and to hold the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent of, &c. afore≈øaid, unto the ≈øaid F. J. and his A≈ø≈øigns in as large and ample manner and form as I the ≈øaid R. C. may or ought to have and enjoy the ≈øame by virtue of the ≈øaid Deed Indented or any thing therein contained, together with the ≈øaid Deed Indented.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of certain Debts by an Admini≈øtratrix to Creditors.

opener.signed: R. C. of, &c. Admini≈øtratrix of all and ≈øingular the Goods, Chattels and Debts of B. C. my late Husband decea≈øed

body.p:
Whereas the ≈øaid B. C. my late Husband in his life time ≈øtood indebted unto, &c. and to every of them ≈øeverally in certain ≈øeveral Sums of Mony; Know ye therefore, that I the ≈øaid R. C. intending as much as in me lieth to give content and ≈øatisfaction to them and every of them, Have given, granted, bargained, a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet over, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents do fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely, &c. unto the ≈øaid, &c. Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, all and every the Book Debts, Specialties, Obligations mentioned in a Schedule hereunto annexed, which are due and owing unto me the ≈øaid R. as Admini≈øtratrix, by one T. A. of, &c. and one A. T. of &c. and by ≈øuch their Sureties, as in the ≈øaid Writings and Obligations
are named as in and by the ≈øaid, &c. it doth more at large appear, together with all and every Sum and Sums of Mony, profits and advantage that ≈øhall or may ari≈øe, come or be had of or by the ≈øaid Book Debts, Obligations and Writings, and every of them, and all my right, title, intere≈øt, property, claim and demand in and to the ≈øame or any part thereof; And I the ≈øaid R. C. do for my ≈øelf, my Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, Covenant and Promi≈øe to and with the ≈øaid, &c. and every of them, their, and every of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, that I the ≈øaid R. C. have not relea≈øed or any way di≈øcharged the ≈øaid Book Debts, Obligations or Writings, or any of them, or any Sum or Sums of Mony in them or any of them mentioned; And I the ≈øaid R. C. do Covenant and Promi≈øe for my ≈øelf, my Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, that neither I nor they or any of them, ≈øhall or will at any time hereafter relea≈øe or di≈øcharge the ≈øaid Book Debts, Obligations, &c. or any Sum or Sums of Mony in any of them mentioned, without the con≈øent of, &c. Fir≈øt, thereunto had and obtained; And that I the ≈øaid R. C. my, &c. ≈øhall and will permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid, &c. jointly and ≈øeverally at their co≈øts and charges to commence and pro≈øecute, all and every ≈øuch lawful Actions and Suits, as ≈øhall by them or any of them, their or any of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, be thought requi≈øite and nece≈ø≈øary for the receving of the ≈øaid Debts or any of them, and the ≈øaid Actions will now aver, ju≈øtifie and maintain, And that the ≈øaid, &c. their &c. ≈øhall and may quietly, have, po≈ø≈øe≈øs and enjoy to their own proper u≈øe, all and every ≈øuch Sum and Sums of Mony, which ≈øhall be recovered and obtained by rea≈øon of the ≈øame, and ≈øhall have full power and authority in my name, to acquit, relea≈øe and di≈øcharge upon
the payment of any of the ≈øaid Debts ≈øo due as afore≈øaid.

div.p: Note, This would be better by Indenture.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of a Statute be an Admini≈øtrator to two Creditors.

body.p:
THis Indenture, &c. Between R. C. of, &c. Admini≈øtrator of the Goods and Chattels of C. R. late of, &c. of the one part, And J. F. of, &c. and F. J. of, &c. of the other part, Whereas the ≈øaid C. R. at the time of his death ≈øtood indebted unto the ≈øaid J. F. in the Sum of 200 l. Principal Mony, and to the ≈øaid F. J. in the Sum of 400 l. Principal Mony be≈øides Intere≈øt for each of the ≈øaid Debts; And whereas J. V. of, &c. in and by one Recognizance or Statute, in the nature of a Stature Staple, bearing date the tenth day of March, in the fir≈øt year of the Reign of, &c. and taken and acknowledged before Sir H. B. Knight, then Lord Chief Ju≈øtice of his Maje≈øty's Court of Common Pleas at Westmin≈øter, is and ≈øtandeth bound unto the ≈øaid C. R. in the Sum of, &c. of lawful Mony of England, payable at the Fea≈øt of St. Michael, the Arch-Angel then next en≈øuing, as by the ≈øaid Statute more at large appeareth, Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid R. C. for and toward the payment and ≈øatisfaction of the ≈øaid Debts due to the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. Hath given, granted, a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet over unto the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, the ≈øaid Recognizance or Statute, and all his right and intere≈øt therein, and all Actions Extents and Executions to be had or pro≈øecuted upon the ≈øame, in as large and ample manner and form as he the ≈øaid R. C. hath, or at any time hereafter may or might have by force of the ≈øaid
Statute: And further, the ≈øaid R. C. doth by the≈øe pre≈øents con≈øtittute, authori≈øe and make the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. his true, irrevocabl lawful Attorney and Attorneys, jointly and ≈øeverally to ≈øue, and pro≈øecute all manner of Actions, Suits, Demands and Executions, in and upon the ≈øaid Statute or Recognizance, in the name of the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, and to receive and recover the ≈øaid Sum of, &c. in the ≈øaid Statute mentioned, and all other Sum and Sums of Mony, benefit and advantage, which ≈øhall or may lawfully be had or gotten upon the ≈øaid Statute or Recognizance, Authorizing them and every of them by the≈øe pre≈øents, to retain ≈øuch Coun≈øellers and Attorneys for the executing of the ≈øaid Suits, Extents and Executions as ≈øhall be requi≈øite and nece≈ø≈øary; And to Execute all and every other lawful Act and Acts what≈øoever, which ≈øhall be meet and expedient in and about the Premi≈ø≈øes; And the ≈øaid R. C. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant, promi≈øe and grant to and with the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their and every of their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, that he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will permit, ≈øuffer, ju≈øtifie, allow and maintain all ≈øuch lawful Actions, Suits, Extents and Executions as the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. or any of them, their Executors Admini≈øtrators or a≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will, ≈øue or pro≈øecute for the levying, taking and receiving of the ≈øaid Sum of, &c. contained in the ≈øaid Statute in the name of the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, And that all Sums of Mony, Recoveries and Executions to be had and obtained upon the ≈øame by any Suit, Action or Execution, or otherwi≈øe ≈øhall be to the only u≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their &c. to be divided between them proportionably according to their ≈øeveral Debts, in as large and
ample manner and form as the ≈øaid R. C. might have had the ≈øame; And that he the ≈øaid R. C. hath not, neither ≈øhall or will he, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, at any time hereafter relea≈øe or di≈øcharge the ≈øaid Debt contained in the ≈øaid Statute, nor any Action, Extent or Execution to be had upon the ≈øame, nor do any other Act in prejudice of the ≈øame: And further, that he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall at any time during the ≈øpace of three years next after ≈øuch time, as the ≈øaid Statute ≈øhall be executed by way of Extent, make or cau≈øe to be made to the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, to the only u≈øe and be hoof of them the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. on reque≈øt to be made, by and at the co≈øts and charges in the Law of them the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their Executors Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øuch a≈ø≈øurance and conveyance of the Land which ≈øhall be extended and put in Execution upon the ≈øaid Statute, as ≈øhall be rea≈øonably devi≈øed by the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. or either of them, their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, or their or any of their Coun≈øel learned in the Law, di≈øcharged of all Incumbrances by the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c.

div.head: A Penal Bill for payment of Mony.

body.p: KNow all men by the≈øe pre≈øents, That I R. C. of, &c. do owe unto J. F. of D. afore≈øaid Gent. ten pounds of lawful Mony of England, to be paid unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns on the tenth day of March next en≈øuing the date hereof, to which payment well and truly to be made, I bind my ≈øelf, my Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators in 20 l. of like lawful Mony firmly by the≈øe Pre≈øents,

closer.dateline:
In witne≈øs
whereof I have hereunto ≈øet my Hand and Seal, this twenty eighth day of November, Anno
que Domini 1699.

div.head: An Acquittance for part of Purcha≈øe Mony.

body.p: REceived by me J. F. the day and year above written, the Sum of 130 l. of lawful Mony of England, in part of the 500 l. of like Mony of England, agreed to be paid for the Purcha≈øe of certain Lands in C. in the County S. according to certain Articles of Agreement Indented bearing date, &c. made between, &c.

div.head: A Warrant to Summon a Copyhold Court, of the Mannor of N.

body.p: WHereas I have received directions from Sr. R. C. Knight, to hold a Court Baron for his Mannor of N. within, &c. The≈øe are to let you know that I have appointed the tenth day of March next, being Thur≈øday, for the holding of the ≈øaid Court at the Hou≈øe of T. B. Yeoman: And therefore do hereby require you to give notice of the ≈øame, unto all Suiters and Tenants of the ≈øaid Mannor, and to warn and require them and every of them to be there, and then pre≈øent, by nine of the clock in the Morning; And that al≈øo at the time and place afore≈øaid, you return a Jury of the Suiters and Tenants of the ≈øaid Mannor, to enquire of ≈øuch Matters as ≈øhall by me be given them in charge,

closer.dateline: And hereof, &c. given under my Hand and Seal, &c.

div.head: A Bill of Credit.

body.p: THis pre≈øent Writing witne≈ø≈øeth, That I R. C. of London Merchant, do undertake to and with J. F. of the City of C. Merchant, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, that if he deliver unto Sir C. R. Knight, or any of his A≈ø≈øigns, to his u≈øe, any Sum or Sums of Mony amounting to the Sum of 1000 l. of lawful Mony of England or under, And ≈øhall take a Bill under the Hand and Seal of the ≈øaid R. C. confe≈ø≈øing and ≈øhewing the certainty thereof, That then I my Executors or Admini≈øtrators having the ≈øame Bill delivered to me or them ≈øhall immediately upon the receit of the ≈øame, pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors or A≈ø≈øigns, all ≈øuch Sums of Mony as ≈øhall be contained in the ≈øaid Bill, which payment in manner and form afore≈øaid, well and truly to make, I bind my ≈øelf, my Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents.

div.head: A Clau≈øe in a Will to enable the Executors to Sell Lands.

q.p:
ITem, I Will and Ordain that the Executor of this my la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament or his Executor or Executors, Admini≈øtrator or Admini≈øtrators, for and towards the performanee of my ≈øaid Te≈øtament, ≈øhall with all convenient ≈øpeed after my decea≈øe, bargain, ≈øell and alien in Fee≈øimple all tho≈øe Lands, &c. for the doing, executing and perfect fini≈øhing whereof, I do by the≈øe pre≈øents give, grant, will and transfer to my ≈øaid Executor, and to his Executors and Admini≈øtrators full Power and Authority, to grant, alien, bargain, ≈øell, convey and a≈ø≈øure All, &c. to any per≈øon or
per≈øons and their Heirs for ever in Fee≈øimple, by all and every ≈øuch lawful ways and means in the Law as to my ≈øaid Executors, or his, &c. or to his or their Coun≈øel learn'd in the Law, ≈øhall ≈øeem fit.

div.head: A Form of an Award.

opener.salute: TO all Chri≈øtian People to whom this pre≈øent Writing ≈øhall come,
opener.signed: J. F. and R. C. of, &c.

body.p:
Whereas divers controver≈øies and debates have been and yet are depending between R. D. and M. C. for the appea≈øing and determining whereof the ≈øaid parties have ≈øubmitted them≈øelves, and are become bound each to other by their ≈øeveral Obligations dated, &c. in the ≈øum of, &c. with Conditions unto the ≈øaid Obligations for performance of the Award, Arbitrement, Determination and Judgment of us the ≈øaid J. F. and R. C. Arbitrators indifferently elected and cho≈øen, as well on the part and behalf of the ≈øaid R. D. as on the part and behalf of the ≈øaid M. C. to Award, Arbitrate, Determine and Judge, of and concerning all and all manner of Actions, Suits, Judgments, Executions, Accounts, Recknings, Tre≈øpa≈ø≈øes, Controver≈øies and Demands what≈øoever, had, made, moved, ≈øtirred and depending between the ≈øaid R. D. and M. C. from the beginning of the World until the day of the date of the≈øe Pre≈øents; ≈øo always as the ≈øaid Award, &c. of us the ≈øaid J. F. and R. C. for and concerning the Premi≈ø≈øes, be made and put in writing under our Hands and Seals, on or before the, &c. as by the ≈øaid Obligations and Conditions it doth more fully appear. Now know ye, That we ≈øaid J. F. and R. C. Arbitrators as afore≈øaid taking upon us the charge of the ≈øaid Award and Arbitrement, and having heard and under≈øtood the Sayings and Allegations
of both the ≈øaid Parties concerning the Premi≈ø≈øes, and being minded to ≈øettle unity and friend≈øhip between them concerning the ≈øame, do thereupon make and put in writing this our Award, Arbitration and Judgment between the ≈øaid Parties for and concerning the premi≈ø≈øes, in manner and form following: That is to ≈øay, Fir≈øt, we do Award, Arbitrate and Determine by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That the ≈øaid R. D. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall well and truly pay, &c. And we the ≈øaid Arbitrators do al≈øo award, &c. That he the ≈øaid R. D. ≈øhall on the, &c. Seal, and as his ab≈øolute Deed deliver to the ≈øaid M. C. or to her u≈øe, a Relea≈øe of all and all manner of Actions, &c. from the beginning of the World to the day of the date of the Obligations afore≈øaid. And further, we do award, Arbitrate and Determine, that the ≈øaid M. C. ≈øhall well and truly pay, &c. and ≈øeal, relea≈øe, &c.

div.head: A Bargain and Seal of all Goods and Chattels real and per≈øonal, to ≈øave harmle≈øs from all Bonds.

opener.salute: TO all Chri≈øtian People to whom this pre≈øent Writing ≈øhall come,

body.p:
Know yet that J. the ≈øaid R. C. as well for the indempnifying and ≈øaving harmle≈øs of J. F. of, &c. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, and every of them of and from all manner of Bonds and Writings obligatory what≈øoever, wherein the ≈øaid J. F. is and ≈øtandeth bound for me the ≈øaid R. C. in any ≈øum or ≈øums of Mony to any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, as al≈øo for divers other good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me hereunto e≈øpecially moving, Have given, granted, bargained, ≈øold and confirmed, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents do give, grant, bargain, ≈øell and confirm unto
to the ≈øaid J. F. all and ≈øingular my Lea≈øes, Goods and Chattels what≈øoever, as well real as per≈øonal of what kind, nature, quality or condition ≈øoever the ≈øame are or be, and in what place or places ≈øoever the ≈øame ≈øhall or may be found, as well in my own cu≈øtody and po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, as in the hands, cu≈øtody and po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, of any other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever; To have and to hold all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Lea≈øes, Goods and Chattels, and all other the Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, to the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs, &c. to his and their own proper u≈øe and behoof for ever. And I the ≈øaid R. C. and my Heirs, &c. all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Goods and Chattels and other the Premi≈ø≈øes, unto the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. to his and their own proper u≈øe as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall and will warrant and for ever defend by the≈øe Pre≈øents, Provided always that if I the ≈øaid R. C. my Executors &c. or any of us do or ≈øhall from time to time, and at all times hereafter clearly acquit and di≈øcharge or otherwi≈øe ≈øufficiently ≈øave and keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. and all his and their Goods, Chatels, Lands, Tenements and Hereditaments and every of them, of and from all and ≈øingular Bonds, Writings Obligatory what≈øoever, wherein and whereby the ≈øaid J. F. at the reque≈øt or for the debt of me the ≈øaid R. C. is and ≈øtandeth bound to any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever in any ≈øum or ≈øums of Mony, and of and from all and all manner of Actions, Suits, Charges, Troubles, Expences and Demands what≈øoever, which ≈øhall or may in any wi≈øe hereafter happen, come, grow or be, to or again≈øt the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. or any of them, for or by rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Obligations, Writings obligatory or any of them, or any thing in them or any of them mentioned or contained, that then this pre≈øent Deed or Grant, and every thing herein contained ≈øhall be utterly void and of none effect, any
thing before mentioned herein to the contrary notwith≈øtanding.

div.head: A Deed of Free Gift of all Goods and Chattels.

body.p: Know ye, That I the ≈øaid J. F. as well for and in con≈øideration of the natural love and affection which I bear to my well-beloved Co≈øin R. C. of, &c. as al≈øo for divers other good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me hereunto moving, have given and granted, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do give, grant and confirm unto the ≈øaid R. C. all and ≈øingular my Goods, Chattels, Lea≈øes, Debts, Ready Mony, Hou≈øhold≈øtuff and all other my Sub≈øtance what≈øoever, moveable and immoveable, quick and dead, of what kind or nature ≈øoever the ≈øame are, and in what place or places ≈øoever the ≈øame be, either in my po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion or in the cu≈øtody of any other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, To have and to hold all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Goods, &c. and all other the afore≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes, unto the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. to his and their own proper u≈øe and behoof for ever, without any manner of challenge, claim or demand from me the ≈øaid J. F. or from any other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever for me, or authorized or procured by me, and without any Mony or other thing to be yielded therefore unto me the ≈øaid J. F. my, &c. And I the ≈øaid J. F. all and ≈øingular the afore≈øaid Goods, &c. to the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. to the u≈øe afore≈øaid, again≈øt all people do and will warrant and for ever defend by the≈øe Pre≈øents. And further know ye, that I the ≈øaid J. F. have put the ≈øaid R. C. in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of all and ≈øingular the Premi≈ø≈øes afore≈øaid, by the delivery of the ≈øum of 5 s. unto him the ≈øaid R. C.

div.head: A Deed to revoke u≈øes in a Settlement, according to a power re≈øerved.

body.p:
Whereas in and by one Indenture, bearing date, &c. and made between the ≈øaid J. F. of the one part, and R. C. of, &c. of the other part. There is (among≈øt other things) one Provi≈øo, contained in the≈øe or the like words, (that is to ≈øay) Provided likewi≈øe, and it is hereby further declared and agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, that if the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall at any time hereafter, during his natural life, be minded to alter, revoke, or make void all or any of the U≈øe or U≈øes, E≈øtate or E≈øtates, Tru≈øt or Tru≈øts herein mentioned, limited and appointed, and ≈øhall by any Deed or Writing by him the ≈øaid J. F. Sealed and Sub≈øcribed in the pre≈øence of two credible Witne≈ø≈øes, declare and publi≈øh his Mind, intent and meaning to be to revoke, alter and make void the ≈øaid ≈øeveral U≈øes, E≈øtates and Tru≈øts herein before-mentioned, declared and appointed, or any of them; That then, and immediately after ≈øuch Revocation ≈øo made as afore≈øaid, the ≈øame U≈øes, E≈øtate, and Tru≈øts in and by the≈øe Premi≈ø≈øes limited, expre≈ø≈øed and declared, of, for and concerning which any ≈øuch Revocation ≈øhall be made, ≈øhall cea≈øe and become void and of none effect: And that then and at all times after the ≈øaid R. C. and his Heirs, and all other per≈øon and per≈øons ≈øtanding and being ≈øeized of the ≈øaid, &c. ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of the ≈øame or ≈øuch part thereof concerning the which ≈øuch Revocation or Declaration ≈øhall be made as afore≈øaid, to ≈øuch u≈øes and purpo≈øes as the ≈øaid J. F. in or by any ≈øuch Deed or writing ≈øhall declare, limit and expre≈øs, and in default of ≈øuch limitation or appointment, to
the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns forever, as in and by the ≈øaid Indenture it doth more fully and at large appear. Now know ye, That I the ≈øaid J. F. do by this pre≈øent Deed, Sealed and Sub≈øcribed by me the ≈øaid J. F. in the pre≈øence of two credible Witne≈ø≈øes declare and publi≈øh my Mind and Meaning to be to revoke, alter and make void all and every the U≈øes, E≈øtates, Tru≈øts and Limitations in and by the ≈øaid Indenture expre≈ø≈øed and limited, of, for and concerning all and every the, &c. and all other Hereditaments ≈øpecified and mentioned in the ≈øaid Indenture, with their and every of their appurtenances, and of, for and concerning every part thereof. And I do hereby further declare, limit and appoint that the ≈øaid, &c. with the appurtenances ≈øhall remain and be, and the ≈øaid R. C. and his Heirs, and all and every other per≈øon and per≈øons ≈øtanding by, and being ≈øeized of and in the ≈øame, ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized thereof to the u≈øe and behoof of me the ≈øaid J. F. my Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns forever, and to and for no other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoever.

div.head: A Bargain and Sale of Hou≈øhold≈øtuff.

body.p:
KNow all men by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That I R. C. of, &c. for and in con≈øideration of the ≈øum of 50 l. of lawful Mony of England to me in hand paid, at and before the ≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe Pre≈øents by J. F. of, &c. wherewith I acknowledge my ≈øelf fully ≈øatisfied and paid, and thereof and of every part thereof do hereby acquit, exonerate and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns; have granted, bargained and ≈øold, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents do fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely grant, bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid J. F. all ≈øuch Goods and Hou≈øhold≈øtuff
and all other, things as are mentioned and contained in a Schedule hereunto annexed, now remaining and being in one Me≈ø≈øuage and the Garden and Yard thereunto belonging, called C. ≈øituate, lying and being in C. in W. and now in the tenure or occupation of the ≈øaid J. F. or his A≈ø≈øigns, To have and to hold all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Goods, &c. before, by the≈øe Pre≈øents bargained and ≈øold unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns for ever. And the ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Executors Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns doth covenant, promi≈øe and grant to and with the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns and every of them, all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Goods, &c. before bargained and ≈øold, and every of them unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, again≈øt all per≈øons ≈øhall and will warrant, and for ever defend by the≈øe Pre≈øents.

div.head: A Declaration by a Wife concerning the di≈øpo≈øing of a Sum of Mony, according to a power re≈øerved before Marriage.

opener.salute: TO all Chri≈øtian People to whom this pre≈øent Writing indented ≈øhall come,
opener.signed: I R. R. Wi≈øe of J. B. of, &c.

body.p:
Whereas by an Indenture tripartite, made the 10th day of March in the fir≈øt year, &c. Between the ≈øaid R. R. by the name, &c. of the fir≈øt part, and me the ≈øaid R. R. by the name of, &c. of the ≈øecond part, and B. C. of, &c. and A. B. C. D. and E. F. of, &c. of the third part, in con≈øideration of a Marriage then ≈øhortly after to take effect between him the ≈øaid J. R. and me the ≈øaid R. it appeareth, that at the time of the making of the ≈øaid Indenture, it was
intended, concluded and agreed beetween him the laid J. R. and me the ≈øaid R. that I the ≈øaid R. or any other per≈øon or per≈øons whom I ≈øhould nominate and appoint (notwith≈øtanding the ≈øaid Marriage ≈øhould take effect) ≈øhould and might have full power and Authority to di≈øpo≈øe of the ≈øum of 500 l. of lawfull Mony of England, and all benefit and profit thereof at all times en≈øuing the ≈øaid Marriage; and to that end, intent and purpo≈øe he the ≈øaid J. R. by the ≈øaid Indenture did for him≈øelf his Executors and Admini≈øtrators covenant, promi≈øe, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. C. A. B. C. D. and E. F. and every of them, and with their and every of their Executors, and Admini≈øtrators, that he the ≈øaid J. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, or ≈øome or one of them ≈øhould well and truly ≈øatisfie, pay and deliver, or cau≈øe to be ≈øatisfied paid and delivered unto the R. C. A. B. C. D. and E. F. or to the Survivor or Survivors of them, or to the Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns of ≈øuch Survivor or Survivors the full ≈øum of 500 l. of lawful Mony of England, upon or before the 10th day of March, &c. if I the ≈øaid R. R. ≈øhould be living, or the ≈øaid 10th day of March, or within ≈øix Months next after the decea≈øe of me the ≈øaid R. R. or within one year next after the death of the ≈øaid J. R. either of which ≈øhall fir≈øt happen next after the date of the ≈øaid Indenture, to be imployed and di≈øpo≈øed of to ≈øuch per≈øon and per≈øons, and to ≈øuch u≈øes, intent and purpo≈øe as I the ≈øaid R. ≈øhould at any times then following, during my life, order, appoint, give or di≈øpo≈øe of the ≈øame. And it was thereby further covenanted, concluded and agreed on by and between all the ≈øaid Parties to the ≈øaid Indenture, and the ≈øaid J. R. did thereby for him≈øelf his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and for every of them covenans, promi≈øe and grant to
and with the ≈øaid R. C. A. B. C. D. and E. F. and every of them, and to and with their and every of their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, that the ≈øaid ≈øum of 500 l. and every part thereof ≈øhould and might from time to time be quietly, had, taken, received and enjoyed unto and by ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons whom I the ≈øaid R. ≈øhould at any time, during my life, con≈øtitute, order and appoint to di≈øpo≈øe of the ≈øaid 500 l. or any part thereof, either by my la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament in writing, or by any writing to be ≈øigned by me the ≈øaid R. or to which my Mark ≈øhould be put in the pre≈øence of two or more Credible Witne≈ø≈øes, as in and by the ≈øaid Indenture, among≈øt other Covenants, at large appeareth; which Marriage ≈øince the making of the ≈øaid Indenture was ≈øolemnized, and no declaration has been yet made by me the ≈øaid R. R. concerning the di≈øpo≈øing of the ≈øaid 500 l. or any part thereof. Now this pre≈øent Writing witne≈ø≈øeth and declareth, that the intent and meaning of me the ≈øaid R. R. concerning the ≈øaid 500 l. when it ≈øhall become due and be paid, is as followeth, that is to ≈øay, If my ≈øaid Husband J. R. be then living, and will become bound for him≈øelf his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators by three ≈øeveral Obligations of 200 l. apiece unto them the ≈øaid R. C. A. B. C. D. and E. F. or the Survivor or Survivors of any of them, or the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of ≈øuch Survivor or Survivors re≈øpectively and ≈øeverally conditioned for the payment unto them of three ≈øeveral equal parts of the ≈øaid 500 l. at the three ≈øuch ≈øeveral and re≈øpective times or days, as my three Children by my former Husband ≈øhall attain to the Ages next hereafter mentioned (that is to ≈øay) C. A. unto the age of twenty years, and B. and C. A. ≈øhall attain or come their ≈øeveral ages of twenty one years, That then the ≈øaid R. C. A. B.
C. D. and E. F. and the Survivor and Survivors of them ≈øhall upon ≈øuch Obligations entred into as afore≈øaid, quietly ≈øuffer him the ≈øaid J. R. to keep in his hands the ≈øaid 500 l. and every part thereof, until ≈øuch ≈øeveral days and times, as the ≈øame ≈øhall be payable by the ≈øeveral Conditions of the ≈øaid Obligations ≈øo to be entred into by him as afore ≈øaid, without paying any Intere≈øt or con≈øideration for the ≈øame; and the ≈øaid 500 l. ≈øo payable by the ≈øaid Obligations or Conditions of them and by me di≈øpen≈øed withall as afore≈øaid, otherwi≈øe ≈øooner payble by the ≈øaid Indenture, if my ≈øaid Husband ≈øhall die, viz. within one year after his death (in which ca≈øe of the death of my Husband I do give no manner of di≈øpen≈øation for the payment thereof) I do hereby al≈øo concerning the ≈øame expre≈øs, declare and appoint, if I ≈øhall not otherwi≈øe hereafter peclare and appoint (that is to ≈øay) that the ≈øaid 500 l. and the whole proceed thereof not di≈øpo≈øed of, as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be to and for the u≈øe of my ≈øaid three Children, to be had and received by them ≈øeverally, when they ≈øhall have attained to their ≈øeveral Ages above-mentioned by ≈øuch third parts, as afore≈øaid. Provided always, and my meaning and intent is, That if any of my ≈øaid Children ≈øhall happen to die before they have attained to the Age above-mentioned, then I do appoint that ≈øuch third part of the ≈øaid Five hundred pounds as was to have been paid to ≈øuch Child at the Age afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be paid and divided equally between the Survivors; and if one only happen to ≈øurvive, then the two third parts allotted for the decea≈øed, to be paid to the Survivor. And if all my ≈øaid Children ≈øhall happen to die, not having attained to their ≈øeveral Ages above-≈øaid, then my la≈øt Will and meaning is, That the ≈øaid Five hundred pounds ≈øhall come and be paid to my Loving Husband afore≈øaid, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators
and A≈ø≈øigns if I ≈øhall not otherwi≈øe hereafter di≈øpo≈øe of the ≈øame, according to the power and authority to me re≈øerved in and by the ≈øaid recited Indenture.

div.head: A Bargain and Sale of Under-wood.

body.p:
THis Indenture, made &c. Between J. F. of &c. and R. C. of, &c. Witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J.F. for and in Con≈øideration of the Sum of 100 l. of lawful Mony of England wherewith he the ≈øaid J.F. doth acknowledge him≈øelf to be fully ≈øatisfied and paid, and thereof doth hereby acquit and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, Hath bargained and ≈øold, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid R.C. all and ≈øingular Woods and Underwoods, growing and being within the Wood called Broyl Wood and the Hedges of the ≈øame, containing by e≈øtimation One hundred Acres, be it more or le≈øs, lying and being in the Pari≈øh of St. Peters the Great, in the County of Su≈ø≈øex, and al≈øo all Lops and Shreds of all ≈øuch Trees being within the ≈øaid Wood, called Broyle Wood, as have been u≈øually lopped at the felling of the Underwood growing within the ≈øaid Wood; Except and always out of this pre≈øent Sale re≈øerved unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, the Bodies and Trunks of all manner of Trees what≈øoever (other than Underwood, the Lops and Shreds of ≈øuch Trees as have been u≈øually lopped) growing or being in or upon the ≈øame Wood, or any parcel thereof; To have and to hold the ≈øaid Underwoods, Lops and Shreds, before by the≈øe pre≈øents bargained and ≈øold, (Except before excepted) unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, to his and their own proper u≈øe and behoof for ever. And the ≈øaid
J. F. doth convenant, promi≈øe and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for him, them or any of them, peaceably and quietly to have, hold, take and enjoy the ≈øaid Underwoods, and to enter into the ≈øaid Wood, and every part thereof, there to fell, hew and cut down all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Woods, Underwoods and Hedge-rows at ≈øea≈øonable times in the year, from the day of the date hereof, until the, &c. and the ≈øame ≈øo fell'd, hew'd and cut down, with his and their, or any of their Carts and Carriages, to carry and convey from thence, to any other place or places, at his and their liberty and plea≈øure at all times, during the ≈øpace of three years, by all convenient ways thereto now u≈øed and accu≈øtomed, without any let or hindrance, of or from him the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns. And the ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Executors and A≈ø≈øigns, doth covenant agree to and with the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, That he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will at every felling which he or they ≈øhall make of the ≈øaid Woods, Underwoods and Trees, leave ≈øtanding and growing in and upon the premi≈ø≈øes, ≈øo many competent and ≈øufficient Standards, Staddels and Stories, as by the Statute is and ought to be left; and al≈øo ≈øhall and will at his and their own proper co≈øts and charges make good all the Hedges and Fences about the young Sprigs of the ≈øaid Wood, for the ≈øafe keeping thereof from the hurt and ≈øpoil of Bea≈øts and Cattle, according to the cu≈øtom of the Country there.

div.head: A Devi≈øe of Lands for Life with a Remainder in Tail, And al≈øo a Beque≈øt of a Term for years, with a Tru≈øt to a≈ø≈øign to an Infant.

body.p:
IN the Name of God, Amen, I W. B. of the Pari≈øh of St. Bartholemew near the City of Chiche≈øter in the County of Su≈ø≈øex, Yeoman, do make and declare this my la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament in manner and form following, that is to ≈øay, Fir≈øt, I bequeath my Soul into the Hands of Almighty God, believing Remi≈ø≈øion of Sins and Everla≈øting Life by the Merits, Death and Pa≈ø≈øion of Je≈øus Chri≈øt my Lord and only Saviour. Item, I give and devi≈øe unto my Son J. B. all that my Freehold Land lying in a Field called Scutteriefield, near the ≈øaid City, to hold unto the ≈øaid J. for Term of his Life, and after his decea≈øe to A. Daughter of the ≈øaid J. and the Heirs of the ≈øaid A. for ever. Item, I give and devi≈øe unto the ≈øaid J. B. all other my Freeholds, Lands and Tenements what≈øoever, To hold unto the ≈øaid J. for Term of his Life, and after his decea≈øe to J. B. my Grandfor, and the Heirs of the ≈øaid J. my Grand≈øon for ever. Item, I give and bequeath unto the ≈øaid J. B. my Son, all that my Land (lying in the ≈øaid Scutteriefield) which I hold by Lea≈øe of the Dean and Chapter of Chiche≈øter, together with the ≈øaid Lea≈øe, and all my E≈øtate and Term therein upon this Tru≈øt and Confidence, that with the Rents and Profits thereof my ≈øaid Son ≈øhall from time to time every 7 years during his Life, renew the ≈øaid Lea≈øe; and the re≈øidue of the ≈øaid Profits ≈øhall have and take to his own u≈øe; And that after his decea≈øe the ≈øaid A. his Daughter, ≈øhall have and enjoy the ≈øaid Lands and the Lea≈øe thereof; And that the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid J. my Son, immediately after the death of my ≈øaid Son ≈øhall a≈ø≈øign over the ≈øaid Land,
holden of the ≈øaid Dean and Chapter; And all their Term therein unto the ≈øaid A. her Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns. Item, I give and bequeath unto E. and M. Daughters of the ≈øaid J. my Son, Twenty Pounds a piece. Item, I give and bequeath unto J. my now Wife, ≈øufficient Meat, Drink, Wa≈øhing and Lodging to be provided and allowed to her by my Executors, for the ≈øpace of half a year next after my decea≈øe, or in lieu thereof Five Pounds in Mony at the Election of my ≈øaid Wife. Item, I nominate and appoint the ≈øaid J. my Son, to be Executor of this my Will, to whom I give all the re≈øt of my Goods and Chattels, after my Debts, Funeral Expences and other Legacies fir≈øt paid and di≈øcharged.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof I have hereunto ≈øet my Hand and Seal the 26th of March, in the year of our Lord 1677.

div.head: A Protection by a Member of Parliament.

body.p: FOra≈ømuch as I have ≈øpecial occa≈øion to imploy the Bearer hereof R.C. my Servant in and about my Bu≈øine≈øs and Occa≈øions during this pre≈øent Se≈ø≈øion of Parliament. The≈øe are therefore to will and require you to forbear to arre≈øt, attach or impri≈øon him the ≈øaid R. C. but to permit and ≈øuffer him peaceably and quietly to go about his Bu≈øine≈øs at his will and plea≈øure during this pre≈øent Se≈ø≈øion, without any Suit, Arre≈øt or di≈øturbance, as you will an≈øwer the contrary at your peril.

closer.dateline: Given under my Hand and Seal, &c.

div.head: A Revocation of a Protection.

body.p: WHereas I F. J. have granted a Protection under my Hand and Seal unto R. C. bearing date on or about the, &c. la≈øt pa≈øt, to endure for the time of this pre≈øent Parliament. Now the≈øe pre≈øents witne≈øs That for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me moving, I do hereby revoke, annul and make void the ≈øaid Protection to all intents and purpo≈øes what≈øoever, ≈øo as the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall not from henceforth have any benefit, priviledge or advantage thereby, but be therefrom utterly debarred and excluded for ever by the≈øe pre≈øents.

div.head: A ≈øhort ≈øingle Bill for payment of Mony.

body.p: KKow all Men by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That I R. C. of, &c. do own unto J. F. of, &c. 10 l. of lawful Mony of England, to be paid unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, on the 10th day of March next en≈øuing the date hereof: To which payment well and truly to make I bind my ≈øelf my Heirs and Executors, firmly, by the≈øe Pre≈øents.

T. and J. and Yards thereunto belonging in the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of L. which are now in the po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the ≈øaid Sir M. R. or his A≈ø≈øigns, To the u≈øe of the ≈øaid Sir M. G. and his Heirs, until the ≈øaid Marriage ≈øhall take effect; and after the ≈øaid Marriage ≈øhall take effect, then to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid E. G. for and during the term of 99 years, if he ≈øhall ≈øo long live, without impeachment of Wa≈øte. And after the end or determination of the ≈øaid term of 99 years, then to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid J. M. and D. C. and their Heirs, for and during the Natural life of the ≈øaid E. G. and no longer, upon tru≈øt to pre≈øerve the contingent U≈øes herein after limited and expre≈ø≈øed: And to that end and purpo≈øe, to make Entries, or bring Actions or otherwi≈øe, as there ≈øhall be occa≈øion; and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid E. M. lawfully to be begotten, and to the Heirs males of the Body of ≈øuch fir≈øt Son to be begotten; and for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue to the u≈øe of the ≈øecond, third, fourth, fifth, ≈øixth, ≈øeventh, eighth, ninth, tenth, and every other Sons of the ≈øaid E. G. on the, Body of the ≈øaid M. M. lawfully to be begotten and of the Heirs males of the Bodies of ≈øuch ≈øecond, third, fourth, fifth, ≈øixth, ≈øeventh, eighth, ninth and tenth, and every other the ≈øaid Sons of the ≈øaid E. G. ≈øeverally and re≈øpectively, ≈øucce≈ø≈øively one after another, according to their Priority in Birth and Seniority in years, the elder Son and the Heirs males of his Body, being always to be preferred, and to take before the younger Son and the Heirs males of his Body. And for wantof ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue Male of all and every the ≈øaid Sons of the ≈øaid E. G. to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid E. T. J. D. J. M. and D. C. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, for and during the term of 500 l. years from thence next en≈øuing, fully to be compleat and ended, without impeachment of wa≈øte, upon and under the tru≈øt and agreements hereafter mentioned and expre≈ø≈øed; and after the determination of the ≈øaid Lea≈øe for 500 years, then to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid Sir M. G. within the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of T. to the u≈øe of him the ≈øaid Sir M. M. and D. C. and of their Heirs, for and during the Natural lives of the ≈øaid E. G. and Sir M. G. and for and during the Natural life of the ≈øurvivor of them and no longer, upon Tru≈øt to pre≈øerve the contingent U≈øes herein after limitted and expre≈ø≈øed, by Entry, or Action, or otherwi≈øe, as there ≈øhall be occa≈øion: And after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid E. M. lawfully to be begotten, and of the Heirs males of the Body of ≈øuch fir≈øt Son to be begotten: And for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, then to the u≈øe of the ≈øecond, third, fourth, fifth, ≈øixth, ≈øeventh, eighth, ninth, tenth, and every other of the Sons of the ≈øaid E. M. lawfully to be begotten, and of the re≈øpective Heirs males of the Body of ≈øuch Sons to be begotten, ≈øeverally, re≈øpectively and ≈øucce≈ø≈øively one after another, according to their priority in birth and ≈øeniority in years, the elder of ≈øuch Sons and the Heirs males of his Body being always to be preferred and to take before the younger Son and the Heirs males of his Body; and for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, to the u≈øe of the right Heirs of the ≈øaid Sir M. G. for ever. And as for and concerning the Mannor of L. and the Park of L. with all the Profits, Ca≈øualties and Perqui≈øites thereof, and Advow≈øon of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh Church of L. in the County of S. with all the re≈øt of the Lands of him the ≈øaid Sir M. R. are and do ≈øtand jointly in debted, and do owe unto us the ≈øaid Creditors divers Sums of Mony which they are willing to ≈øatisfie and pay as far as they are able; Neverthethele≈øs we the ≈øaid Creditors, who have hereunto ≈øealed and ≈øub≈øcribed finding they the ≈øaid R. THis Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. F. J. and R. C. Creditors of C. R. late, &c. of the one part, and R. R. Widow of the other part, Whereas the ≈øaid C. R. at and before the time of his decea≈øe was indebted unto the ≈øaid Creditors, in divers and ≈øeveral Sums of Mony, All which they the ≈øaid Creditors have hitherto patiently forborn; And whereas the ≈øaid R. R. hath ≈øince her ≈øaid Husbands death, peru≈øed and examined the E≈øtate of her Husband, And finding through divers lo≈ø≈øes and hindrances, whereby the E≈øtate of her ≈øaid Husband has been impaired and le≈ø≈øened, that the ≈øame is far ≈øhort of giving the ≈øaid Creditors a full ≈øatisfaction of their ju≈øt Debts, hath hitherto forborn to take forth Letters of Admini≈øtration of the Goods, Chattels and E≈øtate of her ≈øaid Husband, as to her properly did belong, according to the form and due cour≈øe of the Laws of this Realm: And the ≈øaid R. R. having called the Creditors together, and acquainted them with the Premi≈ø≈øes, and with the weakne≈øs of her ≈øaid Husbands E≈øtate, They the ≈øaid Creditors by and with one a≈ø≈øent and con≈øent, were and are willing, contented and plea≈øed to accept of Ten ≈øhillings in the pound for their ≈øaid Debts, upon Security of the ≈øaid R. R. and to be paid at ≈øuch days and times, and in ≈øuch manner and form as hereafter is limited, expre≈ø≈øed and declared: And thereupon have given, and do by the≈øe pre≈øents give their full leave, con≈øents and approbations, that ≈øhe the ≈øaid R. R. ≈øhall and may have and take out in her own name Letters of
Admini≈øtration of the Goods, Chattels and per≈øonal ≈øtate of her ≈øaid decea≈øed Husband, without any interruption or di≈øturbance from them or either of them. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, that they the ≈øaid Creditors before named, do for them≈øelves ≈øeverally and re≈øpectively; That is to ≈øay, every of them for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and not jointly nor one of them for the other, covenant, promi≈øe and grant, to and with the ≈øaid R. R. her Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, That if the ≈øaid R. R. her Exocutors or Admini≈øtrators, do or ≈øhall, on or before the, &c. next en≈øuing the date of the≈øe pre≈øents, become bound in ≈øeveral Obligations, good and ≈øufficient in the Law, in ≈øeveral rea≈øonable penalties, unto the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Creditors, before named, ≈øeverally to be conditioned for the payment unto them, the ≈øaid Creditors, their ≈øeveral Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, of the Sum of 10 s. of lawful Mony of England, for every pound, or 20 s. of their due and principal Debts by the ≈øaid C. R. owing re≈øpectively as afore≈øaid, not accompting any intere≈øt for the ≈øame or any part thereof; That is to ≈øay, on the, &c. And ≈øhall and will al≈øo at the co≈øts and charges of the ≈øaid R. R. her Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øeverally Seal, and as their ≈øeveral Acts and Deeds deliver unto, or for the u≈øe of the ≈øaid R. R. ≈øeveral acquittances or di≈øcharges in Writing, ≈øufficient in Law, thereby acquitting and relea≈øing, as well the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, as al≈øo the ≈øaid R. R. her Executors and Admini≈øtrators of all Debts, Bonds, Bills, Claims and Demands what≈øoever, from the beginning of the world until the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents; and the ≈øaid Creditors ≈øeverally and re≈øpectively every one, by and for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and not jointly nor the one for the
other, do covenant and grant, to and with the ≈øaid R. R. her Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and every of them by the≈øe pre≈øents, That if either the ≈øaid R. R. her Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or her, or their Goods or Chattels, or the Goods and Chattels of her late Husbands, or any of them ≈øhall at any time or times hereafter, until or before the ≈øaid day of, &c. be arre≈øted, attached, mole≈øted or troubled by the above named Creditor or any of them, or by any other per≈øon or per≈øons, by their or any of their means or procurement, or in their or any of their right or rights, for or by rea≈øon of any debt or debts, ≈øo to them or any of them owing by the ≈øaid C. R. at the time of his decea≈øe, That then and from thenceforth, ≈øhe the ≈øaid R. R. her Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall be acquitted, relea≈øed and di≈øcharged again≈øt him or them, by whom ≈øhe the ≈øaid R. R. her Executors or Admini≈øtrators, her, their or any of their Goods or Chattels, ≈øhall be ≈øo arre≈øted, attached, mole≈øted or troubled of, and from all debts, actions, claims and demands what≈øoever, from the beginning of the World until the day of the date of the≈øe pre≈øents, and that the≈øe pre≈øents to be pleaded, ≈øhall be a ≈øufficient di≈øcharge in that behalf again≈øt him or them of the ≈øaid Creditors, his or their Executors or Admini≈øtrators, by whom or by who≈øe means or procurement, or in who≈øe right ≈øhe the ≈øaid R. R. her Executors or Admini≈øtrators her or their Goods, or Chattels, or any of them ≈øhall be ≈øo arre≈øted, attached, mole≈øted or troubled, contrary to the true intent and meaning of the≈øe Pre≈øents. Provided always, That if all the ≈øaid Creditors abovenamed, do not or ≈øhall not at or before the, &c. Sign, Seal, and as their Act and Deed deliver in due form of Law one part of the≈øe Pre≈øents unto, or to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid R. R. That then the≈øe Pre≈øents and every matter and thing therein contained
≈øhall be void and of no effect. And the ≈øaid R. R. for her life her Executors and Admini≈øtrators, doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid Creditors and every of them, their, and every of their Executors, and Admini≈øtrators, That in ca≈øe all the ≈øaid Creditors ≈øhall in due form of Law Sign, Seal and Execute one part of the≈øe Pre≈øents as afore≈øaid, unto or to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid R. R. on or before the, &c. That then ≈øhe the ≈øaid R. R. her Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will in due form of law make or cau≈øe to be made, and duly Seal and execute the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Obligation, and deliver the ≈øame to or for the u≈øe of the ≈øaid Creditors, upon or before the, &c.

div.head: A Licen≈øe to come into, and abide ≈øix Months in England.

opener.signed: We or ≈øuch of us who have Signed and Sealed the≈øe Pre≈øents, being Creditors of R. C. an Engli≈øh Merchant now re≈øiding, &c.

body.p:
Whereas the ≈øaid R. C. is indebted to us his ≈øaid Creditors ≈øeverally, in divers ≈øums of Mony, for which by rea≈øon of bad Debts and Lo≈ø≈øes as well by Sea as Land, he is unable to give unto us pre≈øent ≈øatisfaction, and having de≈øired as well by his own Letters as by mediation of his Friend here in England, to have time without our or any of our Mole≈øtations, Arre≈øts, Suits or Interruptions, to come over and re≈øide here in England, as well to gather in and recover the Debts to him due, as to make his true E≈øtate known unto us, and as much as in him lieth, to give us and every of us ≈øatisfaction for the ≈øaid Debts by him to us particularly owing: Unto which reque≈øt and de≈øire of the ≈øaid R. C. we do hereby conde≈øcend, and are content that he ≈øhall come
over into England, and ≈øtay or abide in London or el≈øewhere within the ≈øaid Kingdom, in peace and quiet, and without the Arre≈øt, Suit, Trouble or Mole≈øtation of us or any of us, for and during the ≈øpace of ≈øix Months from the day of the date hereof.

div.head: A Licence for a Petty-Chapman.

body.head: To the Bailiffs, Con≈øtables and other his Maje≈øty's Officers of the ≈øame County, and to every of them. Greeting.
body.p: KNow ye, That we R. C. and C. R. E≈øquires, two of his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace within the County afore≈øaid, have licen≈øed, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents do licen≈øe A. B. of C. in the County afore≈øaid, Yeoman, to be a Petty Chapman to wander and go from Town to Town, Village to Village, and Place to Place to ≈øell Pins, Points, Tapes, Laces, Knives, Gloves, Pur≈øes, &c. and ≈øuch other kind of Small Wares, and al≈øo to gather and buy Cony-Skins, and ≈øuch kind of Small Wares within the County afore≈øaid, and not el≈øewhere. Provided that this our Licence ≈øhall continue good only for the Term of one whole Year next en≈øuing the date hereof, and no longer.

div.head: A Licen≈øe or Pa≈øs for a Poor Man to go to his Friends.

body.head: To all Con≈øtables, Bur≈øholders, Bailiffs and other his Maje≈øty's Officers of the ≈øame County, and to every of them.
body.p:
R C. and C. R. E≈øquires, two of his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace for the ≈øame County, Greeting. Fora≈ømuch as A. B.
of E. the Bearer hereof, being reduced to great Poverty and Nece≈ø≈øity, hath de≈øired a Te≈øtimonial or Licen≈øe for his ≈øafe travel unto the City of L. in the County of M. where he ≈øaith he was born, and hath ≈øome Friends yet living, by who≈øe means and Friend≈øhip he hopeth to be fully relieved and holpen. In con≈øideration whereof Know ye that we the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. as far as in us lies, have licen≈øed the ≈øaid A. B. to travel the direct way from E. unto the City of L. ≈øo that his Journey be not for longer or further continuance than thirty days next after the date hereof, praying you and every of you not to mole≈øt or trouble the ≈øaid Poor Man in his Travel, but to permit and ≈øuffer him to pa≈øs, ≈øo that he ≈øhew him≈øelf in no re≈øpect offen≈øive to his Maje≈øty's Laws.

div.head: A Licen≈øe to Travel by Water on the Lord's Day.

body.p:
WHereas by an Act of Parliament made, &c. It was Enacted, That no per≈øon or per≈øons ≈øhall u≈øe, imploy or travel upon the Lord's Day with any Boat, Wherry, Lighter or Barge, except it be upon extraordinary occa≈øions, to be allowed by ≈øome Ju≈øtice of Peace of the County, or ≈øome Head Officer, or ≈øome Ju≈øtice of Peace of the City, Burrough or Town Corporate, where the Fact ≈øhall be committed, upon pain that every per≈øon ≈øo offending ≈øhall forfeit and lo≈øe the Sum of five ≈øhillings for every ≈øuch Offence, as by the ≈øaid Act, among≈øt other things, it doth and may appear. And fora≈ømuch as R. C. of, &c. having extraordinary occa≈øion to travel on the next Lord's Day to C. in the County of K. and to u≈øe and employ a Boat, Wherry or Barge in his ≈øaid Journey, hath de≈øired my allowance thereof: The≈øe are therefore in pur≈øuance of the ≈øaid Act to will and
require all Con≈øtables, Churchwardens, Over≈øeers of the Poor, and all other Officers whom the≈øe Pre≈øents may concern, to permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid R. C. quietly and peaceably to perform his ≈øaid Journey on the next Lord's Day, as afore≈øaid, and to u≈øe and employ any Boat, Wherry or Barge at his di≈øcretion, without any mole≈øtation or di≈øturbance what≈øoever at their peril.

closer.dateline: Given under my Hand and Seal, &c.

div.head: A Licen≈øe to Travel on the Lord's Day.

body.head: To all Con≈øtables, &c.
body.p: THe≈øe are to certifie that R. C. of C. &c. where he now dwelleth, having informed me that he hath a Kin≈øman living at A. in the County of K. who lieth now very ≈øick, and he hath a de≈øire to ≈øee him: Know ye, That for this Cau≈øe I do licen≈øe him to travel upon the next Lord's Day the direct way to his Kin≈øman, willing and requiring you not to mole≈øt or hinder him in his ≈øaid Journey, ≈øo that he behave him≈øelf orderly in his Travel.

div.head: A Licen≈øe for a Badger of Corn.
div.p: 6 E. 6. c. 14. 13 E. 25. 5 E. 5. 31 E. 5. 21 Jac. 22. 2 In≈øt. 1 Quorum, not for above a year.

body.p:
AT the General Se≈ø≈øions of the Peace, holden at C. in the County afore≈øaid, this pre≈øent day J. W. of C. in the County afore≈øaid, is admitted, licen≈øed and appointed by the Ju≈øtices of the Peace of the ≈øaid County, to be a Common Badger, Lader, Kedder, Carrier, Buyer, or Tran≈øporter of all manner of Corn or Grain in any Market or Fair within the Realm of England,
and the ≈øame ≈øo bought to convert to Meal, and the ≈øame to carry to the City of L. or the Suburbs of the ≈øame, or to any other Market or Fair; ≈øo that he u≈øe the ≈øame according to the Tenour and true Meaning of the Statute in that ca≈øe made and provided again≈øt Fore≈øtallers, Regraters and Ingro≈ø≈øers, and not otherwi≈øe. The ≈øame Licen≈øe to have continuance from the day of the date hereof, until the next General Se≈ø≈øions of the Peace after the Fea≈øt of, &c. next coming, to be holden at C. afore≈øaid.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof we have hereunto ≈øet our Hands and Seals, this, &c.

C. D.
