div.head: A Deed of Exchange between a Vicar and another, for Land of the Vicaridge Glebe.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between R. D. Clerk Vicar of the Vicaridge of C. in the County of S. of the one part, and W. G. of F. in the County afore≈øaid, E≈øq; of the other part, witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid R. D. hath given, granted and confirmed, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents doth fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely give, gant and confirm unto the ≈øaid W. G. and his Heirs for ever, in exchange all that one Clo≈øe and Pa≈øture lying in C. afore≈øaid, called the Great Carryers, containing by e≈øtimation two Acres, adjoining to a Field called the Inland Clo≈øe, now in the occupation of T. P. on the North We≈øt, to the River on the Ea≈øt, and to the Brook Lands, now in the occupation of the ≈øaid W G. on the South, and al≈øo all that Clo≈øe of Pa≈øture called Little Carryers, containing by e≈øtimation one Acre, lying in C. afore≈øaid, and adjoining to a Field
called the Hoe, now in the occupation of the ≈øaid T. P. on the We≈øt, to a Field called Clymping Mead on the South, and to the Brook Lands now in the occupation of the ≈øaid W. G. on the East, To have and to hold the ≈øaid two Clo≈øes of Pa≈øture with the appurtenances, before in the≈øe Pre≈øents given granted and confirmed unto the ≈øaid W. G. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, to the only ≈øole and proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid W. G. and of his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever. And this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid W. G. hath given, granted and confirmed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely give, grant and confirm unto the ≈øaid R. D. and his Succe≈ø≈øors Vicars of C. afore≈øaid, in exchange for the two Clo≈øes of Pa≈øture before-mentioned, all that parcel of Land in, &c. containing by e≈øtimation twelve Acres, adjoining to a Wall called New Wall, on the North, to a Clo≈øe of Land called by the name of Gar≈øon, now in the occupation of J. P. on the We≈øt, and to the Brook Lands, now in the occupation of the ≈øaid W. G. on the South and We≈øt, To have and to hold the ≈øaid Clo≈øe of Land with the appurtenances la≈øt before in the≈øe Pre≈øents given, granted and confirmed unto the ≈øaid R. D. and his Succe≈ø≈øors, Vicars of C. afore≈øaid, to the only ≈øole and proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. D. and his Succe≈ø≈øors for ever. Provided always That if the ≈øaid W. G. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall at any time be ejected out of the ≈øaid ≈øeveral parcels of Land to him before herein mentioned, to be granted; Or if the ≈øaid R. D. or his Succe≈ø≈øors ≈øhall a ‚Ä¢ any time enter into, take, claim or challenge the ≈øaid ≈øeveral parcels of Land, or any part thereof, then it ≈øhall and may be good and lawful to and for the ≈øaid W. G. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns into the ≈øaid parcel of Land by the ≈øaid W. G. before herein mentioned to be granted, to reenter, and the ≈øame to have again,
repo≈ø≈øe≈øs and enjoy, as in his and their former E≈øtate, any thing herein contained to the contrary notwith≈øtanding.

div.p: Note, Although this Deed will not bind the Vicars Succe≈ø≈øors, yet it makes a good Title again≈øt all others; and it was not doubted but all Succe≈ø≈øors would agree to it, becau≈øe the Vicaridge Land is of much le≈øs value than the other.

div.head: A Defeazance of a Statute Staple.

body.p: THIS Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of, &c. and R. C. of, &c. witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid R. C. by a certain Recognizance of the nature of a Statute Staple, made and provided for the recovery of Debts taken and ≈øealed before Sir J. H. Knight, Lord Chief Ju≈øtice of England, bearing date, &c. ≈øtandeth and is bound unto the ≈øaid J. F. in the ≈øum of 300 l. of lawful Mony of England, payable as by the ≈øaid Recognizance more at large appeareth; neverthele≈øs the ≈øaid J. F. is contented and agreed, and doth covenant, promi≈øe and grant for him≈øelf his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, and to and with every of them by the≈øe pre≈øents, That if the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, or any of them do pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns or any of them, the ≈øum of 160 l. of lawful Mony of England on the 10th day of May next en≈øuing the date hereof without fraud, That then the ≈øaid Recogni≈øance ≈øhall be utterly void and of none effect, or el≈øe to remain in full force and virtue.

div.head: A Defeazance on a Judgment.

body.p: THIS Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. and R. C. witne≈ø≈øeth, That whereas the ≈øaid R. C. by one Obligation, bearing date, &c. became bound unto the ≈øaid J. F. in the ≈øum of, &c. with a Condition thereupon made for the payment of, &c. as by the ≈øaid Obligation and Condition it doth more at large appear; which ≈øaid ≈øum of, &c. or any part thereof, or any thing in ≈øatisfaction of the ≈øame hath not been paid to the ≈øaid J. F. in the ≈øaid Obligation named: By rea≈øon whereof the ≈øaid Obligation became forfeited. And whereas the ≈øaid J. F. hath brought an Action of Debt in their Maje≈øty's Court of Common Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter again≈øt the ≈øaid R. C. upon the ≈øaid Obligation, in which Action a Judgment is obtained again≈øt the ≈øaid R. C. Yet neverthele≈øs the ≈øaid J. F. is contented, and doth covenant, that neither he the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, nor any of them ≈øhall at any time before, &c. Take out any Execution or Executions on the ≈øaid Judgment. And further, the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns doth covenant and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, that if he the ≈øaid R. C. do well and truly pay, &c. That then the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators upon reque≈øt made, and at the charges of the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall acknowledge ≈øatisfaction on record of, and for the ≈øaid Judgment, and ≈øhall al≈øo deliver unto him the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. the ≈øaid Obligation to be cancelled, and the ≈øaid R. C. to be thereof, and of and from the ≈øaid Judgment fully di≈øcharged.

div.head: A Defeazance on Lands forfeited.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. between J. F. of the one part, and R. C. of the other part, witne≈ø≈øeth, That whereas the ≈øaid R. C. by his Indenture, bearing date, &c. for the con≈øiderations therein mentioned, did give, grant, bargain, ≈øell and confirm unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns all the≈øe Lands, &c. with the appurtenances in the County of S. in which ≈øaid Indenture there is a Condition or Provi≈øo to this Effect, That if the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs, Executors, or A≈ø≈øigns or any of them do truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns the full ≈øum of, &c. that then ≈øaid from thenceforth the ≈øaid recited Indenture, and every Covenant, &c. therein contained, ≈øhall be utterly void and of none effect, as by the ≈øaid Indenture it doth more at large appear: Which ≈øaid ≈øum of, &c. was not paid at the day and time above limited for the payment thereof according to the effect of the ≈øaid Provi≈øo: By rea≈øon whereof the ≈øaid Lands, &c. in the ≈øaid Indenture mentioned, are ab≈øolutely ve≈øted and ≈øetled in the ≈øaid J. F. yet neverthele≈øs the ≈øaid J. F. is contented and plea≈øed, and doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, That if he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns or any of them do well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid J. F. Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns the full ≈øum of, &c. That then and from thenceforth the ≈øaid recited Indenture ≈øhall be utterly void and of none effect, the breach made by nonpayment of the ≈øaid ≈øum of, &c. in the afore-mentioned, Provi≈øo contained, or any other thing therein to the contrary notwith≈øtanding. And al≈øo on full
payment of the ≈øaid ≈øum of, &c. at any time within five years next following he, the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and will at the rea≈øonable reque≈øt, co≈øt and charges, in the Law of the ≈øaid J. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, convey and a≈ø≈øure unto the ≈øaid R. C. for ever, the ≈øaid Lands, &c. with the appurtenances in the ≈øaid recited Indendure mentioned, in ≈øuch manner and form as ≈øhall by the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, or his or their Coun≈øel learned in the Law, be rea≈øonably devi≈øed, advi≈øed or required. And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall deliver, or cau≈øe to be delivered unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns within two Months next after payment made, all Deeds, Evidences and Writings which the ≈øaid J. F. hath touching or concerning the Premi≈ø≈øes, ≈øafe, whole, uncancelled and undefaced.

div.head: An Indenture of Partition of Lands between Tenants in Common, who have ≈øeveral Intere≈øts in divers re≈øpects.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between J. B. ≈øen. of, &c. in the County of S. Gent. J. B. jun. Son and Heir apparent of the ≈øaid J. B. ≈øen. And R. G. of, &c. Gent. of the one part, and J. div.head: Covenants for levying Fines and Recoveries, &c.
A Covenant by Husband and Wife, to levy a Fine.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. and C. his Wife on the one part, and J. F. and F. J. of the other part, Witne≈ø≈øeth, That it is covenanted, granted, concluded and agreed, by and between the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents: And the ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and for the ≈øaid C. his Wife, doth covenant, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That they the ≈øaid R. C. and C. his Wife, ≈øhall and will before the end of the Term of St. Hillary next en≈øuing the date hereof, by one Fine with Proclamation in due form of Law, to be levied before the Ju≈øtices of our Sovereign Lord the King, of his Maje≈øty's Court of Common-Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter, or before any other per≈øon or per≈øons ≈øufficiently and lawfully authorized in that behalf, between the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. Plaintiffs, and the ≈øaid R. C. and C. his Wife, Deforceants, recognize and acknowledge all that, &c. ≈øituate, lying and being, &c. in which the ≈øaid R. C. and C. his Wife, or either of them, have or heretofore had any E≈øtate of Inheritance in Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, Rever≈øion or Remainder, with all and ≈øingular the Appurtenances thereof, by ≈øome Name or Names, or Contents and Numbers
of Acres in the ≈øaid Fine to be contained, to be the Right of the ≈øaid J. F. as tho≈øe which the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. have of the Gift of the ≈øaid R. C. and C. his Wife. And the ≈øame ≈øhall thereby remi≈øe and quit-claim from them the ≈øaid R. C. and C. his Wife, and their Heirs, to the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. and the Heirs of the ≈øaid J. F. for ever. And moreover ≈øhall by the ≈øaid Fine warrant the ≈øaid, &c. unto the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. and the Heirs of the ≈øaid J. F. for ever.

div.p: See a Declaration of the U≈øes, with ≈øuch other Covenants as the Ca≈øe requires.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. of the fir≈øt part; C. R. of the ≈øecond part; J. F. of the third part, and F. J. of the fourth part. Whereas the ≈øaid R. to the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. C. and his Heirs. And of and in the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid C. R. and his Heirs.

div.head: A Covenant to levy a Fine, with a render of an E≈øtate for years.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. and C. his Wife, of the one part, and J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, from the Fea≈øt of St. Michael the Archangel, now la≈øt pa≈øt, for and during and until the full end and term of One and twenty years from thence next en≈øuing, and fully to be compleat and ended; Yielding and paying therefore yearly and every year, during the ≈øaid term, unto the ≈øaid R. C. and C. his Wife, their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns re≈øpectively, the yearly Rent or Sum of Eight pounds of lawful Mony of England, at

div.head: A Covenant to levy a Fine, with a render of Rent.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. and C. his Wife, of the one part, and C. R. of the other part, Witne≈ø≈øeth, That for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations, it is covenanted, granted, concluded and agreed by and between the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, for them, their Heirs Executors and Admini≈øtrators, that before the end of Hillary Term next, at the co≈øts and charges of the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, one Annuity or yearly Rent of Fifty pounds of good and lawful Money of England, to be i≈ø≈øuing and going out of the afore≈øaid, &c. with the appurtenances; To have, hold, receive and enjoy the ≈øaid Annuity of Fifty pounds per Ann. and every part and parcel thereof unto the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, from the Fea≈øt of, &c. next en≈øuing the date of the≈øe pre≈øents, until the full end and term of 21 years from thence next en≈øuing, and fully to be
compleat and ended, at the Fea≈øt of St Michael the Archangel, and the Annunciation of the Ble≈ø≈øed Virgin Mary, by even and equal portions, yearly to be paid during the term afore≈øaid. And if it ≈øhall happen the ≈øaid yearly Rent of Fifty pounds, or any part thereof to be behind or unpaid, in part or in all, by the ≈øpace of 20 days after either of the ≈øaid Fea≈øt-days, or days of payment, being lawfully demanded, That then and from thenceforth it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, into the ≈øaid, &c. and every part and parcel thereof to enter and di≈øtrain: And the Di≈øtre≈øs and Di≈øtre≈ø≈øes there to be found and taken, lawfully to lead, bear, drive and carry away, and the ≈øame to detain and keep, until he the ≈øaid C. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall be fully paid and ≈øatisfied the ≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent, and all and every the Arrears thereof, &c.

div.head: A Covenant to make a Tenant to the Praecipe, and ≈øuffer a Recovery with double Voucher in London.

THis Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. of the fir≈øt part, and F. J. and A. B. of the ≈øecond part, and C. R. and J. F. of the third part witne≈ø≈øeth, That it is covenanted, granted, concluded and agreed by, and between all the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, And the ≈øaid R. C. for
him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid F. J. and A. B. and either of them, their and either of their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall and will within one Month next en≈øuing, the date of the≈øe Pre≈øents, make and execute or cau≈øe to be made and executed unto the ≈øaid F. J. and A. B. a good, perfect and ab≈øolute E≈øtate in the Law in Fee-≈øimple, of and in all, &c. lying and being in, &c. London. And al≈øo of and in the Rever≈øion and Rever≈øions of all and ≈øingular the Premi≈ø≈øes, to the end, intent and purpo≈øes, that the ≈øaid F. J. and A. B. and their Heirs, may ≈øtand and be ≈øei≈øed of the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes, and become perfect Tenants of the Freehold thereof, ≈øo that within one Month next after executing and making of the ≈øaid E≈øtate to them the ≈øaid J. F. and A. B. as afore≈øaid, The ≈øaid C. R. and J. F. or the Survivor of them, ≈øhall and may bring and per≈øue his Maje≈øty's Writ of Right patent out of the High Court of Chancery, again≈øt the ≈øaid F. J. and A. B. or the Survivor of them, to be directed to the Mayor and Sheriffs of the City of London, By which Writ of Right Patent the ≈øaid C. R. and J. F. or the Survivor of them, in the Guild-Hall of the ≈øaid City, before the ≈øaid Mayor and Sheriffs in the Court of Hu≈øtings, according to the Cu≈øtom of the ≈øaid City, ≈øhall demand again≈øt the ≈øaid F. J. and A. B. or the Survivor of them, the ≈øaid, &c. and all and ≈øingular other the Premi≈ø≈øes with the Appurtenances, by ≈øuch Names or Quantities as ≈øhall be rea≈øonably devi≈øed or advi≈øed by the Coun≈øel of the ≈øaid C. R. and J. F. or the Survivor of them, unto which ≈øaid Writ the ≈øaid F. J. and A. B. or the Survivor of them ≈øhall appear gratis, and after Declaration and Defence made thereupon, ≈øhall vouch to warranty the ≈øaid R. C. who ≈øhall appear gratis and enter into the
warranty, and vouch over to warranty the Common Vouchee, who ≈øhall appear gratis and imparle, and after make default in contempt of the Court, whereby Judgment ≈øhall be given in the ≈øaid Writ for the ≈øaid C. R. and J. F. the ≈øaid F. J. and A. B. and for the ≈øaid C. R. and J. F. to recover over in value again≈øt the ≈øaid R. C. And for the ≈øaid R. C. to recover over in value again≈øt the Common Vouchee, And Execution thereof ≈øhall be had and ≈øued in ≈øuch ≈øort, that a perfect Recovery with double Vouchers ≈øhall be had and duly executed of all and ≈øingular the Premi≈ø≈øes, &c.

div.head: To ≈øuffer a Recovery in a Court Baron.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. of, the one part, and C. R. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That it is covenanted, granted, concluded and agreed by and between the parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, That the ≈øaid. C. before the, &c. next en≈øuing the date hereof, ≈øhall permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid C. R. to affirm and per≈øue again≈øt the ≈øaid R. C. in the Court Baron of the Mannor of R. in the County of S. one Plaint in the nature of a Writ of Entry ≈øur di≈ø≈øei≈øin in le post of all and ≈øingular, &c. with the Appurtenances, ≈øituate, lying and being within the ≈øaid Mannor of R. which ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage the ≈øaid R. C. late had in Remainder of the Surrender of A. C. his Father, by the Name of (as in the Copy) as by the Court Roll of the General Court of the ≈øaid Mannor holden at A. on the 10th day, &c. la≈øt pa≈øt before the date hereof, among≈øt other things it doth more fully appear: And that the ≈øaid Plaint ≈øhall be affirmed, entred and per≈øued of all and every the Premi≈ø≈øes, with the Appurtenances in R. within the Jurisdiction of the Court of the ≈øaid Mannor of A. To and upon which Plaint to be entred and affirmed as afore≈øaid, he the ≈øaid
R. C. ≈øhall appear in his own proper per≈øon, or by his Attorney lawfully authorized in that behalf, and ≈øhall make his defence thereunto according to Law, and vouch to warranty of and for the ≈øaid Premi≈øes, one B. A. who ≈øhall appear and enter into the warranty, and after make default according to the manner and form of Common Recoveries or Writs of Entry ≈øur di≈ø≈øei≈øin en le po≈øt, whereby the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall have Judgment to recover the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. again≈øt the ≈øaid R. C. and the ≈øaid R. C. to recover over in value again≈øt the ≈øaid B. A. according to the manner and form of Common Recoveries for Lands and Tenements; which ≈øaid Recovery the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall ≈øuffer to be executed by Precept or Warrant out of the ≈øaid Court in the nature of a Writ of Habere Facias Sei≈øinam, according to the order and form of the Common Law. And it is further covenanted, granted, concluded and agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties, That the ≈øaid Recovery, and the E≈øtate of the Premi≈ø≈øes to be had, obtained and recovered thereby, or by rea≈øon thereof ≈øhall be to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, according to the Cu≈øtom of the ≈øaid Mannor, and to no other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoever.

div.head: A Covenant to make A≈ø≈øurance of Lands.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. of the one part, and C. R. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid R. C. for and in con≈øideration of the Sum of, &c. doth for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid R.C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and will on this ≈øide and before the Fea≈øt of, &c. next en≈øuing the date of the≈øe
Pre≈øents, at and upon the rea≈øonable reque≈øt, Co≈øts and Charges in the Law of the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, by Fine or Fines, with Proclamation in due form of Law to be levied, Feoffment or Feoffments, Recovery or Recoveries, with ≈øingle or double Voucher or Vouchers, or by any ≈øuch good and ≈øufficient means, Conveyance or A≈ø≈øurance in the Law, as by the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, or his or their Coun≈øel learned in the Law ≈øhall be lawfully and rea≈øonably devi≈øed, advi≈øed or required, convey and a≈ø≈øure, or cau≈øe to be conveyed and a≈ø≈øured unto the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, all that, &c. and the Rever≈øion and Rever≈øions, Remainder and Remainders thereof, and of every part and parcel thereof with the Appurtenances; as al≈øo all and ≈øingular Deeds, Evidences, E≈øcripts, Muniments and Writings what≈øoever, touching or concerning the ≈øaid, &c. and Premi≈ø≈øes with the Appurtenances, or any part or parcel thereof, To have and to hold the ≈øaid, &c. and other the Premi≈ø≈øes with the Appurtenances, unto the ≈øaid C.R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever. And that the ≈øaid Fine and Fines, Recovery and Recoveries and the Execution thereof, as likewi≈øe all Conveyances and A≈ø≈øurances what≈øoever, to be had and made according to the tenor, effect and true meaning of the≈øe Pre≈øents, ≈øhall be and enure, and ≈øhall be continued, reputed and taken to be and enure to the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, and to no other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoever (with Covenants that he is lawfully ≈øeized, and hath power to ≈øell, and that C. R. ≈øhall enjoy free from Incumbrances, and for further A≈ø≈øurance as is u≈øual.)

div.head: A Covenant for the Attornment of Tenants.

body.p: AND the ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That all and every the now Holders and Occupiers of the Premi≈ø≈øes afore≈øaid, ≈øhall and will before the Fea≈øt of, &c. now next coming, attorn and become Tenants unto the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, of and for their ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Tenements, whereof or wherein they or any of them have or hath any particular E≈øtate or E≈øtates in being, and which are parcel of the Premi≈ø≈øes before mentioned to be granted.

div.head: A Covenant to produce Writings, for defence of the Title to the Lands ≈øold.

body.p:
AND the ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That if the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall at any time or times hereafter, have need or occa≈øion to plead, ≈øhew forth or give in Evidence, any Letters-Patent, Deeds, Evidences or Writings (whereof the ≈øaid R. C. hath covenanted to deliver Copies as afore≈øaid, and which are not hereby bargained and ≈øold) of him the ≈øaid R. C. touching or concerning the Premi≈ø≈øes or any part thereof, for the maintenance and defence of the Title of the ≈øaid C. R. of, in and to the Premi≈ø≈øes or any part thereof, or for any other ju≈øt and rea≈øonable occa≈øion in any wi≈øe touching or concerning the Premi≈ø≈øes or any part thereof, That then and ≈øo often the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns upon reque≈øt, in
that behalf to be made by the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, and at the Co≈øts and Charges of the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and will produce and ≈øhew forth, or cau≈øe to be produced and ≈øhewed forth, all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Letters Patent, Deeds, Evidences and Writings, or ≈øo many of them as ≈øhall be thought needful by the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns in any Court or Courts of Record or el≈øewhere, for the maintenance and defence of the Title of the ≈øaid C. R. of, in and to the bargained Premi≈ø≈øes, or any part or parcel thereof or for any other ju≈øt and rea≈øonable Cau≈øe as afore≈øaid, and ≈øhall and will permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øame there to remain ≈øo long as the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall u≈øe or have occa≈øion for the ≈øame.

div.head: A Covenant to pay back Purcha≈øe-Mony of the Lands ≈øold, or any part thereof evicted within ten years.

body.p:
AND it is covenanted, granted, concluded and fully agreed by and between all the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents; And the ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators and for every of them doth covenant, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That if it ≈øhall happen at any time or times hereafter within the ≈øpace of ten years, to be computed from the day of the date hereof, the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement, &c. and other the Tenements herein before mentioned to be bargained and ≈øold, or any part or parcel thereof, upon any prior or former Title to be by any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever recovered or otherwi≈øe lawfully evicted from the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns by due cour≈øe of Law, or that any Decree in or upon any Bill of Complaint in a
Court of Equity ≈øhall pa≈øs or be made, or that any Judgment in any Suit or Action real or per≈øonal ≈øhall be given again≈øt him the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, whereby his or their Title of and in the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes or any part thereof may be in any wi≈øe avoided, adnulled or defeated, That then and in ≈øuch ca≈øe he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall within three Months next after notice given of ≈øuch Recovery, Eviction, Decree or Judgment ≈øo had and given by the ≈øaid C. R. and upon rea≈øonable reque≈øt in that behalf to be made unto him the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øo much lawful Mony of England as the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes or any part thereof ≈øo happening to be evicted or recovered, or whereunto the Title of the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall be ≈øo avoided, adnulled or defeated as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall amount unto at the rate of eighteen years purcha≈øe for the value thereof, according to the rate the ≈øame was valued at the time of the purcha≈øe thereof by the ≈øaid C. R. as afore≈øaid.

div.head: A Covenant to pay back the Purcha≈øe-Mony at the end of two years, if the Purcha≈øer di≈ølike; and if he likes, then to pay a further Sum of Mony.

body.p:
AND the ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That if the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall at any time within the ≈øpace of two years next en≈øuing the date hereof, di≈ølike of the purcha≈øe of the ≈øaid, &c. And thereof within the time afore≈øaid, ≈øhall give notice in Writing unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators,
That then he the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will within three Months after ≈øuch Notice given, and after a Reconveyance made thereof by the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, free from all E≈øtates, Charges and Incumbrances what≈øoever had, made or ≈øuffered by the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, at the Co≈øts and Charges of the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, in ≈øuch manner and form as the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, or his or their Coun≈øel learned in the Law ≈øhall advi≈øe, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to paid unto the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns for their Purcha≈øe of the Premi≈ø≈øes, the Sum of 800 l. of lawful Mony of England. Provided always, that if the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall not within the ≈øpace of two years ≈øignifie as afore≈øaid his di≈ølike of the ≈øaid Purcha≈øe, That then he the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and will pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns the further Sum of 50 l. of lawful Mony of England, over and above the Mony by him already paid, for the clear and ab≈øolute purcha≈øe of the ≈øaid, &c. within one Month after the end or determination of the ≈øaid two years.

div.head: A Covenant not to claim Dower with a Relea≈øe thereof.

body.p:
TO all, &c. Know ye that the ≈øaid R. C. for and in con≈øideration of the Sum of 100 l. of lawful Mony of England to her in hand paid, before the ≈øealing and delivery hereof by C. R. of, &c. who lately purcha≈øed of A. C. decea≈øed, late Husband of the ≈øaid R. C. a Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. lying and being, &c. whereof he the ≈øaid A. C. was ≈øei≈øed of ≈øome E≈øtate of Inheritance during the
Coverture between him the ≈øaid A. C. and the ≈øaid R. C. the Receit whereof the ≈øaid R. C. doth hereby acknowledge, hath covenanted, granted, concluded and agreed, and doth by the≈øe pre≈øents covenant, grant, conclude and agree to and with the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, that the ≈øaid R. C. or her A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall not at any time hereafter ≈øue for, challenge or demand by Writ of Dower or otherwi≈øe, any Dower or Title of Dower out of the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. or any part thereof; but that the ≈øaid C. R. ≈øhall and may lawfully and quietly enjoy the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. without the lett or interruption of the ≈øaid R. C. or of any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, lawfully claiming by, from or under the ≈øaid R. C. And the ≈øaid R. C. for the con≈øideration afore≈øaid, hath remi≈øed, relea≈øed and for ever quit claimed, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents doth remi≈øe, relea≈øe and for ever quit claim unto the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, all and all manner of Dower and Right, and Title of Dower what≈øoever which ≈øhe the ≈øaid R. C. now hath, may, might, ≈øhould or of right ought to have of, in and to the ≈øaid, &c. and of, in or to any part or parcel thereof; ≈øo that neither ≈øhe the ≈øaid R. C. nor any other for her or in her name, any manner of Dower or Writ, or Action of Dower, or any manner of Right or Title of Dower of or in the ≈øaid, &c. or any part or parcel thereof at any time hereafter ≈øhall or may have or claim or pro≈øecute again≈øt the ≈øaid C. R. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns or any of them; but of and from the ≈øame ≈øhall be utterly barred, and for ever excluded by the≈øe Pre≈øents.

div.head: The form of a Covenant of two Per≈øons ≈øeverally.

body.p: AND the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. ≈øeverally and not jointly, nor one of them for the other, and for their ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators and for every of them re≈øpectively do covenant, &c.‚ÄîOr thus, And the ≈øaid R. C. and R. C. for them≈øelves ≈øeverally and re≈øpectively, that is is to ≈øay, each of them for him≈øelf, and for his ≈øeveral Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and for ≈øo much as concerneth or may concern his own Act or Acts only, and not one of them for the other, nor for the Act or Acts of the other, or of the Heirs, Executors, or Admini≈øtrators of the other, doth ≈øeverally and not jointly covenant, &c.‚ÄîOr thus, And the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. ≈øeverally and re≈øpectively each one for him≈øelf only, and for his re≈øpective Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, and not jointly, nor one of them for the other, nor for the act, or acts, Deed or Deeds, Matter, or Thing of the other doth covenant, &c.‚ÄîOr thus, And the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. and J. F. for them≈øelves, ≈øeverally and not jointly, nor one of them for the other, and for their and every of their ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators do Covenant, &c.

div.head: A Covenant by one, and two Husbands and their Wives.

body.p:
AND the ≈øaid R. C. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and for the ≈øaid C. his Wife doth covenant, &c. If two Men and their Wives covenant ≈øeverally‚Äî Thus, And the ≈øaid R. C. him≈øelf, and for the ≈øaid C. his Wife; and the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, and for the
≈øaid R. his Wife do ≈øeverally and re≈øpectively, and for their ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and not one for the other, nor for the Wife of the other, nor for the Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the other Covenant, &c.‚ÄîOr thus, And the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. for them≈øelves and for their ≈øaid Wives re≈øpectively, their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators do ≈øeverally and re≈øpectively covenant, &c, to and with the ≈øaid J. F. and R. his Wife, and either of them, their and either of their Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe Pre≈øents, &c.

div.p: Note, That notwith≈øtanding the appearance of Severalty in the≈øe Covenants, yet the matter of the Covenant after, whether in affirmation or negation being intire, it ≈øeems that any of the Covenants may be charged with the breach of another of them, unle≈øs there be after in the Deed added ≈øuch a Provi≈øo as followeth.

div.q: Provided always, that the ≈øaid A. B. C. D. and E. F. their Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or any of them ≈øhall not at any time be impeached or charged with the breach of any Covenant herein contained, otherwi≈øe than for the proper Act and Deed of the per≈øon ≈øo charged, or by him or them repre≈øented as Heir, Executor or Admini≈øtrator.

div.head: A Provi≈øo that the E≈øtate ≈øhall he void in default of payment of the Purcha≈øe-mony at the days limited.
div.q:
PRovided neverthele≈øs, and upon this Condition, That if the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs, Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall not and do not well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns or ≈øome or one
of them, the ≈øaid ≈øum of 500 l. of lawful Mony of England, being the remainder or re≈øidue of the ≈øaid ≈øum of 1500 l. before ≈øpecified on the ≈øeveral days of payment hereafter mentioned, and in manner and form following, viz. the ≈øum of 100 l. of lawful Mony of England, on or before the 10th day of December next en≈øuing the date of the≈øe Pre≈øents, and the ≈øum of 200 l. of like Mony, on or upon the 10th day of June, which ≈øhall be in year of our Lord 1694. and the further ≈øum of 200 l. on or before the, &c. being the re≈øidue of the ≈øaid ≈øum of 500 l. That then and from thenceforth this pre≈øent Deed of Bargain and Sale, and every Matter and Thing therein contained ≈øhall be void and of none effect; and that then and from thenceforth it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns into the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances to re-enter, and the ≈øame to have again, retain, repo≈ø≈øe≈øs and enjoy, as in his or their former E≈øtate, any thing herein contained to the contrary notwith≈øtanding.

div.head: A Provi≈øo that an Estate ≈øhall be void in di≈øcharge of a Surety.
div.q:
PRovided always and upon condition, That if the ≈øaid R. what≈øoever, in ≈øuch ≈øort, manner and form as the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall think meet and convenient, and that at all times, and from time to time immediately, from and after ≈øuch alteration, change, inlargement, revocation or making void, of all or any the ≈øaid U≈øe or U≈øes, E≈øtate or E≈øtates, Declaration, Limitation or Appointment of any other U≈øe or U≈øes, E≈øtate or E≈øtates, All and every tho≈øe U≈øe and U≈øes, E≈øtate and E≈øtates of and in the ≈øaid, &c. or of, or in any part or parcel thereof, or ≈øuch of them as ≈øhall be ≈øo revoked and declared to be made void as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall cea≈øe, determine and be utterly void and fru≈øtrate; And that then, and from thenceforth the ≈øaid Fine, and all and every other Conveyance and Conveyances, A≈ø≈øurance and A≈ø≈øurances, what≈øoever had or at any time hereafter to be had or made between the ≈øaid Parties, or any of them of the ≈øaid, &c. or of ≈øuch part thereof, whereof ≈øuch other U≈øe or U≈øes, E≈øtate or E≈øtates, ≈øhall be ≈øo limited or declared as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be adjudged, deemed, con≈øtrued and taken to be, and enure, and the ≈øaid Cognizees of the ≈øaid Fine, and the Survivor and Survivors of them, and the Heirs of the Survivor of them, ≈øhall immediately from thenceforth ≈øtand and be ≈øeized thereof, and of every part thereof, to and for ≈øuch U≈øe and U≈øes, E≈øtate and E≈øtates, Intents and purpo≈øes, and of ≈øuch per≈øon and per≈øons, and in ≈øuch ≈øort, manner and form as the ≈øaid R. C. in or by ≈øuch Deed or Deeds in Writing, or la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament in Writing to be ≈øealed, ≈øub≈øcribed and te≈øtified as is afore≈øaid, ≈øhall create and declare, limit, expre≈øs and appoint, and to no other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoeever; And whereas, afterwards in performance of the Covenants, Grants and Agreements in the ≈øaid recited Indenture mentioned one Fine, Sur Cognizance de droit come ceo, &c. was had, levied, acknowledged
and executed, of and for, &c. in the Court of Common Pleas at We≈øtminster, before his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the ≈øaid Court, by me the ≈øaid R. C. unto the ≈øaid C. R. J. F. and F. J. which ≈øaid Fine was had, levied and acknowledged to the U≈øes, Intents and Purpo≈øes, and with and under the ≈øeveral Provi≈øoes, Conditions and Limitations in the ≈øaid recited Indenture mentioned: Now know ye that I the ≈øaid R. C. for divers good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations me moving, and by virtue of the ≈øaid Provi≈øo before mentioned, and Liberty, Power and Authority thereby to me given and re≈øerved, have altered, changed, determined, revoked and made void; And by this pre≈øent Writing, by me ≈øigned and ≈øealed in the pre≈øence of the Per≈øons under named, do alter, change, determine, revoke and make void, all and every the ≈øaid U≈øe and U≈øes, E≈øtate and E≈øtates, created, rai≈øed, declared, limited and appointed by the ≈øaid recited Indenture and Fine, and either of them, And by force of the Statute of transferring U≈øes into po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of and in the the ≈øaid, &c. and of or in any part or parcel thereof; And I the ≈øaid R. C. of, &c. and to the Heirs of her Body lawfully begotten, do by the≈øe pre≈øents, by virtue of the ≈øaid Provi≈øo, in the ≈øaid recited Indenture contained, and the Liberty, Power and Authority therein and thereby to me given and re≈øerved as afore≈øaid, create, declare, limit and appoint, That the ≈øaid Fine ≈øo had, levied and acknowledged as afore≈øaid, of the ≈øaid, &c. herein before mentioned, ≈øhall be and enure, And that the ≈øaid Cognizees and their Heirs, ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of, and in the ≈øaid, &c. and of and in every part and parcel thereof, to the u≈øe and behoof of me the ≈øaid R. Term of my natural Life without Impeachment of Wa≈øt; And immediately from and after my decea≈øe, to the u≈øe and behoof of M. C. and F. C. her Husband, and of the Heirs of the Body of the ≈øaid M. C. And in default of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, to the u≈øe and behoof of the right Heirs of me the ≈øaid R. C. for ever,

div.head: A Jointure with all Covenants u≈øual therein.

THIS Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of the one part, and R. C. and M. his Daughter of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. during the Coverture between him the ≈øaid M. C. be ≈øeized of any E≈øtate of Inheritance and for the advancement of the ≈øaid M. C. and of the Heirs Males of the Body of the ≈øaid J. C. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators in manner and form following, that is to ≈øay, That he the ≈øaid J. And the ≈øaid R. C. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, covenant, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That in ca≈øe the ≈øaid Marriage between the ≈øaid J. F. and the ≈øaid M. C. Daughter of the ≈øaid R. C. do take effect,

F. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, as the Marriage Portion of the ≈øaid M. the ≈øum of 2000 l. of lawful Mony of England, at or in the now dwelling Hou≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øituate, &c. And the ≈øaid R. C. al≈øo for him≈øelf doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That in ca≈øe the ≈øaid Marriage ≈øhall take effect according to the true meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents, That then the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall and will well and ≈øufficiently maintain, provide for, find keep and ≈øu≈øtain the ≈øaid J. F. and M. his Wife, and all the I≈ø≈øue of their two Bodies begotten from time to time, and at all times immediately from and after the ≈øaid Marriage between the ≈øaid J. F. and M. ≈øo to be had and ≈øolempnized as afore≈øaid, during the natural life of him the ≈øaid R. C. with ≈øufficient and convenient Meat, Drink, Lodging and Hou≈øeroom according and ≈øuitable to their Quality and Degree.

And farther, That the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øhall and will either in the life-time of the ≈øaid R. C. or by his la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament, leave, give, devi≈øe and a≈ø≈øure, or cau≈øe to be well and truly contented and paid unto the ≈øaid J. F. or to the ≈øaid M. in ca≈øe ≈øhe ≈øhall ≈øurvive the ≈øaid J. F. or to the Children or Child to be begotten between them, in ca≈øe the ≈øaid J. F. and M. ≈øhall both happen to die in the life time of the ≈øaid R. C. to be Equally divided between them the ≈øum of 1000 l. of lawful Mony of England (over and be≈øide the ≈øum of 2000l. herein before-mentioned to be paid to the ≈øaid J.F. as and for a Marriage Portion with the ≈øaid M.
to be paid within two years after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid R. C. in ca≈øe the ≈øame ≈øhall not be paid or ≈øatisfied in his life-time.

And the ≈øaid J. F. doth for him≈øelf, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, covenant, promi≈øe, grant, conclude and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, That if the Marriage between him the ≈øaid J. F. and the ≈øaid M. ≈øhall take effect, and be had as afore≈øaid; and if the ≈øaid M. ≈øhall happen to ≈øurvive and outlive him the ≈øaid J. F. and ≈øhall at any time after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. be lawfully evicted or put out, of or from the ≈øaid, &c. limited to her as afore≈øaid for her Jointure, or any part or parcel thereof, That then the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid M. ≈øo much lawful Mony of England for the ≈øaid premi≈ø≈øes or part thereof, being ≈øo evicted from the ≈øaid M. as afore≈øaid, as the ≈øame ≈øhall Amount unto at Rate of ≈øeven years purcha≈øe, for and according to the yearly Value of the ≈øame, within ≈øix Months after ≈øuch eviction.

And the ≈øaid J. F. further for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, doth covenant and grant to and with ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, That in ca≈øe the ≈øaid M. ≈øhall happen to depart this life within two years after the ≈øaid Marriage had and ≈øolemnized as afore≈øaid, without having any I≈ø≈øue of her Body, lawfully begotten by the ≈øaid J. F. then living, That then and in ≈øuch ca≈øe the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will, for and in re≈øpect of the ≈øaid ≈øum of 2000 l. of lawful Mony of England by him received as afore≈øaid, as the Marriage Portion of the ≈øaid M. repay and ≈øatis≈øfie, or cau≈øe to be repaid and ≈øatisfied unto the ≈øaid R.
C. the ≈øum of 1000 l. of lawful Mony of England at one entire payment, within four Months next after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid M.

And it it is further covenanted, granted concluded and agreed by the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, That if the ≈øaid Marriage ≈øhall take effect, and if the ≈øaid M. ≈øhall outlive the ≈øaid J. F. and after his decea≈øe ≈øhall agree to and refu≈øe to accept of the ≈øaid, &c. hereby ≈øetled on her as afore≈øaid, for and in the name of her Jointure, and ≈øhall commence or ≈øue any Action at law for any Lands, Tenements or Hereditaments, which are the Inheritance of the ≈øaid J. F. during the covertue between them for her Dower, or upon her Title of Dower, That then and from thenceforth, f ‚Ä¢ om and after the commencement of ≈øuch Action or Actions, Suit or Suits, the U≈øes and E≈øtates herein before limited ≈øhall cea≈øe, determin and be utterly void, and then and from thenceforth the ≈øaid [the≈øe mu≈øt be Tru≈øtees when this Covenant i≈ø≈øued] H. J. and K. L. ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of all and every the premi≈ø≈øes afore≈øaid, to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, any thing herein contained to the contrary notwith≈øtanding

And the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, his, &c. doth covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his &c. That if the ≈øaid M. after the ≈øaid Marriage had and ≈øolempnized, do happen to die in the life-time of the ≈øaid J. F. that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid M. at her free will and plea≈øure to make, publi≈øh and declare one Will and Te≈øtament in writing, under her Hand and Seal, and thereby to di≈øpo≈øe, will, give and bequeath to any her Children, Servants or Friends, for their preferment and advancement, any ≈øum or ≈øums of Mony what≈øoever, not exceeding in the whole, the ≈øum of 400 l. of the Goods and
Chattels of him the ≈øaid J. F. without any Lett di≈øturbance or contradiction of the ≈øaid J. E. and in as large and ample manner as if the ≈øaid M. were then a Feme-≈øole and unmarried.

And la≈øtly, the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and every of them doth by the≈øe Pre≈øents, covenant, promi≈øe and grant to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns and every of them, that the ≈øaid, &c. And all and ≈øingular other the premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances herein beforementioned, now are and be, and ≈øo at all times hereafter, and from time to time ≈øhall be, remain and continue unto the u≈øes, intents and purpo≈øes, before, in and by the≈øe pre≈øents, limited, expre≈ø≈øed and declared, free and clear, and freely and clearly acquitted, exonerated and di≈øcharged, or otherwi≈øe upon every rea≈øonable reque≈øt in that behalf to be made, well and ≈øufficiently ≈øaved, defended and kept harmle≈øs, of and from all manner of former and other Bargains, Sales, Gifts, Grants, Lea≈øes, Jointures, Dowers, U≈øes, Wills, Intails, Fines, Feoffments, Recoveries, Statutes-Merchant and of the Staple, Recognizances, Judgments, Executions, and of and from all other Charges, Titles, Troubles and Incumbrances what≈øoever, had, made, committed or done, or to be had, made, committed or done by the ≈øaid J. F. or by any other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever by his means or procurement (all ≈øuch Lea≈øes, particular E≈øtates and Intere≈øts as he the ≈øaid J. F. hath heretofore made to any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, of or upon the ≈øaid, &c. and other the premi≈ø≈øes, or of or upon any part or parcel thereof; upon which Lea≈øes and E≈øtates there is re≈øerved the old and accu≈øtomed yearly Rent or Rents, or more, which ≈øhall continue yearly due and payable during the ≈øeveral Terms, E≈øtates and Intere≈øts as afore≈øaid) only excepted and foreprized.

div.head: A Warrant for the Over≈øeers of the Poor to name other fit Per≈øons.

body.head: To the Con≈øtable and Bor≈øholders of D. in the Hundred of F. and to every of them. 43 E. c. 2
body.p: The≈øe are in his Maje≈øty's Name to command you to give notice to the Church-wardens and other the Over≈øeers of the Poor of D. That they are by us required per≈øonally to appear before us at the Hou≈øe of R. C. in A. &c. upon Wedne≈øday the 10th day of March, at eight of the Clock in the Forenoon of the ≈øame day, to make and yield up unto as a true and perfect account in Writing of all Sums of Mony by them received, or rated or a≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed, and not received for and towards the relief of the Poor of D. and al≈øo of ≈øuch Stock to ≈øet the Poor at work, as is in their hands, or in the hands of any of their ≈øaid Poor to work, and of all other things concerning their ≈øaid Office: And that hereof they fail not at their Perils. And you are farther hereby commanded to ≈øignifie unto them, That they do then and there al≈øo certifie unto us the Names of ≈øuch other ≈øub≈øtantial Hou≈øholders of D. as are thought meet to be Over≈øeers of the Poor there for the year en≈øuing. Fail not at your Perils,

closer.dateline: Given under our Hands and Seals at the, &c.

div.head: A Warrant for making new Over≈øeers of the Poor. 43 E. 2.

body.p:
ACcording to the Form of the Statute in ≈øuch ca≈øe made and provided, We who≈øe, Names are hereunto ≈øub≈øcribed (his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the ≈øaid County, do nominate and appoint you who≈øe Names are underwirtten)
to be together with the Church-wardens of the Pari≈øh of R. in the County afore≈øaid, Over≈øeers of the Poor of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh for the year en≈øuing; and to be and do and perform all ≈øuch things, in and touching the ≈øaid Office, as by Law is required, whereof you are not to fail at your Perils.

div.head: A Warrant to make Over≈øeers of the Poor, impowring them and the Church-wardens to Collect and Di≈øtrain for the Poors Tax. 43 E. 2.

body.p:
WHereas by virtue of an Act of Parliament, intituled An Act for Relief or the Poor, in the forty third year of, &c. We who≈øe Names are ≈øub≈øcribed, his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace in the ≈øaid County of S. and one of Us of the Quorum, dwelling in or near the Pari≈øh of B. in the ≈øaid County of S. Have nominated and appointed R. C. and C. R. together with F. J. Church-wardens for time being, according to the ≈øaid Act of Parliament, to be Over≈øeers for the Poor of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh; and to receive the ≈øeveral Sums of Mony taxed and a≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed by them, on the ≈øeveral per≈øons, on the 10th day of December in≈øtant. The≈øe are therefore, according to the ≈øaid Act of Parliament, to authorize you the ≈øaid Churchwardens, and Over≈øeers of the Poor, or any of you, to collect and receive all ≈øuch Sums of Mony as afore≈øaid, and the ≈øame re≈øpectively to levy of ≈øuch per≈øons as ≈øhall refu≈øe to pay the afore≈øaid A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øment, by way of Di≈øtre≈øs, and Sale of their Goods, for ≈øo much, rendring the overplus, if any
be, to the party or parties di≈øtrained; and for default of di≈øtre≈øs, We require all Con≈øtables and other Officers, to bring before Us or ≈øome other his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace of this County, the Bodies of all ≈øuch per≈øons, where no di≈øtre≈øs can be had, that further cour≈øe may be taken with them according to Law.

closer.dateline: Dated the 10th day of December, in the fifth year, &c.

div.head: A Confirmation of the Poors Tax. 43 E. 2.

body.p: SEen, ratified and allowed by Us who≈øe Names are hereunder written, two of his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace within the County afore≈øaid: And We do hereby authorize the pre≈øent Church-wardens and Over≈øeers for the Poor within the Pari≈øh of B. and every of them, to levy by way or di≈øtre≈øs and ≈øale of the Goods of all ≈øuch per≈øons as ≈øhall refu≈øe or neglect to pay the ≈øeveral Taxations afore≈øaid, upon him impo≈øed, rendring to the Owners the overplus which remain upon the ≈øaid ≈øale, according to the Statute in that ca≈øe made and provided.

div.head: A Warrant to levy the Arrears (due to the Pari≈øh by) the former Over≈øeers Account.

body.head: To the Church-wardens, and other the Over≈øeers of the Poor of the Pari≈øh of B. in the ≈øaid County, and to every of them. 43. E. 2.
body.p:
Fora≈ømuch as upon your complaint, it appeareth unto Us, that R. C. and C. R. Church-wardens of the Pari≈øh afore≈øaid, and J. F. and F. J. Over≈øeers of the Poor of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, in the year of our Lord, &c. upon their account by them made and yielded, of and for the
Monies by them received and disbur≈øed, for and in Execution of their Office, according to the Form of the Statute in that ca≈øe made and provided, were in arrear and behind to the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, Ten pounds, and have not yet paid the ≈øame over to you; The≈øe are therefore in his Maje≈øty's Name to command you, that you or ≈øome of you do levy the ≈øaid Ten pounds by di≈øtre≈øs and ≈øale of the Goods of the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. J. F. and F. J. rendring to them the Overplus; And in default of ≈øuch Di≈øtre≈øs, That then you do forthwith certifie the ≈øame unto us, to the end we may further do therein, as to Ju≈øtice doth appertain. Hereof fail not.

div.head: A Warrant to di≈øtrain for the Poors Tax.

body.head: To the Churchwardens, and other the Over≈øeers of the Poor of the Pari≈øh of B. in the ≈øaid County, and to every of them. 43 E. 2.
body.p:
FOra≈ømuch as Complaint hath been made by you, unto us, That the ≈øeveral per≈øons here under-named, have refu≈øed to pay unto you the ≈øeveral Sums of Mony adjoining to their ≈øeveral names, being a≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed upon them ≈øeverally, for and towards the nece≈ø≈øary relief of the Poor of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh according to the Form of the Statute in that ca≈øe made and provided. The≈øe are therefore in his Maje≈øty's Name to command you, that you, ≈øome or one of you do forthwith levy the ≈øaid ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Sums of Mony, by di≈øtre≈øs and ≈øale of the ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Goods of the ≈øaid ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Offenders, rendring to the Parties the Overplus; and in defect of ≈øuch Di≈øtre≈øs, that then you, ≈øome or one of you do certifie the ≈øame unto us, to the end that
there may be ≈øuch further proceeding touching the premi≈ø≈øes, as to Ju≈øtice doth appertain.

div.head: A Mittimus where no Di≈øtre≈øs can be had.

body.head: To the Keeper of his Maje≈øty's Gaol for the ≈øaid County at H. in the County afore≈øaid.
body.p: FOra≈ømuch as is appeareth unto us, That R. C. of, &c. was a≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed and rated at the Sum of 25 s. 6 d. for and towards the nece≈ø≈øary Relief of the Poor of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, according to the Form of the Statute in that ca≈øe made and provided; and that for his refu≈øal of payment of the ≈øame, a Warrant was, according to the Form of the Statute, directed to the Churchwardens, and other the Over≈øeers of the Poor of the Pari≈øh afore≈øaid, under the Hands and Seals of W. M. R. F. &c. his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace for the County afore≈øaid: And for that it now appeareth unto us, That the ≈øaid R. C. hath no Goods or Chattels, by Di≈øtre≈øs and Sale whereof the ≈øaid Mony can be levied, nor will he yet pay the Monies afore≈øaid; We therefore do ≈øend you herewithal the Body of the ≈øaid R. C. commanding you to receive him into the ≈øaid Gaol, there to remain without Bail or Mainpri≈øe, until he ≈øhall pay the Monies afore≈øaid. Hereof fail not at your Peril.

div.head: Upon the Statute of 14 Car. 2. cap. 12. A Warrant to remove out of the Pari≈øh, one lately come thither, and likely to be chargeable.

body.head: To the Church-wardens, and others the Over≈øeers of the Poor of the Pari≈øh of B. in the ≈øaid County, and to every of them.
body.p: WE who≈øe Hands and Seals are hereunto ≈øet, two of his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace of the ≈øaid County, whereof one is of the Quorum, have heard the Complaint by you made unto us, That R. C. hath within forty days before the ≈øaid Complaint, come into your ≈øaid Pari≈øh to ≈øettle there in a Tenement under the yearly value of 10 l. and that he is likely to be chargeable to the Pari≈øh afore≈øaid, and was la≈øt legally ≈øetled at R. in, &c. by the ≈øpace of forty days at the lea≈øt, as Native, Hou≈øholder, Sojourner, Apprentice or Servant there: The≈øe are therefore in his Maje≈øty's Name, and according to the Form of the Statute in that ca≈øe made and provided, to require and authorize you and every of you, that you, ≈øome or one of you do remove and convey the ≈øaid R. C. to R. afore≈øaid, where he was ≈øo la≈øt legally ≈øetled, unle≈øs he give ≈øufficient Security for the di≈øcharge of your ≈øaid Pari≈øh, to be allowed by us.

div.head: A Warrant to ≈øend a Wife and Child to her Husband.

body.head: To the Over≈øeers of the Poor of the Pari≈øh of B. in the ≈øaid County, and to every of them. 2 Ju≈øtices.
body.p: FOra≈ømuch as Complaint hath been by you made unto us, That C. the Wife of R. C. an Inhabitant of the Pari≈øh of B. in the County afore≈øaid, is lately come into your ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. and hath brought with her thither a Male Child of the ≈øaid R. and C. of the Age of, &c. or thereabouts; And that both the ≈øaid C. and Child are likely to be chargeable to your ≈øaid Pari≈øh, and you have thereupon craved from us ≈øuch Relief, touching the Premi≈ø≈øes, as is by Law appointed: The≈øe are therefore in his Maje≈øty's Name to authorize and appoint you, that you, ≈øome or one of you do convey the ≈øaid C. and Child to the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. and there to deliver them to the ≈øaid R. in ca≈øe you can there find him, to be with him ≈øetled according to Law; and in ca≈øe you cannot find him there, then to deliver the ≈øaid C. and Child to the Over≈øeers of the Poor of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. to be di≈øpo≈øed of according to Law.

div.head: A Warrant for apprehending one for returning to the Pari≈øh from which he was removed.

body.head: To the Con≈øtables and Bor≈øholders of the Hundred of in the ≈øaid County, and to every of them, and to the Keeper of the Hou≈øe of Correction, for the ≈øaid County at A. in the County afore≈øaid. 14 Car. 2. cap. 12. 1 Ju≈øtice.
body.p: WHereas R. C. in July la≈øt, legally ≈øetled as a, &c. in the Pari≈øh of F. came into the Pari≈øh of C. to ≈øettle in a Tenement there, under the yearly value of 10 l. and likely to be chargeable to the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, was upon Complaint thereof made by the Church-wardens and Over≈øeers of the Poor for the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, according to the Form of the Statute in that behalf made, by Warrant to the ≈øaid Church-wardens and Over≈øeers, according to the Statute afore≈øaid, directed, by them removed and conveyed to the afore≈øaid Pari≈øh of F. there to remain according to the ≈øaid Statute: Since which, the ≈øaid R. C. did return of his own accord to the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of C. from whence he was ≈øo removed: The≈øe are therefore in his Maje≈øty's Name to command you, that you, ≈øome or one of you, do cau≈øe the ≈øaid R. C. to come before us, ≈øome or one of us, at the Hou≈øe of, &c. called, &c. in the ≈øaid County, the 10th day of January next en≈øuing, at nine of the Clock in the Forenoon of the ≈øame day, to ≈øhew the cau≈øe why he returned to the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of C. and further to do and receive as to Ju≈øtice doth appertain. Hereof fail not at your perils.

div.head: A Warrant to pay Arrears, and continue weekly Relief to the Poor.

body.head: To the Church-wardens and Over≈øeers of the Poor for the Pari≈øh of B. and to every of them.
body.p: WHereas Complaint hath been made unto me by A. C. of your ≈øaid Town, That you R.C. and C. R. the now Over≈øeers of the Poor of your ≈øaid Pari≈øh, formerly paid unto the ≈øaid A. C. the Sum of two Shillings per Week, for and towards the maintenance of her ≈øelf and Children, and that you do now ≈øu≈øpend the payment thereof, whereby the ≈øaid A. C. is utterly di≈øabled to provide for her ≈øelf and Children: The≈øe are therefore in his Maje≈øty's Name to charge and command you the ≈øaid Over≈øeers, that pre≈øently upon ≈øight hereof, you, or ≈øome or one of you, pay unto the ≈øaid R. C. all ≈øuch Arrears as are become due, ≈øince your forbearing the payment thereof, and that you continue to pay her the former Allowances of two Shillings weekly for the future, or forthwith to ≈øhew cau≈øe why you refu≈øe to do ≈øo. And hereof, &c.

postscript.p:
THE Condition of this Obligation is ≈øuch, That whereas one R. C. is now lately come to inhabit and dwell within the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. and likely to be chargeable to the ≈øame; If therefore
the ≈øaid A. and B. or either of them, their or either of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, or every, or any of them, do and ≈øhall from time to time, and at all times hereafter fully and clearly acquit, di≈øcharge, ≈øave harmle≈øs and indempnifie, as well the within named C. and D. Church-wardens of the Pari≈øh Church of B. afore≈øaid, and the now Over≈øeers of the Poor of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh and their Succe≈ø≈øors, as al≈øo all the Inhabitants and Pari≈øhioners of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, which now are or at any time hereafter ≈øhall be there re≈øident, and every of them, of and from all, and all manner of Co≈øts and Charges, Payments, Taxes and Expences what≈øoever, which ≈øhall or may at any time hereafter in any manner ari≈øe, happen, come, grow due or be impo≈øed upon them or any of them, for or by rea≈øon or means of the ≈øaid R. C. his Wife or Children, or any of them, which ≈øhall be ≈øo re≈øiding, living or inhabiting in the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. and of, and from all Troubles, Charges and Demands what≈øoever concerning the ≈øame, That then this Obligation ≈øhall be void, or el≈øe ≈øhall ≈øtand and be in full force and virtue.
