opener.signed: We A. B. of, &c. and C. D. of, &c. the now Over≈øeers of the Poor, for the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B.

body.p:
Whereas there was a Ba≈øtard Child born within the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. begotten on the Body of one H. E. And whereas R. C. of, &c. is adjudged the reputed Father thereof,
And whereas it is agreed by and between the ≈øaid A. B. and C. D. and the re≈øt of the Inhabitants of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. and the ≈øaid R. C. That for and in con≈øideration of the Sum of 20 l. of lawful Mony of England, to be paid to us the Over≈øeers for the Poor by the ≈øaid R. C. We the ≈øaid Over≈øeers and our Succe≈ø≈øors, and the re≈øt of the Inhabitants of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. ≈øhould provide for, take care of and maintain the ≈øaid Child, and ≈øave harmle≈øs, and indempnifie the ≈øaid R. C. of and from the keeping and maintaining it, and of and from all Taxes, Charges and Payments, now already or hereafter to be taxed or charged upon the ≈øaid R. C. for or in re≈øpect thereof: Now know ye that we the ≈øaid A. B. and C. D. have according to, and in full of the ≈øaid Agreement had and received of the ≈øaid R. C. the Sum of 20 l. and do by and with the con≈øent and direction, and for and on the behalf of our ≈øelves, and the re≈øt of the Inhabitants of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. acquit, relea≈øe and for ever di≈øcharge him the ≈øaid R. C. from the ≈øaid Sum of 20 l. and from the keeping or maintaining the ≈øaid Child, and of, and from all Charges, Taxes and Payments, now or hereafter to be charged or taxed upon him the ≈øaid R. C. for or concerning the ≈øame.

div.head: An Indenture of an Apprentice put out by the Pari≈øh.

body.p:
THis Indenture made the, &c. Between R. C. and C. R. Churcwardens of the Pari≈øh of B. in the County of S. and J. F. and F. J. Over≈øeers of the Poor of the ≈øame Pari≈øh of B. of the one part, and R. R. of, &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid Churchwardens and Over≈øeers, by the a≈ø≈øent of his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace of the ≈øaid County, who≈øes Names are hereunto
written, according to the Form of the Statute, made in the 23d. year of the Reign of the late Queen Elizabeth, Intituled, An Act for the Relief of the Poor, Have put out and bound L. A. a poor Child of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh of B. Apprentice to the ≈øaid R. R. till the ≈øaid L. A. ≈øhall come to the Age of four and twenty years, during which time the ≈øaid Apprentice, his ≈øaid Ma≈øter well and faithfully ≈øhall ≈øerve, his Secrets keep, his Commandments lawful and hone≈øt every where, willingly ≈øhall do; He ≈øhall do no hurt nor damage to his ≈øaid Ma≈øter, nor con≈øent to be done by others, but to his power ≈øhall let the ≈øame, or give notice thereof to his ≈øaid Ma≈øter; He ≈øhall not wa≈øte the Goods of his ≈øaid Ma≈øter, nor lend them to any per≈øon without his con≈øent; He ≈øhall not frequent Taverns, Inns or Alehou≈øes, except it be in doing his ≈øaid Ma≈øters Bu≈øine≈øs there; He ≈øhall not during the ≈øaid Term play at Cards, Dice or other unlawful Games; He ≈øhall not either by day or night ab≈øent him≈øelf from his ≈øaid Ma≈øters Service; But in all things as a good and faithful Servant ≈øhall demean him≈øelf towards his ≈øaid Ma≈øter and all his: And the ≈øaid R. R. his ≈øaid Apprentice ≈øhall during the Term afore≈øaid, educate and bring up, or cau≈øe to be educated and brought up in his Trade, with due and rea≈øonable cha≈øti≈øement, and find and allow unto him during the ≈øaid Term ≈øufficient, whole≈øome and competent Meat, Drink Lodging, Wa≈øhing, Apparel, and all other nece≈ø≈øaries meet for ≈øuch an Apprentice; And in the end of the ≈øaid Term ≈øhall find, provice for and deliver unto his ≈øaid Apprentice double Apparel; That is to ≈øay, Apparel meet for him to have and wear, as well on the Lord's Day as on the Working-Days, both of Linen and Woollen, Ho≈øe, Shoes and all other nece≈ø≈øeries, meet for ≈øuch an Apprentice to have and wear;

closer.dateline:
In witne≈øs whereof the Parties
above ≈øaid to the≈øe pre≈øent Indentures, have hereunto interchangably ≈øet their Hands and Seals, the Day and Year above written.

div.head: A Certificate of a Man's Honesty.

body.p: WER. C. Mini≈øter of the word of God, in the Pari≈øh of B. in the ≈øaid County of S. C. R. of B. afore≈øaid, Con≈øtable of the Hundred of B. A. B. and C. D. Church wardens of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, &c. B. A. D. A. E.A. and A. E. of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, and mo≈øt of us Freeholders within the ≈øame, do hereby certifie to all whom it may concern, That F. R. one of the Inhabitants of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, of B. is, and by the ≈øpace of five years la≈øt pa≈øt, hath been a Hou≈øeholder within the ≈øaid Pari≈øh, and by all that time hath behaved him≈øelf, and lived in good ≈øort, and reputed a Man of hone≈øt Conver≈øation, and hath paid according to his degree all manner of Taxes and A≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øments, as other the Inhabitants of the ≈øaid Pari≈øh have done.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof we have hereunto ≈øet out Hands, the tenth day of December, Anno Dom. 1699.

div.head: The Examination of a Per≈øon Robbed on the High-way.

body.head: The Examination of R. C. of A. in the County of S. Gent. Taken before F. J. E≈øq; one of the Justices of Peace for the County of M. on the 10th day of December, Anno Dom. 1699. Oath.
body.p:
THIS Examinat depo≈øeth and ≈øaith, That as he was Riding on Monday the 9th day of December la≈øt pa≈øt from the Town of L. in the County of M. to W. in the ≈øame
County he was A≈ø≈øaulted in the Common Highway, leading from one of the ≈øaid Towns to the other, at or near a place there called B. at about nine of the Clock in the Forenoon of the ≈øame day by two Hor≈øe men, who there ≈øeized upon this Examinat, and pre≈øenting each of them a Pi≈øtol at him Bid him ≈øtand and deliver his Mony, which this Examinat for the ≈øaving of his Life was forced to do; And this Examinat further ≈øaith, That he is ≈øince informed that the ≈øaid place is in the Pari≈øh of C. and within the Hundred of E. in the ≈øaid County; And this Examinat further ≈øaith and depo≈øeth, that the ≈øaid Thieves did then and there Feloniou≈øly take from him, and Rob him of 20 l. in Mony, and four gold Watches, in all to the value of 138 l. And this Examinat further ≈øaith, that he then did not nor yet doth know the Parties that committed the ≈øaid Robbery, or either of them.

div.head: The Examination of a Per≈øon Robbed by three Men, one of whom he knew.

body.head: The Examination as before.
body.p:
R. C. of C. in the County of S. Gent. did on the pre≈øent 10th day of December in the 5th year of the Reign of, &c. per≈øonally come before me S. M. E≈øq; one of their Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace, for the ≈øaid County of S. Inhabiting, &c. and upon his Corporal Oath then taken before me did ≈øay, That about a Month ≈øince he was Riding from C. afore≈øaid, towards H. in the ≈øaid County of S. and in the High-way within the Pari≈øh of B. in the ≈øaid County of S. he was ≈øet upon by three
per≈øons and by them Robbed, and they took from him, &c. And he ≈øaith and depo≈øeth, that he doth know one of the≈øe per≈øons, and ≈øaith that his name is V. W. a Kenti≈øh Man, Born in, &c. and of the Age as he judges him of thirty years or thereabout, and the other he ≈øaith he knoweth not.

div.head: A Warrant for a Hue and Cry after a Felen.

body.head: Sir W. M. Knight, One of his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace for the ≈øaid County, To all Con≈øtables, Bor≈øholders and other his Maje≈øty's Officers, within the ≈øaid County or el≈øewhere, within the Realm of England, whom the Execution hereof may concern, Greeting. 1 Ju≈øt. 28 Ed. 3. cap. 11.
body.p:
VVHereas I have received information and charge again≈øt C. R. who is a per≈øon of Evil Fame, (de≈øcribing his Per≈øonage, Age and Apparel,) who is charged before me to have A≈ø≈øaulted, and taken from the per≈øon of J. F. on the 10th day of October la≈øt at, &c. One hundred, &c. (as in the Information) and he the ≈øaid C. R. is very much ≈øu≈øpected to have committed ≈øeveral other Felonies, and notwith≈øtanding ≈øeveral endeavours for the apprehen≈øion of him he hath not as yet been apprehended, but hath withdrawn him≈øelf and is fled; The≈øe are therefore in his Maje≈øty's Name to command you, and every of you to make diligent ≈øearch within your ≈øeveral Precincts for the ≈øaid C. R. and to make Huy and Cry after him from Town to Town, and from County to County, and that as well by Hor≈øe-men as Foot-men according to Law; And if you ≈øhall find the ≈øaid C. R. That then you do carry him before ≈øome one of his Maje≈øtie Ju≈øtices of the Peace, within the County or Place
where he ≈øhall be taken, to be dealt with according to Law.

closer.dateline: Given under my Hand and Seal, &c.

div.head: A Warrant to Search for one who hath Stollen a Gelding.

body.head: R. C. E≈øq; &c. (as in the next before.)
body.p: WHereas I have received information that a Grey Gelding about fourteen hands high, with a long tail and four white feet, aged about five years, being the Gelding of J. F. of, &c. was in the night of the 10th day of this In≈øtant December, Stollen out of his Land in C. afore≈øaid, and that he ≈øu≈øpecteth a per≈øon who≈øe name he knoweth not, being very Tall of Stature aged about five and twenty years, and in ≈øaddi≈øh coloured Cloaths lined with blew, to have Stollen this Gelding as afore≈øaid; The≈øe are therefore in his Maje≈øty's name to command you and every of you to make diligent Search within your ≈øeveral Precincts, for the Gelding and per≈øon afore≈øaid, And to make Huy and Cry after the ≈øaid per≈øon from Town to Town, and from County to County according to Law; And if upon your ≈øearch or otherwi≈øe, you ≈øhall find the ≈øaid Per≈øon or the Gelding afore≈øaid, or other ju≈øt cau≈øe of ≈øu≈øpicion, That then you carry the ≈øaid per≈øon, or other per≈øons ≈øu≈øpected before ≈øome one of his Maje≈øty's Ju≈øtices of the Peace of the County, or place where he or they ≈øhall be taken, to be dealt with according to Law. Hereof fail not at your perils;

div.head: An Indenture of a Copartner≈øhip between four, for Affairs Dome≈øtick and Foreign.

body.p: THIS Indenture Quadripartite made the, &c. between R. C. of, &c. of the fir≈øt part, C. R. of the ≈øecond part, J. F. of the third part, and F. J. of the fourth part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid Parties for the affiance, tru≈øt, and confidence which each of them hath, and doth repo≈øe in the other, Have concluded and agreed to become Copartners and Joint-traders together, in ≈øuch Trades and Merchandizing, as well within the Kingdom of England, as al≈øo in Holland and el≈øwhere in Parts beyond Sea, where the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall think fit to Trade and Merchandize for their mo≈øt benefit, advantage and profit; And that for and during the ≈øpace of five years, to be computed from the day of the date hereof, from thence next en≈øuing and fully to be compleat and ended.

And to that end and purpo≈øe, the ≈øaid Parties have added and put together a Joint-≈øtock, to be implied in and about the ≈øaid Joint-trade; That is to ≈øay, the Sum of 10000 l. of lawful Mony of England, viz. the ≈øaid R. C. for his part 2500 l. the ≈øaid. C. R. for his part, other 2500 l. The ≈øaid J. F. for his part 2500 l. and the ≈øaid F. J. 2500 l. more, being the Remainder of the ≈øaid 10000 l.

Which ≈øaid Stock ≈øhall be occupied and imploied together, upon an account of fourths both in profit and lo≈øs, The whole in four equal parts to be divided, whereof the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, is and are to have, and bear for his and their parts one fourth part thereof, both in profit and lo≈øs, The ≈øaid C. R. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, one other fourth part thereof, for his and their part both in profit and lo≈øs, The ≈øaid J. F. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, another
part thereof both in profit and lo≈øs, And the ≈øaid F. J. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, the other fourth part thereof, both in profit and lo≈øs, for his and their parts, according to the true intent and meaning hereof.

Which ≈øaid Tran≈øaction, Trade and Bu≈øine≈øs for the con≈øideration hereafter named, is to be done and performed as followeth; That is to ≈øay, The ≈øaid J. F. during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, to have the ≈øole receiving, keeping and charge of all the Ca≈øh and Mony, and of all the Cloaths, Bays and Stuffs, and of all the Bonds, Bills and Specialties belonging to the Joint account here in England; And of all Goods and Wares to be received from beyond the Seas, for and upon the ≈øaid Joint account; And al≈øo the charge of the Writing, true keeping and cu≈øtody of the Books to be kept here in England, touching the ≈øaid Joint account and bu≈øine≈øs in Copartner≈øhip, within the Dwelling-hou≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. in London, for the time being, And the puying of the ≈øaid Cloaths, Bays and Stuffs, and the ≈øelling of all Goods to be received from beyond the Seas, and the receiving of Monies, and the ordering and di≈øpo≈øing of them, and the other joint bu≈øine≈øs is to be equally acted and performed by the ≈øaid J. F. and C. R. And that the ≈øaid F. J. ≈øhall have the management and tran≈øaction of the Affairs relating to the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip and Joint-trade, which are to be managed, done and tran≈øacted in the Parts beyond the Seas.

Whereupon it is concluded and agreed, by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, And each and every of the ≈øaid Parties, by and for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, doth covenant and grant to and with each and every other of them, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents, as hereafter in manner and form
followeth. Fir≈øt, That the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip ≈øhall continue without cea≈øing, in form hereunder declared, from the day of the date hereof, until the full end and term of five years, from thence next en≈øuing and fully to be compleat and ended; And that every of the ≈øaid Copartners in the ≈øeveral bu≈øine≈ø≈øes before mentioned, to be by them ≈øeverally done and performed, and all other matters and things touching the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, ≈øhall and will from time to time to time during the ≈øaid five years, perform and do his and their be≈øt endeavour, care and diligence, for the mo≈øt and be≈øt profit, commodity and advantage of them the ≈øaid Copartners, And that each and every of them the ≈øaid Copartners ≈øhall be faithful, ju≈øt and true unto the other of them therein.

And that all Gains and Increa≈øes, happening or coming of, or by the ≈øaid Joynt-trade and Copartner≈øhip, ≈øhall be indifferently and equally parted and ≈øhared, by and between the ≈øaid parties, their Executors and Admini≈øtrators as is before pre≈øcribed and ≈øet down; And that all Debts, Charges and Lo≈ø≈øes likewi≈øe ari≈øing, happening and growing to be paid and born for or by rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Joint-trade and Copartner≈øhip, ≈øhall be in like manner paid, born and ≈øu≈øtained by and between the ≈øaid Parties, their Executors and Admini≈øtrators in four equal parts, as is before mentioned, and according to the true intent and meaning of the≈øe Pre≈øents.

And that every of the ≈øaid parties ≈øhall from time to time hereafter, perform and do his and their be≈øt endeavour, diligence and travel as need or occa≈øion ≈øhall require, to recover and obtain ≈øuch Debts, Duties, and Sum and Sums of Mony, as by rea≈øon or means of the ≈øaid Trade or Copartner≈øhip, ≈øhall be due or owing unto them, from any per≈øon or per≈øons ≈øo ≈øpeedily as may be
from time to time, And ≈øhall not at any time hereafter without con≈øent of the re≈øt, do or procure, or cau≈øe to be done or procured, any act, device or thing, to prejudice, hinder or retard the Recovery, obtaining or getting in of the ≈øaid Debts, or any of them.

And if it ≈øhall happen that the ≈øaid Parties or any of them ≈øhall tru≈øt or deliver out upon credit or confidence, any of the Goods, Wares, Mony or Merchandizes belonging to the ≈øaid Joint-account, to any per≈øon or per≈øons, whom any other of the ≈øaid Partners ≈øhall pray, warn or admoni≈øh not to tru≈øt, that then, and ≈øo often ≈øuch of them the ≈øaid Partners which ≈øhall ≈øo tru≈øt, and deliver out upon Credit any of the ≈øaid Goods, Wares, Monies or Merchandizes to any ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons, ≈øhall and will within three Months next en≈øuing, an≈øwer and ≈øatifie unto the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock, ≈øo much lawful Mony of England, as the Goods, Wares, Mony or Merchandi≈øe ≈øo to be tru≈øted or delivered out as afore≈øaid ≈øhall amount unto, (in ca≈øe, in the mean time full ≈øatisfaction ≈øhall not be made for the ≈øame, by the per≈øon or per≈øons which ≈øhall be ≈øo tru≈øted, afore≈øaid;) And that in ≈øuch ca≈øe, ≈øuch of the ≈øaid parties ≈øo making ≈øatisfaction therefore, ≈øhall and may have and enjoy the ≈øole benefit of the ≈øaid Goods, Wares, Monies and Merchandizes, or things ≈øo by him intru≈øted, and for which he ≈øhall have made ≈øatisfaction as afore≈øaid.

And that every of them the ≈øaid Parties, (if nece≈ø≈øity require and conveniently it may be) in all his and their buying and ≈øelling, dealings and doings, touching and concerning the ≈øaid Joint-trade, ≈øhall de≈øire and take the advice and direction of the re≈øt of the ≈øaid Parties, or ≈øome or one of them.

And that all ≈øuch Detriments and Lo≈ø≈øes, as ≈øhall without fraudulent practice of any of the ≈øaid Copartners, happen or come to the ≈øaid partible account by the fal≈øhood, ab≈øence or negligence of any Servant or Servants, Apprentice or Apprentices, or which ≈øhall ≈øerve or dwell with any of the ≈øaid Parties, ≈øhall be born and an≈øwered by the Ma≈øter of ≈øuch Servant or Servants, by whom the ≈øame ≈øhall be done or committed.

And further, that none of them the ≈øaid Parties ≈øhall or will at any time or times hereafter, charge the accompt of the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, with any other or more Debts, than only ≈øuch as ≈øhall be pertinent to the ≈øame; and with ≈øuch charge only as ≈øhall be nece≈ø≈øarily and ju≈øtly disbur≈øed, for and about ≈øuch Goods, Wares, Commodities and Merchandizes, as ≈øhall be occupied and imployed in or about the ≈øaid Joint-trade or Copartner≈øhip, and for and about the getting in, recovery and obtaining of ≈øuch Debts, as ≈øhall be due and owing unto them by rea≈øon thereof; nor at any time hereafter during the ≈øaid ≈øpace or time of five years, ≈øhall withdraw or take from the ≈øaid Joint-≈øtock and Accompt any Sum or Sums of Mony or other things, other than ≈øuch as ≈øhall be disbur≈øed for the recovery and getting in of ≈øuch Debts, as are incident to the ≈øame, as is before expre≈ø≈øed and mentioned, and that without Fraud or Covin.

Saving that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for every of them the ≈øaid Parties yearly, during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, to have and take out of the ≈øaid Stock belonging to their Joint-trade and Copartner≈øhip, for every of their particular and private Expences, and occa≈øions as followeth; (That is to ≈øay,) to the ≈øaid R. C. the Sum of 100 l. of lawful Mony of England, to the ≈øaid C. R. the like Sum of 100 l. To the ≈øaid J. F. the like Sum
of 100 l. And to the ≈øaid F. J. the like Sum of 100 l. of like lawful Mony of England, And ≈øaving al≈øo that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid J. F. during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip in re≈øpect of his Hou≈øe-Rent, wherein it is agreed one part of the bu≈øine≈øs of the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, ≈øhall be acted and performed here in England, and for the extraordinary pains of him and his Servants, to be taken and performed in and about the ≈øaid Joint-trade, and for his Expences upon and Entertainment of Clothiers yearly, to charge upon the ≈øaid partible account, and to be allowed yearly out of the ≈øame, the Sum of 80 l. of lawful Mony of England, over and be≈øides the ≈øaid 100 l. a year allowed unto him as afore≈øaid.

Saving al≈øo for the ≈øaid C. R. in re≈øpect of the extraordinary pains of him and his Servants, to be taken in and about the ≈øaid Joint-trade, and his Expences upon and Entertainment of Clothiers as afore≈øaid, and for his Hou≈øe-Rent, wherein it is agreed al≈øo, that one part of the Joint-bu≈øine≈øs afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be acted and performed to charge to the ≈øaid partible account, and be allowed upon the ≈øame the like Sum of 80 l. yearly, of like lawful Mony of England, during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, over and be≈øides the ≈øaid 100 l. yearly to him allowed as afore≈øaid.

And ≈øaving that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid F. J. in re≈øpect of his extraordinary pains to be taken in and about the ≈øaid Joint-bu≈øine≈øs, and for his dwelling in the parts beyond the Sea, where it is agreed he ≈øhall be imployed in and about the ≈øaid Joint-trade and bu≈øine≈øs, during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip there to charge to the ≈øaid partible account, and to be allowed the ≈øame here in England, the Sum of 50 l. yearly of like lawful Mony of England, during the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, over and above the ≈øaid 100 l. a year to him allowed sa afore≈øaid.

Al≈øo the Wages and Allowance, to or for any Servant or Servants to be ≈øent over, or to, or for any Apprentice or Apprentices, where any ≈øhall be ≈øent over and imployed in the ≈øaid bu≈øine≈øs into the parts beyond Sea, (an equal number of Apprentices of each of them, the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. J. F. and F. J. being imployed in the ≈øaid Joint-bu≈øine≈øs;) And al≈øo the charge of any Ware-hou≈øe or Warehou≈øes, to be taken or u≈øed beyond the Seas for the ≈øaid Joint-bu≈øine≈øs; And the Wages and Allowance of one Servant, agreed to be hired by the ≈øaid J. F. and C. R. for the managing and writing of the Books of Account, to be kept here in England, concerning the ≈øaid Joint trade and bu≈øine≈øs, is hereby agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, to be paid and allowed out of the Joint-Stock of this Copartner≈øhip.

And the ≈øaid F. J. for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and for every of them doth covenant and grant, to and with the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. and J. F. and every of them, their and every of their Executors and Admini≈øtrators, by the≈øe Pre≈øents in manner and form following; That is to ≈øay, That he the ≈øaid F. J. ≈øhall not nor will at any time or times during this Copartner≈øhip, leave, transfer or commit the Bu≈øine≈øs, Trade or Imployment, of or concerning the ≈øaid Joint-trade or Copartner≈øhip, in any place or places beyond the Seas, where he ≈øhall have full charge and di≈øpo≈øing, nor any Bills or Specialties concerning the ≈øame, to any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, other than ≈øuch as ≈øhall be thought fit by the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. and J. F. or the Survivors or Survivor of them, and their ≈øpecial con≈øent and agreement in Writing under their Hands in that behalf fir≈øt had and obtained.

by the ≈øaid parties to whom ≈øuch Debts are allotted, or their Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or their Coun≈øel learned in the Law be rea≈øonably devi≈øed, advi≈øed or required.

And it is expre≈øly conde≈øcended and granted by and between all the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, and each of them by and for him≈øelf, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant and grant to and with each and every of the other of them, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe Pre≈øents, in manner and form following, (that is to ≈øay) That no Right of Survivor≈øhip ≈øhall take place or effect, or be put in u≈øe in or for any matter or thing touching or concerning this Joint-trade again≈øt any of them, or any of their Executors or Admini≈øtrators, but that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for any of the ≈øaid parties, to leave, devi≈øe and bequeath in and by his la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament, all his ≈øaid part, portion and ≈øhare of and in the ≈øaid Stock and Gains according to ≈øuch dividend as is afore≈øaid, and the true intent and meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents.

And moreover, That if any ambiguity, doubt, que≈øtion or controver≈øie at any time hereafter ≈øhall happen, ari≈øe or grow between the ≈øaid parties, his or their Executors or Admini≈øtrators or any of them, for, touching or concerning the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip, or any matter or thing in the≈øe Pre≈øents contained, or otherwi≈øe how≈øoever touching the ≈øame, then and ≈øo often each and every of the ≈øaid parties, his Executors and Admini≈øtrators for his and their parts upon reque≈øt to each of them, his and their Executors or Admini≈øtrators to be made by the party or parties grieved, ≈øhall and will from time to time commit the hearing and deciding of ≈øuch ambiguity, doubt, que≈øtion or controver≈øie, to ≈øuch indifferent Men being Merchant Adventurers, as ≈øhall be named by the ≈øaid parties, (that is to
≈øay) each of them to name one, and ≈øhall and will ≈øtand to and abide ≈øuch Order and Determination therein, as by ≈øuch Men ≈øhall be made and ≈øet down in Writing under their Hands and Seals, within one Month next after any ≈øuch doubt, or controver≈øie ≈øo to them made known and referred.

And further it is concluded and agreed by and between the ≈øaid parties to tho≈øe Pre≈øents, and their true intent and meaning is, That none of the ≈øaid parties, nor the Executors or Admini≈øtrators of any of them ≈øhall at any time or times be charged or chargeable by virtue of the≈øe Pre≈øents, further than for his own proper Offence or breach of Covenant, and not for the Offence or breach of Covenant of any other of the ≈øaid parties, his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, any thing before mentioned notwith≈øtanding.

And la≈øtly it is agreed, That none of them the ≈øaid parties, nor any of their Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall or will at any time or times hereafter make, do, commit or omit to do any Act, Deed „Äà‚óä„Äâ Device what≈øoever, with an intent to defeat or make void in part or in all, the true intent and meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents.

div.head: An Indenture on Separation of Copartners.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. of the one part, and J. F. of the other part: Whereas the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents have been of late Copartners together in the Trade of, &c. and by rea≈øon of the ≈øaid Joint-trade and Dealing, divers Debts have become, and are due and owing unto the ≈øaid R. C. and J. F. for divers Goods and Wares. And al≈øo the ≈øaid R. C. and J. F. are and ≈øtand ingaged for divers Sums of Mony. And whereas al≈øo the ≈øaid Parties, for divers good Rea≈øons
them moving, have concluded and agreed to put an end to their Joint-trade and Copartner≈øhip; and the ≈øaid R. C. is contented and has agreed for the con≈øideration hereafter mentioned, to a≈ø≈øign unto the ≈øaid J. F. all the Debts and Sums of Mony which are due and owing unto them the ≈øaid R. C. and J. F. jointly. And the ≈øaid J. F. hath likewi≈øe agreed and undertaken to di≈øcharge and pay all Debts and Sums of Mony which they the ≈øaid R. C. and J. F. do jointly owe to any per≈øon or per≈øons, for or by rea≈øon of their ≈øaid Joint trade or Copartner≈øhip.

Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid R. C. for the con≈øideration hereafter in the≈øe pre≈øents mentioned, doth grant, a≈ø≈øign and ≈øet over unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, all and ≈øingular ≈øuch Debts and Sums of Mony as are owing to him the ≈øaid R. C. ≈øeverally or jointly with the ≈øaid J. F. for or concerning their Joint trade afore≈øaid, and all his Right, Title, Intere≈øt, Property, Claim and Demand what≈øoever in and to the ≈øaid Debts or any of them: And al≈øo all and ≈øingular Bills, Bonds, Specialties and Writings what≈øoever, for and concerning the ≈øaid Debts and the late Copartner≈øhip between them; All which ≈øaid Debts are mentioned and expre≈ø≈øed in a certain Schedule hereunto annexed, To have, hold and enjoy all and every the ≈øaid Debts, Specialties and Writings unto the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, to his and their own proper u≈øe and behoof, without any manner of account therefore to be given to him the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns.

And the ≈øaid R. C. doth by the≈øe pre≈øents give and grant to the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, full power and authority to ask, levy, recover and receive in the name of the
≈øaid R. C. by all ≈øuch lawful ways and means as ≈øhall be thought requi≈øite by the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Debts and Sums of Mony expre≈ø≈øed in the ≈øaid Schedule, for and to the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, without any account to be made, had or given for the ≈øame or any part therof.

And further, That if he the ≈øaid R. C. or his A≈ø≈øigns, or any per≈øon or per≈øons by virtue of any power or authority derived from him or them, have at any time heretofore received, relea≈øed or di≈øcharged any of the ≈øaid Debts or Sums of Mony mentioned in the Schedule (other than ≈øuch Sums of Mony as have been relea≈øed by the con≈øent of the ≈øaid J. F.) That then upon notice given by the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns to the ≈øaid R. C. his, &c. he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall within twenty days next after ≈øuch notice given to the ≈øaid R. C. or his, &c. ≈øatisfie and recompence the ≈øaid J. F. or his, &c. for the ≈øame, without Fraud or Covin.

And that he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall not at any time or times hereafter willingly do or ≈øuffer any Act or Thing to hinder, let or di≈øturb him the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns in the Recovery, getting in or obtaining the ≈øaid Debts or any of them.

And moreover, That he the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will upon rea≈øonable reque≈øt to him or them made by the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, make, ≈øeal and deliver to him or them ≈øuch other ≈øufficient Letter or Letters of Attorney for the recovery and getting in of the ≈øaid Debts and Sums of Mony, as by the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators
or A≈ø≈øigns, or his or their Coun≈øel learned in the Law ≈øhall be rea≈øonably devi≈øed, advi≈øed or required.

In con≈øideration whereof the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf his Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant, promi≈øe and grant to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators in manner and form following, (that is to ≈øay) That he the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will, at or before the, &c. procure and obtain to and for the ≈øaid R.C. his Executors, or Admini≈øtrators ≈øufficient general Relea≈øes and other Di≈øcharges in Law from all Creditors, who≈øe Names are in the Schedule hereunto annexed.

And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid J. F. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators ≈øhall and will at all times for ever hereafter, ≈øave and keep harmle≈øs and indempnified the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, again≈øt all and every per≈øon and per≈øons what≈øoever, to whom they the ≈øaid R. C. and J. F. or either of them are indebted touching or concerning their ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip; and of and from all Actions, Suits, Co≈øts, Damages, Charges, Judgments, Executions and Demands what≈øoever, which ≈øhall at any time hereafter ari≈øe and come again≈øt the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or any of his or their Lands, Tenements, Goods or Chatels or any part thereof, for or by rea≈øon of any Debts or Sums of Mony owing, or for or by rea≈øon of any Bill, Bond, Specialty, Promi≈øe or Contract touching the ≈øaid Copartner≈øhip.

div.head: An Indenture where two Apprentices having taken their Ma≈øter's Shop, covenant with his Executors to gather in his Debts.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. and C. R. Executors of A. B. &c. and J. F, and F. J. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. in part of the performance of the la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament of the ≈øaid A. B. and for divers other good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations them hereunto moving, have demi≈øed, granted and to farm let, and do by the≈øe pre≈øents demi≈øe, grant and to farm let unto the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. all that the Dwelling-hou≈øe and Shop of the ≈øaid A. B. To have and to hold the ≈øaid, &c. with all and every the Appurtenances to them the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, from the Fea≈øt-day of St. Michael la≈øt pa≈øt, for, during and until the full end and term of five years, fully to be compleat and ended, Yielding and paying therefore yearly and every year during the ≈øaid Term unto the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. their, &c. the Sum of forty pounds of lawful Mony of England, at the four mo≈øt u≈øual Fea≈øts or Terms of the year, (that is to ≈øay, &c.) by even and equal portions. And the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. for them≈øelves jointly and ≈øeverally, and for their and every of their Executors and Admini≈øtrators do by the≈øe pre≈øents covenant, promi≈øe and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. and either of them, their and either of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns in manner and form following, (that is to ≈øay) That they the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. and either of them ≈øhall endeavour by all lawful means, without Suit at Law, to the utmo≈øt of their power, to obtain, get in and come
by all ≈øuch Debt and Debts as were and are ≈øtill owing from or by any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, to the ≈øaid A. B. at the time of his decea≈øe, for any Wares or Merchandizes which did belong to the ≈øaid A. B. or any otherwi≈øe how≈øoever. And that they the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. or one of them, their or one of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall once in a Month give a true Account of any Sum or Sums of Mony by them, or either, or any of them received in part or in full of any of the ≈øaid Debts to them the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns: And thereof ≈øhall forthwith make payment to them the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. or one of them, or one of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns without Fraud or Covin.

And al≈øo that neither they the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. nor either of them, nor their or either of their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall take or receive ≈øatisfaction or payment for any Goods or Wares by them or any of them ≈øold to any Chapman or Cu≈øtomer of the ≈øaid A. B. decea≈øed, before ≈øuch Chapman or Cu≈øtomer ≈øhall have fully ≈øatisfied and payed all ≈øuch Debts as were owing from him or them at the time of his decea≈øe to the ≈øaid A. B. (all Chapmen and Cu≈øtomers of the ≈øaid A. B. dwelling within the City of London and Suburbs thereof only excepted.)

div.head: A ≈øhort Bargain and Sale of Coppice-Woods, where the price is partly paid in hand, and the re≈øidue to be paid after.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between N. C. of the City of C. in the County of S. Gent. of the one part, and I. C. of E. A. in the ≈øame County Yeoman, of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth; That the ≈øaid N. C. for and in con≈øideration of, &c. lawful Mony of England, to him by the ≈øaid I. C. before the ≈øealing and delivery hereof, well and truly in hand paid, and five pound and ten ≈øhillings more to be paid in ≈øuch manner as is therein after mentioned, hath granted, bargained and ≈øold, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth grant, bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid I. C. all tho≈øe Coppice-Woods and Under-woods, ≈øtanding and growing, or being upon a parcel of Coppice-Ground called Z. containing by e≈øtimation three Acres in W. A. in the ≈øaid County of S. Except, and always re≈øerved out of this Grant all Timber Trees, and other Trees ≈øtanding, growing, or being in the ≈øaid Coppice-Ground, and all young Sellows there left at the la≈øt Felling of the ≈øaid Coppice, about eleven years ago, And except the Wood, Boughs and Loppings of ≈øuch Trees and Sellows, And al≈øo except and re≈øerved out of this Grant all the Hedges about the ≈øaid Coppice-Ground, and all Wood-Frith and Stuff therein growing or being; And all Coppice-Woods, Under-woods, Frith and Stuff growing or being within four foot of any the Inward Standards of the ≈øaid Hedge, round about the ≈øaid Coppice Ground; And the ≈øaid N. C. for the con≈øideration afore≈øaid, doth hereby give and grant unto the ≈øaid I. C. his A≈ø≈øigns and Servants full Liberty of Ingre≈øs, Egre≈øs and Regre≈øs, by the u≈øual
way and pa≈ø≈øage into and from the ≈øaid Coppice-Ground, to fell and cut down the ≈øaid Coppice-Woods, and Under-woods, hereby bargained and fold before the _____ day of _____ next coming, and the ≈øame to have take and carry away with Carts and Carriages, before the four and twentith day of June next coming; And the ≈øaid J. C. doth hereby covenant with the ≈øaid N. C. That he the ≈øaid J. C. or his A≈ø≈øigns, Servants, Agents or Workmen, ≈øhall not and will not fell, cut or lop any of the ≈øaid Trees, or Sellows in the ≈øaid Coppice Grounds, nor any of the Hedges afore≈øaid, or the Wood, Frith or Stuff therein growing or being, nor any of the Coppice Wood, Under-wood, Frith or Stuff growing or being within four foot of any of the Inward Standards of the ≈øaid Hedges; And that he or they ≈øhall not permit, or ≈øuffer any of the Hor≈øes, or Bea≈øts of the Carts or Carriages afore≈øaid, to eat, crop, or bite any of the Sprouts or young Germins in the ≈øaid Coppice-Ground, And the ≈øaid J. F. doth hereby further covenant with the ≈øaid N. C. That he the ≈øaid J. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will, well and truly pay unto the ≈øaid N. C. his Executors or Admini≈øtrators the afore≈øaid 5 l. and 10 s. on the Nine and twentieth Day of September next coming; And al≈øo that it may and ≈øhall be lawful to and for the ≈øaid N. C. and his A≈ø≈øigns, to have and take to and for his and their own u≈øe all ≈øuch of the Coppice-Woods, and Underwoods, hereby bargained or ≈øold, and of the Poles, Fagots and Stuff thereof coming which ≈øhall be, or remain on the Coppice-Ground afore≈øaid, on the ≈øaid 24th Day of June.

div.head: A Bargain and Sale of Trees and Coppice-Woods, with Covenant to be ≈øaved harmle≈øs from Tithes, and other ≈øpecial Covenants.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between Sir J. R. Knight, &c. of the one part, and W. F. &c. of, the other part, Witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid Sir J.R. for and in con≈øideration of 380 l. of lawful Mony of England, to him by the ≈øaid W. F. before the en≈øealing and delivery hereof, well and truly in hand paid, Hath granted, bargained and ≈øold, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents doth grant, bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid W. F. All the Woods, Under-woods and Trees now ≈øtanding growing, and being in or upon All that parcel of Wood-Land called the Ea≈øt part of, &c. as it is now ≈øet out to be ≈øold, containing One hundred and fifteen Acres more or le≈øs, now or late in the Occupation of R. K. or his A≈ø≈øigns, and lying and being in the Pari≈øh of E. in the County of S. Except, and always re≈øerved out of this pre≈øent Grant unto the ≈øaid Sir J. F. and his A≈ø≈øigns, fifteen hundred of the be≈øt Trees of Oak, A≈øh, Beech, now growing and being upon the afore≈øaid Wood-Land, to be marked and ≈øigned out by F. P. and W. C. or either of them, for and on the behalf of the ≈øaid Sir J. R. And the ≈øaid Sir J. R. for the con≈øideration afore≈øaid, hath given and granted, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth give and grant unto the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, for his and their Servants, Laborers and Workmen, with all Carts, Wains, Carriages, Working-Tools and Implements, free and quiet Liberty of Ingre≈øs, Egre≈øs, and Regre≈øs, in by and through all u≈øual or rea≈øonable Ways or Pa≈ø≈øages for and duing the Term of three Years next en≈øuing the Date hereof, to fell, cut down, hue, cut
out, convert, load, have take and carry away, to and for their own u≈øe, All the ≈øaid Woods, Under-woods and Trees, before in the≈øe pre≈øents mentioned, to be bargained and ≈øold, and all the Wood and Stuff thereof, or of any part thereof, concerning, ari≈øeing, or increa≈øing; And the ≈øaid Sir J. R. hath al≈øo for the con≈øideration afore≈øaid, given and granted and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth give and grant unto the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, one Lime-Kill, and one Chalk-Pit, to be made, u≈øed and enjoyed by the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, upon the ≈øaid parcel of Wood-Land before mentioned, for and during the afore≈øaid Term of Three Years next en≈øuing the Date hereof; And that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, for and during the ≈øaid three years to build and make the ≈øaid Lime-Kill upon the Land afore≈øaid, in ≈øuch convenient place as by the ≈øaid F. P. and W. C. or either of them ≈øhall be A≈ø≈øigned, upon reque≈øt, And in default of ≈øuch A≈ø≈øignment, then in ≈øuch convenient place upon the Land afore≈øaid, as to the ≈øaid W. F. or his A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall ≈øeem meet; And al≈øo during tho≈øe three years to Dig Chalk in the ≈øaid Chalk-pit, and the ≈øame Chalk to burn and make into Lime in the ≈øaid Lime-Kill; And the ≈øaid Lime-Kill to convert and di≈øpo≈øe to the proper u≈øe of the ≈øaid W. F. And the ≈øaid Sir J. R. doth for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators covenant and grant to, and with the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents; That he the ≈øaid Sir J. R. now hath at the time of making, ≈øealing and delivering of the≈øe pre≈øents, good right, full power, lawful and rightful Authority, Title and Intere≈øt to grant, bargain and ≈øeil the ≈øaid Woods, Under-woods and Trees before in the≈øe pre≈øents mentioned unto the ≈øaid W. F.
in manner and form afore≈øaid; And Al≈øo, That he the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtratoas and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall or lawfully may during the afore≈øaid three years, peaceably and quietly Fell, cut down, have, hold, take and convert the ≈øaid Woods, Under-woods and Trees before in the≈øe pre≈øents mentioned, to be bargained and ≈øold, and al≈øo the liberty of Ingre≈øs Egre≈øs and Regre≈øs, before in the≈øe pre≈øents granted concerning the ≈øame, without any Let, Trouble, Interruption or Contradiction, of or by the ≈øaid Sir J. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, and without any lawful let, trouble interruption or contradiction, of, or by any other Per≈øon or Per≈øons what≈øoever; And al≈øo that the ≈øaid Woods, Underwoods and Trees before in the≈øe pre≈øents mentioned to be Bargained and ≈øold, and every part thereof, are and ≈øhall be Exempted priviledged and Di≈øcharged of, and from the payment of Tythes thereof, upon the Felling or converting the ≈øame; And al≈øo, That he the ≈øaid Sir J. R. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall and will from time to time, and at all times hereafter acquit di≈øcharge and ≈øave harmle≈øs the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, of, and from the payment of Tythes for the ≈øaid Woods, Under-woods, and Trees or any part thereof, and of and from all Expences, Co≈øts, Charges and Damages, for, or by occa≈øion of any Action or Suit, to be brought again≈øt him, for or concerning the ≈øaid Tythes; And the ≈øaid W. F. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, doth covenant and grant, to and with the ≈øaid Sir J. R. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe pre≈øents; That the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, or any of them, ≈øhall not fell or cut down any of the Woods, Underwoods or Trees before in the≈øe pre≈øents, bargained
or ≈øold, between the fir≈øt day of May, and the twentieth day of September, in ‚Ä¢ ny of the ≈øaid three years next coming; And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will before the fir≈øt Day of July, in every of the faid three years, avoid and carry away from the Woody part of the afore≈øaid Wood-Land, into the Plaits there, all the Under-woods and Trees, which ≈øhall before ≈øuch fir≈øt day of July, be Felled or cut down in the ≈øaid Woody parts; And al≈øo, That he the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall not during the ≈øaid three years commit or do any wilful hurt, ≈øpoil or damage, to the young Germins ari≈øing or growing, up in the ≈øaid Wood-Lands, after the Felling the Woods, Under-woods and Trees, there now growing or being, or any part thereof; And al≈øo, That the ≈øaid Sir J. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall or lawfully may at any time or times during the ≈øaid three years, cut and take upon the ≈øaid Wood-lands ≈øufficient Stakes, and ≈øufficient of the be≈øt Bu≈øhes there to be had, for the new making, repairing, and inclo≈øing the outer Hedges and Fences belonging to the ≈øaid Wood-land, and for the making any other new Fences, or Inclo≈øures in the ≈øaid Wood-land, and between ≈øuch parcel thereof, where the Woods and Trees ≈øhall in any year be felled and cut down, and ≈øuch parcel thereof, where the Woods or Trees ≈øhall then yet be ≈øtanding, which la≈øt mentioned partition Fences, the ≈øaid Sir, J. R. doth hereby covenant, that it ≈øhall be lawful for the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, after the fir≈øt two years of the ≈øaid three year, to pull up, take and convert to their own u≈øe; And the ≈øaid W. F. doth further for him≈øelf, his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid Sir J. R. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by
the≈øe pre≈øents, that he the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will from time to time, give notice unto the ≈øaid F. P. and W. C. or one of them, of ≈øuch particular Plot or parcel of the Woods, Underwoods and Trees before mentioned, as the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall from time to time then next intend to fell or cut down; To the intent the ≈øaid F. P. and W. C. may mark and ≈øign out ≈øo many of the Trees in ≈øuch Plot or parcel growing as they ≈øhall ≈øee mo≈øt fit, of the afore≈øaid Fifteen hundred Trees excepted out of this pre≈øent bargain and ≈øale; And al≈øo, that if any Action or Suit ≈øhall at any time hereafter be brought again≈øt the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, for not ≈øetting out of Tithes of the afore≈øaid Woods, and if the ≈øaid Sir J. R. or his A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall from time to time, di≈øcharge and ≈øave harmle≈øs the ≈øaid W. F. from the payment of all and every expences, co≈øts and charges, for or by occa≈øion of any ≈øuch Action or Suit, That then the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will permit and ≈øuffer the ≈øaid Sir J. R. and his A≈ø≈øigns, to make defence in ≈øuch Actions or Suits, in ≈øuch manner as he and they ≈øhall think fit, and that the ≈øaid W. F. his Executors Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall not fraudulently or willingly permit, or ≈øuffer any Judgment, or Decree to be had or given again≈øt them in ≈øuch Actions or Suits, nor make any Compo≈øition or Agreements, with the Plaintiff in ≈øuch Actions or Suits.

div.head: A Lea≈øe for years of Tythes.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made the _____ day of _____ in the _____ year of the Reign of our Sovereign Lord William by the Grace of God King of England, Scotland, France and Ireland, Defender of the Faith, &c. Between H. E. of Chidham in the County of Su≈ø≈øex Gent. of the one part, and T. B. of the City of Chichester in the ≈øaid County, Baker, of the other part, witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid H. E. hath demi≈øed, granted and to farm let unto the ≈øaid T. B. all the Tithes both great and ≈ømall, of what≈øoever nature, kind or quality which ≈øhall, during the Term hereby granted, ari≈øe, come, grow, renew, increa≈øe or happen in, upon or out of all tho≈øe ≈øeveral Clo≈øes or parcels of Land containing together about ≈øixty Acres, ≈øometimes the Lands of J. L. Gent. and now in the Occupation of the ≈øaid T. B. in the Tithing of Old Fi≈øhborn within the Pari≈øh of Bo≈øham, To have and to hold all and ≈øingular the Tithes before herein mentioned to be demi≈øed unto the ≈øaid T. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns from the Fea≈øt of St. Michael the Archangel la≈øt pa≈øt, before the date hereof, for, during and until the full end and term of ten years from thenceforth next en≈øuing, fully to be compleat or ended: If _____ or either of them ≈øhall ≈øo long live, Yielding and paying therefore yearly and every year during the ≈øaid Term hereby granted unto the ≈øaid H. E. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns two ≈øhillings for every Acre of the ≈øaid Land in ≈øuch years, wherein it ≈øhall be ≈øown with Corn or Grain, and ≈øo proportionably for a greater or le≈ø≈øer quantity than one Acre as ≈øhall be ≈øo ≈øown. And al≈øo yielding and paying one ≈øhilling and ≈øix pence for every Acre of the ≈øaid Land in the next two years after which it
≈øhall be ≈øown with Clover, St. Foin, Hop-gra≈øs or other like Gra≈øs-Seed, and ≈øo proportionably for a greater or le≈øs quantity than one Acre as ≈øhall be ≈øo ≈øown. And al≈øo yielding and paying one ≈øhilling for every Acre of the ≈øaid Land in ≈øuch years wherein it ≈øhall be un≈øown or otherwi≈øe laid up for Pa≈øture or feeding, and ≈øo proportionably for greater or le≈øs quantity than one Acre un≈øown, or otherwi≈øe laid up for Pa≈øture or Feeding, at the Fea≈øt of St. Michael the Archangel yearly to be paid, except ≈øuch Land as ≈øhall be Summer fallowed for Wheat, for which nothing ≈øhall be paid in ≈øuch year of Summer fallowing. And the ≈øaid T. B. doth for him≈øelf his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid H. E. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid T. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and will yearly and every year during the continuance of the Term hereby granted, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid H. E. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, all and every the yearly Rent and Rents before in the≈øe Pre≈øents re≈øerved to be paid at the days and times before herein limited for payment thereof, according to the true intent and meaning of the≈øe Pre≈øents without Fraud or delay. And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid H. E. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, and his and their Servants ≈øhall or lawfully may from time to time and at all times ≈øea≈øonable, during the Term hereby granted, enter into and upon the ≈øeveral Clo≈øes or parcels of Land before mentioned, to admea≈øure the ≈øame, and to view and ≈øee what Corn, Grain and Gra≈øs ≈øhall be there growing. Provided always, and it is agreed between the parties to this Indenture by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That if the ≈øaid H. F his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall be minded at any time, during the Term hereby granted, to renew the Lea≈øe whereby the Tithes afore≈øaid are holden of
the Dean and Chapter of the Cathedral Church of the Holy Trinity of Chiche≈øter, And for the better doing thereof ≈øhall be minded that this pre≈øent Indenture of Lea≈øe, and the Term hereby granted, ≈øhall cea≈øe and be void: Then if the ≈øaid H. E. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall make and give unto the ≈øaid T. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns good and ≈øufficient Security, That the ≈øaid H. E. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns within forty days next after ≈øuch new Lea≈øe ≈øhall be had and taken of and from the ≈øaid Dean and Chapter ≈øhall and will ≈øign, ≈øeal and as their Act and Deed deliver unto the ≈øaid T. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns a new Lea≈øe of the Tithes hereby demi≈øed, for and during the re≈øidue of the time and Term of years hereby granted, as ≈øhall be then to come and unexpired, under and upon the ≈øame Rents, Covenants, Conditions, Provi≈øoes and Agreements in this pre≈øent Indenture of Lea≈øe compri≈øed, And that the ≈øaid T. B. his Heirs, Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, until ≈øuch new Lea≈øe ≈øhall be made, ≈øealed and delivered unto them as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall hold and enjoy the ≈øaid Tithes under the ≈øame Rents, Covenants and Agreements, as are herein contained, That then and from thence forth, and at all times after this pre≈øent Indenture of Lea≈øe and the Term of years hereby granted, ≈øhall cea≈øe, determine and be utterly void and of none effect, any thing herein contained to the contrary notwith≈øtanding. And it is further agreed, that the ≈øaid T. B. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall upon reque≈øt ≈øeal and execute the Counterpart of ≈øuch new Lea≈øe to them made as afore≈øaid.

div.head: A Bargain and Sale of Goods di≈øtrained for Rent.

body.p:
THIS Indenture, &c. Between N. C. of, &c. J. R. Con≈øtable of the Hundred of, &c. D. C. of, &c. J. F. &c. and H. R. of, &c. of the one part, and J. S. of, &c. T. S. &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That it is affirmed by the ≈øaid N. C. and te≈øtified by the ≈øaid D. C. upon his Oath ≈øworn before the ≈øaid Con≈øtable, that on the 29th day of September la≈øt pa≈øt, before the date hereof, the ≈øaid N. C. in the pre≈øence of the ≈øaid D. C. did enter into a Me≈ø≈øuage and Lands called S. Farm in H. within the Hundred afore≈øaid, and for 155 l. of Rent at the Fea≈øt of the Annunciation of the Ble≈ø≈øed Mary la≈øt pa≈øt, due unto him as he ≈øaid from S. F. upon a Demi≈øe, whereby the ≈øaid S. F. held the ≈øaid Farm of the ≈øaid N. C. did di≈øtrain there found the Goods and Chattels following, (to wit) [recite the particulars]: And it is further te≈øtified by the ≈øaid D. C. and al≈øo by the ≈øaid J. F. and H. R. upon their Oaths ≈øworn before the ≈øaid Con≈øtable, that after ≈øuch Di≈øtre≈øs taken, (to wit) on the 29th day of December la≈øt pa≈øt, the ≈øaid N. C. did at the chief Man≈øion-hou≈øe of the ≈øaid Farm, give publick notice of the ≈øaid Di≈øtre≈øs, and the Cau≈øe thereof, and a Note thereof in Writing, expre≈ø≈øing the particulars of the ≈øaid Goods and Chattels di≈øtrained, and of the ≈øaid Rent for which the ≈øame were di≈øtrained, did then and there deliver unto E. Daughter of the ≈øaid S. F. And the ≈øaid D. C. J. F. and H. R. upon their Oath afore≈øaid, have truly apprai≈øed all the ≈øaid Goods and Chattels di≈øtrained at 90 l. and ≈øay upon their ≈øaid Oaths, that all the ≈øaid Goods and Chattels according to the be≈øt of their Unde≈øtandings, are not worth more than 90 l. And this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid Goods and Chattels being yet unreplevied,
the ≈øaid N. C. with the Con≈øtable afore≈øaid, for and in con≈øideration of 90 l. being the be≈øt price can be gotten for the ≈øaid Goods and Chattels by the ≈øaid J. S. and T. S. paid to the ≈øaid N. C. towards ≈øatisfaction of the ≈øaid Rent of 155 l. for which the ≈øaid Goods and Chattels were di≈øtrained, Have bargained and ≈øold, and by the≈øe Pre≈øents do bargain and ≈øell unto the ≈øaid J. S. and T. S. all the ≈øaid Goods and Chattels before herein mentioned to be di≈øtrained as afore≈øaid; To hold unto the ≈øaid J. S. and T. S. as their only proper Goods and Chattels for ever.

div.p: Note, It is be≈øt to make ≈øo many Parties, for the more ea≈øie proving afterwards, (if occa≈øion ≈øhould be) the regularity of the Proceedings.

div.head: A Settlement by Lea≈øe and Relea≈øe, on con≈øideration of a Marriage intended of Lands, (which the Hu≈øband hath in Rever≈øion after a Tenant for Life) to the Wife for her Joynture, with an Entail to the I≈ø≈øue between them.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made the 7th day of Augu≈øt, 1656. Between W. P. of the City of, &c. in the County of S. Gent. of the one part, and J. F. of C. in the ≈øaid County of S. Gent. and J. C. of E. in the ≈øaid County of S. Gent. of the other part; Whereas a Marriage is intended by the Grace of God, to be ≈øhortly hereafter had and ≈øolemnized between the ≈øaid W. P. and E. C. of C. afore≈øaid Widow, Si≈øter of the ≈øaid I. F. Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth; That in con≈øideration of the ≈øaid Marriage ≈øo to be had, and for the ≈øetling of a competent Jointure and provi≈øion for the ≈øaid E. C. out of the Lands and Hereditaments of the ≈øaid W. P. in ca≈øe ≈øhe ≈øhall ≈øurvive him, in Bar of her Dower, and Thirds at the Common Law, And for other con≈øiderations him moving, he the ≈øaid W. P. hath granted, relea≈øed and confirmed; And by the≈øe Pre≈øents for him and his Heirs, doth clearly and ab≈øolutely grant, relea≈øe and confirm unto the ≈øaid J. F. and J. C. their Heir and A≈ø≈øigns, all that Farm, and all the Lands and Tenements, ≈øituate lying and being in the Pari≈øhes, Fields, Villages and Hamlets of C. and I. in the ≈øaid County of S. now or late in the Tenure or Occupation of M. D. Widow, or of G. C. her Under-Tenant, or either of them; And all Woods, Under-Woods, Ways,
Waters, Commons, Heaths, Wa≈øts, Moors, Mar≈øhes, and Profits and Commodities what≈øoever, to the ≈øaid Farm and Premi≈ø≈øes belonging or in any wi≈øe appertaining And the Rever≈øion and Rever≈øions, Remainder and Remainders of all and ≈øingular the Premi≈ø≈øes, and of every part and parcel thereof; And all Rents Services and Profits thereunto incident and belonging of all which Premi≈ø≈øes hereby granted, or mentioned to be granted, the ≈øaid J. F. and J. C. are now in full Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion by force and virtue of a Bargain and Sale thereof, to them made by the ≈øaid W. P. for the Term of a year from the fir≈øt day of this in≈øtant Augu≈øt, by Indenture bearing date the day next before the day of the date hereof, and by force and vertue of the Statute for transferring U≈øes into Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion; And the ≈øaid W. P. doth further by the≈øe Pre≈øents, for the con≈øideration afore≈øaid, grant, relea≈øe and confirm unto the ≈øaid J. F. and J. C. their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, All the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt, Claim and Demand what≈øoever, of him the ≈øaid W. P. of, in and to the Premi≈ø≈øes, and every part and parcel thereof: To have and to hold the ≈øaid Farm, Lands, Tenements, Hereditaments, and all and ≈øingular other the Premi≈ø≈øes hereby granted and relea≈øed, or mentioned to be granted and relea≈øed with their and every of their Appurtenances unto the ≈øaid J. F. and J. C. their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, to the ≈øeveral u≈øes, behoofs, intents and purpo≈øes herein after mentioned, expre≈ø≈øed and declared, and to none other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoever; That it is ≈øay, to the u≈øe and behoof of the faid W. P. and his Heirs, until the ≈øaid Marriage, and from and after the ≈øaid Marriage had, then to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid W. P. for and during the Term of his natural Life, without Impeachment, of, or for any manner of Wa≈øt, and from and immediately after
his decea≈øe, To the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid E. C. for and during all the Term of her natural Life for, and in the Name of her Joynture, and in full recompence, lieu and ≈øatisfaction of all the Dower which ≈øhe may, or otherwi≈øe might have, claim or challenge in all or any the Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments of the ≈øaid W. P. her intended Husband, And from, and immediately after the decea≈øe of the Survivor of them, the ≈øaid W, and E. To the u≈øe and behoof of the fir≈øt Son of the ≈øaid W. P. on the Body of the ≈øaid E. to be begotten, and the Heirs of the Body of ≈øuch fir≈øt Son lawfully to be begotten; And for default of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, To the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øecond Son of the ≈øaid W. P. on the Body of the ≈øaid E. to be begotten, and the Heirs of the Body of ≈øuch ≈øecond Son lawfully to be begotten; And for default of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, To the u≈øe and behoof of the third Son of the ≈øaid W. P. on the Body of the ≈øaid E. to be begotten, and the Heirs of the Body of ≈øuch third Son lawfully to be begotten; And for default of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, To the u≈øe and behoof of the foruth, fifth, ≈øixth, ≈øeventh, and all and every other the Son and Sons of the ≈øaid W. P. on the Body of the ≈øaid E. to be begotten, ≈øeverally and ≈øucce≈ø≈øively one after another, in order and cour≈øe as they ≈øhall be in order and Seniority of Age, and Priority of Birth, and the ≈øeveral Heirs of their ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Bodies lawfully to be begotten, the Elder of the ≈øaid Sons and the Heirs of his Body being always preferred before the Younger, and the Heirs of their Bodies; And for default of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, To the u≈øe and behoof of all the Daughters of the ≈øaid W. P. on the Body of the ≈øaid E. to be begotten, as Tenants in Common, and not as Joynt Tenants, and the Heirs of their ≈øeveral and re≈øpective Bodies lawfully to be begotten; And for default of I≈ø≈øue, To the u≈øe and
behoof of the right Heirs of the ≈øaid W. P. for ever; And the ≈øaid W. P. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, and for evrry of them, doth covenant, promi≈øe and grant, to and with the ≈øaid J. F. and J. C. their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, by the≈øe pre≈øents, in manner and form following; That is to ≈øay, That he the ≈øaid W. P. at and immediatly before the Sealing and delivery of this pre≈øent Indenture, is ≈øolely, lawfully rightfully and ab≈øolutely ≈øeized of all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid Farm, Lands, Tenements, Hereditaments and Premi≈ø≈øes, and of every part and parcel thereof, of a good, pure, ab≈øolute and Indefeizable E≈øtate of Inheritance in Fee-≈øimple in Rever≈øion or Remainder expectant immediatly upon the determination of the E≈øtate which M. D. Widow, hath therein, for and during the time of her natural Life only, without Impeachment of any manner of Condition, Contingent Provi≈øo, Limitation of u≈øe or u≈øes, or other re≈øtraint, matter or thing to determine, alter, or change the ≈øame; And that he ≈øhall continue ≈øo ≈øeized thereof, and and every part and parcel thereof, until, a good, C. prefect and ab≈øolute E≈øtate in Fee-≈øimple, ≈øhall be thereof ve≈øted in the ≈øaid J. F. and J. their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, to the u≈øes, intents, and purpo≈øes herein before mentioned, and according to the true intent and meaing of the≈øe pre≈øents; And al≈øo that he the ≈øaid W. J. and the Survivor of them, their or his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall enter and take the Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the Premi≈ø≈øes, and of every part and parcel thereof according to the limitation herein before expre≈ø≈øed; And the Rents, I≈ø≈øues, and Profits thereof, ≈øhall employ and convert, wholly for and towards the payment of the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Sums of five hundred pounds apiece to the ≈øaid younger Sons and Daughters, or the Sum of two thou≈øand pounds to be equally divided between them (which of them ≈øhall become payable, according to the true intent of the≈øe pre≈øents, together with the Intere≈øt, for all and every ≈øuch Sum or Sums, after the Rate of ≈øix pounds per Cent. for every year that the ≈øame ≈øhall be unpaid, to be accounted, from the end of the four years before mentioned,) for the forbearance of the ≈øaid Sums or Sum, or ≈øuch part thereof as ≈øhall be unpaid as afore≈øaid; And it is likewi≈øe meant, intended and agreed; That after the ≈øaid Sums or Sum of Mony with Intere≈øt for the forbearance thereof, ≈øhall be fully and truly paid unto the ≈øaid younger Sons and Daughters; They the ≈øaid J. begotten, then living or afterwards to be born as afore≈øaid, and that the ≈øaid only Daughter ≈øhall happen to depart this life, before ≈øhe ≈øhall accompli≈øh the Age of 18 years, or be married, or if there happen to be two or more Daughters of the Body of the ≈øaid R. S. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall or lawfully may from to time, tims, and at all times for ever hereafter peaceably and quietly have hold, u≈øe, occupy, po≈ø≈øe≈øs, enjoy and keep all the ≈øaid Tofts, Gate-room, two Acres of Land and Premi≈ø≈øes with the Appurtenances thereof, and the Rents, I≈ø≈øues and Profits thereof receive, have and u≈øe, to and for their own proper u≈øe and behoof, without any lett trouble, interruption or contradiction of, or by the ≈øaid T. H. and M. his Wife, or either of them, their or either of their Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns; And without any lawful let, trouble, incorruption or contradiction of, or by any other per≈øon or per≈øons having or lawfully claiming, or which ≈øhall or may have, or lawfully claim any E≈øtate, Right, Title or Intere≈øt, of, in or to the ≈øaid Tofts, Gate-room and two Acres of Land with the appurtenances, or any part thereof, in, by, for, from or under the ≈øaid T. H. and M. his Wife or either of them, their or either of their Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns; And that free, clear and clearly acquitted and di≈øcharged of and from all former and other Gifts, Grants, Bargains, Sales, Wills, Entails, Jointures, Dowers, and Titles of Dower, Lea≈øes, Rents, Rent-charges, Arrearages of Rent, Statutes, Recognizances, Judgments, Debts, Executions,
Extents, Intru≈øions, I≈ø≈øues, Fees, Fines, Po≈øt-fines, Amerceaments, Charges, Titles, Troubles Burthens and Incumbrances what≈øoever had, made, committed or done, or ≈øuffered, or to be had, made, committed or done by the ≈øaid T. H. and M. his Wife their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, except the beforementioned Indenture of Lea≈øe made unto the ≈øaid R. F. under the ≈øaid yearly Rent of 6 l. 10 s. of which it is agreed that the ≈øaid T. S. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and may from time to time receive twenty ≈øhillings for the proportionable Rent of the ≈øaid premi≈ø≈øes conveyed to the ≈øaid T. S. And the ≈øaid T. H. doth further for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid T. S. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid T. H. and M. his Wife, and all and every other per≈øon and per≈øons what≈øoever, having or lawfully claiming, or which ≈øhall or may claim any E≈øtate, Right, Title or Intere≈øt of, in or to the ≈øaid Tofts, Gate-room and Premi≈ø≈øes, or any part thereof, in, for, from or under the ≈øaid T. H. and M. his Wife or either of them, ≈øhall and will from time to time, and at all times during the ≈øpace of ten years next en≈øuing the date hereof, at the co≈øts and charges of the ≈øaid T. S. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, well and truly further do, or cau≈øe to be done and executed all and every ≈øuch further lawful and rea≈øonable Act and Acts, Thing or Things, Devi≈øe and Devi≈øes, Conveyance and A≈ø≈øurance in the Law what≈øoever; for the further, better and more perfect a≈ø≈øurance, ≈øurety and more ≈øure making and conveying of the ≈øaid Tofts, Gate-room and Premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances, unto the ≈øaid T. S. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, To the only ≈øole and proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid T. S. and of his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever; As by the ≈øaid T. S. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, or by his or their Coun≈øel learned in the Law ≈øhall
be rea≈øonably advi≈øed or devi≈øed and required. And this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. S. did pur≈øue out of the Court of Chancery one Writ of Entry ≈øur di≈ø≈øei≈øin en le po≈øt again≈øt the ≈øaid T. H. and M. his Wife, then Tenants of and to the Freehold of all the ≈øaid Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes before herein mentioned to be granted and relea≈øed, returnable before the Ju≈øtices of the Court of Common Pleas at Westmin≈øter, in the Term of St. Michael la≈øt pa≈øt, and thereby did demand again≈øt the ≈øaid T. H. and M. all the afore≈øaid Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes by the name of 20 Acres of Land with the appurtenances in A. Unto which Writ the ≈øaid T. And this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth, and it is agreed and declared by all the parties to this Indenture by the≈øe pre≈øents, That the ≈øaid Recovery ≈øo as afore≈øaid, or in any other Form had and executed, and the full force and execution thereof, and all proceedings thereupon had, as for and concerning the ≈øaid Lands and premi≈ø≈øes before herein mentioned to be granted and relea≈øed unto the ≈øaid J. S. ≈øhall be and enure, and ≈øhall for ever hereafter be deemed, e≈øteemed, expounded, con≈øtrued, judged, reputed and taken to be and enure, to the only ≈øole and proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. S. and of his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever. And this Indenture further witne≈ø≈øeth, and it is further agreed and declared by all the parties to this Indenture by the≈øe pre≈øents, That the ≈øaid Recovery ≈øo as afore≈øaid, or in any other Form had and executed, and the full force and executi on thereof, and all proceedings thereupon had, as
for and concerning the ≈øaid Tofts, Land and Premi≈ø≈øes before herein mentioned, to be granted and relea≈øed unto the ≈øaid T. S. ≈øhall be and enure and ≈øhall for ever hereafter be deemed, e≈øteemed, expounded, con≈øtrued, adjudged, reputed and taken to be and enure to the only ≈øole and proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid T.
