keep harmle≈øs the ≈øaid J. S. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, and the ≈øaid Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes to the ≈øaid J. S. granted and relea≈øed as afore≈øaid.

div.head: Two Joint-tenants in Fee, that they may be Tenants in Common, make a Feoffment by Lea≈øe and Relea≈øe of one Moiety to the u≈øe of the one, and of the other Moiety to the u≈øe of the other.

body.p:
THIS Indenture, &c. Between A. W. &c. and M. F. &c. of the one part, and J. W. of, &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid A. and M. being Joint-tenants in Fee≈øimple of the Lands and Tenements herein after mentioned, have agreed to become Tenants thereof in Common; and therefore for ≈øetling the ≈øaid Lands and Tenements in ≈øuch manner as is herein after expre≈ø≈øed, and for and in con≈øideration of five ≈øhillings of lawful Mony of England to them by the ≈øaid J. W. before the en≈øealing and delivery hereof well and truly in hand paid, and for divers other good Cau≈øes and Con≈øiderations, the ≈øaid A. and M. have granted, relea≈øed and confirmed, and by the≈øe pre≈øents do for them and their Heirs, fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely grant, relea≈øe and confirm unto the ≈øaid J. W. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, all tho≈øe Lands and Tenements, commonly called or known by the name of, &c. or by what≈øoever other name or names the ≈øame or any part thereof is called or known, containing by e≈øtimation, 28 Acres of Land, be it more or le≈øs, with the appurtenances (that is to ≈øay) one Coppice or parcel of Wood-lands, containing by e≈øtimation 20 Acres, more or le≈øs, and al≈øo one parcel of Pa≈øtureland to the ≈øaid Coppice adjoining and belonging, containing by e≈øtimation 8 Acres, be it more or le≈øs, together with all Woods, Underwoods, Timber and Trees ≈øtanding and growing on the ≈øaid
Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes; All which ≈øaid Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes are ≈øituate, lying and being in the Pari≈øh of G. in the ≈øaid County of S. and adjoining to, &c. and al≈øo all ways, pa≈ø≈øages, ea≈øments, waters, profits, commodities, advantages, hereditaments and appurtenances what≈øoever to the ≈øaid Lands, Tenements, Hereditaments and Premi≈ø≈øes, or any part or parcel thereof, belonging or in any wi≈øe appertaining, and the rever≈øion and rever≈øions, remainder and Remainders thereof, and all Rents, Services and Profits to the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes, or any part thereof incident or belonging, and all the E≈øtate, Right, Title, U≈øe, Intere≈øt, Inheritance, Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, Rever≈øion, Claim and demand of them the ≈øaid A. W. and M. F. of, in or to the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes: Of all which Premi≈ø≈øes hereby granted or mentioned to be granted, the ≈øaid J. W. is now in full po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion by force and virtue of a Bargain and Sale thereof to him made by the ≈øaid A. W. and M. F. for term of one year, to commence from the 11th day of this In≈øtant July by Indenture, bearing date the day next before the day of the date hereof, by force and virtue of the Statute for transferring U≈øes into Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, To have and to hold the Moiety or one half of the ≈øaid Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances hereby granted and relea≈øed, or mentioned to be granted and relea≈øed unto the ≈øaid J. W. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, to the only ≈øole and proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid A. W. and of his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever: And al≈øo to have and to hold the other Moiety or one half of all the ≈øaid Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances hereby granted and relea≈øed, or mentioned to be granted and relea≈øed unto the ≈øaid J. W. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, to the only ≈øole and proper u≈øe and behoofof the ≈øaid M. F. and of her Heirs and A≈ø≈øignsor ever. And the ≈øaid A. W. doth for him≈øelf,
his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid J. W. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid A. W. hath not at any time wittingly or willingly committed, done or ≈øuffered any Act or Thing whereby or wherewith the premi≈ø≈øes or any part thereof are or is, or ≈øhall or may be impeached or imcumbred, in title, charge, e≈øtate or otherwi≈øe how≈øoever. And the ≈øaid M. F. doth for her ≈øelf, her Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid J. W. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, That ≈øhe the ≈øaid M. F. hath not at any time wittingly or willingly committed, done or ≈øuffered any Act or Thing, whereby or wherewith the premi≈ø≈øes, or any part thereof are or is, or ≈øhall or may be impeached or incumbred in Title, Charge, E≈øtate, or otherwi≈øe what≈øoever.

div.head: A Bargain and Sale of Hou≈øe and Land.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of the one part, and R. C. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. F. for and in con≈øideration of the ≈øum of, &c. to him in hand paid at and before the en≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents by the ≈øaid R. C. the receipt whereof he doth hereby acknowledge, and thereof by the≈øe pre≈øents doth acquit and di≈øcharge the ≈øaid R. C. his Executors and A≈ø≈øigns, Hath Given, Granted, Aliened, Bargained, Sold, Enfeoffed and Confirmed: And by the≈øe Pre≈øents doth fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely Give, Grant, Bargain, Sell, Alien, Enfeoff and Confirm unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, all that, &c. with all its rights, members and appurtenances, together with all Hou≈øes, Edifices, Buildings, Barns, Stables, Orchards, Gardens, Yards, Back-≈øides, Ea≈øments, Lands, Tenements, Meadows, Feedings, Pa≈øtures, Woods,
Under-woods, Ways, Profits, Common of Pa≈øture, Hereditaments and Appurtenances what≈øoever to the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement and Premi≈ø≈øes, or to any part or parcel thereof belonging, or in any wi≈øe appertaining; All which ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, &c. and every of their Rights, Members and Appurtenances, before, in and by the≈øe Pre≈øents, mentioned, or intended to be granted, are ≈øituate, lying and being within the Pari≈øh of B. in the County of S. And now or late in the tenure or occupation of the ≈øaid R. C. or his A≈ø≈øigns; and the Rever≈øion and Rever≈øions, Remainder and Remainders of all and ≈øingular the before-mentioned premi≈ø≈øes, and all Rent and Rents re≈øerved upon any grant or grants, demi≈øe or demi≈øes, made of the premi≈ø≈øes, or of any part or parcel thereof; and al≈øo all the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt, U≈øe, Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, Property, Claim and Demand what≈øoever of him the ≈øaid J. F. of, in or to the ≈øame; and all Deeds, Writings, Evidences, Charters, tran≈øcripts of Fines, Court-rolls and Minuments what≈øoever, touching or concerning the Premi≈ø≈øes, or any part or parcel thereof, To have and to hold the ≈øaid, &c. and all and ≈øingular other the premi≈ø≈øes hereby granted, bargained and ≈øold or mentioned or intended to be hereby bargained and ≈øold, with their and every of their Rights, Members and Appurtenances what≈øoever, unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, to the only proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever. And the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf and his Heirs, the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. and all and ≈øingular other premi≈ø≈øes, before granted, bargained and ≈øold with the appurtenances unto the ≈øaip R. C. and his Heirs, to the only proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns for ever, again≈øt him the ≈øaid J. F. and all other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever lawfully claiming,
by from or under him, them or any of them ≈øhall and will warrant, and for ever defend by the≈øe pre≈øents. And the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant, promi≈øe, grant and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, and every of them by the≈øe pre≈øents, in manner and form following, (that is to ≈øay) That he the ≈øaid J. F. at the time of the en≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents is and until a good, pure, perfect and ab≈øolute E≈øtate of Inheritance of all and ≈øingular the before granted premi≈ø≈øes and every part thereof, ≈øhall be fully re≈øted, ≈øetled and executed in and upon the ≈øaid R. C. and his Heirs, according to the true meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents, ≈øhall remain, continue and be ≈øeized of, and in the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. and all and ≈øingular other the premi≈ø≈øes, in and by the≈øe pre≈øents granted, bargained and ≈øold, with all and every their Rights, Members and appurtenances, of a good, pure, perfect and ab≈øolute E≈øtate of Inheritance in Fee≈øimple, without any condition, rever≈øion, remainder or limitation of any U≈øe or U≈øes, E≈øtate or E≈øtates, in or to any per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, to alter, change, defeat, determine or make void the ≈øame. And that the ≈øaid J. F. at the time of en≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents, hath full power good right and lawful authority to grant, bargain, ≈øell and convey all and ≈øingular the before hereby granted or mentioned to be granted premi≈ø≈øes, with their and every of their appurtenances unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns in manner and form afore≈øaid. And that he the ≈øaid R. C his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns and every of them ≈øhall and may by force and virtue of the≈øe pre≈øents at all times hereafter lawfully, peaceably and quietly have, hold, u≈øe, occupy and po≈ø≈øe≈øs the ≈øaid, &c. and all and ≈øingular the before granted premi≈ø≈øes, with their and every
of their Rights Members and Appurtenances, and have, receive and take the Rents, I≈ø≈øues and Profits thereof to his and their own proper u≈øe and behoof for ever, without any lawful lett, ≈øuit, trouble, denial, interruption, eviction or di≈øturbance of the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, or from any other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever lawfully claiming by, from or under him, them or any of them, or by his or their means, act or con≈øent, title, intere≈øt, privity or procurement: And that free and clear, and freely and clearly exonerated and di≈øcharged, or otherwi≈øe from time to time well and ≈øufficiently ≈øaved and kept harmle≈øs by the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns of and from all and all manner of former and other Gifts, Grants, Bargains, Sales, Lea≈øes, Mortgages, Jointures, Dowers, Title of Dower, Statutes-merchant and of the Staple, Recognizances, Extents, Judgments, Executions, U≈øes, Entails, Rents and Arrearages of Rent, Forfeitures, Fines, I≈ø≈øues and Amerceaments, and of and from all and ≈øingular other Titles, Incumbrances and Demands what≈øoever, had made, committed, ≈øuffered, committed or done by the ≈øaid J. F. or his A≈ø≈øigns, or by any other per≈øon or per≈øons what≈øoever, lawfully claiming by, from or under him, them or any of them (the Rents and Services which from henceforth from time to time ≈øhall grow due and payable to Chief Lord or Lords of the Fee or Fees of the premi≈ø≈øes only excepted and foreprized.) And further the ≈øaid J. F. for him≈øelf, his Heirs Executors and Admini≈øtrators doth covenant, promi≈øe and agree to and with the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, That he the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs, &c. and all and every other per≈øon and per≈øons and their Heirs lawfully having or claiming, or which ≈øhall hereafter lawfully have and claim any E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt or Demand in, to or out of the Premi≈ø≈øes
or any part thereof, by, from or under the ≈øaid J. F. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will at all times during the ≈øpace of ≈øeven Years next en≈øuing the date hereof, at and upon the rea≈øonable reque≈øt and at the co≈øts and charges in the Law of the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, make, do, perform, acknowledge, levy, execute and ≈øuffer, or cau≈øe to be made, done, performed, acknowledged, levied, executed and ≈øuffered all and every ≈øuch farther lawful and rea≈øonable Act and Acts, Thing and Things, Devi≈øe and Devi≈øes, A≈ø≈øurance and Conveyance in the Law what≈øoever, for the farther, better and more perfect A≈ø≈øuring and Conveying of all and ≈øingular the before hereby granted or mentioned to be granted premi≈ø≈øes, with their and every of their rights, members and appurtenances, unto the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, be it by Fine or Fines, Feoffment or Feoffments, Deed or Deeds enrolled or not enrolled, the Enrollment of the≈øe Pre≈øents, Recovery or Recoveries, with ≈øingle or double Voucher or Vouchers, Relea≈øe and Confirmation, or by all and every, or any the ways and means afore≈øaid, or by any other ways or means what≈øoever, as by the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, or by his or their Coun≈øel Learned in the Law, ≈øhall be rea≈øonably devi≈øed, advi≈øed or required; ≈øo as the ≈øaid J. F. his, &c. or ≈øuch other per≈øon or per≈øons who ≈øhall be required to make ≈øuch farther A≈ø≈øurance, be not compelled travel farther than the Cities of London and We≈øtmin≈øter, or either of them in or about the making thereof. And la≈øtly, It is covenanted, granted, concluded, conde≈øcended to and agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, for them, their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, by the≈øe Pre≈øents, that all Fines, Feoffments, Recoveries and A≈ø≈øurances in the Law what≈øoever, hereafter to be had, made, levied, acknowledged,
≈øuffered, or done by or between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents or any of them, of, for, touching or concerning the ≈øaid, &c. and all the ≈øaid ≈øingular other the hereby before granted Premi≈ø≈øes, with their Rights, Members and Appurtenances, and every or any part thereof, ≈øhall be and enure, and ≈øhall be con≈øtrued, e≈øteemed and judged, and taken to be, and enure to the only proper u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns forever, and to no other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoever.

C. 5 s. of lawful Mony of England, in the name of ≈øeizin of the afore≈øaid Annuity or yearly Rent-charge of, &c. before mentioned; And al≈øo he the ≈øaid J. F. and R. C. have hereto interchargably ≈øet their Hand and Seals, the day and year fir≈øt above witten.

div.head: A Conveyance of Land to u≈øe of a Mans Heirs, the Profits during their Minority to pay Debts.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between J. F. of the one part, and R. C. C. R. and D. C. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. F. for and in con≈øideration of the love and affection which he beareth towards A B. and his three Sons, and for the advancement of the Heirs Male of the Body of the ≈øaid J. F. lawfully to be begotten, and for divers other con≈øiderations herein mentioned, Hath given, granted, enfeoffed and confirmed, And by the≈øe Pre≈øents doth give, grant, enfeoff and confirm unto the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. and D. C. all tho≈øe Lands, &c. with all and ≈øingular liberties courts, fairs, commodities, priviledges, juri≈ødictions, emoluments and appurtenances what≈øoever, to or with the ≈øaid, &c. u≈øed or enjoyed, in or out of the ≈øame, or out of any part or parcel thereof; To have and to hold the ≈øaid, &c. unto the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. and D. C. and their Heirs for ever, to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. F. for the term of his natural life, without impeachment of wa≈øt, and from and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. and during the time that the ≈øaid A. Son and Heir apparent of the ≈øaid J. F. or any other being the Heir of the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall be under the Age of 21 years, and until ≈øome Heirs of the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall have accompli≈øhed the full Age of 21 years, to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid R. C. C. R. and D. C. and the Survivor and Survivors of them, and the Executors and Admini≈øtrators of the Survivor of them, upon tru≈øt and to the intent and purpo≈øe that the ≈øaid R. C. and D. and the Survivors or Survivor of them, and the Executors and Admini≈øtrators of the Survivor of them, ≈øhall take, levy, po≈ø≈øe≈øs, u≈øe and enjoy the Rents, I≈ø≈øues, Profits, Revenues and Commodity of all and ≈øingular the
≈øaid, &c. with the appurtenances, and the ≈øame employ during the minority or minorities as is afore≈øaid, for and towards the performance, payment and ≈øatisfaction of all the Legacies, Beque≈øts and Annuities and Debts of the ≈øaid J. F. to be mentioned and ≈øpecified in the la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament of the ≈øaid J. F. And to the u≈øe and intent, that the ≈øaid Feoffees and the Survivors and Survivor of them, their or his Executors and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall with the I≈ø≈øues, Profits, Revenues and Rents, coming, growing and ari≈øing out of, and from the ≈øaid, &c. with the appurtenances, expend, di≈øbur≈øe and be≈øtow at all times ≈øuch nece≈ø≈øary charges in the Law and otherwi≈øe for the defence and maintenance of the Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion and Title of all and ≈øingular the Premi≈ø≈øes, and every or any part thereof, and for the reparation and amendment of all Buildings, &c. in, upon or belonging to the Premi≈ø≈øes afore≈øaid, until ≈øuch time as the ≈øaid Legacies, &c. to be mentioned in the ≈øaid Te≈øtament of the ≈øaid J. F. as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be paid and performed, and until ≈øome Heir of the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall have attained to the Age of 21 years; And to the u≈øe and intent, that after ≈øuch Legacies, &c. paid and performed, the ≈øaid Feoffees ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of the overplus, of ≈øuch Rents, I≈ø≈øues, &c. to the only u≈øe and benefit of the Heirs of the ≈øaid J. F. And after the Heirs of the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall accompli≈øh their full Ages of 21 years, That then the ≈øaid R. C. and D. and their Heirs ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of all and ≈øingular the ≈øaid, &c. to A. F. and the Heirs Male of his Body lawfully begotten; And for default of ≈øuch Heirs Male of the Body of the ≈øaid A. F. lawfully begotten, to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid B.F. ≈øecond Son of the ≈øaid J. F. and the Heirs Male of his Body lawfully begotten; And for default of ≈øuch Heirs Male of the Body of the ≈øaid B. F. lawfully
begotten, to the u≈øe and behoof of the Heirs Male of the Body of C. F. third Son of the ≈øaid J. F. and in default of ≈øuch Heirs Male of the Body of the ≈øaid C. F. lawfully begotten, to the u≈øe of the Heirs of the Body of the ≈øaid J. F. and for default of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, to the u≈øe of the right Heirs of the ≈øaid A. for ever: Provided always, and it is the true meaning, u≈øe and intent of the≈øe Pre≈øents, That if the ≈øaid J. F. hereafter at any time during his Life time, ≈øhall demi≈øe, grant or lea≈øe the ≈øaid, &c. or any part or parcel thereof, by his Deed indented under his Seal, and with his Sub≈øcription of his Name, with his own Hand, for term of year or years, life or lives; That then and immediately after any ≈øuch Demi≈øe, Lea≈øe or Grant ≈øo to to be made by the ≈øaid J. F. the ≈øaid R. C. and D. ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized, of, and in the ≈øaid Mannor, &c. ≈øo to be lea≈øed or granted, to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øame Le≈ø≈øees or Grantees, and every of them, and of their ≈øeveral Executors, Admini≈øtrators, and A≈ø≈øigns, during the Terms mentioned in ≈øuch ≈øeveral Lea≈øes or Grants ≈øo to be made, So that the yearly Rent or Rents, mentioned or re≈øerved by the ≈øaid J. F. in ≈øuch Lea≈øes, Demi≈øes or Grants, be yearly paid unto the ≈øaid J. F. during his life, and after his decea≈øe to ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons, as by the proper and true meaning of the≈øe Pre≈øents, ought to have the rever≈øion or remainder, rever≈øions or remainders of the ≈øaid Lands, &c. ≈øo to be lea≈øed or granted, (A Letter of Attorney to deliver ≈øeizin to the Fe-offees,) Provided always, that if the ≈øaid J. F. by his Writing ≈øigned and ≈øealed in the pre≈øence of three witne≈ø≈øes, ≈øhall repeal, revoke or determin, all or any the u≈øes afore≈øaid or any part thereof, that then, and from thenceforth the ≈øaid u≈øes ≈øo to be repealed ≈øhall be void and of no effect, and that then the ≈øaid Feoffees ≈øhall thereof ≈øtand ≈øeized
to the only u≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. and his Heirs for ever.

div.head: J. F. being ≈øeized in Fee, Convenants to levy a Fine to the u≈øe of him≈øelf for Life, and his Wife for Life, with Entail to his first, ≈øecond or third Son, and in default of I≈ø≈øue Male, to his right Heirs.

body.p: THIS Indenture Tripartite made, &c. Between J. F. and R. his Wife of the fir≈øt part, R. C. and C. R. of the ≈øecond part, and P. F. Son and Heir apparent of the ≈øaid J. F. and for the better ≈øetling of the Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. hereafter mentioned to ≈øuch u≈øes, intents and purpo≈øes as are hereafter ≈øpecified, and the continuance of the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes, in the Name and Blood of the ≈øaid J. F. doth for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, Covenant, Grant and Agree, to and with the ≈øaid P. F. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators by the≈øe Pre≈øents, that he the ≈øaid J. F. and R. his Wife on this ≈øide, and before the Fea≈øt of, &c. next en≈øuing the date hereof, ≈øhall and will at his proper co≈øts and charges, by ≈øuch Fine or Fines with Proclamations to be had and levied in due form of Law, as ≈øhall be devi≈øed or advi≈øed by the ≈øaid P. F. or his Coun≈øel learned in the Law, convey and a≈ø≈øure unto the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. and to the Heirs of one of them, all and ≈øingular, &c.

And it is covenanted, conde≈øcended unto, concluded, declared and agreed by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, that the ≈øaid Fine or Fines ≈øo to be levied, and had of the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, &c. and other the Premi≈ø≈øes with the Appurtenances,
before in the≈øe Pre≈øents mentioned and of every or any part or parcel thereof, and the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt and Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of them, the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. and either of them and of their and either of their Heirs, of, in and to the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes, and every part thereof, thereby to be had, ≈øhall be, and the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. and their Heirs and the Survivor of them and his Heirs, and all, and every other per≈øon and per≈øons, his and their Heirs, that ≈øhall ≈øtand or be ≈øeized thereof, or of any part thereof, ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of the ≈øame, and of every part and parcel thereof, to the ≈øeveral u≈øes, intents, agreements, limitations and payments, and under the provi≈øoes and conditions hereafter, in and by the≈øe Pre≈øents expre≈ø≈øed, mentioned and declared, and to no other u≈øe or u≈øes, intent or purpo≈øes what≈øoever; That is to ≈øay, to the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. F. for and during the Term of his natural Life, without impeachment of wa≈øt; And from and after his decea≈øe, to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. F. his Wife, for and during the term of her natural Life, And from and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. and R. F. to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid P. F. and of the Heirs Male of his Body, lawfully begotten or to be begotten, To be charged neverthele≈øs, and chargeable with ≈øuch yearly Rent or Rents, and di≈øtre≈ø≈øes for the ≈øame, as ≈øhall be hereafter in the≈øe Pre≈øents Limited or expre≈ø≈øed, And for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue to C. F. ≈øecond Son of the ≈øaid J. F. and of the Heirs, Males of the Body of the ≈øaid C. F. lawfully begotten or to be begotten, charged neverthele≈øs and chargeable as afore≈øaid, And for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, to the u≈øe and behoof of the right Heirs of the ≈øaid J. F. for ever.

Provided always, that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid J. F. at any time or times
hereafter, during his natural Life, by his Deed or Deeds in his life time lawfully executed, to a≈ø≈øure, appoint, limit and convey to any lawful Wife or Wives, which the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall hereafter fortune to marry, (in ca≈øe he Survive the ≈øaid R. F.) for term of the life only of ≈øuch Wife or Wives, for or in the name of the Jointure or Jointures of ≈øuch Wife or Wives, one full third part or le≈øs, or ≈øo much as ≈øhall amount to a third part of all the ≈øaid, &c. And al≈øo, that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid J. F. during the term of his natural Life, by any Deed or Deeds in Writing under his Hand and Seal or otherwi≈øe, by his la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament in Writing, to grant, a≈ø≈øure, limit, devi≈øe and convey, to every or any the younger Sons of the ≈øaid J. F. of his Body lawfully begotten or to be begotten, for term of the Life or Lives of ≈øuch younger Son or Sons, ≈øuch yearly Rent-charge or Rent-charges, with a Clau≈øe of di≈øtre≈øs for every ≈øuch Rent, as by the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall be thought meet and convenient, to be yearly i≈ø≈øuing and going out of all and every the ≈øaid, &c. or any part thereof, from and after the decea≈øe of the Survivor of them the ≈øaid J. F. and R. F. ≈øo that the ≈øaid Rent or Rents ≈øo to be granted, limited or devi≈øed as afore≈øaid, do not exceed the Sum of 50 l. per An. in the whole.

And further, that it ≈øhall and may be lawful to and for the ≈øaid J. F. at any time or times during his natural Life to make any Lea≈øe or Lea≈øes, unto every or any of his younger Son or Sons, for the term of One and twenty years or under, in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion or rever≈øion, of all or any the ≈øaid, &c. whereof the ≈øaid Fine or Fines before mentioned, is covenanted to be levied by the ≈øaid J. F. or any part or parcel thereof, (the ≈øaid Lea≈øe or Lea≈øes to commence immediately, from and after the decea≈øe of the Survivor of them, the ≈øaid J. F. and
R. F. his Wife,) charged and chargeable neverthele≈øs with ≈øuch Rent and Rents, Sum and Sums of Mony or Payments, as before or after in the≈øe Pre≈øents are appointed, declared or limited to be had, levied or i≈ø≈øuing out of the Premi≈ø≈øes or any part thereof, in ≈øuch ≈øort as in the≈øe Pre≈øents is mentioned and declared, ≈øo that the ≈øame Lands, &c. ≈øo to be demi≈øed and lea≈øed to any of the ≈øaid younger Sons, do not exceed in the whole the yearly value of, &c. per annum, over and above the Rent or Rents re≈øerved upon ≈øuch Lea≈øe or Lea≈øes, and ≈øo as upon every ≈øuch Lea≈øe and Lea≈øes ≈øo to be had as afore≈øaid, the old and accu≈øtomed yearly Rents and Services, be re≈øerved to be yearly payable and done during the continuance of every ≈øuch Lea≈øe and Lea≈øes, at the days and times formerly u≈øed, And ≈øo that the ≈øame Lea≈øe and Lea≈øes or any of them to be made as afore≈øaid, be not without impeachment of Wa≈øt.

And it is covenanted, granted, concluded and agreed, by and between the ≈øaid Parties to the≈øe Pre≈øents, that the ≈øaid Fine and Fines ≈øo to be levied and had as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be and enure, and that the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. and their Heirs and the Survivor of them and his Heirs, ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of all ≈øuch Lands, &c. which ≈øhall by virtue of the≈øe Pre≈øents, be limited or appointed to be charged with any Rent or Rents, Sum or Sums of Mony or Payments, to any per≈øon or per≈øons, or which ≈øhall hereafter be granted, lea≈øed, demi≈øed or charged according to the intent or true meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents, and according to the power, liberty and authority hereby given, permited and allowed, as well to the u≈øe of ≈øuch per≈øon or per≈øons, to whom any parcel of the Premi≈ø≈øes in the≈øe Pre≈øents mentioned, ≈øhall be hereafter ≈øo limited, appointed, demi≈øed lea≈øed,
granted and conveied, of ≈øuch E≈øtate and E≈øtates, and for ≈øuch term and time as the ≈øame ≈øhall be pur≈øuant to the ≈øaid Authority hereby given to be limited, appointed, lea≈øed or conveied, and under the covenants, charges, conditions and agreements in ≈øuch Lea≈øe or Lea≈øes, Deed or Deeds to be contained; As al≈øo to the u≈øe and intent, that to every per≈øon and per≈øons, to whom any Rent, yearly Sum or Payment ≈øhall be hereafter granted, limited, appointed or devi≈øed, according to the true intent and meaning of the≈øe Pre≈øents, and according to the power, liberty and authority, allowed and given in and by the≈øe Pre≈øents, ≈øhall and may have, receive, levy and take the ≈øame, and likewi≈øe di≈øtrain for ≈øuch Rents, Sum and Sums of Mony, as ≈øhall fortune to be behind and unpaid, according to the intent and true meaning of the≈øe Pre≈øents, and of the ≈øeveral grant or grants, limitation or limitations, device or devices, appointment or appointments, of, for or concerning the ≈øame to be had or made, pur≈øuant to the power and authority hereby given as afore≈øaid.

div.head: A Declaration of the U≈øes of a Recovery and Fine already pa≈øt, viz. To the u≈øe of J. F. and of R. F. his Wife for Life, in lieu of a Jointure, and to the u≈øe of a Tru≈øtee for ten years, to pay Debts and Legacies, and afterward to the u≈øe of the Right Heirs of J. F. in Fee.

body.p:
THIS Indenture Tripartite, &c. Between J. F. of the fir≈øt part, R. F. of the ≈øecond part, and R. C. and C. R. of the third part; Whereas the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. in Trinity Term la≈øt, did by Writ of Entry ≈øur di≈ø≈øeizin en le post, Recover again≈øt the ≈øaid F. J. all, &c. [as in the Recovery] as in and by the ≈øaid Recovery, remaining of Record in his Maje≈øty's Court of Common
Pleas at We≈øtmin≈øter, relation being thereunto had, more fully and at large it doth appear. And whereas, &c. (recite the Fine if any be) Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That the true intent and meaning of the ≈øaid J. F. and of the ≈øaid Recoverors and parties to the ≈øaid Recovery, and of the Cognizees of the ≈øaid Fine, and parties to the ≈øaid Fine, before and at the ≈øeveral and re≈øpective time and times of the ≈øuffering of the ≈øaid Recovery, and acknowedging and levying of the ≈øaid Fine for, touching and concerning the ≈øaid, &c. and premi≈ø≈øes, whereof the ≈øaid Recovery and Fine were ≈øeverally and re≈øpectively ≈øuffered and acknowledged as afore≈øaid, always was and yet is, that as well the ≈øaid Recovery as the ≈øaid Fine, and all and every Fine and Fines, Recovery and Recoveries and other Acts and A≈ø≈øurances of and concerning the ≈øaid, &c. with the appurtenances, or of any of them at any time formerly ≈øuffered, levied, executed or had, wherein or whereunto the ≈øaid J. F. was or is any way a party, and all and every the Executions of the ≈øame, ≈øhould and ≈øhall be and enure, and be con≈øtrued, adjudged, deemed and taken to be and enure, and are hereby covenanted, granted, agreed and declared to be and enure to the u≈øes, purpo≈øes and intents, and under the Provi≈øo's, Conditions and Limitations hereafter in the≈øe Pre≈øents expre≈ø≈øed, limited and declared: And that the ≈øaid Recoverers, and either of them, and all the parties in the ≈øaid Recovery and takers thereby, and their Heirs, and all other per≈øon and per≈øons, and his and their Heirs who now are, or then were, or hereafter ≈øhall be ≈øeized of the ≈øaid &c. with their and every of their appurtenances comprized in the ≈øaid Recovery ≈øhould and ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of the ≈øaid, &c. comprized in the ≈øaid Recovery, and of every part and parcel thereof with the appurtenances, to the u≈øes, purpo≈øes
and intents hereafter expre≈ø≈øed. And that the ≈øaid Cognizees of the ≈øaid Fine, and either of them, and all the parties to the ≈øaid Fine, and the takers thereby, and the Heirs of them, and every of them, and all and every other per≈øon and per≈øons and his and their Heirs who at the time of the levying of the ≈øaid Fine were, or now are, or hereafter ≈øhall be ≈øeized of the afore≈øaid, &c. comprized in the ≈øaid Fine, and every of them ≈øhould and ≈øhall ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of the ≈øame &c. comprized in the ≈øaid Fine, and every part and parcel thereof with the appurtenances, to the u≈øes, purpo≈øes and intents hereafter in the≈øe pre≈øents expre≈ø≈øed and declared, (that is to ≈øay) for, touching and concerning the ≈øaid, &c. with the appurtenances, comprized in the ≈øaid Recovery, to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. F. and his A≈ø≈øigns, for and during the term of his Natural Life, without impeachment of wa≈øte; and from and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. to the u≈øe and behoof of R. F. now Wife of the ≈øaid J. F. for and during the Natural Life of the ≈øaid R. F. for her Jointure, and in lieu and full recompence of her Dower, out of all the Lands, &c. whereof the ≈øaid J. F. now, is or at any time was or ≈øhall be ≈øeized of any E≈øtate of Inheritance, during the Coverture between him and the ≈øaid R. F. and for, touching and concerning all and every the other, &c. mentioned and comprized in the ≈øaid Recovery and Fine, to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid J. F. for and during the term of his Natural Life, without impeachment of wa≈øte. And for, touching and concerning the immediate Remainder of the ≈øaid, &c. before-mentioned, or meant to be limitted to the ≈øaid R. F. for her Jointure as afore≈øaid, immeditately from and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid, J. F. and R. F. his Wife, and of the Survivor of them, and the immediate Remainder of all and
every the other, &c. and every of them, comprized within the ≈øaid Recovery and Fine (whereof there is no u≈øe before limited or declared to the ≈øaid R. F. for her Jointure) to ≈øuch u≈øes, purpo≈øes and intents (immediately from and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F.) and under ≈øuch Provi≈øo's Conditions and Limitations as hereafter in the≈øe pre≈øents are ≈øpecified, expre≈ø≈øed, limited and declared, and to no other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoever, (that is to ≈øay) to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators, and A≈ø≈øigns, for and during the terms and, ≈øpaces of years herein after mentioned, to commence and begin as hereafter followeth, viz. For, touching and concerning the ≈øaid, &c. before limited to the ≈øaid R. F. for her Jointure, for the term or ≈øpace of ten years, to begin immediately from and after the death of the longe≈øt liver of them the ≈øaid J. F. and R. F. his Wife: And for, touching and concerning all the re≈øt and re≈øidue of the ≈øaid, &c. comprized in the ≈øaid Recovery and Fine, for and during the like term and ≈øpace of ten years, to commence imediately from and after the decea≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. upon tru≈øt and confidence, and for and unto the end, intent and purpo≈øe, that they the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns ≈øhall and may receive, perceive, di≈øpo≈øe and employ the Rents, Revenues, I≈ø≈øues and Profits of all and every the ≈øaid, &c. for and during the ≈øaid ≈øeveral terms of ten years, for and towards the payment and ≈øatisfaction of all ≈øuch Debts and Sums of Mony which he the ≈øaid J. F. doth now owe, or ≈øhall hereafter borrow or owe, or for which any per≈øon or per≈øons now doth or do, or hereafter ≈øhall ≈øtand engaged for or with the ≈øaid J. F. and for his proper Debt, and for and toward the payment of ≈øuch Legacy or Legacies, and Sums which
the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall by his la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament in writing, to be by him ≈øigned, ≈øealed and publi≈øhed before three ≈øufficient Witne≈ø≈øes at the lea≈øt, give, limit, ordain and appoint. And from and after the end, expiration, ≈øurrender or other determination of the ≈øaid term or terms of ten year; And as they ≈øhall ≈øeverally end and determine, to the u≈øe and behoof of ≈øuch per≈øon and per≈øons, and for ≈øuch E≈øtate and E≈øtates as the ≈øaid J. F. ≈øhall by his la≈øt Will and Te≈øtament in Writing, in the pre≈øence of three Credible Witne≈ø≈øes or more, limit, appoint and declare; and in default of ≈øuch limitation, appointment or declaration, to the u≈øe and behoof of, &c. Provided always, &c.

until ≈øhe ≈øhall be delivered of ≈øuch Child or die, which of them ≈øhall fir≈øt happen, in tru≈øt only for the pre≈øervation of the contingent Remainder unto her Son, if ≈øhe ≈øhall be en≈øeint of a Son; and if ≈øuch Child ≈øhall not be a Son, then to the u≈øe and behoof of ≈øuch after born Son, lawfully to be begotten, and the Heirs Males of the Body of ≈øuch after born Son lawfully to be begotten: And for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, to the u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. A. in his lifetime: And in ca≈øe there ≈øhall be more than one Daughter between them begotten, the ≈øum of 1000 l. apiece of lawful Mony of England to every ≈øuch Daughter that ≈øhall not be preferred in Marriage in the life-time of the ≈øaid A. B. the ≈øaid Portion and Portions to be paid to them re≈øpectively at their ≈øeveral Ages of one and twenty years, or re≈øpective days of Marriage, which of them ≈øhall fir≈øt happen: And in the mean time for the rai≈øing and paying to and for ≈øuch Daughter or Daughters until their ≈øeveral Portions ≈øhall become due and payable as afore≈øaid, nece≈ø≈øary and convenient maintenance at the di≈øcretion of the ≈øaid Tru≈øtees, or the Survivor of them, their or his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns. And it is concluded and agreed by and between all the ≈øaid parties to the≈øe pre≈øents, and it is the true intent and meaning hereof, That when the ≈øeveral Portions and Sums of Mony afore≈øaid, ≈øhall be paid and ≈øatisfied to the ≈øaid Daughter or Daughters as afore≈øaid, according to the true intent and meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents, or if he or they to whom the Remainder or Rever≈øion of the ≈øaid Mannor, &c. ≈øhall be, remain or come by virtue of the≈øe pre≈øents, after the end or expiration of the ≈øaid E≈øtate of five hundred years, ≈øhall well and truly ≈øatisfie and pay, or cau≈øe to be ≈øatisfied and paid or otherwi≈øe ≈øecure to be ≈øatisfied or paid unto ≈øuch Daughter or Daughters, the ≈øaid ≈øeveral ≈øums as afore≈øaid, That then, immediately from and after ≈øuch payment made, or ≈øecurity given for payment of the ≈øaid ≈øum or ≈øums to ≈øuch Daughter or Daughters as afore≈øaid, according to the true intent and meaning of the≈øe pre≈øents, the ≈øaid E≈øtate or Term of five hundred years herein
before limited to the ≈øaid R. C. and C. R. as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall cea≈øe and determine, and be utterly void and of none effect.

div.head: A Conveyance or Settlement, whereby a man Settles an E≈øtate on him≈øelf, and divers E≈øtates for Life, and in Tail by Covenant to ≈øtand ≈øeized.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. of, &c. of the one part, and J. F. of, &c. and F. J. of, &c. of the other part witne≈ø≈øeth, That it is covenanted, conde≈øcended and agreed, by and between the Parties to the≈øe pre≈øents in manner and form following; That is to ≈øay, whereas the ≈øaid R. C. the day of the date hereof, hath but one Son only B. C. his Heir apparent, and one Daughter A. C. And is fully re≈øolved and determined, how and in what manner his Mannors, &c. ≈øhall by the grace of God remain, continue and be as well in the life time of the ≈øaid R. C. and B. C. his Son as after their Deaths, And being withal greatly de≈øirous to contiue, and ≈øtay all and ≈øingular his ≈øaid, &c. in his Sirname, And for that purpo≈øe to ≈øettle the ≈øame as followeth, he the ≈øaid R. C. doth as well for the Con≈øideration afore≈øaid, as al≈øo for natural and fatherly love which he beareth unto his ≈øaid two Children; As al≈øo for the natural love which the ≈øaid R. C. beareth unto H. C. his Brother and G. C. his Si≈øter and towards H. C. his Kin≈øman hereafter named, doth covenant and grant for him and his Heirs, to and with the ≈øaid J. F. and F. J. their Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe Pre≈øents, That he the ≈øaid R. C. and his Heirs, and all and every other per≈øon and per≈øons, and their Heirs that now ≈øtand and be ≈øeized of, or in all and ≈øingular the, &c. or that hereafter ≈øhall be ≈øeized of the ≈øaid, &c. or of any part thereof, ≈øhall ≈øtand
and be ≈øeized thereof, and of every part thereof to ≈øuch u≈øes, intents and purpo≈øes, and upon ≈øuch conditions and limitations of u≈øes, as in the≈øe Pre≈øents ≈øhall be expre≈ø≈øed and declared, and to no other u≈øe, intent or purpo≈øe what≈øoever; That is to ≈øay, to the only u≈øe and behoof of the ≈øaid R. C. for and during the term of his natural Life, without impeachment of Wa≈øt, And from and after the determination of the ≈øaid E≈øtate, To the u≈øe of the ≈øaid J. F. and his Heirs during the Life of the ≈øaid R. C. to prevent his docking the contingent, Remainders herein after limited and appointed, And from and after his Death, then of and concerning the ≈øaid Lands, &c. to the u≈øe of D. C. now Wife of the ≈øaid R. C. for the term of her Life for her Jointure, and in lieu and ≈øatisfaction of her Dower; And after her decea≈øe to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid B. C. and the Heirs Male of his Body lawfully to be begotten, And for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid C. C. and the Heirs Males of the ≈øaid C. C. begotten, or to be begotten, And for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid H. C. and the Heirs Males of his Body lawfully begotten, And for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue to the u≈øe of the right Heirs of the ≈øaid R. C. for ever; And for and concering the Mannor of, &c. and all the re≈øidue of the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes not limited and appointed to the u≈øes before mentioned, To the u≈øe of the ≈øaid B. C. for the term of his life, without Impeachment of Wa≈øt, And after his decea≈øe to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid A. C. Daughter of the ≈øaid R. C. and the Heirs of the Body of the ≈øaid R. C. begotten and to be begotten, And for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue to the u≈øe of the ≈øaid F. C. Si≈øter of the ≈øaid R. C. and the Heirs of the Body, &c. And for want of ≈øuch I≈ø≈øue, to the u≈øe of the right Heirs of the ≈øaid R. C. for ever.

div.head: Livery of Seizin by Feoffor to Feoffee.

q.p: MEmorandum, That this 10th day of December Anno Dom. 1693, peaceable and quiet Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, and Seizin of the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage and Lands, and other the Premi≈ø≈øes in this Deed contained, was delivered by the within named R. C. to the within named J. F. according to the form and effect of this Deed, in the pre≈øence of tho≈øe who≈øe names are hereunto ≈øub≈øcribed.

J. the Attorneys within named, to the within named R. C. according to the tenour and true meaning of this pre≈øent Indentrue, in the pre≈øence of tho≈øe who≈øe names are hereunto ≈øub≈øcribed.

div.head: Another.

q.p: MEmorandum, That the day and year within written, full and peaceable Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of all and ≈øingular the Lands, &c. within granted or mentioned to be granted, was taken and had by the within named J. F. for and in the names of F. J. within mentioned, and afterwards was for and in the name of the ≈øaid F. J. delivered by the ≈øaid J. F. unto the within named R. C. according to the Authority within given, To hold to him the ≈øaid R. C. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns, according to the form and effect of this pre≈øent Deed, in the pre≈øence of tho≈øe who≈øe names are underwritten.

div.head: Another when the Letter of Attorney is in a ≈øeveral Deed.

q.p: MEmorandum, That full, quiet and peaceable Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of all and every the, &c. within mentioned to be granted, was taken and had by R. C. the Attorney, the within named C. R. by force and virtue of a Letter of Attorney to the ≈øaid R. C. in that behalf made by the ≈øaid C. R. bearing date, &c. for and in the behalf of the ≈øaid C. R. And was afterwards by the ≈øame authority, for and in the name of the ≈øaid C. R. delivered by the ≈øaid R. C. unto one J. F. the Attorny of the within named F. J. thereunto lawfully authorized by force and virtue of one Letter of Attorney, made by the ≈øaid F. J. unto the ≈øaid J. F. in that behalf, bearing date, &c. according to the form and effect of this pre≈øent Deed, the 10th day of December, Anno Dom. 1693, in the pre≈øence of tho≈øe per≈øons who≈øe names are hereunto ≈øub≈øcribed.

div.head: Attorments.

q.p: MEmorandum, That R. C. of, &c. Le≈ø≈øee of all the Lands, &c. within mentioned, having heard this pre≈øent Indenture read, and taken perfect notice and knowledge of the contents thereof, doth con≈øent and agree thereunto, And doth Attorn Tenant to the within named C. R. for the ≈øaid, &c. this tenth, &c. in the pre≈øence of tho≈øe who≈øe names are hereunto ≈øub≈øcribed.

div.head: Another.

q.p: MEmorandum, That the within named R. C. Le≈ø≈øee of all, &c. within mentioned, after the ≈øealing and delivery of the≈øe pre≈øents, and perfect notice thereof taken by him, and of the contents thereof did the, &c. in the year within mentioned Attorn Tenant unto the within named C. R. upon the ≈øaid Grant, according to the form and effect thereof, by the payment of ≈øixpence of lawful Mony of England, in the name of Attornment in the pre≈øence of, &c.

div.head: Another

q.p: MEmorandum, That F. J. of, &c. Gent. and the re≈øt of the Tenants and Farmers of the within mentioned Premi≈ø≈øes, by virtue of ≈øeveral Lea≈øes made unto them by the within named J. F. having all of them had perfect notice of this pre≈øent Grant, did ≈øeverally Attorn, and became Tenants of and for their ≈øeveral and re≈øpective intere≈øts in the Premi≈ø≈øes, to the within named B. A. this pre≈øent 10th day of December, in the year within written, And the ≈øaid Tenants have every of them, given unto the ≈øaid B. A. one penny in the name of Attornment in the pre≈øence of, &c.

div.head: An Attornment by a Collateral Deed.

q.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between R. C. of the one part, and C. R. of the other part. Whereas the ≈øaid R. C. is ≈øeized in his deme≈øne as of free-hold, for and during the term of his natural life, of and in, &c. by vertue of a Lea≈øe to him thereof made by J. F. of, &c. by his Indenure bearing date, &c. And whereas the ≈øaid J. F.
by his Deed indented bearing date the, &c. Hath granted the ≈øaid, &c. with the appurtenances, and the rever≈øion thereof, to the ≈øaid C. R. as in and by the ≈øaid Indenture more at large appeareth: Now this Indenture witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid R.C. for divers good cau≈øes and con≈øiderations him hereunto moving, Hath con≈øented, agreed, attorned and become Tenant; And by the≈øe Pre≈øents doth con≈øent, agree and become Tenant to the ≈øaid C. R. and to the ≈øaid grant to him made, of the ≈øaid, &c. and the rever≈øion thereof; And in the name of Attornment and ≈øeizin of the Rent re≈øerved upon the ≈øaid Lea≈øe thereof, have, at and before the ≈øealing of the≈øe Pre≈øents paid to the ≈øaid C. R. one half years rent due at Lady-day la≈øt, which the ≈øaid C. R. hath accepted of, and from the ≈øaid R. C. as from his Tenant and in name of ≈øeizin thereof, and Attornment to the ≈øaid Grant to him thereof made as afore≈øaid. In witne≈øs, &c.

div.head: Livery and Attornment together.

q.p: MEmorandum. That on the, &c. Peaceable and quiet Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion and ≈øeizin of the, &c. within ≈øpecified, was taken and had, and deliver ed by the Attorny within named, to the within named R. C. according to the tenour and true meaning of this pre≈øent Indenture, And likewi≈øe the day and year above-≈øaid, A. B. C. D. And E. F. being Tenants of the Premi≈ø≈øes by ≈øeveral Lea≈øes to them made of their re≈øpective Tenancies did ≈øeverally Attorn Tenants to the ≈øaid R. C. according to this pre≈øent Grant, whereof they and every of them had full and perfect notice, at the time of their ≈øaid re≈øpective Attornments, All which was done in the pre≈øence of the per≈øons, who≈øe names are hereunto ≈øub≈øcribed.

div.head: An A≈ø≈øignment of ≈øeveral Lea≈øes to two A≈ø≈øignees made Tenants in Common, and not Joint-Tenants.

body.p:
THIS Indenture Tripartite made, &c. Between J. D. of, &c. of the fir≈øt part, T. H. of, &c. of the ≈øecond part, and R. H. of, &c. of the third part witne≈ø≈øeth, That R. F. late of, &c. by his Indenture of Lea≈øe bearing date the 10th day of, &c. in the 4th year of the Reign of the late Queen Eliz, did Demi≈øe, Grant and to Farmlet unto, &c. (and ≈øo recite all the Lea≈øes) which ≈øaid ≈øeveral Indentures of Lea≈øe with the re≈øpective E≈øtates, Intere≈øts, Term and Terms of years of the afore≈øaid G. H. J. K. and L. M. of and in the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, Tenements, and other all and ≈øingular the Premi≈ø≈øes with the appurtenances before herein ≈øpecified afterwards by good and ≈øufficient Conveyances and A≈ø≈øurances in the Law, did ve≈øt and come unto the ≈øaid J. D. who is now lawfully po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of all the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the Appurtenances, for and during all the re≈øidue of the re≈øpective Terms of years, in and by the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Indentures of Lea≈øe granted as are yet to come and unexpired. And this Indenture further Witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. D. for and in Con≈øideration of 340 l. of lawful Mony of England, to him by the ≈øaid T. H. and R. H. before the ≈øealing and delivery hereof, well and truly in hand paid, Hath granted, bargained, ≈øold, a≈ø≈øigned and ≈øet over, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth fully, clearly and ab≈øolutely grant, bargain, ≈øell, a≈ø≈øign and ≈øet over unto the ≈øaid T. H. and R. H. the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, Tenements and other all and ≈øingular the Premi≈ø≈øes, with the Appurtenances, in and by the ≈øeveral before mentioned Indentures of Lea≈øe demi≈øed, together with the ≈øaid Indentures of Lea≈øe, and all the
mean A≈ø≈øignments thereof made; and all the E≈øtate, Right, Title, Intere≈øt, Term and Terms of years, po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, rever≈øion, claim and demand what≈øoever of him the ≈øaid J. D. of, in and to the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes: To have and hold the moiety or one half of all the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the Appurtenances, unto the ≈øaid T. H. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, from the making of the≈øe pre≈øents, for and during all the re≈øidue of the ≈øeveral Terms of years in and by the ≈øeveral before mentioned Indentures of Lea≈øe granted, as are yet to come and unexpired. (The like Habendum of the other Moiety to R. H.) And the ≈øaid J. D. doth for him≈øelf, his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, covenant and grant to and with the ≈øaid T. H. and R. H. their Executors Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns by the≈øe pre≈øents, That they the ≈øaid T. H. and R. H. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, by Moieties re≈øpectively, as afore≈øaid, ≈øhall or lawfully may from time to time, and at all times, for and during all the re≈øidue of the ≈øeveral Terms of years, in and by the ≈øeveral before mentioned Indentures of Lea≈øe granted as are yet to come and unexpired, under the Re≈øervations, Conditions and Agreements in the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Indentures of Lea≈øe contained, peaceably and quietly have, hold, u≈øe, occupy, po≈ø≈øe≈øs, enjoy and keep all the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, before in the≈øe pre≈øents mentioned, to be bargained, ≈øold or A≈ø≈øigned, without any let, trouble, interruption or contradiction of or by ≈øaid J. D. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns; and without any lawful let or interruption of or by any other per≈øon or per≈øons, having or lawfully claiming, or which ≈øhall or may have or lawfully claim, any E≈øtate,
Right, Title or Intere≈øt, of, in or to ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, or any part thereof, in, by, for, from or under the ≈øaid J. D. his Heirs. Executors or Admini≈øtrators, or by or with his or their con≈øent, privity or procurement. And al≈øo, that the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes now are, and during all the remainder of the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Terms of years, ≈øhall remain, continue and be unto the ≈øaid T. H. and R. H. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, by Moieties re≈øpectively, as afore≈øaid, free, clear and clearly acquitted and di≈øcharged, of and from all former and other gifts, bargains, ≈øales, ≈øurrenders, forfeitures, charges, titles, troubles, burthens and incumbrances what≈øoever, had, made, committed, done or ≈øuffered by the ≈øaid J. D. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns. And al≈øo, That the ≈øaid J. D. his Executors and Admini≈øtrators, and all and every other per≈øon and per≈øons, having or lawfully claiming, or which ≈øhall or may have or lawfully claim any E≈øtate, Right, Title or Intere≈øt, of, in or to the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, in, by, from or under the ≈øaid J. D. ≈øhall and will upon every rea≈øonable Reque≈øt, during the ≈øpace of 10 years next coming, at the co≈øts and charges in the Law of the ≈øaid T. H. or R. H. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators or A≈ø≈øigns, well and truly do, acknowledge, ≈øuffer and execute all and every further lawful and rea≈øonable Act and Acts, thing and things, conveyance and a≈ø≈øurance in the Law what≈øoever, for the further better and more perfect a≈ø≈øurance, ≈øurety and more ≈øure making and conveying all the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes, with the appurtenances, unto the ≈øaid T. H. and R. H. their Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, by Moieties, re≈øpectively, as afore≈øaid, for
and during all the remainder of the ≈øaid ≈øeveral Terms of years as are yet re≈øpectively to come and unexpired.

div.head: A Lea≈øe of a Me≈ø≈øuage, Mill, Lands, Meadows, Pa≈øtures, Tythes, and other things, with ≈øeveral Exceptions, Habendums, Re≈øervations of Rent, Provi≈øoes and Covenants, whereby may be made a ≈øeveral Lea≈øe of any of tho≈øe things, with ≈øuch Exceptions, Habendums, Re≈øervations of Rent, Provi≈øoes and Covenants, as the ca≈øe requireth.

body.p:
THIS Indenture made, &c. Between J. L. of D. in the County of S. Clerk, of the one part, and W. T. of H. in the ≈øame County, Yeoman, of the other part, Witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid J. L. hath demi≈øed, granted, and to farm letten, and by the≈øe pre≈øents doth demi≈øe, grant and to farm let unto the ≈øaid W. T. All that Me≈ø≈øuage, Tenement and Farm, called H. Farm, with all Hou≈øes, Farms, Stables, Yards, Back≈øides, Gate-Rooms, Gardens Orchards, Lands, Meadows Pa≈øtures, Feedings, Moors, Mar≈øhes, Wood-grounds, Commons, Ways, Waters, Ea≈øments and Appurtenances what≈øoever, to the ≈øaid H. Farm belonging, or as part, parcel or member thereof, at any time accepted, reputed, taken, known, u≈øed, lea≈øed, occupied or enjoyed in H. afore≈øaid.‚ÄîAll that Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement with the Appurtenances, ≈øome-times called B. late in the occupation of J. S. and all Outhou≈øes, Barns, Stables, Buildings, Curtilages, Gardens and Orchards thereunto belonging. And al≈øo all tho≈øe ≈øeveral Clo≈øes or parcels of Land, Meadow and Pa≈øture herein after particularly mentioned; (That is to ≈øay,) All that Clo≈øe of Arable Land called T. Clo≈øe, containing by E≈øtimation, 10 Acres, between the High-way leading from A.
to B. on the Ea≈øt a Ditch in the Land of J. B. on the we≈øt a Hedge on the Land of W. B. on the North, and Land in the occupation of S. C. on the South; and al≈øo all that Clo≈øe or Pa≈øture, containing by E≈øtimation ≈øix Acres, between a Fence of Po≈øt-Rails and Pales on the Land of A. B. on the Ea≈øt, a Wall on the Land of W. Y. on the We≈øt, Land of E. F. on the North, and Land of S. H. on the South; and al≈øo all that parcel of Land containing in length 45 Perches and 2 Foot, and in breadth at the Ea≈øt-end 10 Perches, 3 Foot and 6 Inches, and at the We≈øt-end 15 Perches and 9 Foot, in a common Field call Whitefield, and between Land there of B. C. on the Ea≈øt, and Land of D. E. on the We≈øt. (And ≈øo of other parcels, wherein you may briefly expre≈øs, as before, whether the Fence do belong to them or the adjoyning Lands) All which ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes, are ≈øituate and being in the Pari≈øh of D. afore≈øaid; and al≈øo all Ways, Waters, Ea≈øments and Appurtenances, to the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes, or any of them belonging‚Äî All that Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement commonly called the White-Lion, now in the occupation of A. B. his A≈ø≈øigns or Under-Tenants, in or near the Street called Cheap≈øide, in the Pari≈øh of Mary le Bow, London, together with all and ≈øingular Shops, Cellars, Solars, Chambers, Rooms, Entries, Lights, Windows, Ways, Pa≈ø≈øages, Yards, Back≈øides, Buildings, Gutters, Water-cour≈øes, Ea≈øments, Profits, Commodities and Appurtenances what≈øoever, to the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage in any wi≈øe appertaining‚Äî All that Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement and Brew-hou≈øe, late in the occupation of A.B. his A≈ø≈øigns or Under-Tenants, in or near a Street called B. Lane, in the Pari≈øh of St. Mary A. London, together with all Stables, Edifices, Buildings, Lights, Windows, Ways, Pa≈ø≈øages, Water-cour≈øes, Profits, Commodities and

T. his Executors, Admini≈øtrators and A≈ø≈øigns, ≈øhall and will at the end of the Term hereby granted, leave the ≈øaid Dove-Hou≈øe hereby demi≈øed, Stocked with a Flight of One hundred and fifty Couple of Pidgeons at the lea≈øt, to and for the only ≈øole and proper u≈øe and benefit of the ≈øaid J. L. his Heirs and A≈ø≈øigns; And ≈øhall and will al≈øo at the end of the ≈øaid Term leave the Pidgeon-holes in the ≈øaid Dove-Hou≈øe well and ≈øufficiently repaired, amended, maintained, ≈øu≈øtained, and kept without fraud or delay

div.head: Covenants to convey Land in Con≈øideration of 5 s. in hand, and re≈øidue to be be paid at a day to come, without obliging the Buyer to pay, ≈øo that if he fails in payment, he may not pretend to have any Equity afterwards.

body.p:
THis Indenture made, &c. Between N. C. of the City of C. in the County of S. Gent. of the one part, and A.B. &c. of the other part, witne≈ø≈øeth, That the ≈øaid N.C. for and in con≈øideration of 5 s. of lawful Mony of England, to him by the ≈øaid, &c. before the ≈øealing and delivery hereof, well and truly in hand paid, doth covenant with the ≈øaid, &c. by the≈øe pre≈øents, that if the ≈øaid N.C. ≈øhall be living on the 2d day of April next coming; And if the ≈øaid A. B. or his Heirs, do or ≈øhall on the ≈øaid 2d day of April, well and truly pay or cau≈øe to be paid unto the ≈øaid N. C. the full Sum of 680 l. of lawful Mony of England, Then the ≈øaid N. C. immediately after receipt of the ≈øaid 680 l. ≈øhall and will at the Co≈øts and Charges of the ≈øaid A. B. by good and ≈øufficient Conveyance and A≈ø≈øurance in the Law, and well and ≈øufficiently to be executed, grant, convey and a≈ø≈øure unto the ≈øaid A. B. and his Heirs, all that Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement, Gate and Back≈øide with the Appurtenances, containing by e≈øtimation 8 Acres of Land, and all that Field or parcel of Land called the Hine Ear≈øh, containing by e≈øtimation ≈øix Acres, one other Field called or known by the name of Stanfield, containing by e≈øtimation four Acres, one piece of Land lying in two Severals called 8 Acres, one little Coppice containing by e≈øtimation two Roods, one parcel of Land called the Slipe, containing by e≈øtimations two Acres, and a half, one Mead called Hamock Mead, containing by e≈øtimation two Acres, one Mead lying near Ructon Gate between the Farm-Mead there, and Lands formerly of W. S. all which Premi≈ø≈øes are ≈øituate lying and being in South-Mundham in the County afore≈øaid, and are now
in the Occupation of E.D. And al≈øo, all that Me≈ø≈øuage or Tenement called the White-Hart, with the Barn and Gate-room thereunto adjoyning and belonging, late partly in the Occupation of R. C. and partly of M. P. in the Pari≈øh of St. Pancras near the City of C. afore≈øaid; And al≈øo all that Me≈ø≈øuage called the A. with the Back≈øide and Stable thereunto belonging, ≈øituate and being in the We≈øt-≈øide of the North-≈øtreet within the City of C. afore≈øaid, and now in the Occupation of F. M. together with all Barns, Stables, Buildings, Orchards, Woods, Commons, Profits and Appurtenances what≈øoever to the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuages, Lands and Premi≈ø≈øes belonging, with Covenants on the part of the ≈øaid N. C. therein to be compri≈øed, that the ≈øaid A. B. and his Heirs, ≈øhall and may from thenceforth, hold and enjoy all the ≈øaid Premi≈ø≈øes, without any let or interruption of the ≈øaid N. C. his Heirs or A≈ø≈øigns, or of any per≈øon or per≈øons claiming by, from or under him or them, except Le≈ø≈øees under the mo≈øt u≈øual Rents; Provided always, and it is hereby agreed and declared by the ≈øaid parties, That if the ≈øaid N. C. ≈øhall happen to die before the ≈øaid 2d day of April, Or if the ≈øaid, &c. or his Heirs, ≈øhall not pay unto the ≈øaid N. C. the ≈øaid 680 l. as afore≈øaid, Then the ≈øaid, &c. his Heirs, Executors and Admini≈øtrators, ≈øhall be wholly and for ever excluded and debarred of and from all Right, pretence of Equity, Claim, Preemption and Demand of, for or in to the ≈øaid Me≈ø≈øuage, Lands, Tenements and Premi≈ø≈øes, and every part thereof, and of, in or to the ≈øaid 5 s. by the ≈øaid N. C. received as afore≈øaid.

closer.dateline: In witne≈øs whereof the parties fir≈øt above named, have to the≈øe pre≈øent Indentures interchangeably ≈øet their Hands and Seals the day and year fir≈øt above written.
